Reviews.Title: “A perfect get-away from "Vegas" right on the strip”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel66usa
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel right on the strip. No crazy slot machines! There was a great complimentary coffee service (cappacino and espresso included) and muffins in the morning but the great thing was that the room had a Keurig coffee machine in it. If you travel to Vegas often, you know most hotels won't provide coffee machines unless you have a presidential suite. I like coffee when I get up and don't want to trudge through the lobby to find a Starbucks (that might not be open). The spa was relaxing. The exercise room was great. Service was excellent everywhere but the restaurant (but we went at an odd time and the service was good, just not Four Seasons style). I would definitely stay here again. Especially because you can enjoy the fabulous Mandalay Bay pools!

Reviews.Title: “Serenity in the City”
Reviews.Author: Cici14
Reviews.Content: My BF and I stayed for only a night on our way back from Hawaii just to break up the flight home. I'm convinced this is one of the only places in Las Vegas that you can actually get some sleep. The room was very small however the view of the strip was outstandng from the floor to ceiling window. The bed was hands down the comfiest hotel bed I've ever slept in and the room impeccably clean. Access to and from the airport was quick and easy and check in was seamless. I also love the fact that it is a smoke free environment. I didn't leave with myself and all of my luggage stinking like a stale ashtray. Of course it doesn't have the energy and excitement of other Vegas properties but if calm is what you are looking for then here you will find it.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons is a true hidden gem in Las Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: Michael P
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons is a 5 Star hotel within a hotel (located inside of the Mandalay Bay) that is first cabin all the way. What is of great interest, their nightly room rates are very competitive if not better than large hotel/casinos on the strip. A little hint, with the exception of the suites, all the rooms are just about the same. When upgrading, you just receive a better view of the strip. Although nice to glance at, one does not really spend that much time inside their room in Las Vegas. So save yourself a little money and book the "best rate" room. Also, this hotel offers all guests the use of their House Car (drop-off only) which is a 2012 Mercedes 550 with driver. All part of their service so you save on cab fare if traveling to another location for dinner or to the mall. Stayed her a dozen times in the last few years, never disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “In Name only”
Reviews.Author: ScottCarenJack
Reviews.Content: The four seasons has always represented to me, a finer touch in customer service and rooms that are well maintained and artfully decorated. Sadly, like so many Vegas properties that have been around awhile, the wear and tear of our suite was glaring. Additionally, a hot meal was served cold and there were issues with the bathroom plumbing. Was The Four Seasons attentive in each case? Except for the wear and tear, yes! But I stay with this hotelier with the expectation that issues like this never come up. I pay a premium for this type of a stay and want nothing less.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and beautiful facility.”
Reviews.Author: LuciaO4444
Reviews.Content: Excellent service and beautiful facility. Wonderful food. Lots of children who were happily visiting all of the sights. We had a wonderful family time celebrating an adult birthday with friends and family flying in. I was happy that there was no casino in that part of the hotel since I do not like to participate in that and in most hotels you must walk through the casino to reach the theater or other activity. This place was calm and beautiful. The staff was just outstanding...from parking attendants to maid service to check in to parking aqttendants and doormen to concierge. Everyone made eye contact and smiled and had a greeting. Very welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Fabulous - A Retreat from Madness!”
Reviews.Author: Nico_Cannes_France
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel - from reception, to rooms, to pool. Great service and perfect. The best place away from the madding crowds, but attached to the Mandaly Bay (ask for the 'secret entrance') so you still have everything on your doorstep - yes, class in Las Vegas DOES exist!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - well above average”
Reviews.Author: Aussiebw
Reviews.Content: Decided to try the Four Seasons due to Mandalay Bay being fully sold out while I was there. Upon arrival, I asked about upgrades and agreed to upgrade to a King room with strip view and floor to ceiling windows. We were very impressed! What a magnificent view of the strip - 24hrs a day! We ordered room service for lunch, and without exaggerating, it was one of the best meals i've had for quite a while. Go ahead and send me a message if you need more information. The staff are very accommodating. Compared to some of the other hotels we've stayed at in Vegas (similarly priced), the service was excellent and staff were perfect. Next time i'd upgrade to a Suite just because we like 2 bathrooms, but even the bath in our room was very nice. Shampoo and Conditioner was L'occitome? and seemed much nicer than the stuff we are used to seeing at some other chain hotels. Digital Movies on demand were all current, an we have enjoyed a couple of those. Sitting in the room admiring the strip view and laying back watching a movie at the same time. What more could you ask for? Also I forgot to mention the king size bed was awesome. Very comfortable, and the room extremely quiet....just what I was looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Not what u expect from a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bill J
Reviews.Content: Dissapointing . Even tho it is a good hotel , on all levels its not what i expected reading all those wonderful critics,, The pool area/relaxed oasis is Exellent.

Reviews.Title: “By far the BEST resort in all of Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: CdnBeachBum37
Reviews.Content: What can I say about this place except that it is the most wonderful place to stay. I have been to Vegas 6 times and have stayed in many of the strip properties (some great, some not so great) and by far the Four Seasons exceeded my expectations in every way! Yes the rooms are beautiful, (although a little boring when it comes to decor) the beds are spectacular, (so much so that I bought their pillows) the floral arrangements in the public areas are beautiful, the pool is awesome and the restaurants are spectacular, but it's the service that takes the cake. You will want for NOTHING and you will feel and be treated like a king. Great job Four Seasons!

Reviews.Title: “what more can I add??”
Reviews.Author: joussardines
Reviews.Content: OK- bar none, best hotel/room we have ever had the honor to stay in. We had upgraded to a Four Seasons room and I can say that it was worth it. Although I am certain the standard rooms here are superior to other hotels' rooms, this one was totally over the top and well worth it for an anniversary self indulgence type trip. I feel I cannot add anymore than what has already been said here besides the fact that in the two short days we spent in Vegas, many hours were taken up with staying in to enjoy the room, the view, one another and the Four Seasons experience. That in itself is a testament to the excellence of the place considering we are two very adventurous souls that usually like to be constantly on the move. Above and beyond the superior customer service, they even delivered an anniversary cake to us after check in. I have never felt more spoiled or pampered in my life. This may be a once in a lifetime trip, but hey, we work hard and we deserved it just this once. K- maybe a few more times in the coming years! ANY questions at all, please drop me a line.

Reviews.Title: “Our level of expectations was exceeded. Very nice job. Will return.”
Reviews.Author: logger93
Reviews.Content: The staff at the four seasons was spectacular. Our stay was perfect. In a town where it can be tough to maintain class and dignity, the las Vegas four seasons was magnificent!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay ! My 8 year old loved loved the hotel !”
Reviews.Author: timelo
Reviews.Content: The staff is amazing and they know how to interact with children. We were treating like VIP !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all the way around.”
Reviews.Author: DanSmith847
Reviews.Content: In Las Vegas for business - conference. Stuck in the hotel most of the time, but what a great facility. Staff very professional and exceedingly well trained. Not a huge fan of Las Vegas, but if you go, this is a wonderful place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay......will stay again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jennmaybe
Reviews.Content: Just returned a few days from a fabulous 1st time in Vegas! We spent 4 nights here at FS and I am more than happy I chose this hotel. As so many others said, the customer service was absolutely top notch and that is what will take us right back to FS on our next trip to Vegas. Oh yes........there will be another trip! We had a Premium Strip-view suite, on the 37th floor. The views were amazing all the time, but they were the best at night. The room was spotlessly clean and we do not have one complaint at all, about anything. We loved having the express elevators, so we never had to wait more than a minute for them. We loved being right there with MB and all the access that came with that. The bed was as comfy and we slept so well on it. One thing I did not know before we went (and I read A LOT of Trip Advisor), was the tram that goes from MB to Luxor and Excalibur. That was great to have, because those walks are longer than they look. However, the only complaint we have about that is the hours. For it to be Vegas, these trams do not run the late or early hours. (This is part of MB, so it has no reflection on Four Seasons). So, we ended up having to take a last-minute taxi down to Excalibur. We had to catch our bus out to the Nascar race and did not have enough time to walk it once I found out the tram did not begin running until 9am that morning. I am very excited about the renovations FS will be doing this year. We plan to stay right there again on our next trip to Vegas!! Would I recommend this hotel.......you bet I would!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent NON Smoking hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Morcella
Reviews.Content: The rooms are spacious, tastefully decorated, and very comfy beds. The bedding is high quality and makes for a restful nights sleep. The quiet rooms, view, wi-fi, coffee maker, tea kettle upon request have made this a nice stay. The staff are friendly and helpful. I could easily choose to stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: WheeledWonder
Reviews.Content: This review will be short and to the point, The Four Seasons is a must if you want an experience of a lifetime, From Front Desk to House Keeping the Staff know exactly how to treat guests. We were on a our honeymoon and stayed for 10 days.. we upgraded our room to a Strip view and we weren't disappointed!! Our curtains remained open for the entire trip. If you want an oasis in a City that never sleeps, then the Four Seasons is the hotel you must stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Another trip to perfection!”
Reviews.Author: NM-Foodie-57
Reviews.Content: How does the FSLV do it time after time? Combine excellent management with a proven staff ... That's how! Very special mentions to Heidi at Verandah (who's always a treat), Denise, the Concierge, (who refused to be stumped by the most arcane of queries), and the entire bell staff (who never even snickered at our constant requests to access our rented bicycles). While my husband and I have been coming here for about 10 years, ths time we experienced a rare treat: a tour of the kitchen by Chef Antonio Minichiello! Great management always starts at the top, and Mark Hellrung, the GM, runs one super-tight ship! Always gracious and graceful, The Four Seasons Las Vegas should be experienced by everyone. Be forwarded: it will ruin for travel anywhere else!)

Reviews.Title: “5 Stars might not be enough.”
Reviews.Author: TorontoFR
Reviews.Content: Other reviews say it all. Probably one of the best hotel I stayed in to date. Essentially because of the professionalism and hospitality of the staff. Doormen, concierge, security, cleaning staff, everyone you meet greets you with a warm and friendly smile and a nice word. Away from the busiest part of the strip but offering an easy access to it, this is the perfect place for family or simply people who enjoy some peace. If we ever go back to LV, this will be the place we will chose again. Strongly recommended to one timer, to make your experience in LV magnificent.

Reviews.Title: “Damn They Are Good - A Decade of Excellence”
Reviews.Author: Chacoan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Four Seasons Las Vegas annually for about 10 years. In that time we have seen no degradation of the physical property or in the service. It is simply amazing that they manage to be so consistently, top-notched in their hospitality. We stayed recently at another Four Seasons property where they were constantly "making things right" after small screw-ups. That has never been the case at the 4Seasons LV. They just get it right on the money each time, every time over a decade of visits. From check-in to check-out, we've experienced a gracious hospitality that exceeds the Bellagio and the Palazzo in LV, the Broadmoor in Colorado Springs, the Phoenician in Phoenix and any other 4 Seasons we've frequented. Cudos, go to Mgr. Mark Hellrung and his staff. This level of performance over time is not due to chance. "Chapeau!"

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular staff, quiet location”
Reviews.Author: 10514traveler
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons in Las Vegas is a beautifully appointed hotel with a very indulgent staff. The superior room was spacious and comfortable. However, the view from the 39th floor was straight onto the airport. It might be difficult to get a pretty view in Las Vegas. The Verandah bar staff was terrific as was the pool staff. If you are going to Las Vegas, I highly recommend this location.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best!”
Reviews.Author: FalWetVet
Reviews.Content: We must confess, world wide this is without a doubt our very favorite hotel. Once a year we are in Town for business and returning to the Four Seasons is like coming home. Every employee you encounter will greet you with a smile (these people, actually like working here!) and there is nothing they will not do to make your stay even more enjoyable. Upon arrival you are greeted by long time staff whom most likely will remember you, the front desk is amazing, Conceriege the best in Vegas and so it goes with the rest of the staff. Restrained elegance throughout the property is a breath of fresh air versus the over the top opulence elsewhere on the Strip. The suites/rooms are sumptuous, dreamy beds and everything is spotless..let's not forget about the turn down service. It's all the little things and attention to details for which Four Seasons is rightly renown. Quite simply there is no finer hotel. Both restaurants are fabulous, pool area is truly an oasis. For those wanting "casino action", elevator takes you right to Mandalay Bay, the casinos and a host of restaurants, shops etc. For whatever reason you need to be in Vegas, Four Seasons is sanity in an insane place.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely will not stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Dzblnd
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Very clean. At very end of strip. Close to airport. Hotel is the top floors of Mandalay Bay. It's a long walk down several long halls from check in to the elevators. Then another long walk to our room. I parked in Mandalay Bay parking garage. I wandered through a maze of hallways until I found the elevators. It was easier to use valet parking but that was $22 a day plus tips. Definitely will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A luxurious oasis on the strip”
Reviews.Author: KandAJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 5 nights and really appreciated the convenience to Mandalay Bay and the strip, while also being able to escape to the typical four seasons serenity. Rooms were large with great views, clean, and quiet. If available, the house car is nice to use as it will take you anywhere in a 3 mile radius of the hotel. The fitness center is very nice for a hotel and it never had more than 4 or 5 people in it while we were there, which was not crowded at all. The hotel is a bit pricey when compared to some of the other hotels on the strip but worth it if you want the great service.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise within Paradise within Sin City...”
Reviews.Author: et49589
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Las Vegas 5 nights celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary. First of all this was one property that impressed me more than any we stayed in. We were honored to have stayed ib the hotel of such caliber. The hotel management, front desk, spa, Veranda, concierge cleaning and bar lady services were transcendent to delivers the full spectrum of ensuring our stay was the best that it can ever be. We stayed in the Four Seasons non-suit with window wall to was floor to ceiling and the view we had was breath taking. We stayed in the West tour and were afraid that the view will not be good as in East tour, to our surprise, we had a full view of Strip, Desert and Mountains. Room service was spontaneous. We liked Veranda good food and not overpriced. Most professional concierge service and the hotel grounds, I am thinking to turn my back yard in to miniature version of Four Seasons Gardens where I was spending time whenever I needed tranquility and serenity. To much to included in the review. If I could give 6 stars for everything I would.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice for couples”
Reviews.Author: Goodbloke1
Reviews.Content: Sitting in the top few floors of Mandalay Bay, the Four Seasons offers something different from most luxury Vegas Hotels and is a great option for couples wanting class instead of bling. My wife and I booked a strip view suite for a few nights as part of our honeymoon tour of the US. Upon arrival at the Mandalay Bay the first immediate "exclusive" feel you get is walking past the queues for Mandalay check-in to the smaller dedicated FS check in- more staff & no queue. In fact as soon as you enter the FS section of the ground floor you can hear and feel the hussle bussle of the Mandalay Bay fade away behind you giving way to the quiet and more reserved but tasteful decor of the Four Seasons. You then take the exclusive FS elevator to the upper floors but to be honest our first room, fantastic by usual standards, didn't quite live up to our expectation. The view of the strip was very much at an angle, we didn't really face it and the size felt to me like it fell a little short of what we expected. So we asked to be moved and the process took half an hour or so, but was well worth it. We were moved to a top floor room that was both larger and faced directly down The Strip. Perfect. The rooms are again quite understated in the way they are fitted out, much like the other area of the FS Hotel, but they ooze class, are exceptionally comfortable and ideally suited to the type of guests this hotel is looking to attract. One thing I would criticise is the cost of the wi-fi in the room - I can't remember exactly how much but it was an extortionate amount for 24hrs and the one thing that left a bit of a bad taste in the mouth. You get the use of all the Mandalay facilities & I didn't get the impression the couple of FS restaurants are particularly well used but certainly the pool area is fantastic as the Mandalay pools are very busy & noisy whereas the Four Seasons pool area is like a tranquil oasis in comparison. The location is at the effective end of the strip on the opposite end to the Wynn Hotels. Might be slightly more convenient to be more centrally located as it's easy to underestimate journey times to get from one hotel to another in Vegas, so guess that would be one argument to stay elsewhere. But the service in this hotel is second to none, just faultless and for a honeymoon couple like us or anyone else wanting something a bit more exclusive than a big brash casino hotel in Las Vegas, then you will not be disappointed here.

Reviews.Title: “Serenity in Sin City”
Reviews.Author: Ken99
Reviews.Content: The wife had a Re/Max convention to attend. I went along for the ride. We don't gamble and don't like Vegas for all the reasons that so many people do. That's why this hotel is perfect. While it is in the Mandaly Bay, it has it's own private entrance, small reception and elevators that wisk you straight to the top floors of the hotel. While the wife worked from early a.m. till early evening, I hung out at the private pool. Not a single kid in sight. No splashing. No screaming. Just the pool boy to clean my sun glasses and spray Evian water on my face. Also had very good couples massage. Room service was excellent for early morning eats. Veranda restaurant was very good too. Concerige for wife's business needs were very helpful. Only problem was our suite had maybe 4 phones and two of them didn't work (even after maintenance replaced them). Also used the hotel Mercedes to drop us off at other hotel for dinner and to the airport for return trip. We will stay here next year.

Reviews.Title: “I love love love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: susanj007
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas has thousands of hotel rooms and most are larger and less expensive than the Four Seasons. BUT, what the other hotels lack is class and perfect service. This is not my first stay here and I will always stay here when in Vegas. Special kudos to George at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Four seasons amenities staff food and beds are exceptional.”
Reviews.Author: Whaler802
Reviews.Content: We love the restaurants pool area and spa. They always accomodate our cat on our road trips thru LV

Reviews.Title: “BEST PLACE IN VEGAS! IF IT'S NOT, THE OTHERS MUST BE INCREDIBLE!”
Reviews.Author: RobiOne
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Four Seasons in Vegas as part of our 8 week trip in the USA. If at first I was a bit doubtful about my choice (the hotel occupies the same building as tha Mandalay Bay and could have been a bit of a mess) at the end I was more than enthousiastic. We were given a partial strip view ans paid for a mountain view, so the kids were really happy about it. I was really surprised, since on other occasions I had noticed that hotels tend to give the "less charming rooms" to customers who book trhogh EXPEDIA and other websites. The staff was always helpful and ready to go the extra mile, from the reception till the concierge. We loved the pool and the delicious Italian restaurant and the fact that here again the staff is really extra and tries to help in any way. GREAT WINE LIST! The only negative side (but it's maybe not the hotel's fault...) the mail I left to send while I was leaving never arrived... If the Hotel is a bit distant from the rest of the STRIP, this soon proved to be an advantage, because it is quiter! We would certainly go back to the Four Seasons!

Reviews.Title: “A Touch of Class”
Reviews.Author: Sandi F
Reviews.Content: The rooms were beautiful! Large, spacious, great views! Large bathroom with a tub to die for! Fantastic service. Every single staff member I came into contact with was friendly and eager to make my stay a memorable one. The spa was lovely and the spa staff very nice. The steamroom was, without a doubt, the best I've encountered. Just the right temperature and the perfect amount of eucalyptus. The only negative was that there were no hot tubs, jacuzzi's or pools. Otherwise, very relaxing and nice ambience. The room service food was delicious and the waitstaff very friendly, fast, and efficient. A little on the expensive side, but isn't room service always expensive? I did like the fact that the gratuity was already included. I think the thing I liked the most about the hotel was that it was not crowed like all of the other strip hotels. When I wanted crowds, gambeling, etc, I just went down the elevator and into the Mandalay Bay. When I wanted some peace and quiet, it was right back the the Four Seasons. It felt kind of like a hide-away resort. I even loved the fact that the doors to get to the hotel from the Mandalay Bay are kind of "hidden" and a little hard to spot. Overall I would highly recommend the Four Seasons Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Room was immaculate. Customer Service was amazing and everyone made eye contact with me and said hello with a smile!”
Reviews.Author: Sherwin E
Reviews.Content: The service was perfect. From the moment I pulled up at the valet I was greeted with a smile and friendliness. My bags were automatically taken care of once they knew I was checking in. I was escorted all the way to the front desk and not just pointed there. The room was immaculate. They even had a robe for my 5 year old son ready and waiting. Everyone was friendly. I mean everyone. I walked by the spa and when I looked inside the lady at the front desk made eye contact and said hello to us. Our room was cleaned twice a day. Coming back from the Shark Reef aquarium and seeing our room completely cleaned with the soft music in the background on the TV and slippers by out bedside was a pleasant surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: loudab
Reviews.Content: We had booked a one room suite and were pleasantly shocked to be put in one of the nicest rooms in which we've ever stayed. It was a huge suite--kitchen, dining room, living room, work area, huge bathroom, gorgeous bedroom--with 180 degree views of the strip on the 37th floor. The room and the views were breathtaking. We also loved the service and the food at Veranda, the in house cafe. The cocktail hour drink deals are great and the food was yummy. The room was blessedly quiet, the linens comfortable and the shower robust. I can't imagine wanting to stay anywhere else in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of calm in Las Vegas madness”
Reviews.Author: Trazie
Reviews.Content: Very lovely hotel calm and quiet and very relaxing. Nice to return to the calm after a day out in the excitement of the Vegas strip. I stayed with my husband, my two year old and three year old. The staff were happy to see the children - they didnt just "put up" with them as some hotels do. The spa was a delight. Room service was a bit slow and not very flexible.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, but difficult to navigate.”
Reviews.Author: AZMerrie
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is very beautiful and classy, but it is intertwined with Mandalay Bay. It is confusing to get from the rooms to the business meeting areas.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely stay - Vegas Craziness Optional.”
Reviews.Author: clamberton
Reviews.Content: I'd always stayed in Strip hotels before, but this time we stayed at the Four Seasons. It's far less overstated than other Vegas hotels. The rooms are big and very comfortable, cabs are readily available with very short lines, and room service is excellent. The Concierge can also help with large group dinner reservations, which was a bonus. If you're staying for just one night, you may prefer to be on the Strip so you don't spend time going from place to place. If you're staying for more than a day or two, this is a nice way to have a relaxing vacation, a peaceful "home base" for your Vegas adventures, and to avoid the crush and tackiness that's hard to avoid in the Strip hotels.

Reviews.Title: “5 star experience in Las Vegas, especially for 2 yr old”
Reviews.Author: L Z
Reviews.Content: Beautiful clean upscale hotel. Our 2 yr old was welcomed with sponge letters in the tub spelling out his name, a plate of M&Ms and gummy bears and cookie with Welcome, NAME spelled out in chocolate. Room was well taken care of and clean, and the hotel was spotless. Very nice staff and amenities. We really enjoyed the espresso bar in the mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: doglover28
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a relaxing long weekend in February. Was fabulous. Property is beautiful serene and oasis in vegas crazy! The only downside is I wish the spa offered nail services.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Human-scale Home in an Unreal City”
Reviews.Author: Venamo
Reviews.Content: Every Agust I have to visit Las Vegas for a meeting usually at the Bellagio; which I passionately despise. (How can 4,000 rooms check out in 5 Star fashion?); so depasite the incovenience and cost of traveling back and forth 3 or fout times a day I stay the what I consider my refuge fronm the glizt of an unreal city. The Four Seaosns is human sacel. The pool holds a reasonable number of people; Though my one complaint is the music that some times spills over from the Mandalay is bothersome. One canm walk to the room elevators not thru the hub-bub of the casino but under it. Check-ins and check outs; fast like at many real properties. Breakfast at La Veranda, which has wold class Huevos Ranchero's is a t4at. Sitting by the pool at 6 am as the sun rises in the coolest part of the dry air is a good start to the day. The well managed bell staff frequently arranges complimentary transfers to the Bel;lagio and like so many of Four Seasons personnel have been therre since it opened. Maybe that is also why they always seem to remember that my Significant Other and I have different surnames. Howmanyhotels unless they were well staffed and well managed would do that; even in Las Vegas. This prperty has me a real fan.

Reviews.Title: “Just wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Stephen R
Reviews.Content: A two day stay in Las Vegas for work and a mandated hotel, which sometimes is a bad thing unless it's the Four Seasons Las Vegas! Arriving early, the hotel was busy and a while to wait for a room, but to be expected, so lunch in the Verandah Restaurant (the tuna sampler was lip smacking) before picking up my 'key' and up to the 38th floor to find I'd been given an amazing suite with views of the Strip and McCarran airport - for an airplane geek that was wonderful, so was the exercise just walking from one end of the suite to the other. The staff couldn't have been more amenable and pleasant, and if I'd had time I would have tried the spa, but didn't. My only wish is that there was a proper bar - the bar is in the Verandah, perhaps when the weather is kinder there's one outside, but not in mid-February. Very recommended if you want to be out of a casino hotel, but on the doorstep and with 1st floor access to the Mandalay Bay you can easily do all of that if you want to.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: DCJD2012
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas multiple time and stayed at most of the best and newest resorts. This is my favorite. It begins with arrival at the airport. Being on the south end of stro, you can literally land, get rental car and be in the lobby within 20 minutes from landing. The lobby is, like all Four Seasons, immaculately clean, peaceful, quiet and in Vegas, smoke and casino free. The restaurants are all great and you don't feel like you're in Vegas, unless you want to, and then you merely have to walk to second floor and in 2 minutes you're in Mandalay Bay. Stay here, you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquility in the middle of Vegas chaos”
Reviews.Author: chappaqua chick
Reviews.Content: After getting off the strip it was such a delight to get back to our hotel. Our room, the staff, the restaurant were all fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “I forgot I was in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: PMA_Riqo
Reviews.Content: Being in Vegas can have it's ups and downs but this Hotel is definitely a breath of fresh air over the typical Vegas scene!

Reviews.Title: “Sub standard service with one exception”
Reviews.Author: andrewsydney
Reviews.Content: As a family of six we booked two rooms over new years eve. Needless to say this was not cheap. But, the value equation may have made it worthwhile ... Except it fell far short. We arrived an hour after check in after driving from la, to find our rooms were neither on the same level, as had been requested, nor ready ! We were also not offered any water, even though they were at reception. Bottom line, one fumble after another meant we didn't get in for another five hours. While in, no milk for in house coffee even though a nespresso machine and capsules are in the room, and a room service request for milk was "forgotten". Apart from the bill, where it was "remembered". Also, my wife was not acknowledged as a guest whilst we were there for the next two days. Fast forward; we go to check out, and the charges are all wrong. The rooms are tired, the service poor, the prices high; you don't need honors in maths to see that doesn't add up. I noted there was one exception. His name is Leonard and he is the most helpful concierge you could hope to meet, even to the extent of playing card tricks to amuse my waiting 12 year old whilst we were waiting to book a show through the desk. He's a uber concierge, and the management should ask him to talk to the front desk and other areas about customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ljpeas
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, crazy city. A calming oasis in a storm of madness! I love the fact that the pool boys knew your name within 30 minutes of arriving. The ice cold cucumbers and face towels pool side, the amazing spa and the fantastic restaurant. Just perfect. The best hotel in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't going to write review but friends said I should because of my experience.”
Reviews.Author: Deirdre188
Reviews.Content: On my first visit to Las Vegas from England, we stayed at the Four Seasons from 28th Dec to 2nd January. The hotel was great and housekeeping staff really courteous and helpful. However, on the night of the 30th, my 21-year old daughter wanted to head back to the room but my husband was still playing at the casino. My daughter was happy to go back to the room by herself but, after discussion with my husband who said he wouldn't be much longer, I went with her. As we got to our floor, about halfway down, a young man wearing a hooded jacket with the hood up was just standing. As we approached him, he started walking ahead of us. When he got to the end of the corridor, he again just stood still. As he heard the click of the roompass, he turned around and headed back towards us. Knowing I couldn't get into the room before he could get his foot in the door, I stood outside and my daughter entered the room. The man and I just watched each other until he had passed down the corridor. Unsettled by the incidence, I phoned the front desk to tell them about the man. No one got back to me but, luckily, my husband saw him leave the Four Seasons lobby and had noticed him because he still had the hood up. Replying to a survey, I said I thought even a note under our door would have been reassuring. After another email, I did get a phone call from the hotel saying that someone else had also reported the man and, unfortunately, "Las Vegas does attract a criminal element". They said that their Security had been unable to locate the man. I appreciate that it wasn't the hotel's fault that the man was there but their response was poor. Also I cannot understand how my husband managed to see this man a good 5-10 minutes after I (and someone else) reported the man but the hotel security could not. The hotel is not that large nor does it have many exits. It would also have been reassuring to know at the time that they had taken by concern seriously. I occasionally wake up at night and wonder "what would have happened if my daughter had gone to the room alone?". The hotel and staff were great but

Reviews.Title: “too much or not enough”
Reviews.Author: kakistoc
Reviews.Content: This is a very personal review and should be taken as such. I visited Vegas just once, to tick it off the list. And I rather wish I'd chosen somewhere besides the Four Seasons. Although the service was as outstanding as ever (thank you for remembering our anniversary, guys), the spaces were large and soulless and didn't have the luxurious feel of other Four Seasons hotels. Also, walking through some other Las Vegas hotels, I feel I'd missed out on part of the Vegas experience. If I ever do go there again I'll try somewhere like the Bellagio with a bit more bling. Having said that, if I were a regular visitor, I'd choose the Four Seasons for all the usual reasons: peace, consistency and service. So absolutely no complaints. Just not quite what I was looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Will never forget my time here”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa M
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are amazing - the level of service and standard of quality make this hotel the only place to be in Vegas. It's surreal as it's very quiet and relaxed here - not like the other hotels on the strip. I stayed in February so the weather was mild and outdoor pool area wasn't open etc but this didn't affect my stay. My two favourite touches where the giant choc strawberries placed in my room and also the eggs benedict breakfast - i often think about them! It's expensive but it's worth it! I will definitely be back once can afford to do so!

Reviews.Title: “Top notch and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Jason W
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel in Vegas. Great location, great service, and very quiet. Was very nice to be able to escape the noise and glitz of the strip, yet be really close to everything when it was time to go out. World class establishment.

Reviews.Title: “First business meeting at Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: AlexY2012
Reviews.Content: Extremely courteous and professional staff starting at curbsite all the way to the room. No waiting at the front desk with immediate room availability. It was actually nice to be shielded from the traffic, noise, and commotion as compared to some of the other "luxury" hotels. This was the first time we held our corporate meeting to Four Seasons. My feedback to our company - U.S. Healthworks - will be to definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Business Plus!”
Reviews.Author: JOSEPH C
Reviews.Content: They do a great job of pampering the guests! Free Robe, Slippers in Room, Turndown service, free shoe shines, house car instead of a taxi, reservastions and airport assistance. Great location and partnership w/ Mandalay Bay for Restaurants and Gambling!

Reviews.Title: “Vegas without the "tacky"”
Reviews.Author: FunFamilyadventure
Reviews.Content: My husband, three teenage children and I stayed at the Four Seasons for four days in February. When you stay at the Four Seasons it feels more like a vacation...luxurious, comfortable and convenient, and it is removed from the chaos I think of as Vegas. The exercise room was great and the pools for kids are fantastic although we couldn't use due to cold weather. I was able to drop a dime in the casino at Mandalay Bay, yet didn't worry about the kids wandering the hotel grounds. I love the bedding and mattresses you sleep like a dream. The room was very large with 2 doubles and room for a rollaway so for a family of 5 it is an easy pick. Shower area was great lots of hot water with a forceful spray and the bathroom all in marble was lovely. We will stay here whenever we head to Vegas, try it, you will love it.

Reviews.Title: “It doesnt get better than this!”
Reviews.Author: DieHardRamsFan
Reviews.Content: Without a drought, this is one of the nicest places to stay in Vegas. The service, amenities and rooms are nothing short of exceptional. Tucked within the Mandalay Bay, located at the end of the strip, you have the Vegas feel but without the hustle and bustle of other hotels. It has its own private pool or you can use the Mandalay’s pool. Both are great for sun, fun and people watching. If you want to be pampered, this hotel is well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best!”
Reviews.Author: Terri W
Reviews.Content: I travel with my husband at least once a year to Las Vegas for a show that is held at The Four Seasons Las Vegas. Everytime we stay here we are treated so well and the staff is willing to accommodate any of our needs that have included, storing a anniversary cake, printing boarding passes, making special arrangements, or a private towncar to the airport. If given a choice, this would be the ONLY property I would stay at in Las Vegas. I look forward to our next trip and another stay at The Four Season Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “What a five-star hotel should be”
Reviews.Author: Scott W
Reviews.Content: After an underwhelming stay in Encore last year, I decided to try the opposite end of the Strip to see if it was any better. The Four Seasons is ranked as one of the best hotels in Vegas, so I went in with some pretty high expectations. I can honestly say this hotel met, if not exceeded, every single one of them. At Encore, any request I made to the staff was answered with either "No" or "That costs extra." Compare that to Four Seasons, where they offer complimentary water during check-in, complimentary coffee and tea, complimentary shoe shines, complimentary newspaper of your choice, complimentary turn-down service, and even a complimentary house car that will take you anywhere you want to go within a three-mile radius. In addition to all these amenities, the staff actively went out of their way to accommodate me, even greeting me by name when I walked through the lobby. This was a welcome change to the rest of the city, where you're just another face in the crowd. In fact, the entire hotel felt like an escape from Vegas - there were no lines during check-in or check-out, no masses of people crowding around a nightclub, no shrieking or laughing coming through a connecting door, and not a single slot machine to be heard as you walk through the hallways. It's an oasis of serenity in one of the most vibrant cities on Earth. There are downsides, unfortunately. The dreaded resort fee is here, although if an extra $20 per night will break your budget, this probably isn't the best hotel for you. Mandalay Bay, which houses the Four Seasons, is located on the far end of the strip, meaning it's a long walk to anywhere. There are only two restaurants specific to the Four Seasons, a steakhouse and a café, and both are quite pricey (though the food is excellent). Finally, it can be a bit of a scavenger hunt to find where the entrance to the hotel is hidden, especially after a long day and a few drinks. Despite these few problems, it's easy to see why the Four Seasons holds a place as one of the top hotels in Las Vegas. The rooms are not cheap, but if you can afford to stay there, you'll get to enjoy one of the few five-star hotels in the city that actually deserves its rating.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: indyweirs
Reviews.Content: Our Four Seasons experience was excellent. Beautiful accommodations, perfect service. Hidden treasure in Mandalay Bay...peaceful, classy, quiet - yet just an elevator ride to all the usual Vegas craziness.

Reviews.Title: “AS GOOD AS EVER”
Reviews.Author: bgrantma
Reviews.Content: Arrived jan 28 for one night seemless checkin at 2 pm on a sat aft i had booked a stripview room through amex fhr and all the benefits that come with that were explained to me at check-in previous posts had complained of a dated room i didnt find that at all sure when i stayed here a few years ago it looks the same as it does now but they keep the common area and rooms in bristol condition. i had dinner at the veranda sat nite it was excellent try the italian donuts for desert aft dinner i went and saw brad paisley at the mandalay great show gambled then retreated back to the calm and serenity of the FS sun breakfast buffet at the veranda was so good everything you could want and more. checking out to go to the bellagio for 4 days of meetings hate to leave look for bellagio review.

Reviews.Title: “Serenity on The Strip”
Reviews.Author: toddennyc
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons is tucked away atop Mandalay Bay. I was surprised to learn this when I arrived. The lobby is beautiful and isn't typical tacky Vegas. Physically lives up to the Four Seasons name. I was most impressed with the employees at the hotel. The service I received was always genuine and personal, which is unusual for hotel staff in Vegas. Breakfast, Lunch, and Dinner was experienced all at the hotel restaurant. The menu was very imaginative and well executed. The pool food was good too.

Reviews.Title: “except for my cell phone usage”
Reviews.Author: mjdio
Reviews.Content: A wonderful and personal first class experience in an elegant hotel. Probably one of the most friendly, courteous and efficiently staffed hotels in the world. It is affordable elegance, but the true difference is the total avoidance of cumbersome lines and a noisy crowded lobby. Check the cost of every call before you dare dial that phone. It will cost an immediate $12.50 just for connecting outside of the local area.

Reviews.Title: “A stopover stay”
Reviews.Author: tonymartinez92
Reviews.Content: Recently I had the chance, while on my way to LA, to stopover for the night in Las Vegas. My wife and I were lucky enough to stay at Four Season's property on the strip. From the moment we arrived, we were treated like royalty. It was almost embarassing how much attention we recieved, but none the less, it was amazing! We decided to dine in the casual restaurant, Verandah, and it was, like the rest of the stay a plesant experience. I have to admit though, we ordered lighter fare and were not overly impressed. It just seemed like it parts of the dinner were prepped too far in advance and not as fresh as they could have been. The service was prompt, courtious and pleasant. The rooms were very well appointed as you would expect at a Four Seasons, we had an amazing view of the strip and the beds were comfortable. I appreciate the newer style of coffee dispensers in the room (Krueg's single serve) but they're too loud. My wife was sleeping so I felt that I had to venture to the lobby for my morning fix, not my favorite thing to do when I first wake up is have to ride an elevator and encouter others in the lobby when I"m still in my "PJ's". I think there has to be a better solution. Overall, though, we enjoyed our stay and send a big thank you to the staff. You were all so nice, we appreciate all your hard work!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location with amazing views of the strip.”
Reviews.Author: Matthew C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is both elegant and beautiful. More relaxed than the rest of the strip but being next to Mandalay Bay gives you great access to the highlights and local attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Splendor in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Lulu120639
Reviews.Content: The service was the best. Individual attention at the pool, the front desk and in the restaurant. Your every need was met. The room was very clean and the bed comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel as far as service hands down.”
Reviews.Author: UberTravelerNYC
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of places to choose from in Vegas and although the Four Seasons is not as new a some of the others it is still the best in terms of service. The staff really does a great job acknowledging you where as at some of the other hotels it's impossible to get that level of service. It was also a great escape from the casino noise and crowds. Meeting rooms looked great and I liked the fact that you didn't have to walk miles from your room to the meeting space.

Reviews.Title: “NICE!”
Reviews.Author: SpaniardinIowa
Reviews.Content: We really had a great time at the Four Seasons in Las Vegas, during the day we just stayed at the pool and really enjoyed the quiet, peace and pampering (frozen treats, face spray, sunglass buttler, flavored water, sunscreen etc). Great treatment, the only thing is that the rooms are small compared to other hotels in the area but other than that, everythign else was good, including the restaurant by the pool for romantic night diners. I will not stay anywhere else in Vegas, just wished the rooms where bigger!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: BagmanNZ
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here over Christmas. Everything was terrific, the staff, the room, everything about this hotel. My only suggestion would be to dump the Mandalay Bay. I know with this hotel taking up the top few floors of the Mandalay Bay this could be a problem, but I'm sure it would be worth it. We only went through the Bay once but it was enough, it hasn't proved any better than the last few years when we've been to it. But the Four Seasons, superb, absolutely and completely, superb.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Diane D
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay at the Four Seasons....just loved it! I honestly did not even want to go, but I must say the hotel helped make the trip a really wonderful one. We had a small suite with an unbelievable view and breakfast in the room looking at "the view" every morning. The reception staff, concierge staff and hotel greeters at the front door all to a man/woman could not have been more helpful. From almost being forced to go by my husband, I now am trying to decide when we can return! I would not even consider staying any where else...so good to have the option of not going in and out of a casino every time you want to go to your hotel...yet there is one so very close. We loved the quiet...as well as the wonderful dinner we had in the Veranda...really VERY good! We used the American Express Platinum Card as well...that is the way to go!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: michbren
Reviews.Content: We went to Las Vegas strictly to see a show that we had wanted to see for a couple of years. We were looking for a non-gaming hotel and were undecided between the Four Seasons and Mandarin Oriental. The Four Seasons provided everything we expected: beautiful hotel, very quiet, superb customer service, quality rooms with comfortable bedding, many nice amenities in the room, excellent housekeeping service, three express elevators and delicious food in the Verandah restaurant. We reserved a basic room, which is what we received – the lowest floor (35th) overlooking the airport runway and the Mandalay Bay Convention Center parking lot. It wasn’t the best view and you could hear the planes taking off but since we were only staying two nights it was fine. We really liked being able to schedule the three hour window that would work best in our schedule for housekeeping to clean our room. We enjoyed the proximity to Mandalay Bay, as we went there a couple of times and it was great to return to the serenity of the Four Seasons via “the secret door”. I am glad we selected this hotel and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Oasis”
Reviews.Author: london5288
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Four Seasons Las Vegas with my 23 year old daughter in January 2012. I used my Amex Platinum card benefits which included complimentary breakfast and a complimentary dinner in the Verandah cafe. We were warmly greeted by the staff every day and our room was a free upgrade to a Premium Strip View as part of my Amex card benefits. The room was spacious, the view was amazing and our bathroom was luxurious with wonderful amenities. When the housekeeping staff noticed that I was using the Occitane lotion, she left extras for me in the room. We enjoyed the convenience to Mandalay Bay which was just steps away from the serenity of the Four Seasons. We used the tram from Mandalay Bay to the Excalibur, then walked to other locations on the strip such as the Bellagio and the Mirage. Since the Four Seasons is on the south end of the strip, it is further away from the action than hotels like the Bellagio. However, we preferred being able to escape the chaos of the north end of the strip and return to our peaceful paradise at the Four Seasons each evening. The food was delicious in the Verandah cafe and our dinner there was a superior dining experience. Our waiter was knowledgeable about the menu, helped us with a wine selection and gave us tips on things to do in Vegas. He was an exemplary staff member and added to the enjoyment of our Four Seasons experience. I would definitely stay at the Four Seasons again and I can understand why other reviewers agree this is the number one hotel in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “fab”
Reviews.Author: h b
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, staff, food and concierge. Really fab and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Serene and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: JMK220
Reviews.Content: We had just drove all over Utah, Arizona, and Nevada, and were ready to settle down for a night. This hotel is a serene paradise in the midst of the crazy Las Vegas Strip. The staff was so generous and caring and catered to your every need. I got the best facial I had ever received at the spa, and the pool was one of the best parts! It was a clear, cool oasis hidden inside a beautiful garden. The poolside food and service was great! The food was better than the best you can get in a restaurant. The rooms were also very nice. We stayed up until 1:00a.m., (3:00a.m. Ohio time which we are used to!), still got a great night sleep and woke up refreshed. Seriously, this review sounds to good to be true, but I can't say enough good things about this place! Choose Four Seasons Las Vegas no doubt. A great place for people of all ages.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in a circus!”
Reviews.Author: Anne W
Reviews.Content: All I can say is if you want a cultured, refined and relaxing spa hotel in Las Vegas without the ding-ding-ding of slot machines this is IT! This is the ONLY hotel I would even consider staying with kids if we were passing through the city. Wonderful, polite and thoughtful staff... sigh... miss it already!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: beachretirement
Reviews.Content: Over Christmas we decided to stay at the Four Seasons. Our room was amazing and we were offered an upgrade when we arrived, we already had a strip view but they gave us an even more amazing room with a view of the strip! Every detail was perfect and the staff went out of their way to make sure we had what we needed and adapted to our special needs. We will definitely be back to stay longer. The beds are great too!

Reviews.Title: “Faultless as a hotel, but location let it down a bit.”
Reviews.Author: h_goodwin
Reviews.Content: We turned up havign just dropped off our rented harley so were all kitted out in bikers gear and incredibly sweaty and pretty gross. This didn't seem to phase the staff as we got out of the Eagle Rider van, or as we checked in. The service was impeccible, welcoming the newly-weds to the hotel. We were asked if we'd like to upgrade our room at a reduced cost and refused this (we'd been on the road for 5 days staying at fairly crummy motels, so whatever room they were going to give us would feel like a palace) but they upgraded us anyway! We had a strip view room on the 35th floor - the views were incredible, particularly from the ceiling to floor windows. the bed was the most comfortable i've ever slept in and boy did we sleep well for the 2 nights we were there - I'm surprised we even left the bed it was THAT comfortable! the room was huge and we had plenty of space and a great little coffee machine that made proper coffee. We did, however, venture out and on our return we had a little card and a plate with two giant straweberries that were soaked in champagne and coated in chocolate in the bride and groom outfits - with compliments from the consierge. A really lovely touch. there were bathrobes and slippers for us and luxury toiletries in the bathroom. the whole place oozed understated luxury. the staff were very helpful and always so polite, even after I wrote to them to thank them upon our return to the UK, I got a letter back from the Manager. The only thing that let it down slightly was the location. It's right at the bottom of the strip and you need to add on at least an additional 20 minutes if walking to get there. The location was, in fact, so far away from the action that my husband has said he wouldn't go back. I on the otherhand, would. But apart from the location, our stay here was faultless. An amazing experience for such a special time in our lives.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms r looking old ,when r u remodeling?”
Reviews.Author: Avi L
Reviews.Content: When r rooms upgraded,need remodeling. We r loyal customers for over 10 years,but we cannot stay in old looking rooms and paying the same or lower if we can stay at encore or mandarin oriental instead

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in a crazy place”
Reviews.Author: gabbyr7
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Four Seasons hotel in Las Vegas. Its a perfect hotel for kids and a quite oasis in the heart of Las vegas. The facilities and service were fantastic. We had a suite with 2 rooms, it was lioght and spacious and clean. The kids were welcomed with chocolates written in thier names and bath products ready especially for them. The pool was never busy and the staff around the pool were fantastic, remembering our names. The hotel is at the end of the strip which is good as its not crazy around you but means you cant walk to shopping or the other casinos. All together it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in the middle of the desert”
Reviews.Author: callstuz
Reviews.Content: If Las Vegas is an oasis in the middle of the desert, then the Four Seasons is an oasis in the middle of Las Vegas. For the busniess traveler, it's tough to beat: top-notch service and facilites (as expected from a Four Seasons Hotel), excellent dining options in the hotel, and easy access...no need to walk a mile through a maze of slot machines and smoke to get to the lobby. Simply drive to the entrance, and you're there. If you want the "Vegas Experience" you can walk out a side door and enter Mandalay Bay's casino. If you want to venture out, no problem because there aren't any long lines at the Four Seasons, another huge plus. The Spa has a fully equipped gym, with a fantastic steam room. Various massage and beauty treatments are available. For the business traveler, girlfriend's weekend, or a couple's getaway, if you're looking for the Vegas scene but want serenity at night, look no further than the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Very spacious”
Reviews.Author: LAmom_11
Reviews.Content: My husband, toddler, and my mom accompanied me for a professional meeting at the Wynn in October and we stayed at the Four Seasons. We chose the Four Seasons because they provided a microwave and fridge free of charge for me to heat up milk for my toddler. We stayed at the suite, large square footage, large entry into the room and in front of each bathroom. They also had a welcome gift for my toddler and child soaps/shampoo (same with other Four Seasons). Their service was excellent. They put a diaper genie in the room. We went to Palmer's Steakhouse downstairs which was very good if you love wine and steak. The pool was nice, heated. Valet was very curteous, put bottled water in our rental car each time. The best things about this hotel are cleanliness, spaciousness, and customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodation”
Reviews.Author: azlinden
Reviews.Content: Our accommodation was great. Hotel was a quiet and restful oasis in Vegas. Special treatment for our pet that was much appreciated and staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons Experience”
Reviews.Author: iskico10
Reviews.Content: Ended New Year's Weekend with a Strip view room and it was perfect. Verandah was a good dinner experience. Reserving SUV and Driver to the neighboring McCarran Airport was very helpful for a very early morning flight out. Once you've experienced Four Seasons, nothing can compare.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas casino free!”
Reviews.Author: heidi h
Reviews.Content: We wanted to go somewhere warm but close to where we live so we didn't have to fly far with our 2 year old. We decided on Vegas and in researching hotels I discovered (via tripadvisor) that the four seasons has no casinos (which is a definite selling point for us), offers access to the pool amenities of mandalay bay AND the rooms are the same price or LOWER than most of the other nicer hotels on the strip. While it is at the end of the strip and this might be a negative to some, is a quiet oasis in all of the madness of vegas. The four seasons is also EXTREMELY kid friendly, offering welcome gifts, bathroom amenities, and child sized bathrobes! The pool also has life guards on duty during the day and has great, inexpensive food poolside for kids. The service, rooms, spa, are all top notch!

Reviews.Title: “After second stay, this is definitely our firm favourite in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Pomonan
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in August, and a further night in December 2011. This really is an excellent hotel option in Las Vegas; we really do like the feeling of separation from, yet convenient access to, Mandalay Bay's Casino. It's probably a toss-up in many ways between this and the Tower Suites at the Wynn, but if anything this represents better value (unless you can get a deal at Wynn/Encore). August was a rare summer visit for us, but well worth it - can thoroughly recommend the pool here. Service is excellent throughout. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “New Years 2012”
Reviews.Author: PortlandWirenut
Reviews.Content: Once again, this is by far the best hotel in Las Vegas to stay at. Everyone from the valet service to the front desk to the maid is friendly and helpful if needed. The rooms are comfortable, well cared for and if there is any problems, those are taken care of promptly. It is a great escape from the casino atmosphere which can be overwhelming sometime but always fun, especially when you are "winning". Geat way to end the old year and begin the New!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ahhhh...so wonderful, quiet amid the noise of Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: PatChris22
Reviews.Content: Everything here was FIRST CLASS! The staff, the room, the spa, the quiet, right next door to the noise of the Mandalay. The Four Seasons has its own lobby and occupies the top (4 or 5) floors of the Mandalay. The elevator has stops for the top floors, the lobby and "C", for casino. The elevator stops, you walk 10 feet through you own private door into the Mandalay front desk and casino. When you want to leave the noise, and smoke, your room key lets you through the door back into the Four Seasons elevator, and smoke-free quiet and elegance. This will be the only place we stay when in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Our New Favourite in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: cal8888
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel just before Christmas 2011 for two nights. Absolutely the best and top-notch service we have experienced in Las Vegas and we have stayed at pretty well all the good hotels. We were consistently greeted by name from the get-go - and ALL levels of service were attentive and friendly while maintaining a high level of professionalism. Rooms and hallways were impeccably clean and QUIET (although there was a faint aroma from food preparation - but not in the room, only hallways). The room was well appointed with elegant furnishings and a nice bathroom, but was a bit on the small side for Vegas. Still very, very nice though - no complaints. We stayed with the AMEX fine hotels program so we got an automatic complimentary room upgrade, complimentary breakfast every day, and one complimentary dinner. Food was excellent. The Fitness Club access was complimentary and the facility was spacious and immaculate with all the newest equipment - lots of bikes, ellipticals, treadmills (all with built in TV's) - plus complimentary fruit, iced gatorade and iced lemon water. There were plenty of big windows overlooking the gardens and large fountain. The Spa is attached to the fitness area and was also immaculate and well-staffed. This hotel has no casino so THANK GOODNESS we did not get assaulted with cigarette smoke, ringing slot machines, crowds and all the usual casino-related stuff when we checked in. Just a gorgeous lobby and gracious staff, and beautiful peace and quiet. But worry not gamblers - the hotel is connected to Mandalay Bay so you can go to the casino in a heart-beat if you like or take the monorail from Mandalay Bay and walk to the hotels that are more central on the strip. Bags were up to the room within minutes, and when we checked out the bellman was at our room within minutes of hanging up the phone to collect our bags and load them into our car. When I forgot some bags in the back seat of the car, which had already been parked, the bellman graciously retrieved them and they were in our hands within 15 minutes of placing the request. This will now be the ONLY hotel we will stay at in Vegas - our new favourite!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific customer relations work by Diego. They really take care of the guests. Best place in Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: B0bD
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quiet a peaceful yet provide interconnecting access to Mandalay Bay Casinos and shows. The food quality is exemplary. The food servers are very attentive. But don't show up at the restaurants right before their closing time, you will still get very good service, but not excellent service. All other times, the restaurant gives outstanding service. The housekeeping gives best service, they even call you to provide turn-down service in case they see do not disturb sign on the door. So, if you are looking for a hotel that is serene and has quiet elegance, then you can bet this selection.

Reviews.Title: “Our new favourite hotel in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Mike S
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best hotel in Las Vegas. The doormen greet you by name, the check-in is quick and friendly, the room is fabulous (great bed and shower), and the food and service at the restaurant is five star! The workout centre is clean, modern, fully loaded with all the equipment and amenities you could imagine.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LinusBF2
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Las Vegas is perfection. However why would you come to Vegas and stay in a hotel that is so non Vegas. This is the same Four Seasons you would find anywhere in the world. You head to Vegas to have a Vegas experience. You will not find it at this hotel. It is small, the pool is the same as you would find in many yards in middle america. In fact the hotel is gated from its neighbor "Mandalay Bay" to give the Four Seasons a feeling of exclusivity. So pretentious, very funny once you see the pool at the Four Seasons. In brief, it is a place to stay if you have too much money and are above having a Vegas experience.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrsluxuryexplorer
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay here. I didn't mind being so far down strip, I liked that the hotel didn't have gambling. Loved the room, well designed, a place for everything so would be suited to longer stays. We stayed 5 nights. Loved the pool area, loved the gym. The gym is shared with the spa, so nice environment and nice free cucumber water. Friendly door staff, even though our car pulled up covered in mud with us very bedraggled from a day in death valley! Only negative: We returned from strip one night for drink in hotel bar - was 10.05pm, but server said bar had just closed, no other bar available and could not take drinks up to room! (We could have ordered room service, but twice the price, or go back to casino at Mandalay Place. We were tired so just went to bed!) This seemed odd for a hotel, especially in Vegas! Also happy hour does not seem to be active at the pool bar, only Veranda bar, even though it is just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and the best hotel in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: sofiaJ66
Reviews.Content: From the time you step into Four Seasons Las Vegas, the concierge are welcoming and friendly, the front desk is professional and efficient! Our suite is just what we wanted and more! Spacious and classy! Bathroom- a must for us shower and bath tub separate! The walk in dressing room was perfect -keeping our suitcases,clothes out of sight! The concierge services are outstanding..they cant do enough to accomodate their guests! We had asked them at the last minute if they could get us Guns and Roses tickets- they managed and we got excellent seats on the balcony! 10/10 to them! The Spa is professional and their massages are great...one of the best spas! The gym well that was also impressive...well run and they even re-fill your cup whilst you are running on the treadmill!! :) Service with a smile! The restaurants in the hotel are great and when you want to go to the casino- its only a door away and you can enter the noisy world! Overall a 5 star experience!! This is our second stay at this hotel and we will return!

Reviews.Title: “quality and style only let down by location”
Reviews.Author: ade1266
Reviews.Content: The service is everything you would expect from a luxury brand sich as The Four Seasons, down to the complimentary show shine every day which is excellent. Reception staff are polite and efficient, there are more doormen than guests (or that is how it feels) and its nice to have your own express elevator - the Four Seasons is set on the top four floors of The Mandalay Bay hotel. The hotel has its own private pool area although you can use the larger wave pools etc of The Mandalay Bay, although their guests cannot use yours. Service here again is impeccable - loungers are towleed for you, chilled water brought to your side, nothing is too much trouble, although as the pool area is small, it does get busy. Ensure you ask for a strip facing room otherwise your only view may be of the airport 2 miles away. Our room was beautiful, clean, well appointed with stationary that appeared to be closer to papirus than plain orrdinary paper - nice touch. My only reservation is that the hotelis at the very end of the strip and therefore you can feel out of the action a touch, if thats possible in Vegas - closer to the centre and the score would definitely have been a 5.

Reviews.Title: “everything you want in vegas is at your fingertips, with class”
Reviews.Author: sck1
Reviews.Content: another stay, another 5 star review. It is another world to most of Vegas. It is classy,quiet,mannered staff and beautiful. Just a hidden hallway from the busy Mandalay Bay , you have the best of both worlds. We were able to use the complimentary car service a few times and it got us around up the strip and to the town mall. This a wonderful help since the taxis were expensive so I rather tip a driver who does nor charge for sitting at a light. The Varanda was super for a quiet drink at happy hr. and breakfast .Staff are like gosts--- you dont notice them but they are there when you need them. Well trained!

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as expected...”
Reviews.Author: bev s
Reviews.Content: We are familiar withe Four Seasons in other cities and found this one tpo not be quite at the same level of service as the others. We enjoyed the hotel itself, just felt service could have been more with a smile...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience. U must stay at this hotel to believe it.”
Reviews.Author: Roxi B
Reviews.Content: Try the restaurant, the food and service are excellent. We've had brunch and several dinners and not been disappointed. The fitness center has it and the rooms are nice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect foil for Vegas trip”
Reviews.Author: M S
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the perfect retreat for the high pitched pace of Vegas. We were happy to be in the city and happy to have a very comfortable, even luxurious, hotel and room and spa to retreat to in order charge our batteries for more Vegas stimulation and excitement. Must do: get a room with a strip view! The Saturday / Sunday brunch was the bomb..We definitely want to go back to Vegas and just as much, want to go back to that Four Seasons hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Every Thing Perfect”
Reviews.Author: CarnivoreGunter_TX
Reviews.Content: If you can find something wrong, you can not be made happy. From the time we arrived till we checked out it was perfect. Giant two room suite with a view of the strip. The bed was great and it's just a different mood than when you are at other places. No hipsters or wannabe's.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing as always!”
Reviews.Author: laurabell57
Reviews.Content: An excellent experience from beginning to end. Quiet,, clean, professional and friendly. We did not like the Verandeh. Service and food were below our expectations. We did not even eat our main dish. Room service was prompt and plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Escape. The Four Seasons provides a welcome and luxurious break from Las Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: JCT1216
Reviews.Content: Awesome service and rooms. The location is fantastic and the hotel is quiet and calm offering relief from the Las Vegas noise. The long taxi lines that are common at casino hotels are virtually non-existant at the Four Seasons and the valet staff is amazing. They welcome you by name and send you off with bottled water and a smile. I would absolutely stay at the Four Seasons Las Vegas again.

Reviews.Title: “*****”
Reviews.Author: Matthew E
Reviews.Content: an oasis in Las Vegas. easy access to the Mandalay casino and the Boulevard. the stay was awesome. cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Guhan V
Reviews.Content: Great hotel on the strip. They had a nice kids welcome amenity. Everyone was courteous and the room was excellent. I picked this hotel since it was fully non smoking and I was very particular about this since I was traveling with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Cant wait to go back !”
Reviews.Author: jajd123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in October 2011, during our 14 night stay in Las Vegas. The Four Seasons hotel is situated on the top floors of the Mandalay Bay, with reception on the Ground floor, the hotel has its own dedicated lifts that only stop from the 37th floor. We were able to check in around 12:00 although the room wasnt ready, we made our way outside to the pool area which was very nice with plenty of comfortable loungers in the shade which was great as it was very hot. We were served with plenty of water, frozen fruit and nice cool face wipes which was a relief in the 100 degree heat. The staff were attentive, polite and friendly throughout our short stay. We received our room key around 14:00 and our room was 38106 which was on the 38th floor, the hotel is spotlessly clean as you would expect and the room was lovely and very comfortable with floor to ceiling windows the view (especially at night time) was fantastic. The bathroom was large enough with great L'Occitane toiletries which we use at home. There were also robes and slippers which was also a nice touch. Overall the hotel was extremely comfortable and cosy and not overly stuffy as some 5 star hotels can be. We will be back here, hopefully for a longer stay when we return to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Always the best!”
Reviews.Author: DrDaveMaui
Reviews.Content: Great personal service. Greeted by name. Great food and service at Verandah. Comfortable bed and bathroom amenities. Quiet oasis in a high-energy town, yet convenient to action. All these things keep us coming back regularly to Four Seasons Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “The best las Vegas hotel...period!”
Reviews.Author: jtrob
Reviews.Content: Quality of accommodations, staff, overall experience is what you should expect from Four Seasons. What i liked best about the hotel is the quiet and serene nature of the stay in the midst of all the casion/Vegas experience going on all around. It's an island of sanity in an insane town, and you don't forced to walk through a casino when experiencing the hotel Concierge was also allot of help. Overall great stay, it's the only hotel I want to use in Vegas from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious - OUTSTANDING service”
Reviews.Author: JSMass
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure of recently staying here during a trade show. I arrived with a very bad case of laryngitis. The hotel must have informed every staff member. I was given chicken broth, tea with honey, extra orange juice to "help me get better". It was very nice to be fussed over so much. The hotel has an excellent spa/fitness center. I did not use the spa but did use the fitness center - it was well equipped and extremely clean. All first class just like the rest of the hotel. The room was huge, opulent, the bed was superbly comfortable. The room was extremely clean. The best thing about the property was the service. Highly recommend this property over the rut of casinos on the strip. Keep in mind that staying here will require a taxi ride (approx $20.00) to get anywhere on the strip. So if you have a lot of meetings it may be a bit expensive going back and forth. The hotel does have a car service that operates on a first come first served basis.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the marathon/half marathon”
Reviews.Author: DFW_travlr
Reviews.Content: Excellent service. The room was very spacious with a great view. Very comfortable. Maid service was excellent, came by twice a day. My only negative comment is the Four Seasons is located on the top floors of the Mandalay Bay. I'm claustrophobic, so staying on the 37th floor made for an uncomfortable elevator ride. Fortunately, the elevators are quick and since they are dedicated only to the Four Seasons, we never had a wait. The Four Season's staff were very welcoming after the race. We were welcomed back to the hotel with water, a heated entrance, along with smiles and greetings. We were able to get from the finish line to the hotel lobby without having to deal with the mess inside Mandalay Bay.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Vegas! An oasis!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelgirlWyoming
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Four Seasons in Las Vegas for 8 days for a conference. What a perfect choice to stay here and not in one of the many noise and smoky hotels on the strip. My room was on the 37th floor and the view over the strip breathtaking. The Spa and the restaurants are top notch as expected. I have stayed at the Bellagio, the Wynn and the Palazzo but I fell in love with the Four Seaons because you can stay in Vegas having to deal with the craziness. Loved it and I will return!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful oasis among the glittery Strip”
Reviews.Author: island2beach
Reviews.Content: I fell in love with the Four Seasons.No smoke, no hype, just a quiet,serene elegance in which to relax. I stayed for three nights the first week in December.The Rock n Roll marathon was just outside on December 4th. The hotel was a calm refuge. Next door, the Mandalay Bay hotel and casino had people sleeping in the hallways.While it is fun to visit the other hotels and casinos, I want to come back to a smokefree enviroment.The free expresso bar in the lobby every morning was a treat.The seafood macaroni and cheese in the Verandah restaurant was so delicious. Another treat was the tomato soup with its pesto finish. YUM! It is all the way at the end of the Strip so travel to the shows is something to consider.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel beats Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: callia02
