Reviews.Content: Four Seasons Las Vegas represents a distinguished clientele and cut-above service from the rest of the strip hotels including other 5-star resorts in City Center, Bellagio, etc...However, as some guests have noted, the room is nothing special for a Vegas resort. Specifically the room decor and amenities are a bit outdated. The bathroom is outfitted with brass fixtures - the nearby JW resort has larger tub and rain shower head. If we were there for the room alone, it would have been a disappointment when comparing the luxury of nearby Cosmopolitan or The Hotel. In fact, The Hotel has many of the same perks, but instead is an all-suite hotel with extras like flatscreens in the bathrooms and an extra half bath in every room. To sum it up, I would say my experience was similar to the Westin and Marriotts I travel to on business. Not bad, but not luxury that I would associate with Four Seasons. Pros: 1. Check-in persons were professional and helpful 2. Bath products 3. Location on the strip - away from traffic 4. Gingerbread holiday display 5. Clientele 6. Work-out facility 7. Turn-down service and housekeeping 8. Coffee maker 9. Service at pool Cons: 1. Verandah service (both before arrival and there) 2. Outdated/lackluster rooms 3. Bed sunk on one side 4. Size of pool and proximity to loud Mandalay Bay speaker systems 5. Men's locker room (spa) - did not have tea and ambiance of women's locker room according to my husband 6. Resort fee 7. valet - attendants overwhelmed - expensive to park w/ long wait We enjoyed staying at Four Seasons and appreciated very much the staff. For a larger, more luxiurious, unique room we will probably opt to stay at the Cosmopolitan, Mandarin Oriental or The Hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel , staff very professional , highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Sbanyard
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in november. At the end of the strip but ideal position to walk and see all of the strip then catch the monorail back if youre tired and dont want to walk back . Staff were all very professional the room was wonderful very comfotable and big. Hotel was excellent and would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great alternative in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: the_d_duo
Reviews.Content: Were in Vegas for a wedding. Have stayed at Mandalay Bay before, but honestly didnt know about this hotel - which has a separate entrance and is the top 4 or 5 floors. The rooms and common areas are a little dated, but spotless and well serviced. Staff is great. The atmosphere is a little more relaxed than Mandalay - although all of the frantic-ness is right through a set of doors. We liked that, although quiet in Vegas is not for everyone. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “2011 NFR trip”
Reviews.Author: mdvm
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel that has exclusive lobby with no slots or crowd. Staff caters to your every need. Rooms are clean and have great views. Luxury bathrooms with separate tubs, and showers. Spa and excercise room are clean and luxurious as well. As at all Four Seasons hotels no charge to use spa or excercise room. Wifi in your rooms. However, there is a $20 a day resort fee. Free coffee daily in spa and lobby. We were in Vegas for NFR and stay over lapped with the hectic Rock and Roll Marathon on Sunday night. Mandalay Bay was a zoo that night with runners passed out in the lobby, and lined up 100 deep to get on the elevators. We were glad we did not have to contend with that crowd. Twice daily maid service was wonderful, but normal for a Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: VRMG
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons in Las Vegas with our 2 daughters (7 and 3 yrs old) and chose the hotel as it did not have a casino and was rated child friendly by previous reviewers. The hotel was excellent - very discreet and sophisticated (unlike most Vegas hotels). The room size was excellent. We stayed in a regular room without a strip view as we wanted 2 beds (rather than a King and a sofa fold out bed for the kids). They did provide bath robes for the kids but only when we asked. They also sent up a plate of M&Ms with the kids names iced on the edge of the plate but no gifts for the kids as mentioned by previous reviewers. We parked our car with their valet service (there is no self park). The valet staff were brilliant and would always put a couple of bottles of water in our car before we drove off. In fact, bottled water was complimentary throughout our stay. We had a very comfortable stay and would highly recommend the hotel. My only criticisms are the following: 1. It is a 5 star hotel with enormous room sizes yet our beds were very small doubles - they surely can afford queen sized beds! 2. We were offered an upgrade when we checked-in for an extra $125 per night as they had lots of spare capacity (we checked in on Monday afternoon). It would have made me a Four Seasons fan-forever if they actually just gave us a free upgrade given that they had so many rooms available. 3. Room service was efficient but we had to constantly ask for things - the bathrobes for the kids, for the tea/coffee bar to be replenished, etc.

Reviews.Title: “A new tradition for Thanksgiving”
Reviews.Author: SRDryja
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, his parents, and my parents all stayed at the Four Seasons Las Vegas over the week of Thanksgiving 2011. All of us had such an easy time, from start to finish. The concierge was lightning responsive to all our requests (airport pickups, car rentals, ticket arrangements, etc.). The Verandah restaurant was the perfect host to our Thanksgiving dinner, providing a meal with all the traditional trimmings, as well as a meatless version for those of us who are vegetarian. We sat out on the patio with heat lamps warming us and could not have enjoyed ourselves more. We walked away with full bellies and sore cheeks from laughing and enjoying ourselves so much. The spa is beautiful--smaller than most, but ideal for the quiet hotel it calls home--and Heidi, the massage therapist, gave a great massage. I liked the fact that it was fairly small and quiet. It made it easy to feel at home and comfortable. The rooms were well-appointed and clean. They do show some age--the handle on our bathroom sink leaked when we turned it on and the TV in my in-laws room died while they were there. But the staff leapt to replace the TV as soon as they were called. It took 15 minutes from the time my mother-in-law called until they had a new TV, installed and working. Housekeeping did a great job cleaning our room daily. They added little touches, such as slippers at turn-down. My father-in-law couldn't fit the size medium slippers they left behind, so he put a note requesting larger ones. That night and from then on they left him large-sized slippers. This made his week. Finally, my husband had to work while we were there. The internet was fast and consistent and it was easy for him to get set up at the provided desk with all the provided outlets. The Four Seasons Las Vegas is a perfect hotel for those who want a quieter, non-smoking Vegas experience with access to everything the Strip offers. The only downside about it is that it is at the FAR END of the South side of the Strip, so if you have shows further north (and most shows are), you have to make arrangements to get there, either by renting a car, taking a taxi or using the hotel's courtesy car service, if it is available. Still, the next time we are in Vegas, we are staying there because of all the peace of mind they provide in every other way.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden treasure”
Reviews.Author: CairoLATravels
Reviews.Content: This Four Seasons is slightly hidden within Mandalay Bay. However, you feel like you are at a Four Season with it's own lobby, own check in area, own valet area & own elevators. Very clean, very quiet, you forget you are in the craziness of Las Vegas. The only thing is that it's located at one end of the strip but the rest of the strip is easily accessible by taxi, tram (to Monte Carlo) or walking (not that close though). We love traveling with our dog and they are so accomodating. They bring you a dog bed, dog bowls, dog water etc. BTW, the most comfortable beds everrrr.

Reviews.Title: “Classy corner of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: mjmf
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons isn't the sort of hotel you'd expect in Vegas. It's low-key, discreet, elegant and a bit sleepy, literally tucked into a few floors of one wing of Mandalay Bay hotel/casino, a much bigger hotel. It seems to cater to mostly business travelers rather than tourists - with a small lobby and no casino of its own, it's quiet and chill - not a party hotel. But the service is top notch, and the rooms and bathrooms are well appointed. The gym/spa area is very classy, and it's all about the details like chilled Gatorade in the gym and aromatherapy in the steam room. The resort fee, which you pay on top of the room rate, gives you wifi access and spa/gym access. I'd stay there again if i were on business, but for pleasure i'd go with another hotel more central and a bit more 'Vegas'.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay at the FSLV”
Reviews.Author: TXLacy
Reviews.Content: This was our third or fourth stay at the Four Seasons Las Vegas for business reasons. We were fortunate to have a wonderful view of the strip. The room was as clean, quiet and perfect as we remembered in the past. What also stands out at the Four Seasons is the service which is always accommodating and friendly. I particularly appreciate staying there because the sounds and smells of the casinos can be a bother. The only suggestion, and one I never mentioned to the hotel, is to add a thin blanket to the beds. There is a wonderful soft, fluffy comforter with a sheet. However, I always became warm at night and would like the addition of a thin blanket. The thermostatic doesn't make the room cool enough for the thick comforter. It may be just me, but others may benefit.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: LinZPhiladelphia_PA
Reviews.Content: Elegant, tranquil oasis adjacent to Mandalay Bay so you have the best of both. Views are nice. Gym facilities and pool areas are great. Everyone on staff is very professional, helpful & personable. One issue is that on weekends in the rooms facing the airport we could hear the music from the Lounge, "Foundations" on the top floor (which is part of Mandalay Bay into the week hours. The Four Seasons Hotel can't control that.

Reviews.Title: “On of the BEST hotels we have ever stayed in...”
Reviews.Author: KFG13
Reviews.Content: There isn't much more to say....we would gladly and wholeheartedly recommend the Four Seasons as an oasis of tranquility and calm in Las Vegas. Keep up the good work!!! The service was impeccable. The hotel was immaculate. And having the Mandalay Bay casino right on your doorstep but a completely separate entity is heaven-sent. Other people who have commented on TripAdvisor re: The Four Seasons have mentioned the secret door...and it was a joy to be able to use it and escape the chaos of Vegas!! K&A

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: Jim B
Reviews.Content: A "gem" of a hotel-- literally an oasis in the middle of a cultural wasteland.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Anniversary Stay!”
Reviews.Author: PamK91
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the Four Seasons Las Vegas. It's just what we wanted for our 24th wedding anniversary. Unlike other Las Vegas hotels, we were able to walk right up to the front desk and get our room within 5 minutes. We were greeted warmly by the front desk and congratulated on our anniversary. They upgraded us to a beautiful suite and sent up an anniversary card & cake once we settled in. Loved how quiet the hotel is--yet convenient to the strip. We visited the Mandalay Bay casino next door which was fun. My husband enjoyed the beautiful workout facilities the next morning while I lounged by the beautiful, quiet pool. Just a fantastic trip; I'd highly recommend this hotel to people wanting to be in Vegas but not wanting the crowds, noise, and smoke!

Reviews.Title: “Time to Step It Up”
Reviews.Author: LuxFirstTravel
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Four Seasons several times since it opened. Here's a quick summary of its pros and cons. PROS: No casino for those who want a quiet place to stay in Las Vegas. Private pool for FS guests only. Excellent restaurants on premise -- Verandah and Charlie Palmer. Decent fitness center and spa. Early check-in and out requests are generally accommodated. Easy access to Mandalay Bay and its pools and excellent restaurants. CONS: Noisy location next to McCarran Airport. Intolerable shrieking sound coming through room door when windy outside. Affected by internal construction noise from Mandalay Bay. New resort fee to access fitness center which was previously complimentary (internet access, however, is thrown in) Inconsistent quality of spa services. Last massage left me extremely sore and nauseous for a few days. An excellent massage therapist wouldn't let this happen. Non-descript rooms and suites -- decor lacks personality. Beds are not comfortable and the towels smell like harsh detergent. No special amenities in suites such as TVs in bathrooms or steam showers. Showers tend to leak a significant amount of water. AC system is very loud and not conducive to a relaxing atmosphere. TVs don't appear to be HD. Only valet parking is available. Front desk staff can be brusque or condescending at times. Overall, the cons sadly outweigh the positives. The kicker is that the Four Seasons tends to charge more than other properties. With all its shortcomings -- how can this be justified? It's long past time for the Four Seasons to step up its game. With other five-star properties in town offering lower rates, it is simply getting harder to justify staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but a bit behind the new casinos.”
Reviews.Author: knightline
Reviews.Content: I stayed here when the hotel first opened - then again in December of 2010. The suites and rooms on the strip side are worth paying more for the view. They are nicely appointed - but compared to the **** newer casino hotels like Wynn I found the Four Seasons lacking a bit. The pool is terrific - you can use their quiet smaller pool or go to the unique Mandalay Bay pools/ocean which is a lot more crowded but still worth visiting. The exercise room is adequate but nothing special. Rooms are very nice but a bit dated. I'd stay here again if I could find a special rate, but I prefer the Wynn or The Hotel at Mandalay Bay. Some of the newer 5**** casinos with more central strip locations have better views. Did I say my favorite is The Wynn?

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a mediocre casino”
Reviews.Author: Malthus500
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed in the Four Seasons and was impressed. The one bedroom suite was very comfortable and quite. Great view. Overall, the hotel is an oasis after a night of gambling. The hotel staff were very professional without being cold and the assistant manager (Matthew) went out of his way to right a minor wrong. Would gladly make it the only destination in Vegas and we have stayed at all of the nicest suites, including the newest at City Centre. HOWEVER, the Mandalay bay casino is getting tired and seems to cater to families with small children. Not the scene we wanted or expected having stayed at The Hotel on numerous occasions. May have been the holiday (Thanksgiving) or the closing of The Lion King but not nearly as nice as the Casino at the Wynn. In summary, go for the Four Seasons but gamble/dine elsewhere (Food at the Mandalay Bay casino is not great).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: Oxypete
Reviews.Content: Our family reunion over Thanksgiving was held here. The hotel is oustanding in every aspect. The staff is amazing and by the end of the second day were calling us by our family name. Don't miss the happy hour. The staff even gift wrapped a present purchsed for my son-in-law's birthday. Our room was clean and the bed very comfortable. Worth every penny we paid. We will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Four Season Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Sfacc1mm
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, it doesn't feel like you're in vegas. Spa was great and service top notch. can't wait for Four Season Maui

Reviews.Title: “A haven on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: DeanpW
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a quiet, sophisticated oasis on the Strip, yet close to gaming when you're so inclined. It takes up the top floors of the Mandalay Bay, yet has its own entrance, so you don't have to go through a casino to check in, as is the case with a number of Las Vegas hotels. Rooms are the typically high Four Seasons quality--comfortable and classy but not vulgar. Service also reflects the Four Seasons tradition--unobtrusive yet always available and personable. There are two very good restaurants, Charlie Palmer Steak and Verandah. While Charlie Palmer is the "name" restaurant, we actually prefer Verandah, for its available outdoor seating and varied menu. There is a private entrance to the Mandalay Bay casino and easy access to the many restaurants there and to the large outdoor "beach" there. There's also a quieter private pool for Four Seasons guests.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis on the boulevard.”
Reviews.Author: curlup44
Reviews.Content: Very central to all the casinos an restaurants and a first class hotel. Nice restaurant and very helpful staff,. Very good size rooms with all amenities.

Reviews.Title: “The Only Place to stay in Vegas !!!”
Reviews.Author: stuartbabcock
Reviews.Content: As close to perfection as you will find!!! From the private drive up, unrelenting impeccable service, and elegant accommodations you can not go wrong !!!!!!! You do not feel like you are in Vegas until you look outside or enter Mandalay Bay through private areas. The conference facilities are superb. The pool area and gardens is gorgeous and the water was warm enough to swim even though it was rather cool outside. I have previously stayed mainly in Bellagio, Wynn, Encore or Hard Rock Tower suites but these do not compare. If you like the service and experience that only Four seasons can give then stay at this amazing hotel. All rooms are in the top floors of Mandalay Bay that is reached through private express elevators.

Reviews.Title: “wow”
Reviews.Author: IglRMB
Reviews.Content: Another fantastic four Seasons experience. I must warn you - the hotel is for rich guys only, and I mean really RICH guys. I was luck to get a good deal, otherwise I´d stay elsewhere. The room was a palace!!! Amazing. Like in "Pretty woman" ' his bathroom is bigger than the Banana boat. Mine was even bigger! )

Reviews.Title: “A great escape in Vegas! Serenity on the strip : )”
Reviews.Author: MPTravelsAlot
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at the Bellagio when we come to Las Vegas for fun. I was recently in Vegas for a conference that was held at the Mandalay Bay so I decided to stay at the Four Seasons. The hotel is located on the upper floors of the Mandalay Bay Hotel with great views of the strip. What it has that many Las Vegas hotels lack is peace, quiet and yes serenity. Once you are done dancing or attending your favorite show, you will find a clean, quiet, peaceful room to come back to. A rare gem perched high atop the hussle and bussle of the Las Vegas strip!

Reviews.Title: “A little bit of calm”
Reviews.Author: travelmumatlanta
Reviews.Content: Had a four night stay here on our first ever trip to Vegas. We travelled with 2 young children so were aware that Vegas isn't exactly aimed at kids. We chose this hotel primarily for the fact that it had a non-gaming lobby and atmosphere. Room was ok- pretty standard higher end US hotel stuff. Staff were very welcoming and really made us feel comfortable with the fact that we had children in tow. There were some nice touches aimed at them- child sized bathrobes, and special bath products. And the chocolate jigsaw was a big hit! Staff did all they could to be helpful - concierge was knowlegable about the food options, staff in Veranda made the kids an off menu banana split when we rolled up at 4.30 in the afternoon. After the madness it was so nice to come back to the FS and felt that little bit exclusive because of its separateness. Be prepared to spend on taxis because you are at the far end of things.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Birthday Celebration”
Reviews.Author: jharris2466
Reviews.Content: We stay at many hotels around the world and have stayed in other top hotels in Las Vegas but every time we are at the Four Seasons, it's like coming home. From the front desk to room service, it is top notch. This trip was for only one night and it was my husband's 50th birthday. Denise and Cara at the Concierge desk were so helpful and efficient in assisting me with the day and really excited for us. The whole experience was great. I highly recommend if you want to feel like you're away and at a hotel that is a class act, you stay at the Four Seasons when you're in town.

Reviews.Title: “Different than expected”
Reviews.Author: Wagsdvm
Reviews.Content: There wasn't anything particularly wrong with my stay, but I purposely booked this hotel thinking it would be a smaller property (as is the case with most Four Seasons), as compared to the megahotels on the Las Vegas strip. It is positioned on the top floors of the Mandalay Bay complex, rather than a stand alone property. I prefer hotels where there is a balcony or window to open. I did love the aquarium in the lobby and especially liked the fantastic workout room. As always, great service, which I expect from the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Eye of a storm”
Reviews.Author: dnapp1
Reviews.Content: We chose the Four Seasons based on tripadvisor reviews and as many other reviewers have commented, this place is like an oasis amongst the frenzy of Las Vegas. Situated at the south end of the strip all the attractions are within walking distance (it is cool in November, may be too hot to walk in summer) or else use the monorails to get around. We visited most of the big hotels and this only re-inforced our view that we had chosen well. No queues at check-in, no casino to get through, a quiet pool area and reception, and friendly, helpful staff. The concierge office staff were really helpful with directions, taxis, booking tickets etc. OK it is expensive but you get what you pay for. We had a room looking straight down the strip from the 39th floor and we couldn't fault it. And if you do want the razzmattazz the Mandalay Bay is only yards away. After a hard day on the strip or shopping, get to the Verandah bar for happy hour (actually 4pm - 7pm) and enjoy one of the reduced price cocktails, and the snacks that are available. Will definitely stay there again when in Vegas, and I'm certainly be tempted to visit other hotels in the group.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Family Setting in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: minkymeen
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed here last week for 5 nights with our 4 month old baby. From the moment we arrived the staff were very helpful and friendly. Our room was excellent, very clean and had the extras which I had asked for for the baby e.g. microwave/kettle. There was a cot in the room with a welcome pack for the baby including nappies and a skincare range and a cuddly toy. A wonderful touch. We had a a problem with our room within an hour of checking in (one which I would rather not mention in this review) but once this was reported to housekeeping, the manager came and spoke to us, apologised and sent up 2 appetisers and 2 entrees to our room as way of an apology. We very much appreciated this gesture and the food was outstanding. The concierge was very helpful during our stay as were the front door staff and bell boys. There was always a taxi ready for us and someone waiting to take our bags and stroller to the room. My husband used the gym twice and said it was excellent. The hotel is with walking distance of the centre of the strip and we enjoyed our daily walk up and down the strip to and from the hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay away from the hustle and bustle of other hotels in vegas. As soon as you walk into the four seasons from a day out you welcome the peace and tranquility and relaxing atmosphere. I just wish the weather had been a bit warmer so we could have ted the pool outside! Perfect location for families who want a non casino / non smoking / non gaming hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, not perfect”
Reviews.Author: GoBlueTraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. The room was large and comfortable with chairs, desk, minibar, flat screen, closet space. The marble bathroom was nice and in good condition. Service to the room was excellent. You can choose the time of day you want your room made up. Attentive turn down service. A lovely pool just for Four Seasons or you can use the pools at the Mandalay Bay Hotel which is attached to the Four Seasons. I had a problem with the concierge. She gave me some wrong information. I ended up wasting about half a day back-tracking from what she told me and then figuring things out for myself. I should have just relied on my own iPhone as I always do and bypassed the concierge. So my main complaint at this hotel was that the concierge services were out-of-date. This wasn't the fanciest hotel room I have ever stayed in but it was very, very nice by most standards.

Reviews.Title: “A Fife Star Experience”
Reviews.Author: JFriedland
Reviews.Content: Excellent facility with well trained and knowledgeable staff.

Reviews.Title: “Classy place”
Reviews.Author: AlexDNewJersey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business for 3 nights. Elegant, comfortable rooms, free internet, nice pool, great food. A quiet place so if you're looking for a lot of hoopla- this is not it. However, it is connected to the Mandalay via the second floor. Nice amenities- robe, slippers, and upscale soaps, shampoo, etc. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: seersucker
Reviews.Content: I love the Four Seasons. We've stayed here 3 times and it's the only place we'll stay in Vegas. It's a great respite from the hustle and bustle of Vegas and the service is beyond reproach. I can't imagine a better place to stay. Love it!

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to come home to”
Reviews.Author: Joolzsunka
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Four Seasons in Las Vegas and were very glad we chose this hotel. My friend and I were in Vegas for the first time, neither of us really gamble, but we thought it seemed like a fun place to visit. The hotel was classic old style - all marble, cream and gold. I think it occupies the top six or so floors of Mandalay Bay. We had a lovely room that overlooked the Strip and the mountains. Floor to ceiling windows, comfortable beds, big bathroom with all the little extras like slippers, robe and great toiletries (L'Occitaine). Staff at the hotel are incredibly nice, knowledgable and helpful - from the front desk to concierge to staff in the bars & restaurants. Couldn't fault the service and they bend over backwards to help you. There is easy access to the Mandalay Bay Casino if you want to gamble, but you aren't staying on top of it. Much nicer atmosphere for people who really aren't that into the casino scene. It is also at the end of the strip, a bit away from the mayhem, which made it a great place to come home to. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Should be on the Short List of Las Vegas Luxury Hotels”
Reviews.Author: HLJaxon
Reviews.Content: I was in Las Vegas attending a conference in the Mandalay Bay. I explored reservations at the Mandalay Bay and noticed the Four Seasons was an adjoining property. I am so pleased I made that reservation detour. The rooms were sparkling clean, roomy and well appointed. I have stayed at other Four Seasons property, but I was absolutely blown away by the level of customer service at all levels of the hotel. From the housekeeping staff to the Concierge, all addressed me by name and made my experience extremely personal. I'm not an experienced Las Vegas traveler, but this will be the first property I check for availability for an subsequent stays.

Reviews.Title: “Queit oasis in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: bryan g
Reviews.Content: This hotel is like nothing else in Vegas. Probably like what hotels were like in the 50's. Personal service, friendly valets, doors opened and a welcome at every turn. The big luxury hotels never come close to this service unless you are a high roller. The non smoking and non gaming atmosphere was great. When we wanted that we went through one set of doors and were in the normal Vegas of the Mandalay Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service hard to match. Will come here again and again”
Reviews.Author: kaliushka
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights in October 2011 with our two year old daughter. This was our second stay at Four Seasons. We never felt the stay was too long, every day was very welcomed as we knew that the hotel staff does everything to keep you happy. The concierge provided lots of tips on how to make our stay enjoyable, including our daughter. She enjoyed the colouring books, DVDs and books that we could rent out for free. The spa and fitness service is quite relaxing, especially after a long walk. Oh, there is a espresso machine available early morning, so my husband and I started our day with a cup of latte and cappuccino, while our daughter enjoyed a pastry. Some people might say it is a bit far from the noise of the Strip, but we loved it. It was an oasis of serenity and luxury. Will go back again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Get the Four Seasons luxury experience without the Vegas craziness (that's right next door at Mandalay Bay if you want!)”
Reviews.Author: Amy B
Reviews.Content: Get the Four Seasons luxury experience without the Vegas craziness (that's right next door at Mandalay Bay if you want!)

Reviews.Title: “50th Birthday get away!”
Reviews.Author: azmom_11
Reviews.Content: From the minute we checked in, until our departure their service was outstanding, and the beds were amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Las Veags!”
Reviews.Author: BAS1982
Reviews.Content: We booked Four Seasons through LowCostUSA and it cost us £900 for double queen room for 7 nights inc taxes - Best Price found for this hotel - WELL WORTH THE MONEY! We arrived at the hotel and straight away the staff we very attentive. We walked into the gorgeous hotel and it was so peaceful. No queues at all to check in - unlike the rest of the hotels in Las Vegas. We then took the private lift to the 35th floor, no stopping at all the floors. Our room was a perfect size, two queen beds, desk, chair, tv, 2 wardrobes, coffee maker etc. Bathroom also was perfect size with a tub and shower and seperate toilet. Can I just say that the beds are the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in,in my life! The maid service is great too, they ask on check in when you would like them to come clean but our cleaner also came to our door and asked. This was good because we had changed our minds. They also came on an evening and left us several gifts like cupcakes and strawberries with melted chocolate! We were unsure about the tipping situation but with the maid i tipped at the end of the week -its a personal choice. Room view was of the pool and the mountains, helicopters flew past but very quiet. Pool was perfect. We stayed on the loungers near the bar which got alot of sun all day round. Staff were never too far away if you needed them but far enough not to bother you all the time. They came around with the Evian spritz and frozen fruit/chocolate which was a lovely surprise. Pool food - excellent. I recomend the burger and also the nachos-very filling, my brother had the seared tuna salad which he loved! Easy access to the Mandalay Bay pool, we never went through as the Four Seasons was just too perfect. Verranda-went here once for happy hour. Was very calm and relaxing and the drinks were good too $5 and were very strong. The private lift also takes you to the casino floor. This is where you access Mandalay Bay. As soon as you step into here you really feel the difference. We did spend a lot of time in the Mandalay bay casino, had a great enviroment but we were happy at the end of the night to take our private lift up to the room. Car parking - We used the self car park at the Mandalay Bay and only used the valet at Four Seasons through the day. This is because at the Four Seasons you can valet your car as many times as you want throughout the day but if you keep overnight you get charged $22. It is only a 5minute walk from Four Seasons to self car park. Also everytime you collect your car from Four Seasons valet they provide you with bottled water. Conseige - Anything you need advice with or help they supply. I needed directions to Red Rock canyon they provided, directions to Hoover Dam they provided, tickets for a helicopter ride to Grand canyon they called booked and organised. Brilliant service! I would always recommend this hotel as I wouldnt change anything about it even the car parking situation. Ten out of ten for everything. Great holiday great hotel. x

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation thanks to the Four Seasons!”
Reviews.Author: Jo S
Reviews.Content: All levels of staff could not have been nicer. Most important- the room was very very clean. We did not tell the staff that it was my birthday but housekeeping saw wrapping paper in our trash and when we got in late that night, there was a chocolate cake complete with plates, silverware and napkins with a very nice birthday card waiting for me on the desk. From the personal attention at the pool (which was quiet and wonderful) to valet making sure that we had cold bottles of water waiting for us in the car every time we called for it, I could not be happier with our hotel choice. From now on my family and I will only stay at the Four Seasons when visiting the great Las Vegas!!!

Reviews.Title: “Sanctuary in the Mayhem”
Reviews.Author: Bancroftus
Reviews.Content: Checked in easily & quickly, very quiet in reception, indeed quiet and relaxed throughout the hotel. Reasonable size room, very comfortable bed. Keurig coffee maker, desk and comfy chair. Bathroom has bath and a separate shower, good mirror and a hair drier is provided. Maid service is very high quality every day, I felt guilty messing up their work every day. It's not until you leave the Four Seasons into the Mandalay and the smoke, smell and crowds of the casino, that you really appreciate the serenity that the Four seasons offers. There is no greater contrast to the rest of the fantasy that is Las Vegas. On the food front the weekend buffet is excellent, but so were the other meals we had. Pool service food is similarly very good. Plenty of towels to lie on and dry off with, water heated so pleasant to swim in if the bigger Mandalay is too cold. Suncream available in dispensers if you forget yours, as we did. Vegas is great but we did travel outside to Red Rock Canyon which is true wide open cowboy country and great vale at $7 for a car, Hoover dam and the new bridge are great constructions, Grand Canyon South ridge is difficult to appreciate. Four seasons staff are only too willing to help on pretty much anything, including tracking down lost and found. They are efficient, helpful and friendly but not obsequious The only downside is that you are quite far from the centre of the strip so we took perhaps more taxis than expected but if you want peace and quiet in the whole hotel (for example The Bellagio reception is like a busy airport) and not just your room this is the place to be. Overall it was a great stay in a lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property with Service in Mind!”
Reviews.Author: disneydad331
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a trade show at the Mandalay Bay Convention Center. This property was super-upscale, but not too upscale for the regular traveler. I showed up in jeans and a sweatshirt, and it was still the same service that the people in suits got! Check-in was good, was able to be upgraded to a suite (which was great!) The restaurants were nice, and the whole area was nice and quiet because of its seclusion from the Mandalay Bay. If you wanted the casino, it was right through the door, but if you wanted the peace and quiet, you had it on the 4 Seasons side. Lots of free amenities including wi-fi, slippers, and shoe cleaning service. great views, and top notch service. Got a great rate through a hotel booking company, so it was a great value, not sure if it is worth the normal rack rates, but if you can get a good rate, this trumps the Mandalay Bay anyday!

Reviews.Title: “Super, many thanks!”
Reviews.Author: PeripateticJohn
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this oasis of elegance for three days last Christmas with my wife. This was the second time I visited Las Vegas and the first time for my wife who enjoyed it very much. We went to all the famous casinos, drove to Red Rock, took a helicopter to Lake Mead and the Grand Canyon (if you can afford it don't miss it), and all in all we had a great time! Our hotel contributed significantly to this. One of the few that doesn't have its own casino (it is adjacent to Mandalay Bay) it is quite and luxurious. The rooms are up to Four Seasons standards, the gym was perfect and the Christmas decorations were fantastic. We got married during our stay (in the Graceland Chapel, which I recommend wholeheartedly) and the hotel staff helped any way they could (perticular thanks to Brenda). And the photos we took before and after in the hotel lobby will last a lifetime. We shall definitely come again!

Reviews.Title: “Tranquility in the madness of Las Vegas - enjoy both!”
Reviews.Author: EastbourneFamilyFour
Reviews.Content: We were very concious that travelling to Las Vegas with an 8 and 10 year old was not the norm so we wanted to find somewhere that wasn't going to be hard work with kids. On this basis we looked at the non gaming hotels and picked the Four Seasons and we were glad we did. The hotel is amazing if you want to enjoy the madness of Vegas and then come home at the end of the day and shut the door on it all. You could be anywhere in the world in the Four Seasons but you have all the amenities on hand. The service is great buy you pay the price for that, however is there anywhere cheap in Vegas? Breakfast for four of us in the hotel was around £100 - I have to confess one day we went to McDonalds across the road for £25! Ours were the only kids in the hotel for the full 8 nights they were there. My kids are fine with this (as are we!!) but if you want kids clubs and other children to mix with then this hotel (in fact Vegas on the whole) is not the place to take them. The service round the pool is very much 5 star with chilled face towels, frozen fruit, fresh smoothies, sun cream and aloe vera and even complimentary hot chocolates (when it gets to 70 degrees) on a daily basis. The daily room fee is steep at $50 each (even the kids have to pay it which I think it pretty outrageous). The service is generally under stated and they do a great happy hour in the bar 4-7pm with $5 cocktails and small plates which we absolutely maxed out on! Our total dissappointement with the hotel was more for the kids than us. They said if you email in advance we will have welcome amenities and chocolate jigsaws for the kids. I did this a month in advance and it never happened even though I asked twice (it became embarassing after this) and they said they would send a birthday cake for my daughter in the middle of our stay, this never happened either. The night befoer we were due to leave the service kicked up a notch, not surprising as tips were due to housekeeping etc the next day, I don't like this. The Four Seasons is little known in Vegas and I like it this way, I would gladly return. You are connected to the Mandalay Bay so it's like being in the madness of it all with a door to tranquility (you will no doubt read other reviews about the 'secret door'). They just need to make sure they follow through on their 5* promises for the kids as well as the adults - they are their future customers.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: Ron S
Reviews.Content: No casino on site , but a short walk into the Mandalay Bay gives you all the gambling you need . A haven of peace and quiet with superb service . Absolutely faultless from Reception ,Housekeeping , Pool through to the Restaurants . Highly recommended for those who want a stylish hotel . Only downside was that it is located at one end of the strip so walk/taxi/train have to be used to get to the evening action !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in luxury surroundings”
Reviews.Author: Meals97
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our honeymoon in June 2011. I was able to get a corporate rate because of the nature of my work. We stayed in a deluxe strip view room and the view was absolutely amazing, particularly given the location of the Four Seasons at the end of the strip. The service was faultless. The atmosphere at the pool was great. The cocktails and pool food were amazing and reasonably priced (compared to other Four Seasons Hotels) but to be fair it is Vegas! The room was very clean having been cleaned in the morning and turned down at night. The bed linen was to die for! Concierge were very helpful and booked us on a last minute tour of the Grand Canyon. We went into many other hotels during our stint in Vegas and we were so happy to be going back to the haven of this tranquil hotel. It is probably the only hotel without a casino but there is one within easy reach at the attached Mandalay Bay. I would always stay at the Four Seasons for any future trips in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch”
Reviews.Author: nod90
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights here on Virgin Holidays deal - the deal on offer made it possible for us to afford staying discrete hotel 5 star eatablishment. We are now throughly spoilt when it comes to staying any where else. The Four Seasons manages to have an understated class about it which is no mean feat in a city as brash as Las V. The staff are attentive but not snobby. We got off the plane after a 10 hour journey - drove around the block to the hotel and were greeted as with respect and courtsey. Check in took 5 minutes. It was everything we expected and made our trip to Vegas really special. I cannot imagine going to Las Vegas and not staying at the Four Seasons. We had a north facing room on 38th floor - side ways view of strip and overlooking the airport and the mountains. Sound proofing excellent so watching planes come and go was exciting. Bed really comfortable. Pool area lovely. Food in the resturants the best in Las Vegas but pricey. But eating out in Las Vegas isn't cheap and not great value. Actually, Las Vegas is up it's self in this respect with lots of swank resturants which are very average by European [French] standards. Days out to Grand Canyon and Hoover Dam are great. And the shows are world class.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not up to all the hype”
Reviews.Author: KBGA
Reviews.Content: I’ll preface this review with the qualifier that prior to this stay we were at The Ahwahnee, a truly first class hotel. Everything else pales to the Ahwahnee. The Four Seasons is a fine hotel. It is a quiet oasis in the chaotic Las Vegas scene. Service is good. The staff do not just point you in a direction, they come out to show you. The room was comfortable and quiet. We had an airport view and did hear some plane noise but only with certain planes and it was not constant. The bed was good; bedding soft. The heavy down comforter was a bit much for Las Vegas tho. The bathroom is large with both show and big tub. We were surprised to find lipstick and empty sugar packets on the dresser but really the previous guests should know how to use a garbage can. It’s easily overlooked by housekeeping and otherwise the room was spotless. Much has been written about the pool but I can’t say it was all that great. We were sandwiched in like sardines the one day (the Mandalay pools were closed for a concert). They do come around, allegedly once an hour, with “amenities”. That would be one carefully rationed frozen mini Snickers bar per person. Never saw frozen fruit but my imagination says it would be one grape per person only please. An entire afternoon at the pool saw only one pass thru of the Snickers and one cold cloth. The pool opens at 9 and closes at 5, which was a let down. The pool attendants do make up a lounge chair for you with towels and provide a pitcher of fresh ice water. If you get a good price on the room, this hotel is definitely worth it. We unfortunately believed the hype and left another first class property early, and paid top dollar for one night – something we in the end didn’t think was worth the extra night and cost.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay, but...”
Reviews.Author: amegoro
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Friday-Sunday for Halloween weekend and UFC 137. Our room was located on the 38th floor with views facing the pool area. Overall, a wonderful escape from all the chaos that is Las Vegas. Highly recommend. A few highlights: 1) The bed is extremely comfortable and just what I needed to catch up on some sleep 2) Large and immaculate bathroom with L'Occitane products. 3) Very quiet and peaceful environment 4) Enjoyed a delicious brunch buffet at the Verandah restaurant which is located right next to the lobby. Fresh crab at the omelet station, enough said. 5) The little things: everything is clean and high quality, service with a smile/addressing you by your name

Reviews.Title: “Vegas at it"s Best”
Reviews.Author: Grannyfranny947
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Hotel of Las Vegas was one of the most enjoyable accomodations that we have experienced. From the time we checked in until we departed the staff members were extremely helpful, pleasant and willing to accomodate our needs. We have visited Vegas many times over the years and we can honestly say that The Four Seasons is at the very top of the list.

Reviews.Title: “Jimmy Buffett Vegas Concert Haven”
Reviews.Author: Chuck W
Reviews.Content: I honestly can say enough great things about the Las Vegas Four Seasons. My wife and look forward to booking our next trip and, without a doubt, we'll be back at the Four Seasons. The pool and staff made a perfect trip even better.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis on the Strip ...”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaToast
Reviews.Content: We checked in after a week-long conference at a nearby hotel - this was a planned treat and we were not disappointed. Upon check-in we were offered an upgrade to a one bedroom suite which we accepted and were soon in our 39th floor residence. During the previous week we had discovered the bar at the Verandah and dined there while watching the World Series. Certainly not a sports bar atmosphere, but rather a quiet small area with great service and food. Over the course of our three meals here we had both snacks and entrees - all were superb and the prices rival those of any other restaurant, even at the neighboring Mandalay Bay and THEhotel. The pool area was very private and totally removed from the Mandalay Bay beach area. Again, a welcome distinction. One could access the casino directly via a stop on the all-express elevators (the Four Seasons rooms are on the 35-39 floor of the Mandalay Bay) and there is a key-entry private area to the elevators on the casino level. We had the convenience, if we wanted it, but were were more than happy to escape to the hotel. Great stay and will be back next October. This location compared favorably to the others Four Seasons locations we have visited.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Business Visit”
Reviews.Author: Bradg1998
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 wonderful nights at the Four Seasons Las Vegas in October 2011, and would certainly visit again for my next business trip. The hotel is located on the top 5 floors of the Mandalay Bay resort, with separate entrances, elevators, and restaurants from that property. While the hotel itself is quiet and serene, you're only steps away from the casino and other amenities at Mandalay. As usual, the Four Seasons staff was exemplary and my room (which actually was upgraded to a massive suite) was lovely. My only complaint is the hotel's location on the strip - while my event was being held at the Four Seasons itself, if you're meeting (or gambling desires) take you elsewhere in Vegas the hotel's location can be a bit prohibitive (as it's at the very end of the strip near the airport). I look forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful serenity - but DON'T USE THE PHONE!”
Reviews.Author: philguk
Reviews.Content: I always dread heading to Las Vegas - it's by far my least favourite US city, but I tend to get dragged there each year as part of some convention or other Last week I was one of the presenters at IBMs Information on Demand conference and elected to stay at the Four Seasons for a change What a great decision that was For people (like me) who are not in Las Vegas by choice, it provides a haven from all the noise and bustle of a regular casino hotel. Closing the "magic door" between the Mandalay Bay and the Four Seasons elevator lobby was bliss. As the noise faded away, you could feel yourself relaxing Without exception the staff were attentive and friendly - especially the servers in the Verandah Restaurant who started to feel like "old friends" (we had MANY meetings in the Verandah!) So why am I only giving 2 stars? Well, for personal reasons I needed to keep in touch with the folks back home in the UK, and made a 20 minute (or so) phone call each morning for the 5 days I was there For this, the Four Seasons charged me OVER SEVEN HUNDRED DOLLARS Even assuming I made a 20 minute call every day (and I am sure some were shorter than this) that is over $7 a MINUTE! Only calling the UK remember, not the moon! In retrospect I wish I'd made a fuss when I was checking out, but it was very early and I was n a rush to get to the airport In Europe, hotels must list the RATES they charge for telephone calls - all I saw in my room as a comment that the hotel added a "55% uplift" to their phone charges Of course, I have written a note of complaint to them, and if get a satisfactory resolution I'll be more than happy to revise my review - but for now, I definitely feel that I have been taken advantage of, which is not a nice feeling It also means I won't be considering a Four Seasons for ANY of my hotel needs Pity It was such an amazing stay up until this discovery Phil G

Reviews.Title: “fine but just as good hotels in the centre”
Reviews.Author: alkymalky123
Reviews.Content: ok, but why waste your money, far more better value hotels in the centre of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid rooms near the airport”
Reviews.Author: orimarc
Reviews.Content: Four Seasons Hotel Las Vegas is a nice place to go if you want to stay away from crowded places. All you have there is luxury. Rooms are nice and clean. We had to switch twice though, cause room they gave us was facing Internacional McCarran Airport. You could hear the noise of the planes landing and taking off. So, if you want to go there, pay a little more and ask for a room facing the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of VERY LOUD music!!!”
Reviews.Author: thecoeinn
Reviews.Content: We were looking forward to sleeping and relaxing in the legendary Four Seasons excellence to celebrate my 50th birthday and our 27th anniversary. Our room was beautiful, the bed luxurious, the pool staff and food were awesome. There were comfy pool chairs, stacks of fluffy towels and full use of the Mandalay Bay pools....ahhh.. we were so looking forward to our stay. Upon arrival we were very pleased that they were able to accommodate our morning arrival and offered us an upgrade to a pool view, which we accepted. They even surprised us with a delicious chocolate cake to celebrate our special occasion. Very nice and appreciated. However, there was VERY LOUD horrible DJ pool party music that played until midnight for a very small crowd on the Mandalay Bay Beach the first night of our stay. We were ready to sleep at 9:30 p.m. (we're from a different time zone and were exhausted). We had checked the Mandalay Bay website prior to booking the Four Seasons and saw that there were no concerts planned during our stay. Since we booked the Four Seasons with the intention of actually sleeping we were very disappointed that we weren't told that there would be VERY LOUD music playing until midnight when they offered us the pool view upgrade. We could still hear the music after trying to drown out the sound with music on our room TV. If we had been told about the music issue we would not have accepted the upgrade and would have requested a room away from the noise. In addition to not being able to sleep for an additional 2 1/2 hours after we should have been able to sleep, we were disappointed that we weren't offered any type of compensation for our inconvenience. The front desk staff simply said they were sorry and that there wouldn't be any music for the remaining two nights of our stay. When we checked out we also let them know of the noise problem we had experienced and they once again apologized but didn't offer any type of compensation. I also filled out the mail-in survey to notify them of the problem that we had experienced but never heard anything back. If we wanted noise we would have booked ourselves a room at the Cosmopolitan. Actually we did stay two nights at the Cosmopolitan following our stay at the Four Seasons using our Marriott points. We requested a room away from the nightclub music noise that we had read about on Trip Advisor and were upgraded to a One Bedroom Suite with a balcony overlooking the Bellagio fountains. The room had a fantastic view of the strip and was quite. My husband frequently travels for business and prefers to stay at Four Seasons hotels but based on our negative experience at this Las Vegas Four Seasons he has started staying at Marriotts again to earn Marriott points.

Reviews.Title: “Serenity in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: DeborahN
Reviews.Content: I had a booked an American Express package which included a dinner and breakfast credit. At check-in, I was upgraded to a one bedroom suite...the room was amazing! There was an impressive living room with 1/2 bath and a large bedroom with marble bathroom. This was one of the nicest rooms that I have stayed at in this price range. It was lovely to be in a non-gaming hotel since the lobby, hallway and rooms did not smell like stale cigerettes. The pool was small by Las Vegas standards, but very relaxing. The biggest negative was the food at Verandah Restaurant. The food and service was below par for a Four Seasons Hotel...with so many wonderful choices in Las Vegas, the onsite restaurant leaves a lot to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Best on the strip for us”
Reviews.Author: ash s
Reviews.Content: Went and looked in most hotels on the stip, and this hotel is top class, it costs a bit more than some hotels but cheaper than others(low cost usa saved us over £300 and no resort fee) , but well wearth it. If you wont vegas full on all the time then this hotel is not for you, but if you wont the best of both worlds this is for you, privet pool, reception and entrance, driveway on the strip, there is velet parking which is $20 over night, but nothing to use during the day apart from tip $3 to $5, and also a carpark around the back of the hotels which is free all the time. You can use all facilitys at mandalay bay, the casino, pool ect but also have the privece of your hotel which is on the 35 to 39 floor of mandalay bay with your own privet lifts that only 4 seasons can use. you can use it to get to the casino floor also though a privet door on the casino floor. If on foot, to get to the cross roads at MGM/NEWYORK NEWYORK there is a tram or you can walk though all the way to the excaliber thought from madalay bay to the luxor and on. ( hope my spelling etc ok) Si

Reviews.Title: “Memorable!”
Reviews.Author: Sharon V
Reviews.Content: Beautiful accomodations, a pleasant, professional staff, GREAT food!

Reviews.Title: “A sanctuary in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Michelle2550
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, clean, quiet and serene. Excellent staff, friendly and efficient. Very nice pool area with access to all of the Mandaly Bay pools. I recommend the rooms with a view of the Las Vegas strip, amazing! Not inexpensive of course, but the prices aren't untouchable either.

Reviews.Title: “Just what you expect from a Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: Nailcutter
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on the American Express package which included breakfast and dinner. Service is 5 star as you would expect. This is no Marriot hotel! The staff opens the door for you, walks you to the front desk and then to your elevator. The lobby and public areas is opulent. The room is typical of a Four Seasons hotel. Everything nice, great bed, nice bathroom with separate area for the toilet. Needs a fan though. Nice touches though like your choice of newspaper hanging on your doorknob and not on the floor. Valet is $22 which is rare for a Vegas hotel. Pool area very nice and you have the option of going to the Mandalay Bay pools. The casino is entered by a private entrance. This was a nice quiet hotel in the land of craziness known as Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Just heavenly”
Reviews.Author: cloudysunday
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 days at Four Seasons and I loved every minute of it. The hotel reception lobby is very tasteful and immaculate. This sets the tone for what a patron can expect when they arrive to their room. Before I move on to the room special mention must be made of the hotel staff who were excellent. This includes the staff working at the Verandah Restaurant who took time to explain the different meals which were on offer. The Sunday Brunch is a sight to behold. I don't think I've ever seen so much food! I was in an executive suite on the 37th floor and the view was spectacular. The room was immaculate in terms of size and very well-appointed. The bed was a little too soft for my liking but did not prevent a good night's sleep. The bathroom was large and the decor opulent. The complimentary bath products are L'Occitane which is a really nice touch. My room also had a coffee machine - again a nice touch. Thank you Four Seasons for making my stay in Las Vegas an enjoyable and showing other hotels how it should be done.

Reviews.Title: “Ditto Everything said”
Reviews.Author: Famishedtraveler
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent visitor of vegas and always try to stay at Manadalay Bay complex-- although have stayed everywhere other than Mandarin. Will always come back to 4Seasons from now on. It really is an oasis. Not to have to fight the crowds at the pool is worth the extra price. The "secret door" is not really that secret at all -- it's in the lobby and marked Four Seasons-- I was expecting something more. Then again, it does take you to express elevators to your floor. The rooms are just OK. Actually they are about the same as a regular MBay room. Not as nice as the MBay suites or any room at THEhotel but they are well appointed and a good size. You can upgrade to a suite but our rate was so good that any upgrade would almost double the rate so we stayed in the standard room. Still, Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Really the most mellow and fantastic way to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: wienchick
Reviews.Content: I just checked out this weekend from a wonderful 4 night stay at the Four Seasons in Las Vegas and the plummet back to reality has been shocking as I write this from a Hilton in Houston (but more on that later!) A friend and I decided to treat my mom to some shows and the Four Seasons for her 60th birthday celebration. We managed to book and amazing deal with Allegiant air that included airfare and hotel for only $60 more than staying at other 4 star hotels on the strip, so already, this was shaping up to be a good deal. I was so excited about the entire trip and our action packed itinerary, and it did not disappoint. I love it when you're hotel actually lives up to your expectations. Check-In: The check-in process was easy and quick. When asked if we wanted to upgrade to a strip view room, I asked the FD agent if it would be possible to upgrade us for my mom's birthday. She quickly smiled, worked on her computer, and offered us the complimentary upgrade as a "goodwill gesture" for our celebration. A very nice start to the trip indeed. Room: The room was probably the only real disappointment for our stay. While the view of the strip was indeed nice, I would probably not have paid for the upgrade had I viewed the 2 rooms and was happy it was offered complimentary. It was also not as luxurious as other Four Seasons I have stayed in before (Jackson, Amman, Cairo) and the room itself seemed like a very well appointed/upscale Intercontinental, Hyatt, Hilton, but nothing incredibly special. The bathroom was much nicer and more along the lines of what you would expect in a Four Seasons. The "free" (daily resort fee really pays for this) Wifi was welcome and worked well enough to watch TV, so that was good. Also liked that it extended throughout the property, including the pool. Concierge: I had contacted the property before our arrival and asked about the Lion King dinner and show packages. Cara helped me and we exchanged a few emails and phone calls in which she also helped us plan other activities for our stay. She was very prompt and super friendly and helpful and made that great first impression you hope your staff will make when working with incoming guests. She also greeted us warmly when we arrived on property and helped make additional suggestions for our stay. Her service was the additional spark you are hoping for when you stay at a five stay property. Housekeeping: Housekeeping was good and prompt and responded quickly to our request for additional towels and amenities... I love the l'occitane products at the Four Seasons. Only major issue here was on our second day on property, my mom had become ill and was in the room most of the day. We had our DND sign on the door, but then left the room at 6pm for our dinner that evening and removed the DND, expecting to get our room cleaned. Upon returning after 11, our room had not been serviced for turn down. Especially when I have not had my room serviced all day, it is a real bummer to return to a messy room, and I think housekeeping should have checked to make sure that we had received service. This prompted me to call housekeeping and request what time we would like service for the rest of our stay, but I feel like I shouldn't have to do that in a five star property. Pool: The pool alone is the main reason that someone should check into this property. We spent 3 days lounging by the pool and it was relaxed, with excellent service and so serene. The pool attendants checked on us regularly to bring cocktails or food and about hourly, a dedicated staff member went around the pool offering fresh frozen fruit or cooling misting spray. Our first day the group decided to venture over to the Mandalay Bay Pool, thinking we would like to try our turn on the lazy river and the chaos that awaited us as we walked through the gates to the pool made us quickly decide we would not spend one more minute over at their pool. It was such a stark contrast with the screaming kids, loud music, and haphazard chairs and obstacles, that we vowed never to return and safely spent the rest of our vacation at the peaceful pool at the 4S!! Parking: Valet is great, but if you want to save the $22 a day, self park is around the back of the casino and not that far off a walk (by Vegas standards!) We chose to use that money for cocktails by the pool....Valley of Fire being our favorite! Other facilities: The beauty of this property is that you have access to all the amenities of the Mandalay Bay and its many restaurants, but also the choice to stay in the little quiet cocoon of the Four Seasons. This was something very appealing about the property and did make a difference when deciding if I wanted to pay a HUGE premium for the Four Seasons spa or the Mandalay Bay Spa. It's nice that guests have a choice to do either. Minor complaints: Three very nitpicky complaints I would want to point out. When we ordered room service, we were told it would be delivered by 8:35 and it arrived at 8:43. I know this is very minor, but a property like this should under promise and over deliver. Also, I noticed on multiple occasions when I called the Front Desk, I would be asked to hold and then placed on hold for a couple of minutes. I felt like they should have dedicated staff for answering phones during peak times, because the wait times did not seem ideal for the Four Seasons....elsewhere fine, but not here. Lastly, I wanted my bill the evening before check out and the FD agent did not preprint that night's fees and taxes. When I called down again to ask for a complete bill, he told me that his system was not allowing him to preprint the charges. I don't know of a single hotel in the world that cannot do this and some retraining should probably be done to make sure that a guest is able to get a complete bill the night before check out, since this is a very common request. Although, very minor issues that did not affect our stay, still some areas where there could be a tiny bit of improvement. While I want to give this property an excellent rating (it really was like a 4.5), it did have a few minor areas for improvement and the housekeeping issue on our second day was probably the only reason I would not rate it along the other 5 star resorts I have stayed at before. I would however highly recommend staying here if you would like to get away from the "hustle and bustle" of Vegas and this quiet, calm, relaxing property deserves all its praise. There is no comparison to hotels in Vegas, but it has a bit or room to compare to some of its other Four Seasons counterparts.

Reviews.Title: “Not so Vegas”
Reviews.Author: SoulFitGirl
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for that incomprehensible bargain, where you pay $40 per night but every linen is sure to be saturated in cigarette smoke and remnants of the previous occupants might linger in hidden corners, this isn't your place. We stayed here for the Las Vegas Marathon, and couldn't have chosen a more luxurious and comfortable hotel. Only steps from the race start and finish. No smoke. No ringing slots. No late night parties that sound like crimes in progress. Magnificent food. We returned the next month for a business dinner at Charlie Palmer Steak, and can't wait to go back again. Because the Four Seasons is tucked inside Mandalay Bay, you won't miss any of that Vegas bling — if you want it. But we found that a half-day trip to Red Rock Canyon for hiking and trail running, a 45 minute drive from the strip, suited our needs perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: platanelson
Reviews.Content: Reviewed August 25, 2011 Loved everything about our stay, service & room were excellent!

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing find- an oasis!”
Reviews.Author: Alybuk
Reviews.Content: What a Stunning hotel. AmaZi g attention to detail. Was quiet and serene. Lovely not having a casino- other hotels were loud and too busy. Amazing room! Would stay there Again...and again... And again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: TravellingQueen24
Reviews.Content: I was so pleasantly surprised by the Four Seasons in Vegas. I don't like Vegas: don't like the strip, can't keep up with the nightlife, don't enjoy gambling, but alas, have family living there. I've always stayed around the middle of the strip or the south strip. I am so happy to have come to the Four Seasons b/c it has completely changed my view of Las Vegas! It was so nice, quiet, classy, the pool was INCREDIBLE. No smoking, gambling, ridiculousness. I will absolutely be staying here the next time I have to make the trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Vegas -”
Reviews.Author: aquaman0601
Reviews.Content: This was quite a surprise compared to the other hotels I've stayed at on the strip. No flashing lights, no slot machines, simple quiet lobby area without 100 people queued up to check in. Not what you expect from Vegas. BUT... If you want the casino experience, they are connected to the Mandalay Bay and you can enjoy the hustle and bustle of Vegas... Excellent rooms, reasonable rates, great staff with a very personal touch. Note. Breakfast at the Veranda restaurant is very pricey, but the Breakfast Buffet at the Mandalay is reasonably priced and can be charge to your room at the 4 seasons.

Reviews.Title: “I couldn't have asked for more!”
Reviews.Author: Holidaywithpeskykids
Reviews.Content: What can I say, this hotel was great. We have stayed at the four seasons New York which was equally as fabulous. The staff, the room service, the personal touches in the room for the children were all fantastic. I cannot rate them highly enough. Also, being towards the end of the strip you must get the best strip views in las Vegas as you can see everything through the floor to ceiling windows! The bed is ridiculously comfortable too. I could go on but don't want to bore you - definitely highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Relax on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Ashur_K475
Reviews.Content: I always go to Las Vegas every year, and I choose this hotel every time. If I don't want to gamble then I'll surely be lounging around here. Very close to casinos and shows which is very good. My friends loved it here and would love to go back. There are many restaurants next door. I would reccomend this to anyone who loves going to Las Vegas but loves to relax. Looking forward to another trip next year!

Reviews.Title: “Peace on the strip”
Reviews.Author: J B
Reviews.Content: Really like this hotel and have stayed here several times. The fact that it's only four floors within the Mandalay Bay hotel adds to it's air of exclusivity. The pool attendants are fantastic and nothing was too much trouble. For those who want to be involved a bit more with the action on the strip then this might be a bit too far away being right at the end. Our only complaint was we had to have a room change because of the noise from the rooms on both sides (very loud music at 3am) and the new room wasn't as good as the one we left. One good tip is if you hire a car park it in the Mandaly valet car park and you won't pay the four seasons parking charges

Reviews.Title: “Serenity on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Cawater
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons is indeed more quiet and low-key than anyplace else on the strip. Lovely public areas and an aura of peace and quality. However, it is on the very far end of the strip and a $15 taxi ride to the Wynn, for example. You can take the public strip bus as an alternative but that is a bit of a hike and the monorail is even more of a trek. You are trading location for serenity. Having said that, the pool is lovely. Complimentary SPF 15, 30 and 50, pitchers of water, excellent service, just a hint of throbbing music from the Mandalay Beach next door. Rooms are huge with floor-to-ceiling windows and being located on the top floors, the views are spectacular. Keurig coffeemakers, large flat-screen, great bedding. I did get the vibe that the property is ready for some remodeling: decor is a bit traditional 90's. The Veranda Bar has a great happy hour with $5 food and drinks. Try the White Tiger - basically Vodka lemonade. No resort fee = good. $15 wi-fi fee = bad. Note that there is a McDonalds, Subway, Panda Express and liquor store right across the street if you want to avoid the $200 celeb chef meals once in a while.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquility in a fast paced city”
Reviews.Author: sssung
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I took a short weekend trip to Vegas for a concert in Mandalay Bay and loved our stay at the Four Seasons. The type of service we received here for the price paid was absolutely outstanding when compared to other luxury hotels on the strip. The serenity starts the minutes you pull up to the port cochere when greeted by the warm welcoming valet services team. Jason at the front desk checked us in quickly and brought us ice cold bottles of water. This relaxing experience of the check-in process on a Friday late afternoon was far and above many hotels we’ve stayed at before (the Wynn, TheHotel, Bellogio, Cosmopolitan to name a few) It’s probably due to the amount of rooms at the Four Seasons vs other mega hotels. I highly recommend happy hours at the Verendah before a show. The service was superb, the amount of food was just right, and the food and drinks are soooo yummy. We didn’t have much time to experience the spa or the pool; however, I do have to mention the valet service department. We would call down to request for the retrieval of our car and it was always there and ready to go with two bottles of ice cold water in the car. I’m really impressed with the attentive services that the whole valet team provided. The Four Seasons Las Vegas was an oasis away from this fast paced city. The door that leads to Mandalay Bay from the Four Seasons complete shuts the noise off. It was day and night difference when you open that door. With all of the great experience we had, I do have couple of minor things (no bad) to say. We had a room facing the pool and did hear the planes taking off all of the time. Fortunately they didn’t last all night, but as late as late as 11 O’clock and as early as 6 in the morning though. During our stay, we didn’t have to pay a daily resort fee; however, the hotel is preparing to charge resort fees mid –October….I’m really hoping that the management would serious consider include valet parking in this fee. If not, it’ll be $42/day of parking and resort fee on top of the room rate.

Reviews.Title: “vegas with dignity”
Reviews.Author: 92Melinda
Reviews.Content: loved our stay at The Four Seasons, expect the reputation to stand true. good service- but no snobs :) peaceful atmosphere. full spa services are a little pricey but I enjoyed it. Didn't try the restaurant but had a $10 smoothie by the pool one afternoon. We will absolutely go again if we can score a discount room rate like this time.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Content: This is the best place to stay in Vegas for many, many reasons. Treat yourself and be stress free.

Reviews.Title: “If you want the best, you got the best!”
Reviews.Author: Travis M
Reviews.Content: Nothing falls short at the Four Seasons. Every aspect exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, top quality service and courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: Ade_T_22_
Reviews.Content: Fantastic service from start to finish! We stayed for a night before going to the Bellagio as part of our honeymoon trip, this was by far the better hotel for everything. Check in was smooth and we had bottles of water given to us which was very welcoming after a lengthy drive of which we had drank what we had during the journey. The gentleman who met us as we drove in was polite and professional and escorted us to the front desk where a very pleasant girl checked us in and gave us all the information we needed for our stay, she even went to the concierge to get various print outs of restaurants in Vegas. We were upgraded to a lovely room as part of our honeymoon, and after going into the room there was a knock at the door where the front desk girl Leanne had sent up some chocolate covered strawberries and a hand written card wishing us all the best in our future married life together - a wonderful touch from a wonderful hotel. Would stay here next time and avoid the Theme Park hotels further down the strip. Top quality service, top quality hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons LV”
Reviews.Author: marc a
Reviews.Content: Overall, I thought it was an excellent hotel. The staff was friendly and welcoming. The public areas are what you would expect at any 5 star property. I was offered bottled water when checking in. The apples at the reception area were a nice touch.... had a few each day. I stayed on the 36 floor overlooking the airport. If you love watching the planes take off, this is a great room to watch planes and helicopters (all day and night) and I could barely hear any of it from my room. The layout was pretty standard for Vegas, canopy bed and high tread count linens were nice. Coffee maker was great. The bathroom was huge and covered in marble. Toilet with a phone was in a separate room in the bathroom. I loved the bath products, L"Occitane, which included large & small fragrant bar soap, small lotion, shampoo, conditioner, body wash. Spar was wonderful but small, nice and club-like atmosphere. Pool was great, nice and quite away from the chaos at Mandalay bay. Got to use the house car. If you need to go 3 miles or so, you can use it, provided it's available. Housekeeper was wonderful...place was spotless every night and she had a bucket of ice waiting for my everytime I came back in, late or not.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of Tranquility”
Reviews.Author: Fevil
Reviews.Content: Entering the hussle and bussle of the Mandalay Bay is a great experience. Not least because you can enjoy the atmosphere without being stuck in the lengthy check in queues or having to push through crowds of people. As you enter the door marked "Four Seasons" the atmosphere and decor change into a calm, tasteful and relaxed vibe. Empty check in desk were a welcome sight. The staff are professional, knowledgeable and the service we received was immpeccable. A slight hitch with our room at the beginning was resolved quickly and very much to our satisfaction. The suite we had overlooked the strip and was amazing, the bellboy couldn't have been more helpful, the pool area is quiet and serene, the facilities of the Mandalay Bay are on your doorstep, the SDX bus stops right outside and there's a tram to take you on your journey up the strip. If you're looking for a hotel in Vegas where you have access to the mayhem and fun, but wish to retreat to your own quiet sanctuary at the end of the evening, this is the one for you.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Both Worlds”
Reviews.Author: misctraveller
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best places to stay if you want access to a big casino hotel (Mandalay Bay) but want the quality and service of the Four Seasons. The FS has their own entrance and lobby separate from the rest of the building, their own pool and spa facilities and their own elevators. The Four Seasons Las Vegas delivered on all fronts. Every member of the staff goes overboard to make sure you are taken care of. Heading out for the day? The bellman gives you bottles of water to take with you and if you need a ride they have a courtesy car to take you. The room had a great view with floor to ceiling windows overlooking the strip. There was a k-cup machine for coffee, big flat screen and very comfy bed. Most importantly, the room was spotless and smelled great. We did have a small problem with the shower but after informing the front desk, it was repaired immediately. The pool was small but perfect for the size of the hotel. Staff were of course right there to get you anything you needed (thumbs up to the frozen snickers and ice pops). You also get access to the big pools at the Mandalay Bay if you want a change of pace.
