The concierge desk was awesome, very professional and knowledgeable. If you've never stayed at a Four Seasons before, this is a great one to try out since the rates were really reasonable (at least when we stayed).

Reviews.Title: “A total delight.”
Reviews.Author: Not P
Reviews.Content: A total delight from check-in to The Verandah restaurant, Charlie Palmer's to all all the staff we encountered. The hotel is a remarkably good value and a great place to stay to get away from the noise and clamor or Las Vegas yet close enough to access it all when you want.

Reviews.Title: “The Four Season Hotel is perfect from beginning to end”
Reviews.Author: carlosmazziero
Reviews.Content: The Four Season Hotel is perfect from beginning to end: - with pleasing architecture and contemporary - with very friendly and polite staff, spacious and confortable rooms. Certainly when we will get back to Hotel Four Season again while in LV!

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was perfect. Can't wait to stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Beth S
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Vegas for our 20th anniversary. Our stay couldn't have been more perfect. I could not find one fault with the hotel. The room was unbelievable and the staff went ouf of their way to be helpful. They have the best concierges that I have ever worked with.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy bed”
Reviews.Author: Stacy823
Reviews.Content: On our fifth and final night in Las Vegas/Grand Canyon, we stayed at Four Seasons. I loved the first three nights at Venetian, but the bed at Four Seasons was the BEST. I could have stayed there all day.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons Hotel las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: NancyT187
Reviews.Content: Excellent Service Best Ever QUIET RELAXING Great Food Best Pool

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful retreat from the madness of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: AnjanieN
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was perfect. They have spoiled me for every other future hotel experience. The service was top notch. The hotel is gorgeous. The food and drinks were terrific (don't forget to grab a few $5 happy hour cocktails!). The room was spacious and comfortable. The bed and pillows were truly the best I've ever slept on. Every employee remembered my name and greeted me personally every time they saw me. I felt like royalty! We used the hotel for our business meetings, and it was the best choice for a Las Vegas hotel. Truly upscale! Everything was terrific. We will always stay here during future Vegas trips.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons quality and service”
Reviews.Author: aguyinthe818
Reviews.Content: Scored a great last minute deal here, nearly half the published rate. So keeping that in mind, this was an excellent stay. Typical Four Seasons room and experience. By current Vegas standards the room would be considered pedestrian, however it was tasteful, killer strip views. Nicely appointed bath with L'Occitaine bath products (though they were not completely replenished daily). Service at all levels is peerless. Particularly the pool service, if youre a pool goer in Vegas (I usually am not) this one is small and lovely with amazing service, Evian facial mist was a lovely touch. The house car (a complimentary Mercedes S550) was usually available despite the busy weekend and was much nicer than a cab for getting around the strip (tip was the equivalent cost). The spa is for treatments only.... There are virtually no facilities other than a steam room. The walk to Mandalay was long, through beautiful though abandoned corridors, but it was a refuge. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality customer service.”
Reviews.Author: JennyandDanWakefield
Reviews.Content: We arrived back in Vegas after our 8 day road trip so we were quite frazzled when we got to the four seasons. The warm welcome was second to none, our bags were swiftly taken away, our hire car parked and check in was so simple and professional. The rooms are beautiful and the floor to ceiling windows offered amazing views. The four seasons pool is fantastic, they sort out your sunbed with towels, free sun lotion, a pitcher of iced water and occasionally they come round with frozen fruit and evian water spray for your face. The service was the most excellent i have ever experienced. Thank you for making the end of our honeymoon so extra special.

Reviews.Title: “Best service on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: Sue E
Reviews.Content: Best service on the strip! Everyone is very friendly and helpful. Beautiful property - understated elegance.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons Hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: William J
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a beautiful location! This Four Seasons is one of the best I've stayed in. I visit Las Vegas on a monthly basis and decided to stay on 'The Strip.' I'm glad I did! This location has great prices and great service. My wife was very happy while I was working with a lot to do in this area. She spent time in the spa and gym and never missed a workout! Highly recommended! William

Reviews.Title: “Super pleasant if you're not into noisy/smoky casino vibe”
Reviews.Author: Barbara M
Reviews.Content: Very nice from check-in to check-out. Incredibly quiet and tasteful. One thing I will say is get a humidifier if you can as the rooms are very dry. Tasty and reasonably priced room service that came in record time and they pointed out that service was included and that I didn't need to tip! When has that happened ever in room service history?! Nice bathroom amenities (L'occitane.) It definitely is not the most modern four seasons but had everything you could want and a very fair price! Business amenities could be improved as there was not an on-site person working at the business center and it was an annoying self-serve printer.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at the Four Seasons Las Vegas, 9/16 thru 9/19.”
Reviews.Author: Randy R
Reviews.Content: Everything was great and top notch. Being able to go straight from the elevators to the pool or the Casino floor of the Mandalay Bay was a great perk. The hallways were super quiet and sleep was restful. I would recommend being aware of the concerts they have at the Mandalay Bay pools frequently. They are very loud, but they seem to end by 11:30pm. and quiet returns after that. The staff was really awesome. Really can't recommend enough.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis of Calm”
Reviews.Author: primacy
Reviews.Content: For a quite respite from the chaos of the casino floor and the strip, Four Seasons Las Vegas is an excellent choice. The lobby, halls, facilities (spa, gym, pool, restaurant) and halls are refreshingly quiet (not desolate or empty) compared with the chaos of the casino floor and the strip. The service was top notch and the spa treatments, though a little pricey, were excellent. We also enjoyed the weekend brunch. The rooms are well appointed, but not large or sumptuous -- just very nicely done, standard hotel rooms. And the location at the south end of The Strip made getting around (we went to 2 shows) a little bit of a challenge. But, overall, we were extremely pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Treated me like royalty”
Reviews.Author: Deborah597
Reviews.Content: Of course we expect a Four Seasons hotel to be very nice and upscale. But I was treated like royalty by all the personnel: from the smiling valets who greeted me before I even got to the front door, to the front desk, the wonderful concierge staff, friendly and efficient restaurant personnel, housekeeping, and to the very friendly send-off as I was leaving. The people there acted like they truly wanted me to love my stay.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis away from the madness of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: cody2222
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have nothing but good things to say about our stay at the Four Seasons in Las Vegas. We made our decision to stay at this hotel, based on the many wonderful reviews found on Tripadvisor and we were extremely pleased that we had made the right choice for our accommodations. The hotel is instantly calming after a long flight - you are greeted at the door with a warm welcome and a smile and that hospitality continues throughout your entire stay. The hotel is immaculate, our room was beautiful with floor to ceiling windows and a great view of the Strip, the spa/changing/shower areas are well stocked with everything you could possibly need, the pool area is very quiet and peaceful, everyone is so helpful .....the list of good things just goes on and on. If you are looking for a hotel that is close to gambling, shows, etc. - but want to have a restful place to escape to at the end of the night - the Four Seasons is the place for you. We highly recommend!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pure bliss away from the Strip-chaos”
Reviews.Author: Johanna M
Reviews.Content: Calm, welcoming, not crowded what so ever... (At least not the two nights me and my fiance spent there - sunday til tuesday) The spa and fitness area is a haven of tranquility as a very nice contrast to the chaos and low-life outside the hotel. Staff very friendly and observant but not in an exaggerated way. Restaurant Verandah lacks a little when it comes to presenting food and wine. Food good though, had both lunch, dinner and happy hour appetizers there. If you don't like gambling and just want to unwind and have a relaxing time at a superior hotel with real value for money, this is the hotel to stay at in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and 5 star service.”
Reviews.Author: kitten099
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Four Seasons for a week at the end of September. The hotel is located at the end of the strip within the Mandalay Bay complex. We had an immediate check in. I saw long queues at most other hotels to check in and out. We used the tram , bus and taxis to get around and had no problems with the location. The bedroom was large and well appointed and decorated in a classic style , it did not have a wow factor that other 5 star hotel rooms may have but it was very comfortable. We requested a fridge and this was delivered with no extra charge. No mini bar issues that other trip advisors report on. The bathroom had a good walk in shower, separate WC(no silly see through door either) and nice bathrobes and toiletries. We had a view of the pool and did hear noise from the Mandalay beach concert one evening but this had been pointed out to us on check in and was not an issue. The pool area was lovely, green and restful and the pool staff greet guests on arrival and set up seats in shady or sunny areas as requested. I checked the pool as the Mandalay Bay and it was not for me, no shade, very busy with loud music and a wave pool but I can see how it would appeal to some. Four Season guests can use all the Mandalay Bay facilities and has a large choice of restaurants . We had dinner at Mix and found it excellent. We also enjoyed brunch at the Verrandah. It was nice to use the facilities at the Mandalay but to then come back through the "secret door" to the Four Seasons. Without doubt the highlight of the hotel is the truly excellent service provided by the staff. From the friendly door men, to the helpful linen porter who showed us to the pool area and the excellent concierge all the staff are a credit to the hotel. We saw many other lovely hotels on the strip but because of the excellent service would only return to the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “True excellence. An oasis of peace in the middle of Vegas chaos.”
Reviews.Author: Mike P
Reviews.Content: I can't recommend this hotel enough. It was welcoming, calm, and gorgeous, in keeping with what you would expect from the brand. Some examples of the service I enjoyed: - In checking out, I asked the woman at the desk "you wouldn't happen to know where I'd find a bottle of water would you?" She then instantly handed me a bottle of water. - At 4:00 pm on a Sunday I went to the spa and asked "could you fit me in for a massage today?" I was in at 5 pm, and had basically the best massage ever. Phenomenal. - I walked into my room and was wondering, where am I going to shine my shoes? After the afternoon turndown I found a bag on my bed, reading "complementary shoe shine". Wow. This may be de rigueur but I did not expect it. The atmosphere of the hotel was especially nice after walking through the casino floor... quite a contrast of relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “The best of both worlds”
Reviews.Author: kshapiro1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Four Seasons last week, it really was the best of both worlds. Lets start with the positive: The pool was great and the staff was amazing, each morning when we came down they would set up our chairs ( unlike strip hotels where you have to walk in circles trying to find chairs). In addition they would keep refreshing our ice water and checking back to see if we needed anything ( please keep in mind that they work on tips and it really bothered me to see that guests were not tipping the staff for setting them up !) It seemed like every hour they were giving our Popsicle's or frozen watermelon pops ! We were on a package that included breakfast, the first morning I ordered the continental breakfast for two from room service, I was surprised that this only came with coffee, juice and toast for close to $28.00, I called back to room service to check and was informed that this WAS ALL that was included, I am still not sure that is correct because the rest of the days we ate in the Veranda and it included fruit and yogurt. If you have breakfast there ask for Veronica, she was amazing.. she really knows the meaning of customer service !!! The only negative is that we had some maintenance issues with our room, it took a few tries but they were corrected and the management was right on top of it to make sure that we were comfortable and happy... My husband does not like Vegas for the most part ( he was there for a convention) I am the one who visits 3-4 times a year, we get many offers for free rooms and he refuses to go, now that he has experienced the Four Seasons he has agreed to go back next year as long as we stay there !!!

Reviews.Title: “It is not our fault”
Reviews.Author: CancunRobbery2010
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were having our 40 anniversary. I ordered a Limo from the airport to the hotel. The limo did not show. I ordered a special surprise for my wife from room service. Called the day of our arrival to make sure it would be delivered no later than 8:00pm. We arrived at 8:05pm it was not in our room. Hotel Manager kept offering to comp us a meal to make up for unacceptable service. Not what we expected from a Four Searson Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and quiet on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Frank037
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with our two children early september. The four seasons is in mandaly bay building. So right next to the mandaly beach/pool area. Whit the room comes free entrance to the beach/pool. With children, the place to go as they loved the wave pool and the lazy river. The hotel is what you expect from four seasons. Nice rooms with great service. But above all it is a place of absolute calm and quietness right in las vegas. Something you appreciate after a busy and noisy day of las vegas. There is a little train to Lyxor and excalibur hotel. The rest is all within walking distance. So if you are going to Las Vegas with children or you are looking for a quiet spot, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vegas Experience EVER!”
Reviews.Author: FromAlaska
Reviews.Content: Let me say that my first experience at the Four Seasons earlier this year was not good. But after speaking with the hotel manager and seeing first hand his concern for customer satisfaction I decided to give it one more try. I couldn't have been more pleased. Efficient check in, immaculate room, super comfortable bed, top rate concierge staff, outstanding pool and pool manager (Chanel). Staff remembered me and greeted me by name - including Hotel Manager, Director of Rooms, guy who checked me in, breakfast waiter and pool staff (I did spend quite a bit of time (and $) at the pool). If I could talk my husband into it I would go back for my birthday in December but I am afraid Four Seasons is not his style. But given the chance I would stay here again (with my sister or girlfriends) without question!

Reviews.Title: “Flawless!”
Reviews.Author: coreyjstanford
Reviews.Content: I could write a novel about how wonderful any Four Seasons is. I could easily elaborate on the luxurious accommodations and the exceptional service. There is no need. It's merely understood. Four Seasons Las Vegas is no different. They delivered on every level possible. Flawless is the one word that describes my stay. This is the number one place to stay in Las Vegas. Period.

Reviews.Title: “EXEMPLERY EXPERIENCE 09 2011!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MadeilaineFPalma
Reviews.Content: 'Would have loved to have the pool areas open as early as 6:00 A.M., and as late as midnight! Vegas has 3-digit temperature; this should be applicable to alternative cooling measures, hence, opening pool areas earlier and later are very much standard. Shouldn't it be? Also, my husband and I love our suite on the 37TH floor! The view was the airport and pretty much most of Las Vegas skyline! Nice! We would have loved a complementary spa, since this was our very first time being in FOUR SEASONS facility! We love the serene, calm & ambiance of the whole facility!!! VERY, VERY IMPRESSIVE! Mahalo nui loa. Dan & Maddie

Reviews.Title: “Fancy pants in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: trippinandtravelin
Reviews.Content: Can I move here please? I went with a few friends for a "Girls Weekend" and thoroughly enjoyed the hotel!! A great location located high up and with wonderful views. A fabulous pool that wasn't the typical Vegas pool. Classy, not drunkenly cheesy. Wonderful service wherever we went, especially poolside. Thanks Fours Seasons for a memorable trip to Vegas (without making me feel dirty, how I normally feel leaving this crazy place!)

Reviews.Title: “Calm oasis in Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: b19jfm
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in September, 2011. Excellent rooms, great staff and ambience made for a very relaxing stay. Had breakfast in the room one morning which was great. Had a fabulous filet mignon in the Verandah restaurant accompanied by a great bottle of wine - one of the best meals I have ever had. The only downside to the hotel is that they charge you for wifi which in this day and age is a complete joke! Get with the times Four Seasons!

Reviews.Title: “Hands down, the best hotel experience my husband and I have ever had!”
Reviews.Author: Camhoo84
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to the Four Seasons recently for a joint birthday getaway, and the staff more than impressed us with their level of accommodation. Upon check-in, we discovered that we'd been given a room with two double beds, when we'd reserved a king. The staff flew into action to switch us to a king room immediately, which also involved re-routing our room service tray of champagne and strawberries that my husband had pre-ordered as a surprise for me. That delivery was taken care of, and included as a surprise to us both was a chocolate birthday cake, which my husband hadn't even ordered. In addition, a lovely handwritten birthday note welcoming us both was on the tray. We were delighted with the extra touches that really made our arrival even more special than intended, and those extra touches were repeated throughout our stay. Upon our arrival back in the room late that first night, we were "greeted" by the deafeningly loud music and reverberations from the concert going on 36 floors below at the Mandalay Bay beach. I also was not feeling well, adding to the discomfort. Neither I nor my husband, who regularly sleeps with earplugs, and thus had some with him, could fathom sleeping amid that noise, and we were very disappointed since we'd specifically chosen the Four Seasons as a haven from the Vegas craziness. We asked each other how the hotel could bill itself as such an exclusive enclave with the knowledge of these Mandalay Bay concerts. My husband called the front desk and explained the dilemma, and they sprung to action, sending a bellman to move us to the other side of the hotel, into an enormous suite, to our surprise. All was perfectly quiet thereafter. Not stopping there, the staff also gave us a 20% discount card to the Verandah restaurant, which we used the next evening, and a $50 gift card to the Spa, which I was more than happy to use. The next morning, I received a very considerate call from a hotel assistant manager who apologized for our trouble and asked if she could do anything further for us, particularly me, as she knew I'd been feeling poorly. We spent two days relaxing poolside, and the pool staff was a major highlight of our experience at the hotel. All were extremely accommodating and eager to help, striking a perfect balance between prompt availability and unobtrusive service. Our every need, along with some we didn't know we had, was met efficiently and pleasantly. Our lunch at the poolside bar was fantastic, and our dinner meal at Verandah was exquisite - service and food. The air conditioned patio is genius, and we thoroughly enjoyed dining poolside without being subject to the Vegas heat. My experience at the Spa was fabulous - one of the best body scrub/massage treatments I've ever had. My husband and I travel and dine out frequently, and our benchmark for good service has become just that, "service." Mistakes, accidents and misfortune happen anywhere and everywhere; the measure of an establishment is the manner in which such events are handled. The Four Seasons has this crucial aspect of service distilled to a science, and it is this level of responsiveness and accommodation that prompted this announcement to my husband: "I ONLY want to stay at Four Seasons wherever we go from now on!" They've spoiled me for all else. I'm hoping that our Vegas experience has convinced my husband to honor my oft-repeated request to go the Four Seasons Nevis!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Sophisticated. Romantic. Restful. Removed from the smokey noise, but close enough if you want to be in it.”
Reviews.Author: Jessica B
Reviews.Content: Everything was great EXCEPT for the $37 tequilla on the rocks at the pool bar. Margarita advertised as $15 on menu so why more than double the cost for the same thing MINUS the sugary/sour mix? I watched him pour 2 shots, the same amount he used for the margarita. So what gives? I wanted to throw a fit, but it was our last afternoon and my husband didn't want me to get in a confrontation. I don't mind paying for great service (which this hotel offers in every way), but not an arm & a leg for a pool bar drink.

Reviews.Title: “Great, it isn`t at the Strip.”
Reviews.Author: Megyxu
Reviews.Content: We chose the Four Seasons because it hasn't got a Casino and it’s at the end of the strip. To go to the beginning of the strip you can cross to the Luxor Hotel and take the train or you can go by taxi. We have a really good experience at Four Seasons Hotel, first of all because of the outstanding staff and service and secondly for the cleanliness and comfort of our room. The soundproofing of the room was really good. Our room faced the airport and we didn't hear any noise from outside. If we come back to Las Vegas we'll choose the same hotel. We didn´t have dinner at the Verandah restaurant but its menu looked really good. The breakfast was delicious fresh fruit, juice and a huge variety of choices and again the service was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the strip”
Reviews.Author: SwissSpaceBoy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one week in a Premier Strip view room on the 36th floor. Waw ! we really enjoyed this 5* hotel. You enter through the Mandalay Bay hotel and the casino but once you arrive there, what a calm. This is the first time in a Four Seasons hotel and it surely impressed us. Some good points : - very quiet - it has the upper floors of the Mandalay Bay so you can have a spectacular view of the Strip from the South. The Strip is wonderful in the evening. - very close to the airport but no noise as you cannot open the windows, but you have fresh air intakes. A/C is working of course. - very good concierge desk and I want hereby to thank the staff for helping us out with some reservations troubles. Use them to book a show, helicopter tour or restaurant. They know all the good places ! - very good room service - very clean (hotel is new since 2006 I think) - very good bed - huge LCD screen with dvd player, safe, coffee machine - (!) you can decide when the housekeeping is done by choosing a time frame. No more housekeeping at 8am. - very good private pool - very good restaurants that are quiet and with excellent service (maybe a bit expensive but this is Vegas) - breakfast à la carte - private hotel entry for taxis Points to take into account : - the hotel is located at the south of the strip so you need a cab to go downtown. But there are a lot of shops in the Mandalay Bay resort itself.But honestly, it is indeed an oasis in SinCity. - you cannot open the windows and no balcony as the rooms are on the top floors. This hotel was a very good surprise and we cannot wait to go back in order to lose some money in the casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent as always”
Reviews.Author: DJDB
Reviews.Content: Made the annual trip to Vegas for some spa action, had such a wonderfull relaxing time. Stayed in the most basic room, which is still terrific, the strip view is great if you never done it, but overall not worth the extra money. Everything went like clockwork, except for one broken lift that slowed things up very briefly, but was hardly an inconvenience. All the pool staff remembered me and what i drank and ate from previous years, and the whole pool area is full of people who clearly also come back regularly as the staff would stop and chat. You really feel like you're seeing old friends when you go back. Met some great people in the pool, including the usual scattering of celebs just taking it easy and mingling. Massages were terrific, Heidi is a star. I had one slight issue with a food promotion at Verandha, with conflicting prices for the same special offer, and the food manager came to apologise when I checked out and arranged for an upgrade at the FS in San Francisco. Why anyone would want to stay anywhere else beats me, the combination of luxury, style, calm and relaxation is perfect. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Calm oasis in Sin City”
Reviews.Author: rlf_vancity
Reviews.Content: Have very much the same impression and feedback as the other reviewers here - Four Seasons is the best place to stay in Las Vegas if you are not interested in the frenetic, loud chaos of the strip. It is a non-smoking, non-gaming hotel and has the usual Four Seasons service and quality. The rates are competitive with other high-end hotels on the strip, but you get the added benefit of a smaller hotel with personal service. The rooms are great (pay the extra for the view), the pool and restaurants are lovely and the service is top-notch. All guests have access to Mandalay Bay's facilities, but you won't stay long in the chaos before retreating back to the Four Seasons. The food at the poolside and in the restaurant is excellent - all restaurants in Las Vegas are pricy, but at least the quality at the Four Seasons makes it worth it. Overall, if I had to visit Las Vegas again, I would choose the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “A few niggles, but still excellent”
Reviews.Author: buffgirl73
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons for 15 nights this time around and 95% of the stay was excellent. Check in was fine although the guy who dealt with us didn't feel it necessary to give us water (as is normal and all other guests had) and I found him rather fake and smarmy. We went for a one bedroom suite this time and the room was impeccably appointed, the only slight issue was that for some reason the shower was smaller than we’ve had before with a wobbly faucet and its door wouldn't shut properly. Normally this sort of thing is picked up by the maids, but not on this occasion. Despite this everything was going great until our first Wednesday. Down by the pool the usual water refills weren't forthcoming and it appeared as if all the staff were either in a bad mood or had received some bad news because they were pretty much absent. This mood continued when we went down to get a car and all the staff ignored us (normally they are there straight away asking us if we would like a cab/car etc), and after waiting for 5 minutes we had to ask for a cab as they were having their own little conversation between themselves. Not very impressive. When we returned to the room later that day there was a message from the front desk. When I called downstairs to find out what it was about I unfortunately got the smarmy guy again and he explained what the issue was. Although nothing major, I was not impressed that when I pointed out that some of the information that he had provided us with at check-in was lacking, he was far too quick to say it was my fault. Which as it turns out, it wasn't. I was fuming when I came off the phone, this is the sort of attitude I’d expect from the Mandalay Bay, not the Four Seasons. The next day a lady from the front desk called specifically to apologise which made things better but the original person didn't bother. He is someone I will avoid in the future. I don't pay to be patronised. All in all though the stay was great, the pool service was a little hit and miss at time in terms of getting fresh ice, and weirdly enough, this took a dip when they were quieter, but the staff was mainly friendly and accommodating. It is worth noting that I had the best massage ever experienced in the Spa, 80 minute Four Seasons with Spinal Detox - something very special!! We will be back next summer but are going to try somewhere new in Feb/April as it unfortunately doesn't hold its faultless appeal anymore and despite being good value for money, it certainly isn't cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel of choice in Sin City”
Reviews.Author: MSSCt
Reviews.Content: I took my niece here for a four day stay to celebrate her college graduation. She had never stayed at a Four Seasons so this was a real treat. This hotel does not disappoint! You feel like you are the only guests. It is quiet which is nice. It is right next door to the Mandalay so if you want casinos and loud noise you just open the door and go next door but trust me you won't want to because this hotel treats their guests like royalty. The staff sent up a cake congratulating my niece on her achievement...how's that for service? The spa gives top notch service....as a matter of fact my niece and i had a couple of services and we fell asleep. The attendant woke us up (thankfully) because they knew we had a 8 pm dinner reservation and didn't want us to be late. What hotel does that? We had the concierge set up all of our dinner reservations for this reason. Pool was incredible....service outstanding....fresh frozen fruit was given to guests which was a nice touch. You must stay at this hotel....you will be glad you did!

Reviews.Title: “5 stars all around”
Reviews.Author: seasontravelergirl
Reviews.Content: We came here during the 4th of July weekend. It has a beautiful pool area and the staff give you creamsicles while laying pool side. If their pool doesn't seem good enough you can also use the Mandalay Bay facilities as the four seasons sits right on top of Mandalay Bay (literally). It's a little more private and secluded then your standard 5 star hotels in Vegas but it's also classy. Though some might find it "stuffy." I took 1 star away for location because its a tad far from most of the strip action so you'd have to drive or cab it. The check in people found out it was my birthday and this sent up a complimentary cake for me, it was great. We didn't bring our dog with us but we noticed other guests with dogs and also employees walking dogs. So if I ever travel with my dog, I will be sure and stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding customer service”
Reviews.Author: Eliminatetsa
Reviews.Content: If you can afford it, it's the best hotel in Vegas. No where else in Vegas did I get the level of customer service that I did at the 4 seasons. Such attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “If you have to be in Las Vegas when it is 105 degrees...”
Reviews.Author: rg1ga
Reviews.Content: Be at the Four Seasons Hotel! Especially, their pool. Wow! There were mist-producers over the most comfortable chaises. Every hour, the accommodating staff brought one treat after another--cooling wash cloths, frozen watermelon balls, Evian water sprays, popcicles. So relaxing. The food from the Verandah Restaurant can be served pool-side and was truly excellent. I cannot find fault with any aspect of the stay, except the cost. Notably, this is the most UN-Las Vegas Hotel on the strip. If you want the Las Vegas Strip Hotel, all you have to do is walk across the door to the Mandalay Bay Hotel. Most of the Strip hotels have the same general 'feel'. We visited the Mirage, the Bellagio, the Venetian, the MGM. Some seem nicer than others but you can forget you are in Las Vegas at the Four Seasons. I mean this in a good way. It is an oasis. Not cheap but loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful all around”
Reviews.Author: purplegirl22
Reviews.Content: If you are traveling with your family, don't even consider staying anywhere else. The property is TOTALLY KID FRIENDLY - not an once of stuffiness, and so pleasant for the adults too.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis from the kaos!!!”
Reviews.Author: L0vinVegas
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really wonderful. It is the best of both worlds. It allows you to get away from the crazy happenings of the Vegas strip. But, still close enough to get back to it. Pool ares is top notch as is the staff. Spa is great as well as the complimentary fitness facility. There are two restaurants, both very good, but expensive. There is a very nice happy hour from 4-7 every day, that is very reasonable. Overall, awesome hotel, but $$$$$$$$. But, this is the Four Seasons and Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm among a sea of Las Vegas chaos”
Reviews.Author: TheDogAteMyHomework
Reviews.Content: I hate Vegas. Its an awful city - nothing but a well orchestrated fraud. That's why when we had to be there for our trip, we decided to pick the Four Seasons. The Four Seasons Las Vegas was a welcome oasis in that horrid city. Despite being part of the Mandalay Bay complex, we were almost completely isolated from the low end riff raff that patronizes that other resort. The Four Seasons was everything one would expect from a true luxury property. This isn't just a place with a nice lobby and expensive restaurants. Its truly a 5 star experience, with top notch service. My only criticism is that there's only one swimming pool. As a family friendly hotel, it would have been much more pleasant if the little ones had their own pool to splash around in. Also, the available services at the Spa were limited as there was no mani/pedi available. If you must be in Vegas, this is the best property in town.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence beyond compare: no other hotel makes you feel so special and right at home!”
Reviews.Author: NM-Foodie-57
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been coming annually to the FSLV for about 10 years and each trip exceeds our expectations. This time, we discovered that the fitness center had undergone a facelift. New Technogym equipment (for those road warriors who depend on their daily workout, you know how important and comforting it is to ot have to just 'make do' with the equipment that's lying around) and a redesigned women's locker room and steam room. The staff member who turned down our room got us contoured pillows just like we have at home, and had a birthday cake sent up to our room when she learned that it was my birthday! Will we be back? In a heartbeat ... Just try to keep us away!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Anna777_11
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful, professional and warm. The breakfast is the best in town! The pool is great with a very relaxing atmosphere. We were on our honeymoon and we truly felt pampered. They are dog friendly. The concierge was very helpful and booked us in great restaurants. Overall, the best experience I've had in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “The Four Seasons Las Vegas is wonderful! A gem tucked away in the noise and party atmosphere of Las Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn C
Reviews.Content: Wouldn't stay anywhere else in Vegas!! It is very kid friendly...the pool staff are awesome! The concierge will make sure you have what you need vis a vis dinner reservations, show reservations and tickets, etc...The little extra touches they provide really make a difference. You can relax at the spa and the gym is great..then go out fresh for the night, by stepping into Mandalay Bay Casino to party.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was amazing. The staff could not have been more helpful if they tried. Outstanding.”
Reviews.Author: Darren B
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing, service was outstanding and attention to detail was spot on. I highly recommend this hotel. It is at the top of the strip but you are never to far away from all the action. It is an oasis amongst the calm. Best hotel bed I have slept in by far. I could not fault this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “#1? I dont think so”
Reviews.Author: bellapug10
Reviews.Content: We stayed this past long weekend for my husbands 50th and I so wanted to be able to say it was the absolute best, but it wasn't. I booked a suite and a separate room for the kids 21 and 23 - I reconfirmed this booking twice and still when we arrived our rooms were in separate wings, although on the same floor. I was told by the reservations department not to worry the rooms would be adjoining. It seemed to me that this set the tone for the entire stay. Although the rooms are lovely although a bit dated, the amenities are first class and the staff are very attentive. We had one very serious issue which the management and security staff totally dropped the ball on, my son's wallet was taken out of my bag and his prized $200.00 was taken. We did have security tell us that they reviewed the tape etc., but could see nothing. No one from management followed up, it was all a little bizarre how no one actually wanted to deal with this theft. I cannot imagine this to be an isolated incident. We did receive an email from the security office with an offer of a $200.00 credit towards our room charges. For a five star hotel in Vegas it is just not worth the money. Drinks and food prices are really high, and because of the location you need to taxi everywhere, the hotel car was nowhere to be found.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to its reputation--HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.”
Reviews.Author: s0j0urner1
Reviews.Content: I work in the hotel industry myself. Hence, I know what to look for when it comes to service and quality in a hotel. The Four Seasons in Las Vegas lives up to its reputation. Right when we drove up to the driveway the valet and Guest Services Manager, Matthew Romero, welcomed and greeted us. And that gesture of hospitality was continuous throughout our stay. The valet staff and doormen were friendly and acknowledged us (and the other guests) every time they see us in the lobby. There were always 2 bottles of water in our car every time we needed our vehicle pulled up---a very classy and hospitable gesture. And they always asked us if we needed directions to where we are going. The front desk and guest services agents were very guest-oriented. There was always a smile in their faces. When we arrived at our room, the housekeeping staff (I think her name was Maria..??) stopped by to make sure we had ice in our room's ice bucket, and even wished our stay "Have a wonderful stay Mr. & Mrs.___". Amazing! The word that comes to mind when describing the service that we received from every department is IMPECCABLE. The room was clean, polished, and well-stocked with amenities. When we requested cleaning service, it was serviced by the time we returned to our room. The lobby was magnificent with the marble floor well-polished and sparkling and the centerpiece was absolutely lovely. A hotel of this calibre and quality is deserving of its esteemed reputation. Thank you Four Seasons for the wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bsan3456
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying here for 4 nights. What a great place. The hotel staff makes you feel at home from the moment you arrive. The rooms are excellent with great views. It connects to Mandalay Bay so you have access to many places to eat and the casino. The hotel is quite and almost like a different world compared to the noise at other big hotels. The location is at the south end of strip so you have to ride to the other end of strip on bus or taxi but you really have everything you need here. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Almost forgot I was in Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: Iangostridge
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend with 2 friends in Vegas.We stayed at the Four Seasons.It was so calming I almost forgot where I was.Everything was spot on from the excellent reception we recieved to the staff and facilities.Our suites were overlooking the strip and were incredible.The friends we took with us had never been to Vegas before and were blown away both by the hotel and Vegas itself.I have been to Vegas over 50 times and this is the best hotel I have stayed at,in fact I can only think of 1 better.As an afterthought it is not cheap but wow is it worth it .We are returning for a much longer stay next year.

Reviews.Title: “As Good As It Gets”
Reviews.Author: topshelfplease
Reviews.Content: With the vast array of hotel choices in Las Vegas, and having stayed at many if not most of the best hotels in town, I consistently return to the Four Seasons for business and vacations alike (alone with my wife and likewise with our kids...many times). The exquisite service, quality of the rooms, tranquility at the end of a day (whether working hard or playing hard) makes this fine hotel, truly tough to beat. Top Shelf all the way...Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel you stay in when you don't want to stay in a casino”
Reviews.Author: SydneyFrequentFlyer
Reviews.Content: If you don't want to walk through a hotel lobby that doubles as a casino then this is the hotel for you. Not quite up to Four Seasons standard but it was pretty good. And don't worry, there's a casino right next door if you get the itch.

Reviews.Title: “It's Number one in Las Vegas for a reason!”
Reviews.Author: Diane201
Reviews.Content: From start to finish our stay at the Four Seasons was great. Reception staff were fantastic and our room was out of this world. We stayed in a one-bedroom suite overlooking The Strip. The view was phenomenal and probably one of the best from any hotel as you are looking back the whole length. Facilities are amazing, and as we were travelling with children they were keen to use the pools at the Mandalay Bay too. The hotel is a quiet retreat from the hubub of the strip but close enough to join in the fun too. I would highly recommned it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing week”
Reviews.Author: lcsjss2
Reviews.Content: From the time we checked in to the time we left our 7 night stay was amazing. The food and service at the Verandah restaurant was fabulous especially the salmon sandwich and the vegetarian omelet that I ordered for breakfast which was not on the menu. :) The Maid service twice a day and frozen treats and services at the pool made you feel pampered. It was like staying in a secluded retreat like Hawaii even though we were in Las Vegas. I cannot say enough about this hotel and the staff other than to say I've told everyone how wonderful our stay was and that we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Oasis in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: LittleG1818
Reviews.Content: I usually come to Vegas to go crazy, but for a calm business trip, the Four Seasons was perfect. It's part of the Mandalay Bay - floors 36 - 40, but it has a separate entrance, separate pool, separate restaurants, etc. I had a gorgeous view of the entire strip from my room and the bed and shower were both amazing. I loved that you don't have to walk through a huge casino just to get to the elevators, and the service was spot-on from the minute I checked in to the minute I left. It's not as lavish as Four Seasons in more exotic destinations, but it is a perfect getaway if you don't want the casinos, clubs and crowds at your doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful island retreat in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: bermurray
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here August 14 for our 35th wedding anniversary. From check-in through the next two days all was perfect. The pool is wonderful, the staff helpful and well-trained. We were upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite since it was our anniversary and it was lovely. Our son had sent a bottle of wine through room service, and when they heard it was our anniversary they added a cake to the order as a bonus. I have stayed in many hotels in Las Vegas and can easily see why the Four Seasons is rated number 1!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: donsieAdelaide
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Four Seasons, we had a Strip View Room and for a first time to Vegas this was a fantastic view, and the bed was super comfy! Yes it is at the end of the strip, but I loved that, the strip is Crazy and it was so nice to return to the serenity of the Four Seasons! There is a free monorail which you can catch part way up the strip, and then you can enjoy the walk and the sightseeing from there. Premium outlet shopping is a must (only went to the larger one), and also a visit to Downtown Vegas was great! We also went on the Maverick Helicopter Tour on the Grand Canyon - Awesome! The Four Seasons is located on the top floors of Mandalay Bay so you have access to the facilities here also, and once you find that door that steps you back into your Four Seasons Serenity it's bliss! Poolside was great unfortunately with a short stay we only had one day to enjoy our time here. Poolside attendants were friendly and brought frozen fruit, snickers bars, sprayed you with a cool mist etc. I even saw some guests having their sunglasses cleaned. We did pop into the Mandalay Bay Pool for a look, and returned very quickly! We ordered lunch whilst at poolside and the serving size was large! We also enjoyed the breakfasts here and cocktail hour. Everything about our stay here was Special and I'm glad we spent that bit extra for the experience! Note for this Hotel (and all Hotels) Free WiFi should be included!

Reviews.Title: “"Above and Beyond" all expectations!”
Reviews.Author: ScrappyKFPanda
Reviews.Content: This is the place to stay if you are looking to be pampered beyond belief. The service is everything one can expect and more. And yet, upon passing through the exclusive door to the Mandalay Bay one is tranported into the middle of all Vegas is and sought to be...

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm in a desert storm....”
Reviews.Author: katharine4444
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel. My husband and I stayed at the 4 seasons for 10 nights this month. It was our first trip to LV and we chose the best hotel on the strip! The customer service was second to none and it was so lovely and peaceful even though it was the height of the season! LV strip is manic, all the hotels are mad busy and noisy so it was lovely to return to the peace and quiet of the 4 seasons. The Mandalay Bay underneath the hotel is the complete opposite....smelly, noisy and very LV so you get the best of both worlds by stopping here! We are a normal middle aged couple who like good hotels but also having fun and the combination of the 4 seasons and the strip met all our requirements!!!

Reviews.Title: “What's left to say?”
Reviews.Author: Nili B
Reviews.Content: Quite, elegant, great service, and still a great stay as the Mandalay Bay water park and casino are available without leaving the facility when some action is needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with the silence you enjoy, yet on the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: EricO4
Reviews.Content: The only weak point was the WIFI Internet Access 14 USD per day which worked in time slots and therefore very slow when using external lock in to our main server. Internet itself was o.k. and once I used the cable (Ethernet) it was more stable yet more a VW than a Porsche in terms of speed.

Reviews.Title: “Great relaxation getaway”
Reviews.Author: x98peterson
Reviews.Content: This was a nice treat for us. We flew in on a whim from a charity auction event, on a charter flight. We did not have luggage, or toiletries, and when we checked in we did tell the staff this. I didn't expect them to take care of everything but at least an offer to provide a razor would of been nice. We did call down for some things later, and had to call twice to get a razor and brush. (Took limo to Walgreens for the rest). The pool was a nice resting spot. Especially compared to the hustle and bustle of the Mandalay Bay area, we were glad to have our own private area. The service from the waitresses was great. The pool staff not so much. We were the first ones to the pool one morning, and after being there for almost 2 hours, an attendant came over and asked us to move to another area b/c another family had requested it? We politely accepted the move, but thought that was rather rude. We also asked for a massage pool side, our waitress said "You are next, she should be right over". It took her over 2 hours to come over. We asked if we could order another person to come out, that we didn't care what it would cost, and she said no one else was available from the spa. The cool mist downs and frozen fruit were great, I did see staff complain and roll their eyes when someone asked for some fruit... So, with a little more "five star" tweeking from the staff, it would of been a five star stay, so I give it four stars. I am not sure if I would return, b/c I have stayed at many other five star resorts that had nicer staff.

Reviews.Title: “One of the most outstanding hotel experiences I've had!”
Reviews.Author: CapeWomen
Reviews.Content: The rooms were extraordinary and still affordable for us! The extra touches by our maid service really made a wonderful impression on us and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Just fab! A place of peace and solitude away from the madness that is Vegas!!”
Reviews.Author: Karen B
Reviews.Content: Top tip go next door to the Mandelay Bay pool for the waves but make sure you go back to the Four Seasons for poolside relaxation and great food.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the hype!”
Reviews.Author: paulantx
Reviews.Content: Parts of the room were filthy, mini bar was so dusty like it hadn't been wiped down in a while. The chicken quesadilla from room service was very grisley but the mozzarella salad was good. The pool was not relaxing because there were so many screaming kids with rafts and the server never came back to take my lunch order. The house car took me back to the airport and that was a great service!! The room size was smaller than expected. You had to close the bathroom door in order to get to the sink. I would also note that my room was closest to the airport side and the planes woke me up at 6 am every morning. Just not as great as I expected from such a pricey hotel. Also, no free parking???

Reviews.Title: “Perfect getaway from normal Vegas hotels”
Reviews.Author: hallage
Reviews.Content: Loved it ......check in here -no casino and no crowds just the best !

Reviews.Title: “Luxury & tranquility at the Top of Town...”
Reviews.Author: TravelTrishWA
Reviews.Content: Having flown 24hrs to arrive at this hotel was fabulous. This is our 5th trip and first time at the FS and it was a fabulous luxurious haven in this amazing crazy place. Starting with the room being spacious, with everything you need, tea & coffee facility always welcome, the best pillows and bed and a view of the strip that was sensational. This fabulous hotel is located on the top 5 floors at the top of the Mandalay Bay. The Mandalay Bay was also a lovely hotel and very nicely decorated and lots of restaurants and live entertainment on weekends We ate at the highly regarded Burger Bar in the venue then some great live Blues music at the House of Blues also in the venue... good food there too.. This hotel is at one end of the strip so it helps to have a car specially in the summer. If not the taxi & bus system is good.   Would recommend it highly as a luxury venue to escape the madness! Private Pool area as well adjacent to the very large Palm Beach facility ... The only fault is expensive wifi - valet - which should b free for guests...

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all expectations and then some...”
Reviews.Author: NavyBoy88
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 days/3 nights in Vegas for a family getaway, coinciding with our wedding anniversary. Despite usually staying at Fairmont properties, we decided on the Four Seasons for it's smaller and quieter atmosphere. It is tucked away adjacent to the Mandalay bay property, and shares the same building (The Four Seasons has the upper 5 floors). The staff, and their attention to details is truly amazing. Check in was personalized, quick and a free upgrade was offered. Our room, Dlx Double, was of a good size, and included full bar/snacks and kids amenities. Beds are very comfortable, and turned down service is punctual. First night, we received an anniversary cake, and second night, popcorn and pop for our daughter. The pool area is small but plenty of staff to serve to your every demand. Four Seasons guests have access to the much crowded Mandalay bay beach, but we much preferred our small oasis where everyone remembers your name. Many dinning options are available, and the quality matches the price accordingly. There is a house car available (first come first serve), which we've used a few times. The staff was more than willing to accommodate a late check out , which allowed us to enjoy the pool for a few more hours. If you prefer a quiet hotel, with impeccable service, look no further. We can't wait to return to vegas and the Four Seasons Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lindsay342
Reviews.Content: We always try to spend some of our time in the Four Seasons when we get to Las Vegas because, although the rooms may not be as glitzy as some others, the service is something special. Each staff member we came into contact with was so helpful and went out of their way to assist. Bed are very comfortable, poolside is great and you can always pop through the gate to Mandalay Bay if you feel like trying the lazy river or wave pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great family stay on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: CTFamilyGuy06482
Reviews.Content: We began our tour of the Southwest U.S. from Vegas and was looking for a clean and comfortable family oriented hotel on the strip. We found it! This hotel was very clean, quiet, had an awesome pool area, and best of all was smoke-free since there is no casino here. The service staff was wonderful and treated our party like royalty. If you want to gamble you can walk over to Mandalay Bay. If you want to tour the strip you can walk out the front door and head up the strip or jump on the free tram. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms smaller and simpler than I would have expected for the Four Seasons, but all else was excellent and made up for the minor ”
Reviews.Author: modestdave
Reviews.Content: Excellent, attentive service. Entry and exit an absolute pleasure, as its private entrance keeps guests separated from the mass of people and cars at the Mandalay. Rooms are clean, but rather simple. Soundproofing is way below par for Las Vegas. Hopefully, the rooms will updated soon, to be on par with equivalent caliber luxury hotels. Great stay overall. Amazing staff.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly great for kids”
Reviews.Author: SusanNYC63
Reviews.Content: We flew into Las Vegas only because we thought it would be a good start point for our trip through the southwest parks. We didn't expect to like it that much, but decided to spend 2 days based on all the reviews from families with kids. The best part of the trip by far was the Four Seasons hotel. We chose this hotel because it has no casino in the lobby. While in Vegas we visited all the other hotels recommended for families (Luxor, Paris, Excalibur, etc.) and while I can see the attraction, they were all very loud, smoky and chaotic. It takes 20 minutes just to walk through the lobbies. The 4 Seasons is completely different, small, calm and not trying to sell anything. They also treated the kids so well. 10 minutes after checking in they delivered bath kits for the kids with child-sized robes, slippers, tearless shampoo and conditioner, bubblebath and bath sponges spelling their names! A little later came popcorn and soda - all unsolicited. The room was huge and had a fabulous view of the strip. I know it is an expensive hotel and may not be a realistic choice for everyone, but it made our stop in Las Vegas a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “First class service from beginning to end in an impeccably maintained hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Travelsquirrel53
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Hotel Las Vegas more than fulfilled my expectations for a five-star hotel experience. The management and staff were highly professional, courteous, and impeccably presented. Each and every one made us feel very welcome. The hotel rooms were well-appointed and spotlessly clean, with very comfortable beds and exquisite linen. The manicured grounds and pool complex were a pleasure to explore. The food was fresh and delicious, with a French flair. After visiting some other hotels along the Strip - which were noisy, overcrowded and smoky - it was wonderful to come back to the quiet and private oasis at Four Seasons. I am so glad I chose this hotel and would highly recommend it to others. I believe it is the best hotel in Las Vegas. Bravo Four Seasons, I'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “With or without kids, you can enjoy yourself here!”
Reviews.Author: quinnsgal
Reviews.Content: This was the first stop of a 2 week trip. 2 adults, 2 young children. Booked our room through AmEx -and at first our suite was not as we were expecting. After expressing our dissatisfaction to the front desk, we were immediately moved to a suite that had the view we were looking for. The hotel was clean and smoke free. They really focus on making children happy - sending up personalized welcome chocolates for the kiddies, leaving special bath products for them, having small bathrobes laid out for them. We ordered room service and the food was great-delivered fast, hot-and was delicious to boot. The one negative to the property was the service we experienced poolside-they seemed to be either understaffed or just unattentive. All in All, upon returning to Las Vegas, I plan on being a guest at the Four Seasons again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, best place for kids! There wasn't one thing I could complain about!”
Reviews.Author: Jeans14
Reviews.Content: I have been to Las Vegas several times, first time staying at the Four Seasons Las Vegas. We decided to bring our daughter who is nine! We stayed ten nights in the premium strip view room, tons of space, great view! Pool area was fantastic, the food, service and all the extras by the pool made it a very relaxing trip!!! The hotel staff in all areas of the hotel go out of there way to provide excellent service! I would highly recommend this hotel and will continue to stay there as a family or as a couple!!!

Reviews.Title: “Real quiet, every other hotel is lika a zoo”
Reviews.Author: TripsiloveTotake
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, real quiet, every other hotel we visited felt like a zoo, loaded with people. Great service. Pool experience is like heaven, they spray water on your face (of course with your permission). They set great foamy bench or cabana for you @ the pool. They clean your sun glasses. Water, sunscreen is provided. Great experience. They stored our luggage since we checked out in afternoon and our flight was @ night; allowed us to freshen up @ the fitness center / spa. Fitness center looked very good, didn't use in this trip but just visited, every machine had a sweat towel. Showers @ the spa were great, with force and temp control separate. Cannot give 5 stars due to 2 things: Our room shower was too forceful. My daughter went for shower after a swim and the force of shower on head made her faint in the shower. She totally blacked out. Later on they came and changed the shower head, but that made us miss our show which was previously booked with no returns or exchanges. Our daughter recovered after couple of hours. No deals on Lion King show, every other hotel gives deals to their shows; but not four season's.

Reviews.Title: “Excels Again”
Reviews.Author: TravelWell040
Reviews.Content: Originally booked at the Marriott Cosmopolitan, we switched to Four Seasons after we read the Trip Advisor comments on the "party crowd" and accoustics at the Cosmopolitan. We have stayed at the Four Seasons Las Vegas many times and were always treated to exceptional service and courtesy. This time was no exception. The Verandah restaurant has improved over its already excellent reputation with a new breakfast menu. You can never go wrong at the Four Seasons. The top five floors of the Mandalay Bay Hotel are were the Four Seasons' Rooms are located.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of calm and tranquility”
Reviews.Author: NHamptonTraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 days for a conference at mandalay bay. I have previously stayed at Mandalay Bay and the Hotel and stayed on basis of rave reviews here on tripadvisor. On arrival I was welcomed by friendly reception staff and taken to my room. While I didnt eat at any of the restaurants I did have room service breakfast and dinner which i really enjoyed and was of a high standard. The bedroom facilites were what you'd expect with a very comfy bed but nothing out of this world. I was given some complimentary nachos and dips on the first evening but these were not then removed until i got room service to remove them which i felt was poor. Why only very good? personally I saw nothing special maybe this was because i didnt use the facilities enough spending most of my time in mandalay bay. What was great though was to be able to switch off from the madness of las vegas into the calm and tranquility provided by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: luby12
Reviews.Content: We loved that the four seasons was on the top 5 floors of the Mandalay Bay because you could use their facilities but you coif get away from the casino feel by going to Four Seasons. Always the best service and clean!

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it, we will def return!”
Reviews.Author: gingerpair
Reviews.Content: This place was fantastic. Exactly what I expect from the Four Seasons. I will say it was a bit of a hike if you plan on returning to the hotel throughout the day. I mostly enjoyed the atmosphere. It was a welcomed peacefulness after a long day on the strip. There were never any lines to check in or out, unlike the casino-hotels. As soon as we walked in the door it felt like home.

Reviews.Title: “Best time in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Gary W
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough good things about the FS Las Vegas! The pool is awesome and the ability to hop into the crowd at Mandalay's water park then hop back to the quiet elegance of the Four Seasons pool is worth the price alone. Great being able to snag the house car to go to the Wynn for dinner too. Perfect stay Their weekend brunch is the best I've ever had - they have their own donutologist making donuts fresh as you wait!

Reviews.Title: “We felt pampered from the moment we stepped out of the car”
Reviews.Author: hmjom5
Reviews.Content: This hotel chain are experts in customer service. They do everything to make you feel comfortable and pampered. We loved the experience and we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: jnavani
Reviews.Content: The service was amazing. Amanda-the reservation manager was great. She responded to all my emails promptly and was generous with our requests. The pool side staff was phenomenal. We didn't get a chance to try out the restaurants on site. We did try room service and the pool side food....both which were good. The pool staff would also do complimentary stuff every hour....spray us with Evian water, clean our sunglasses...offer frozen ice pops,milky way chocolates and pineapples on a stick. Concierge was great. They even gave us a complimentary mini bday cake and brownies, since we were celebrating a special occasion. All the staff during our stay were friendly and remembered our names. Having access to Mandalay's pools .....was a plus! I would highly recommend the Four Seasons to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “A real and true oasis of calm, class, luxury and (believe it or not) value, in Sin City.”
Reviews.Author: DJay414
Reviews.Content: My wife was provided a gift certificate to any Four Seasons hotel from a thankful client, and we chose to stay in Vegas, not because we love Vegas (although I do, but we were bringing our thirteen year old and her friend), but in part because of the tremendous value we found in the Four Seasons' hotel there. Of course Vegas is fun -- restaurants, shopping, hitting the tables and some pretty cool shows -- but it's also chaotic and phenomenally cheesy (right?). The Four Seasons hotel (attached to the Mandalay Bay) was a terrific value (about $200 a night mid-week), right in the thick of things (doors lead right into the Mandalay Bay craziness) but also can be isolated, calm and beautiful in its own right. Initially, my thirteen year old and her friend hit the Mandalay Bay beach pool right outside the gated Four Seasons pool, where they could frolic within safe texting distance, but my wife and I barely left the much nicer and insane-less Four Seasons pool. A couple of wonderful touches: the pool staff brought us free pitchers of iced and fruited water, and continuously refreshed the pitchers with more ice and water. On incredibly hot days, your normal luxury hotel (and certainly your normal Vegas hotel) would love to take advantage of the heat by having friendly wait staff take your orders for vastly overpriced cold drinks and you'd be thankful for it normally when they brought you those drinks. The Four Seasons' approach of having diligent, friendly people constantly bringing us free water (as well as crazy but perfect items like free Otter Pops and free cinnamon-infused frozen melon balls) was a small but awesome touch. Other great things -- the pool was never crowded, there were cabana like day beds under shaded fans and there was no charge for using those day beds, again a far cry from the Mandalay Bay (which I like by the way) but which would charge you at least an additional $200 a day to use a similar cabana. In general, the Four Seasons' staff walks a great tightrope -- a lot of luxury hotel staff can be wonderfully pleasant, but, at the end of the day, kind of hopelessly useless; at the Four Seasons, we were impressed not just by the genuine pleasantness of the staff, but the actual and real competence and diligence they uniformly displayed, from doing things like running us over to spots in Vegas in brand new air conditioned Mercedes' cars (again, for free) to finding us really good restaurants perfectly within our value range. Another nice touch: unlimited use of the small but very nice fitness center was also, again, free and part of the room charge. I have stayed at nearly all of the best hotels in Vegas -- Encore, Bellagio, Wynn, Cosmopolitan (which I like a lot). It took me awhile to try the Four Seasons (for some reason, I was afraid it would be too overpriced, stuffy or removed), but having done so, I am completely sold. It was a great experience and, remarkably, I think a great value in a town that can suck the money out of you (not to mention your soul) faster than an E-trade baby on caffeine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, fantastic service Four Seasons quality all the way”
Reviews.Author: windy240
Reviews.Content: Do not eat in the steak restaurant Charlie Palmer Steakhouse. My experience was very bad. Service was so bad it was a joke. We were a group of 9. 5 got the same entree. However, the entree did not look the same, was not cut the same. one person got all end pieces. (it was a grilled flank steak type cut) the meat was not cut taking the grain of the meat into account. Skip the steakhouse. They need a little work, oops a lot of work. We were ignored most of the time. groups came ate and left and we sat waiting, waiting......... The Verandah restaurant is fantastic. expert attentive service. You every need is anticipated and met. Four Seasons quality all the way.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Seaklife
Reviews.Content: What an amazing stay with an incredible staff. It was awesome to be able to step away from the hustle and bustle of Las Vegas, but still have everything, including Mandalay Bay, right at your fingertips. They really take care of you here. Treating you and everyone else like your concerns are number one. I don't know how they do it. Amazing!

Reviews.Title: “A caring oasis on the mad strip.”
Reviews.Author: taipeirose
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best of both worlds: one may enjoy the tranquility of The Four Seasons, and then slip through a discreet door to have fun at the Mandalay Bay wavepool or to gamble in the casino. Our children were greeted with personalized gifts and apparently there were many options available to them through the concierge which we never had time to explore. We took the complimentary car to the Bellagio one night...very classy! The staff is friendly and discreet and very well trained. The same comment continues through to the staff of the Mandalay Bay casino. The only thing that we didn't like about the room was that the mattress was too soft. I am not sure whether this can be corrected. The remoteness of the location is the only downside, but this can be worked around by taking the tram from Mandalay Bay to the more animated part of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Four Seasons!”
Reviews.Author: penasia
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here with a family of 4 and we would have loved to stay much longer! Las Vegas was part of our 4-week-long California tour and we are not interested in gambling so we weren´t sure what to expect of Vegas or what else we would do there. In the end, it was our most relaxing break thanks to the quiet and peaceful luxury of the Four Seasons Hotel. The best part was clearly that due to the location next to the Mandalay Bay Hotel we could enjoy the best of both worlds: The kids loved the wave pool and the Lazy River at the Mandalay Bay while we adults preferred the serenity of the smaller but secluded Four Seasons pool. No one had to compromise! The hotel was elegant and quiet and we basically never saw and heard anyone. At the same time staff was very helpful and there when we needed them. We were glad we didn´t stay in any of the more typical, noisy and overcrowded hotels in more central locations on the Strip. The view of our room was amazing and room service excellent! We hope to be back!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to eventually make it over !!”
Reviews.Author: JudyBrian
Reviews.Content: We had a booking with this hotel and due to a very unfortunate accident involving our son we could not make it to the USA. Many hotels were not interested in our circumstance and would not help us out. This hotel was so helpful with our cancellation and very sympathetic. We have friends travelling to Las Vegas next month and have recomended they stay at Four Seasons. We will make it there at some stage and this is where we will look forward to spending our holiday. Staff were terrific !!!

Reviews.Title: “Daughter's birthday...”
Reviews.Author: dobiezeke
Reviews.Content: We recently spent four nights at the FS in August. I had high expectations of the hotel based on reviews/comments by previous guests. The Four Seasons and their staff met and exceeded all my preconceived ideas! We were in Vegas for my daughter's fifth birthday (her choice - not hard to twist Dad's arm). We upgraded to a one bedroom suite overlooking the pool. I informed the desk staff that we staying for my daughter at which time they requested her first/last name. We proceeded to the room and got ready for dinner. Upon returning to the room my daughter was greeted with a chocolate mousse birthday cake, a plate of M&M's with a white chocolate 4 piece puzzle, a child's robe, and bath sponges spelling out her last name. She was thrilled! The four nights were a continuation of the service and courtesy displayed by all the staff in the hotel. The room was large, clean, and well prepared each day. I would recommend the Four Seasons in a heartbeat for anyone from family to couples.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cookie E
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exceptional and definitely lives up to the Four Seasons standard we expected. From check-in the staff were exceptional. The Four Seasons hotel sits atop the Mandalay Bay hotel, occupying floors 35 - 39, so by definition you are guaranteed a high floor! The room itself was very spacious, with a very generously sized bathroom. The Beds were large and incredibly comfortable, and when we asked for an extra duvet, they brought 2! The rooms were cleaned incredible well, for example in the shower they lined up our toiletries in descending height order: just a little thing to let you know that you're at a FS hotel. The Lobby was also beautifully laid out. There is the Asian theme to it, however it is not over-the-top (like most other hotels in Vegas!), but they have done it in a way that is really nice to look at. The Four Seasons Pool service is exceptional, the Pool is the perfect size, no deeper than 5 feet anywhere, and normally when we went in there were not too many people in the pool. The hotel itself is not crowded, which is a rare thing to find in a city such as Vegas. In all the other hotels we visited (eg Venetian, Rio etc), even at 5pm there were people checking in. There is also the benefit of there not being a casino, so there was no smoking in the hotel. It is possible to get from the Mandalay Bay hotel to the Four Seasons Hotel, but if you don't know where you're going, it can get very confusing! This hotel is exceptional, and if visiting Las Vegas I would definitely reccomend it, because it is less crowded, exceptional, FS standard service, and no musky cigarette smell everywhere, unlike many other hotels in Vegas! I have nothing to fault for this wonderful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A Bit Tired and Outdated”
Reviews.Author: Johnny1066
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from the 4 Seasons after a 7 night stay. Yes, its the 4 Seasons and yes the place was clean and the staff were as efficient as you would expect from a hotel such as this. I did however feel the place looked and felt a bit tired and outdated. The rooms are of a good size, well furnished and the cleaning staff were first class. The pool I felt was a bit of a disappointment; the staff there were also hit and miss. I would certainly try a different 5 Star next time. Finally, you are a bit isolated at the end of the strip and you have the "ding ding" of the Casino below you at all time.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall but a few rough edges”
Reviews.Author: amonynous
Reviews.Content: We chose the Four Seasons on the basis of the reviews here for a family vacation with our two kids (8 and 10). We were not disappointed; the hotel lived up to our high expectations and all the great fetures/benefits mentioned by other reviewers, albeit with a few issues that could easily be addressed. The Good We had a standard view one-bedroom suite on the 39th floor, consisting of two large rooms, one with an oversised and very comfortable king bed, the other with a sofa bed and wet bar. The bedroom has a full-sized bathroom attached with bath and shower, the other room has a half-bathroom with a hand-basin. Both rooms have large flat-screen TVs with DVD players, bedroom had iPod dock/alarm clock combination. The rooms were spacious with floor to ceiling windows and plenty of storage space. Cooling levels were good in the rooms despite it being 100+F/40+C outside the large windows. We did need to crank it up during the morning when the sun was shining in to the room but it coped very well in the middle of summer. Location at the end of the strip was fine for us - we were there for a relaxing break, to see the (natural) scenery and to catch a few shows. Taxis were generally $14-$18 (including tip) and 10 minutes max to/from the heart of the strip. A big plus is that there are no lines to get a taxi at 4S. Contrast that with a 30 min taxi line outside Caesar's Palace (you wouldn't want to walk more than a few blocks at this time of year). The Four Seasons pool was great on every level. Well furnished with comfortable new loungers, fantastic poolside attendants and no problem getting somewhere to sit as the staff at the pool set up chairs for you (in the sun or in the shade) and clear them down fairly quickly when people leave. Some of the seating was next to hidden speakers playing a selection of current tunes. Seats right next to them were rather loud, but there were other areas where you couldn't hear the music at all. We never had a problem finding a spot to suit us. The pool was large enough for the number of people wanting to use it. The kids liked getting there early so they could have the whole thing to themselves, but even at the busiest times there were never more than a dozen people in the water. There were lots of people with younger kids at the pool, but they were well behaved and not overly noisy or crazy. The pool attendants don't allow large inflatables/tubes in the 4S pool or jumping/diving, but neither were they enforcing 'silence in the library' rules either. The adults standing in the water with their Kindles and smartphones all seemed happy enough. Food and drink service at the pool was fantastic - pricey but worth the money, and frankly no more expensive than many more average eating places in the city. We ate at the Verandah restaurant several times and again the food and service were good - the weekend brunch buffet was great. We're a family of vegetarians and there was plenty of choice on all the 4S menus except the Steakhouse (naturally). The Average With the exception of the bed, the furniture in the rooms was fairly average and functional. Perfectly adequate but certainly not the over-stuffed 'country house' armchairs depicted on the web site. Suspect that much of it has been replaced with lesser quaility items over the years. The sofa bed was fine for our two young(ish) and skinny kids, but I don't think an adult would find it at all comfortable - small, thin mattress, not very supportive. Room cleaning and turndown times were erratic. Some days the room was cleaned first thing, others late afternoon.
