Turndown was also erratic anywhere between 5:30pm and 9:30pm - given that they made up the sofa bed for the kids this was slightly problematic as we either ended up with nowhere to sit and watch TV or (on one occasion) had to call down so we could get the kids to bed. Not the end of the world, as a call to housekeeping would quickly resolve any problems but a bit more predictability would be helpful. Noise levels in the room were generally very good. We had a room overlooking the airport with four active runways and two busy helicopter tour companies almost opposite. You could hear aircraft and helicopters taking off and landing from about 6:00m to mid-evening, but only if you turned the A/C off first, so no worries there. There was a bit of misic noise from somewhere one evening -seemed to be coming from the A/C vent and might have been from the nightclub on the top floor, but we only heard it once and suspect it might have been from another guest room below. Again it wasn't overly intrusive or an issue. No rowdy parties banging and shouting in the hallways at 2:00am was a real bonus for a Vegas hotel. If you were overly bothered by noise you might be disturbed, but it was impressive for a room overlooking a busy airport to be far quieter than many city-centre hotels. The Bad Paying daily for WiFi and Valet parking is very poor show in this day and age. I'd happily pay for the valet service was very quick - we'd just turn up at the front door and the car would be there in a couple of minutes. Nobody wants to pay for a necessity like WiFi though. To make the point, I could pick up and use free WiFi service from THEhotel when sat at the Four Seasons pool. FS management needs to move with the times! The Mandalay Bay pool looks great in pictures and has the potential to be fantastic, but it is the perfect illustration that 'Hell is other people'. Packed pools, can't get a plastic sun lounger in full sun unless you turn up at opening time, loud music and bodies everywhere. Queues of crying children and teens emerging from the wave pool with bashed in eyes, noses and just about everything else due to the mob atmosphere. Even our kids could only stick it for 30 mins on a couple of days and we're talking about children who were happy to spend six or seven hours in the FS pool most days. The worst (only) badly behaved person at the FS pool all week was an 'adult' who was clearly incapable due to drink who had to be taken out in a wheelchair by a couple of smartly dressed security guards. Even that was handled without a fuss or disturbance, and you can hardly blame the hotel for it (suspect he had already had far too many before he arrived). Maintenance of electrical items in rooms really needs to be looked at by management. We found one table lamp with the bulb hanging inside the shade from wires. Another table lamp gave off a worrying smell of burning on the last night when switched on, and when I went to unplug it from the wall after switching off, the faceplate fell off the wall socket when the lamp cord was removed. These issues were reported to housekeeping who sent an engineer straight up and offered to move us to another room. We declined as we didn't want to be disturbed as this all happened as we were putting the kids to bed. Reported to the front desk in the morning (as we were checking out that day) and they promised to look in to it. Hope they do! Not an ideal end to the stay, and clearly some of the fittings are well past their sell-by dates. Without wishing to generalise, the wiring of US appliances generally leaves a lot to be desired compared to UK portable equipment, and this isn't the only hotel where I've experienced similar issues. Overall Would we go back? Yes I think we would. Having had a look around a few other hotels in Vegas this is right up there. The quality of the rooms and furniture does need updating somewhat, but it is still pretty good in my book, and the fantastic service from the staff and calm atmosphere of the hotel overall mark it out as something special.

Reviews.Title: “We can't wait to return to the Four Seasons in Vegas!!”
Reviews.Author: CurlCouple
Reviews.Content: Wow! What a pleasant surprise to be wowed by a hotel. We chose this hotel due the overwhelming recommendations on Trip Advisor by people with children, We stayed here with our 3 kids aged 12,10 & 9 who said it was the best place EVER! The employees went above and beyond, filling our water by the pool constantly, asking if they could do anything to make our stay more comfortable and setting up trays for us to eat our meals on. I loved they had no problem setting up the luxury round seating for my kids and treated them just as they did us. When my daughter didn't enjoy her meal the employee actually noticed and quickly asked if she could bring her something else. We loved using the Mandalay Bay pool from 7:30-9 (no one is awake in Vegas at this hour) then when things started to get busy we walked back to our private pool which were the only ones in. The only complaint we had was we wished the room had 2 queens rather than 2 doubles, not sure why any room has "doubles" these days! If you have kids STAY HERE. We were very happy not to have to walk through a casino with our kids, Vegas can truly be a family destination if you can avoid all the nasty parts. THANK YOU so much Four Seasons for a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and great service”
Reviews.Author: jaquelita
Reviews.Content: I spent a few nights at the four seasons hotel for business trip and I couldn't be more pleased with their service. It is very private and you can get to sleep and really get some rest after a long day and lots of walking. The pools are amazing and the beds are awesome! I loooved the pillows. These are one of the most comfortable beds ever! It is nice if you want to be away all the noise from the vegas strip. But also you can just go down to the casino if you want to continue with the party. It is very close to the airport as well so you don't have to worry about getting in or out in time. We made it in about 5 min!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service at this oasis on The Strip”
Reviews.Author: roadtrip38
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons for two nights at the end of our family's summer RV trip. Maybe it was the contrast of going from the RV to a luxury hotel, but we felt that the service was fantastic. Upon our arrival, the staff brought our kids each a plate full of candy as well as junior-sized bath robes. Another nice amenity was having the valet crew put cold bottled water in our car for us each time they brought it around for us. Another highlight of our stay was the pool. Because the hotel shares a "campus" with Mandalay Bay, guests get to use the pools there free of charge. What a great combination -- go crazy with the kids in the Mandalay wave pool and lazy river and then enjoy the peace and quiet of the Four Seasons pool. That's where they'll clean your sunglasses for you, pass out frozen Snickers bars, and spritz you with Evian. Talk about contrast. Only thing that would have made the stay perfect would have been free Wi-Fi.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic will always try to use four seasons from now on!!!”
Reviews.Author: debs163
Reviews.Content: from pulling up outside we were made to feel so special. the service was above & behond. lovely hotel, rooms, pool etc. made up for the disappointments of other hotels we stayed in on this trip!!! There is not one negative comment to say about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “rooms need an update”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel702
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel and although I appreciated the tranquility of the hotel (no casino & at the end of the strip) I was very underwhelmed by the rooms. We had a suite and I found the ceilings to be low and the furniture to be old, the bed small, AC unit very loud and the bathroom rather dated. Also, my husband had asked for an antipasto platter and snacks to be in the room upon our arrival because we were driving in and it was not there. In fact it arrived maybe an hour after calling about it. Right before we got our room service dinner. It was ok, but not great and when there are so many other options in Las Vegas- would definitely stay elsewhere next time. (Last year we stayed at the Tower Suites at the Wynn and I much preferred those suites).

Reviews.Title: “Average for Four Seasons.”
Reviews.Author: Weedman_CL4
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at a number of properties around the world so while this is a great property in general it is average for this banner. Reservation Type - AMEX Premier Hotels & Spas Check In - Good, but not the sit down with a cool beverage we have seen in other places Upgrade - Checked in late in the day, got a great upgrade with a view of the strip Breakfast Voucher - Choose room service. Worked out fantastic with great service and food. Dinner Voucher - Only good at the Veranda. Casual dinning with a very solid menu. Ask for Gerardo...his level of acumen made the process great...his personalized service made the experience great. ***Be sure to get a couple of recos from him, my wife and I took them and loved the meal! Parking - Had to pay for parking which is a first for me in this town! Location/Casino. The location is not really great unless you want a picture of the welcome to vegas sign. It is attached to the Mandalay Bay Hotel & Casino...you can read my review, but to save you the time take a pass on that one. Overall if you like personalized service and to have accommodations out of the hustle and bustle I think you will find this a good option.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I could live here”
Reviews.Author: bchood
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights on our way across the country. We actually were here during our anniversary, so we wanted to stay somewhere nice. We got way more than we expected. The room was enormous! It was a suite with a huge bedroom with a view of the strip. The kind-sized bed was the most comfortable thing I've ever slept in. The bathroom was huge and luxurious and clean. The robes and slippers in the room were very comfy. Lots of closet space. The living room was huge also, and there was a half bath in the entryway! The mini bar and snack bar had tons of choices, which I love. Room service was great - I can't say enough about this hotel! I liked staying here because it doesn't have a casino with people smoking everywhere. It's at the end of the strip, so we had to take cabs everywhere, but it was worth it to get away and relax once we were in the hotel. We were expecting a package while we were there, and the staff was so friendly! Also, we had our dog with us and there was plenty of green space for him and tons of space in the room for him to run around.

Reviews.Title: “Oh dear, cutbacks at the four seasons!”
Reviews.Author: MarkKirsty
Reviews.Content: Well I'm afraid to say that the four seasons is not the same hotel it was when we visited last year and its no surprise that it's lost it's no. 1 spot on here and I feel it won't be long before it's not even in the top 5. I really don't know where to start! Arrival and check in was pleasant and un eventfull and our room spacious and clean, however it's very noticeable that huge cutbacks have been made at the four seasons, the little things that made it the place to stay in Las Vegas. The calm and tranquility of the pool has gone, it's turned into a kids splash pool where parents let their children run riot, jumping in and out of the pool with no regard for the other users of the pool, no longer can you sit in the pool to keep cool whilst reading a book without it getting soaked! There was no intervention from pool attendants encouraging parents to take their children to the Mandalay pool which with a wave machine, beach and lazy river it's built for fun! We also noticed that the free poolside icicles, cold face flannels, frozen fruit, smoothies etc have all but disappeared. Last year these would happen every hour or so! In a week of being here we where lucky if we got anything once a day! Turn down service used to be something special, iced water, slippers at the side of your bed and soothing music, a real calm to return to after your night out, now all you get is two pillows moved off the bed! It's hardly worth it. I know these things seem trivial but when your paying a premium for a so called five star luxury hotel it's these little things that make the difference and mask the fact that the hotel is over 10 years old. We felt so let down, we actually went and had a tour of the Manderin Oriental which we where encouraged to book instead of the four seasons, however we decided to opt for what we knew, boy where we wrong! It's a real shame as it's a lovely property, but I know for fact that talking to other couples around the pool they feel the same way, one couple who said had been coming twice a year for seven years wouldn't be returning. I did speak to a manager who admitted there had been cutbacks, unfortunately like i said to him, for every 1 person that tells you 20 will vote with their feet and not bother to come back. We are already planning our summer vacation for next year and if we return to Vegas,it won't be to the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “"Was ok for a business meeting but could have been better"”
Reviews.Author: eahmail123
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Four Seasons for one night under the american express fine hotels and resorts program for a meeting. First the room upgrade was a view of the parking lot if you call that an upgrade. Second, room service forgets to deliver something for me and the next day when I checked out i was just told it was not on the computer. Lastly, dinner at the Verandah restaurant was just subpar because of the service which was kinna slow and the food was just ok, steak was kinna tuff. Transfered to the Bellagio the next day to gamble and was treated way better. Food was excelent and the amex upgrade was a middle suite fronting the fountains.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel offers a very high level of service; position great; staff great - no complaints at all.”
Reviews.Author: suejanethomas
Reviews.Content: Having never been to LAS before the conciege was very experienced & helpful in prompting us on the best way to move between properties and areas to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel made for an amazing wedding.”
Reviews.Author: lizkittyliz
Reviews.Content: Our friends got married here. We were worried about Vegas in the summer but it was made perfect by this hotel. The service was the best we have ever experienced. As soon as you walked in you didn't feel like you were in Vegas any more. No slots, no noise, no smoke, NICE staff! The lobby is beautiful and was always comfortable in temperature despite the 100+ degree temperatures outside. The pool was also amazing. It was crowded due to the heat but the service and setting made it. They set up your chairs for you and make the so comfortable. They have great poolside drinks and food options. The staff comes around with free flavored waters, frozen fruit lollipops, and even Evian misters in addition to the already installed misters. Somehow it just wasn't that hot out by this pool. They also had sunscreen and lotion dispensers to keep everyone protected. The pool was a great temperature and very inviting as well. Our room was nice but nothing out of this world. The view was also of the pools and airport, which wasn't beautiful but honestly was quite interesting. It was very clean and the products in the room were nice. The restaurants are also very good. We had brunch twice (expensive but COMPLETELY worth it) and also ate at the steak house. The wedding venue isn't that special, it is a hotel ballroom that is very nice but it's still a ballroom. The service was what you expect from the four seasons and the food was good but not amazing-how could it be serving 250 all at once? We had a great time and can't wait to stay at the four seasons in Vegas again. It was so relaxing and refreshing it really changed my Vegas experience.

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough good things about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: shettena
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the reviews on this site and I wasn't disappointed. I stayed here with my wife and two kids (ages 5 and 1) for four days in July and from beginning to end it was a great experience. We were upgraded to a spectacular suite overlooking the strip. The Four Seasons seems to make an extra effort to welcome families with little touches like a plate of candies for the kids and a little stuffed animal inside the baby crib. Service was impeccable. The hotel was an oasis of calm in the hubbub of Vegas. We will be back. I can't imagine staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel met or exceeded all of our expectations. Fantastic hospitality blended with world class service.”
Reviews.Author: RGS_888_11
Reviews.Content: Enjoy the proximity to the Mandalay Bay wave pool and lazy river, as well as the Shark Theatre.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service. Beautiful oasis in Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: happytravels092
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival the staff was incredibly helpful. It was too early to check in, so they stored our luggage and directed us to brunch, and then the spa and pool. We were completely taken care of. We were upgraded from a standard room to an executive suite - a very pleasant surprise. The spa staff was wonderful, and accommodated us quickly after a misunderstanding about massage reservations. The massages were lovely and although it was unplanned, the staff directed my husband and me to a private waiting room where we could relax together afterwards. The pool staff is very attentive and we loved the poolside menu – a range of refreshing cocktails and tasty lunches. We liked the fish tacos the best. Overall, this was an incredibly relaxing getaway for our anniversary. We never strayed too far from the Four Seasons, because it's classy and elegant, and calming compared to every other place!

Reviews.Title: “Viva Diva Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: mrsrocketgirl
Reviews.Content: Having been to Las Vegas many times, I have always wanted to stay at the Four Seasons LV, especially when I passed the gated pool area. When deciding what to do for my 50th birthday, I realized exactly where I wanted to celebrate that milestone. My husband and I spent 4 nights at the the Four Seasons LV and had an amazing time. When we arrived, we were upgraded to a Strip view room. I received a complimentary chocolate cake on the first night of our stay. The pool was amazing and I was there every day from 9-5 and sometimes later. We enjoyed breakfast and lunch by the pool as well. The pool staff were incredibly friendly and attentive, often referring to us by name. We were offered frozen melon balls, frozen pushup ice pops (love those!) and frozen mini Snickers. Our iced water pitchers were consistently refilled. They offer to clean your sunglasses as well. The staff practically tuck you into your lounge chair with fresh towels, but we chose a small, canopied cabana (I referred to it as my cabanita) which is perfect for two people to relax and get some shade when needed. They have a few on the premises for free but you have to get there early (8:30 am) to snag one, which is fine as they serve coffee, lattes and even made us FS version of a frappucino. Yum! Ok enough about the pool-we used the gym, even though we each needed gym clothes and sneakers. The gym/spa reception staff supplied us with clean, FS gym clothes during our stay. The steam/eucalyptus room is complimentary and was great! The Verandah restaurant, located next to the pool has a Happy Hour in which we enjoyed great drinks and small plates @ $5 each! Can't beat that! The housekeeping staff was stellar, coming in more than once a day to clean, organize bathroom toiletries and replenish L'Occitane products! Whoa! Room service was awesome as well. We were able to print our boarding passes for free on the hotel computer and the concierge was very helpful. We loved the privacy, luxury and serenity of the Four Seasons Las Vegas. When we wanted to venture into frenetic Las Vegas, we just went through the secret door and entered Mandalay Bay. Voila! The Four Seasons Las Vegas was the perfect retreat for us and allowed us to experience Las Vegas on our own terms. I'm afraid to tell my secret hideaway but I want other to enjoy it as well. One more note: we saw quite a few families with kids of all ages and it was great. Everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves. I would love to bring my nieces and nephew there as the FSLV seems very kid-friendly. The best and we'll be back!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons: excellent hotel, just don't be insulted by the rude Valet parking guy.For the rest, it was top quality.”
Reviews.Author: wolfman2766
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel, just don't be insulted by the rude Valet parking guy.For the rest, it was top quality. Concierge very helpfull Room clean & practical, housekeeping girls friendly.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Vegas if you want to receive excellent service”
Reviews.Author: PezFletcher
Reviews.Content: After a huge amount of research we selected the Four Seasons as it was non gaming and recognised that families do travel to Vegas. Check in and check out were fast ( defintely no queing ) and there were several nice touches such as popcorn and drinks for my son ( age 13 ) a DVD libarary for him to select from ( good when we he wanted to chill for a bit ). Chocolates and a hand written note sent up as we were in town to get married. Pool area was excellent - not a huge pool but never crowded and as a Four Seasons guest you have access to the Mandalay Bay pool - great fun but you wouldn't want to be there all day if you want to relax ! The Four seasons scores highly on service and atmosphere - a stunning hotel where you can relax but are only moments away from all of the action. Certainly recommend this for families with kids of all ages

Reviews.Title: “A great stay with a few minor hiccups”
Reviews.Author: SleepyEurope
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice as a family in July visiting from europe.We had a couple of fairly minor issues but all in all we were overwhelmed by the excellent service and care and consideration especially from Ella and some of her close team - 10 out of 10.When issues arose such as noise from the Foundation room disco, she personally dealt with them in a highly professional manner and resolved the issues immediately to our satisfaction and beyond.We,like other reviewers cannot fault the staff - for example we witnessed the Housekeeping teams working very hard all day long. That said a few observations that are intended to help and hopefully not act as criticism per se. 1.The pool area is fairly small and playing loud music is okay but not what everyone wants on vacation,so a quiter area would be appreciated.There is no where else to sit and read quietly.I could not see outside misting machines used in lots of locations in Vegas which would have helped keep the area cooler, for those that say,sat in a designated area with this facility. 2.There is no in hotel coffee shop although you can work through to Starbucks etc in the adjoiing hotel if you fancy a longish walk to and from the hotel.Why not build a small upscale coffee shop (see the one in the Cosmopolitan for example) that sells nice coffees,upscale,sandwiches and cakes? We had an evening flight and despite a kind late check out at 2pm - we still had 6 hours to wait in the hotel - after a few hours around the pool and eating in the restaurant - we could only find the chairs opposite the check in - to sit and wait in - Im not convinced FS is making the best use of the space they have - eg on areas around the in hotel shop or on the 1st floor where the conference,business meeting rooms are situated. On a related subject there is only Charlie Palmer - which starts at circa $30 for a main or the inhouse FS restaurant (which is very good - service and food) so eating in the hotel bar room service is limited.Charlie Palmer was closed for a private party with Cisco (with no notice on the door either !) one of the nights we stayed. 3.The Spa staff were very nice but one minor irritation was there was no Spa Nail service only in the next spa in the Mandalay Bay - Im sure FS are missing out here not offering an express service for Nails or any other service - all treatments are aimed at the premium end eg $ 100 up. 4.Similar to other reviewers small things like no water in the room,no free wifi really is nickel and diming in our view. All in all the staff were very helpful as I stated at the beginning of this review - I think the point raised by another recent reviewer - that the hotel being part of the Mandalay Bay and having a somewhat old look and feel is part of the issue - I agree that FS should consider moving up the Strip to one of the newer developments - and refresh their local branding and presence - as a faithful FS client globally - I cant help but feel this would be a good,yes expensive - but overall worthwhile - strategic move for FS. Finally Thank you again to Ella and her team - who all work very hard to provide top service,that simply cannot be faulted.

Reviews.Title: “HOOCHIE MAMA - Amazing view!”
Reviews.Author: Oliverocks
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a 37th floor strip view room on arrival and boy oh boy was it a stunner! Huuuuge comfortable bed and lovely luxurious bathroom. If you are lucky enough to be staying on a Sunday you must try the breakfast buffet bonanza, literally anything you can think of for breakfast is there for the picking.

Reviews.Title: “Top NOTCH !!”
Reviews.Author: dh24yaya
Reviews.Content: This Four Seasons is truly an oasis in a crazy frenetic city !! You probably could find a spalsher hotel room on the Las Vegas strip BUT you won't find service and elegance anywhere else like this ! it was a peaceful and civilized place to relax - fabulous pool, unprecedented service and professional & friendly staff who always wanted to make everything perfect for us. The Verandah restaurant also has fabulous food and service, room service was prompt and delicious, and the Spa has excellent technicicans. Another advantage is the large and competent concierge staff...a shout out to Kimberly who made our stay very special. My only "grip" is that wireless internet was not included...everyone uses wireless these days...it should be included ....

Reviews.Title: “Great location for having a car in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: scottoishi
Reviews.Content: Overall great place as are all four seasons hotels. Rooms are immaculate, food is excellent. It is a great location if you are not heavy into gambling. Also, if you have a car valet is much easier than casino hotels. Only drawback for me was that service was a little less than I expected at valet and housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Wade29
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews and decided to stay here with my wife and two young daughters. I found out that they only follow through with what they say on their website when you remind them and ask for things. i have stayed at many of the Ritz Carlton chains around the world and thought that Four Seasons was on par with that level of class, service, and follow through. I found out that I was extremely wrong. Since this was my first stay at a Four Seasons, I doubt that I would stay with their chain again unless I was given a deal I could not refuse. I for sure would not go back to this resort considering that you can get far better deals for the $, and get nicer rooms, better service, and a staff that offers what they advertise. I have way too many things to mention that went wrong, but to name a few: 1. Shower leak that I cleaned up after each shower so no one would slip and fall. 2. Lack of communication from staff, and was actually lied to about a couple of things throughout stay. Listen, I have no problem when things go wrong on your end, just admit it and all is good. When you lie to cover up your mistakes, that is a problem. I just realized I am spending way too much time at a place that people should reconsider going to. I will say that Housekeeping was great. My room was clean and that is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: VTexas
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Four Seasons for these reasons; A. The elevator having a “C” button for the Casino, you get off the elevator, turn left and you’re in the casino, no waiting for the elevator and no crowds. B. The hotel is quiet and serene; I was there over the weekend and hardly saw anyone. C. Room service food was excellent, they tell you exactly what minute your food will be delivered, and they were never late. D. The staff was outstanding, great interaction with Room Service and the Concierge. E. The floor to ceiling windows MADE the room. F. The bath products, the bath products, the bath products. I usually stay at the Bellagio or MGM because of Comps, but I will pay again for my room because I enjoyed staying here so much, it felt like Vegas years ago. The AC worked great, I didn’t hear the helicopters, and I was on the strip side. The things I mention next would not detour me from staying here again, there was a gap under the hotel door that shines light from the hallway at night, nothing a towel didn’t take care of. There was a blue light shinning from the back of the dresser that lit up the room at night, another towel took care of that problem too. Maid service took one of my un-opened bottles of tequila during a cleaning. Maid service took all my ashtrays during a cleaning, yes there are smoking rooms. I didn’t get a birthday cake, even though it was stated on the reservation, and no staff called us by name in the hallways, LOL. If you have any questions, drop me an email.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: craigo11
Reviews.Content: Staff were very friendly and attentive. Great being able to step away from the hustle and bustle of the Mandalay Bay into a quiet and smoke free environment. Travelled with a 3 year old so loved the Four Seasons pool and loved the ability to use the beach resort at Mandalay Bay, especially the children's area of the wave pool and the lazy river. Would highly recommend for families.

Reviews.Title: “Not as perfect as other Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: ptbrk
Reviews.Content: My company has negotiated a special rate with this property and I usually find myself staying here. This is the third time I've stayed here in the last 2 months and I have to point out that my experience has not been quite as good as in other Four Seasons properties. It seems as if someone is not paying attention to what works and doesn't work inside the room. Anywhere from a broken coffeemaker, doors that don't close shut, broken ipod chargers, snowy TV picture, missing clothes hangers, etc. I know the staff has tried hard but I'm just a little tired of complaining. This hotel is good for the business traveler because you avoid the casino scene, but if you end up near the elevator, you'll end up with the conventioneer partying and screaming all the way to their room.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Service in a Relaxed Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Shotlady
Reviews.Content: Return guest, again on my birthday. Arrived early (10:30am) and room was not quite ready but not a problem as the receptionist offered use of the spa and its facilities to change into our pool attire. The spa attendants checked our luggage for us. They paged us about 45 minutes later to tell us the room was ready. And ready it was, with our luggage delivered and placed on the luggage racks and lovely chocolate cake in honor of my birthday! The room was wonderful,clean and fully stocked with the usual 4S amenities. But I think the room furnishings are due for an update. Great service poolside, as always. Tried the Verandah for breakfast and loved it! Only stayed one night but made the most of our relaxing pool time. Again the hotel offered us the use of the spa to shower and change even though we had already been checked out for many hours. They do go above and beyond any other property in Vegas, IMO.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the extra money...”
Reviews.Author: ivanrmcc
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Four Seasons as a special treat and because so many reviews had recommended it as a greatd hotel when travelling with Kids. They were not wrong. Lots of little extras that made the kids feel special and the service was great. The Four Seasons' rooms are actually the top few floors of the Mandalay Bay hotel but it has a separate lobby and restuarants. The benefit is that the smell of cigarette smoke that pervades all of the other hotels (& casinos) in Vegas is not present here, (but it hits you as soon as you enter the Mandalay Bay through the connecting door. On the plus side as a Four Seasons Guest you will have access to the Mandalay Bay pool complex which is excellent and really all the kids wanted anyway. One word of caution the hotel advertises its superior room as suitable for 2 adults and a child. It isn't !! unless the child is a baby. We ended up getting a second (adjoining) room and paying extra for that. It is also not the best location for access to the strip. Overall it is expensive but if you want to spoil yourself it is a great location (oh! and great for kids)

Reviews.Title: “Fab!Fab!Fab!”
Reviews.Author: babbilu
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel! Their private pool and pool service are fabulous. The option to splash at the Mandalay Bay lagoon is a definite perk. Check in was lightening-fast. When we opened the door to our room, we were in for a very pleasant surprise - they upgraded us to a Suite gratis! The service had great touches - plates of chocolate puzzles for the kids, with their names spelled out in chocolate; children's-size bath robes and toiletries; twice-daily cleaning service; BVLGARY bath products. What we valued the most was the fact that the hotel did not have the casino, however, you could use the "Ali-Baba's secret door" on Mandalay Bay's casino floor to access Four Seasons' elevators directly. If you are traveling with kids in Vegas, this is THE place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hated to Leave”
Reviews.Author: breezy41
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights - the staff here is superb - very professional, courteous, helpful, and prompt. The rooms are picked up twice a day, rooms are spacious, and the quiet, calm atmosphere is a perfect retreat from the hustle and bustle that is Vegas. The pool experience is wonderful. They bring you to your lounges, cover them w/towels for you, bring you pitchers of ice water, spritz your face with Evian mist, and bring your food on little tray tables - what more could you ask?! Everything about the hotel is first rate. Will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Peace and quiet in the midst of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: travelkm
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a conference. We took our two young children. It was really nice not having to walk through the noisy and smoky casinos. The service was wonderful as always at any Four seasons. We would definitely return again!

Reviews.Title: “Best of All Worlds!”
Reviews.Author: Noelclaire
Reviews.Content: Get all the luxury and beauty of the Four Seasons without the casino tackiness AND have access to the restaurants, gambling, and wonderful swimming options (wave pool, lazy river, etc.) of the Mandalay Bay. The room was delightful and the service outstanding. We will never stay anywhere else in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “My number one preference hotel to stay in Las Vegas for the past 15 years.”
Reviews.Author: DesertCowgirl
Reviews.Content: The Four Season Las Vegas is in a class of it's own. Although, I enjoy being in Las Vegas and love the excitement to it's time to dine and retreat for the night, I count the opulence, class, and the superb service that the hotel provides and it my number one choice for the past 15 years. I have tried many others, however, I still come back to the Four Seasons, no comparison!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Idratherbesouth
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived to the time we left we enjoyed a first class experience at Four Seasons Las Vegas. Our two night stay was a relaxing way to end or six night trip to Arizona and Nevada. Anything we needed was provided. All the service personnel were extremely cordial and helpful. After walking through the pool area of Mandalay Bay we were relieved to be able to relax once again pool side at the Four Seasons. The Saturday morning doorman ("Captain Kirk") introduced us to a cab driver (Tommy) that was extremely knowledgeable about the city and recommended places to visit as he drove us to the end of The Strip so we could walk back and see the sights. I would recommend The Four Seasons to anyone who wishes to treat themselves during a stay in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Your private island…”
Reviews.Author: RomanceWriter
Reviews.Content: This hotel is your private island in a sea of lodging choices. Located high atop the Mandalay Bay, Four Seasons offers you a private sanctuary away from the casinos, away from the smoke and away from the noise found in all casino properties. While this hotel occupies the top five floors of the Mandalay Bay property, its services and staff are uniquely Four Seasons. There is a large Four Seasons sign on Las Vegas Blvd that marks the private entrance to the property. Valet parking is available for $22 per day or you can opt to park in the large parking lot, free of charge. Be prepared for a short, five-minute walk from the parking lot to the hotel entrance. Not a big deal, unless you loathe walking in desert heat. Your bellhop will escort you to the front desk and introduce you to your reservation agent. These folks are professional, yet friendly and make the check-in process hassle-free. Upon receiving your keys, you’ll make a lovely walk down the corridor to the private elevators that will whisk you up to your oasis (floors 35-39). Rooms: furnished with all the amenities you’d expect. The Strip-View suite is beautiful and worth the upgrade. Imagine looking down the strip at night, sipping your favorite drink with someone special next to you. If you treasure a quiet nights sleep, you’re in the right place. Elevators: private use for card-carrying guests of the Four Seasons. There’s a button marked “C” – that takes you to the floor with the Mandalay Bay casino, shops and restaurants. These private elevators are located in a secure, card-controlled lobby that limits access to Four Seasons guests only. Food: plenty of choices await your palate on this property. You need only decide what you’re in the mood to eat, which is easier said than done when you have access to Mandalay Bays 22 restaurants in addition to the Four Seasons two restaurants, Charlie Palmers Steakhouse and the Verandah. Breakfast averaged $50 for two, incl. tip. Eggs Benedict $18, two eggs with ham $17, coffee $5.50 – seated at the Verandah. Lunch was slightly more and dinner was $100 (for two, with one or two drinks). We had one dinner at Wolfgang Pucks’ LUPO which was much less, because they allow you to split the order. Given their generous portions, requesting half-orders makes sense for those watching their waistline. For those late night Big Mac attacks, there’s a McDonalds across the street. Pool: gated, private access to another quiet oasis, tucked far away from the wave-surfing throngs at the Mandalay Bay pools. The cinnamon infused, frozen watermelon balls were awesome. Hint: arrive at the pool before 10:30am for the best lounge locations. Shopping: plenty of small shops located in the covered corridors connecting Mandalay Bay to the Luxor and the Excalibur. You never have to walk in the desert heat, unless you want to experience the Strip up close and personal. And your M Life players card works in those casinos as well. Every moment spent at this hotel was memorable, in large part because the staff goes that extra mile to ensure your stay with them is a memorable one. The Four Seasons Las Vegas earned my future business. Can’t wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience all-round”
Reviews.Author: Areallyniceguy
Reviews.Content: We where made to feel like rock stars! My two teens and I where on the last days of our summer road trip, and decided to detour to Las Vegas. American Express recommended this property...and what a way to conclude our vacation! As we pulled up it was immediately apparent that the staff goal was to provide a five star experience, and not a hotel stay. Every staff member was accommodating, knowledgable, and generous. This was not my first Four Seasons, but the experience was unique. Our room was upgraded (due to availability), spacious and spotless, with a great view of the desert. This property is terrific for kids, as it features a wave pool, lazy river, private pool separate from Mandaly Bay, and a terrific aquarium. The restaurants are 5 star...but the breakfasts are unique. I haver never tasted anything like the pancakes (get cardiologist consent!). The price was reasonable and an excellent value. My only complaint was the location at the end of the strip...but the house car was always available at no charge. I almost forgot the spa! I can describe it in two words...life changing. I wish I could remember my masseuse's name...she's been e 14 years...wish I could bring her home. Upon checking out the valet had ice water in our car's cup holders. I love the little things!

Reviews.Title: “an island of serenity”
Reviews.Author: hampsteadbloke
Reviews.Content: The only hotel we'd use in Las Vegas - classy and elegant, but above all an island of serenity in a sea of craziness. There are many other cheaper options in LV, but if you want a superb hotel experience, nowhere else compares. Note a daily internet charge of $15 p.d. is charged in addition to the room rate, and that the breakfast included rate covers charges up to $72 per couple per day. This is entirely adequate, but the quality of the food is so good, it can be tempting to exceed the allowance! Pool service is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Serenity Now In Vegas”
Reviews.Author: TheOp001
Reviews.Content: If you are bringing your family to Vegas (had to for a Grand Canyon trip) and wish to avoid the drunks, noisy crowds, and casinos, Four Seasons is the hotel for you. Peaceful entrance, courteous staff, great restaurants. The hotel even gave my son a welcoming cookie basket. Great room views of The Strip - always looks better the further away you are.

Reviews.Title: “Not as expected”
Reviews.Author: ls1975
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at other Four Seasons and I would say the Four Seasons at Las Vegas does not do justice for its price. There are few things that would prevent me from staying there again: 1. It is quite a long walk from the main lobby to the elevator, probably about 1/6 miles. This hotel actually shares the same building with Mandalay Bay. If you only plan to stay at the hotel, then probably you won't mind about the distance. However, as a tourist, after the whole day of sightseeing and walking, it will be really exhausting to walk another 1/6 miles just to reach to your room. 2. We were given mini water bottle for 2. And if you are asking for 2 more, they will charge extra. When you asked for room service, it might take longer than the normal time, it is probably due to that long distance walk from the lobby. 3. The room itself is not that impressive. It looks normal and it is not worth for the price that I was paying for. 4. Location is not that great. For all these reasons above, as much as I love staying at Four Seasons, I would NOT stay at the Las Vegas location again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious oasis - very pet friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Prefer5Stars
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights for a quick getaway. We even brought along our little dog. As with all Four Seasons, the service was top-notch and impeccable. From greeting us upon arrival to departing at check-out, we were provided with excellent service and enjoyed ourselves in luxury. At first we were a bit nervous about walking the dog around the hotel since everything is so high quality, but this hotel is very welcoming and accommodating to people AND animals! It was nice to be away from the typical Vegas crowd, but at the same time it was easy to access the entire casino and grounds of Mandalay Bay. Some reviewers have mentioned the "poor" location at the end of the Strip. While yes, this location is far from the center attraction of the Strip, we found that is was easier to access the airport, freeway, and we were glad to not have to drive through the Strip. The one drawback is the cell service (using AT&T iPhone) as it was extremely slow, but it was this way throughout the entire Mandalay property. So, it was not easy to use the Mandalay app. The hotel does offer internet access for $14.99/day, but we opted not to purchase. (To be honest, the hotel should be offering free Wi-Fi for the room rate they charge, but this is a typical Four Seasons charge). Food was excellent here, too. So scrumptious with excellent menu. Quick-tip: Happy Hour everyday from 4pm to 7pm - it does not disappoint! We will definitely be back to visit FSLV!

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: SvenOlaf
Reviews.Content: A real oasis in Las Vegas. Quiet, relaxed, clean, airy, modern... Great private pool with good service and lovely and good value restaurant and bar looking onto the pool. Great touch for the kids - arrived to 2 plates of chocolates with M&M's spelling out their names - and lettered sponges on the bath edge spelling their names. Everything was good - including quick valet parking, something we didn't get at the Trump... Would highly recommend if you fancy some quiet luxury in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel on the strip. The rooms are luxurious and the service and attention to detail second to none.”
Reviews.Author: MAH42
Reviews.Content: From the moment you walk into the Four Seasons you realize this is different from most of the other hotels. While it is physically part of the Mandalay Bay resort (occupying the 35th through 39th floors) the Four Seaosns has it's own lobby that is away from the hustle and bustle of the casino floor. It is a quiet port in the never-ending activity that is Las Vegas. The attention to detail is fantastic from the people at the door welcoming you back to the restaurant where all of the staff address you by name. All in all a very delightful experience in what is now my favourite place to stay on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: susan_warshaw
Reviews.Content: We loved it and we'll be back! The Four Seasons Hotel is beautiful, clean and a wonderful place to stay. It was quiet and the pool area is beautiful and relaxing. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to feel that they are treated very well.

Reviews.Title: “A breath of fresh air”
Reviews.Author: maculafailte
Reviews.Content: The non gaming aspect of this hotel was not a great attraction for us initially but after the non stop strip activity the peace and calmness of the hotel was just what was needed. Every aspect of the hotel was good and the pool area was terrific. it is just a shame that we did not spend longer there. Although it is at the very southern edge of the strip we found it an excellent base with easy communications to MGM etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great refuge from "Vegas"”
Reviews.Author: TableOf5
Reviews.Content: We wanted to sneak a few days to Vegas on a family trip w/o bringing our young ones around what Las Vegas has to "offer". FSLV was perfect! We got to enjoy our favorite hotel plus use the amenities Mandalay Bay has to offer. We stayed in a one bedroom suite {#39100} and it was perfect for our family of 5. Living room was huge and had two pull out sofas, there are 2 large walk in closets plus a nice sized study and dining room, plus a powder bath and kitchen. This felt slightly more like a business hotel than a normal FS, not as one-of-a-kind attention to detail or personality in the rooms or decor - also not quite as kid-friendly {no kids club} although the kids' treat was a hit! The staff was better than other hotels, but not quite as intuitive or thoughtful as the FS Wailea. Only negative is how far down the strip it is and the CRAZY lack of cars they offer in a place like Vegas - ONE car for guests. Even in Maui there was a fleet of SUV's ready to take and pick us up from a shopping center that's merely a block or 2 away. This really needs to be remedied in my opinion. The valet staff was great as was concierge, housekeeping and front desk. We'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Internet Problems”
Reviews.Author: TravelBoulder
Reviews.Content: Went to Vegas on Business, hotel is great except one thing, the internet was terrible. Room was clean nice amenities. Great strip view. Breakfast was nice I wouldn't stay here again until internet situation is sorted out or if internet is not important to you.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bilkysue84
Reviews.Content: Want to feel like a superstar.. This is the place to stay!! The staff are so friendly in every part of this hotel.. Four Seasons must be a nice place to work for, because you can feel it in all the staff.. Its such a nice retreat from the las vegas scene.. Behind the Scene (the Store), there is a door at the Mandalay Bay Resort and Casino, that only four seasons guests can use with their room key. This brings you to the private elevators that wisk you away to your retreat from the las vegas madness!! Love the hotel. Thank you for helping to make our vacation wonderful

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous experience. A real oasis in an otherwise busy and crazy city. The staff is friendly, yet very professional.”
Reviews.Author: cabin54
Reviews.Content: Fabulous experience. A real oasis in an otherwise busy and crazy city. The staff is always attentive, friendly and very professional. The hotel is immaculate. We love the fact that it is truly a non smoking property without gaming. Access to all of the Mandalay Bay ammenities is also a big plus. Way to go Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Unparalleled in personal service. Warm welcome in a town where personal touches are extremely appreciated. Quiet oasis.”
Reviews.Author: DrDaveMaui
Reviews.Content: Relaxing peace and quiet, yet footsteps' convenience to excitement when desired. Great service in room, at pool, restaurant and spa. Warmth and professionalism at front desk. Breakfast and dinner at The Verandah excellent.

Reviews.Title: “The best service”
Reviews.Author: mflickermd
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here many times and it has always been good. Is it like the 4 seasons in Chiang Mai?No-but for Vegas, it is very ,very good. It is a bit dated, but everything functioned well, it was spotlessly clean ,and the service, as always, was exemplary. I would highly recommend their breakfast-great quality and lovely setting at the Veranda restaurant.We will be here again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury”
Reviews.Author: highlatte
Reviews.Content: We were having dinner at Charlie Palmers, decided to stay the nite. Being locals we got a great rate. The room was spacious, contemporary and classy, as is the entire hotel. Bed was sooo comfy. Beautiful pool and connected to Mandalay Bay for gamblers. The staff was very pleasant from valet service to morning check-out at the desk..

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better!”
Reviews.Author: Satisfiedplusone
Reviews.Content: The Four Season's Las Vegas lived up to its number one standing. The hotel is beautiful, the service impeccable and the beds are some of the best I have ever slept on. If you want to be close to the action of Vegas but get away to your own sanctuary, then the Four Seasons is the hotel of choice. We look forward to staying there again, and again when we return to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to par with the other Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: TravelLover1125
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the 4th of july holiday and my review of this hotel is very mixed. We have stayed at other 4S as we love the level of service, relaxation, and cleanliness of these resorts. so here is my review, and mind you, I am comparing this one to the others!!! First off, it is not a stand alone property as it occupies the top 5 floors of the Mandalay Bay hotel, so that was a little odd to me. When we booked this hotel, I requested a Fridge as my daughter has special dietary needs, a microwave, which they suggested, and told them we were celebrating her belated Birthday and our anniversary. When we checked in, there was no Refrigerator, the T.V. did not work, the microwave did not work, there were no robes for the children, no welcome treat for the children and the kid's Room service menu was missing. I called the appropriate dept.'s to start having these items fixed and it took forever to get the Fridge, to get the kid's menu, to get the robes etc. This was really disappointing to us, as these items should have all been checked to make sure they were in working order and there before we arrived. Aside from the bad start, the staff was all wonderful and very friendly, the pool service was great, concierge great, as well as valet. House car was never available at the time we requested but we did not expect it to be. We loved how quiet the hotel was and joked about going through the magic door from the Mandalay Bay back to the 4S, how it was like steeping into another world. We are non smokers and did not go on the trip to gamble but rather spend it with out children, so it was perfect for us!!! So, to sum it up, we are glad we stayed here and checked it out, but would probably not stay here again when we return to Vegas. The Wynn Hotel looked too tempting to us!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for families with teens”
Reviews.Author: marlaur
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel and Staff. The best place we have ever stayed in Las Vegas. Other 5 star Las Vegas properties I have stayed at do not compare to the intimacy and service quality found at the Four Seasons. My 2 teenage girls never want to leave, the pampering and attentiveness is refreshing in a fast paced city like Las Vegas. Rooms are beautiful and well appointed. A big thank you to all of the staff, but especially Lindsey (Asst. Mgr.) for all of your help in making this a memorable trip for my family,

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience at the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: pjs52
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this hotel. The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. We felt pampered. The room was fabulous, and we had access to everything we needed and wanted to do. The pool was just awesome, as was the staff there and the service. It was a pet friendly hotel, which was what we needed. I would go back to this place in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Nice reprieve, quiet getaway”
Reviews.Author: HonorableTraveler
Reviews.Content: Service is what you’d expect from the Four Seasons. Every employee greets you with a smile and a polite salutation, and many call you by name. It seems like the stealthful housekeeping staff slips into your room and tidies up every time you step out. We didn’t mind. They are very efficient and respectful. This hotel is one of the few on the Strip that does not have a casino. It is separated from the Mandalay Bay by walls and doors so that, once you get behind them, you’ve escaped the loud crowded Vegas scene. Vegas can be warm and dry, so every time you turnaround, someone is handing you two bottles of cold water. This is a nice touch. The pool area is very nice and quiet. The overall décor is a little understated for Vegas – maybe even a little dated – but this may be intentional to create a warmer, homier feeling to the place.

Reviews.Title: “Escape the crowds, while enoying the crowd!”
Reviews.Author: Schade64
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, I was greeted by the excellent staff. Though the room was not ready, we quickly headed off to lunch. Before we finished, our room was ready, bags in the room and us happy by the pool drinking Mojita.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful room, fantastic view, great night away from home.”
Reviews.Author: GAJoe
Reviews.Content: Just far enough away from the Strip to avoid traffic, yet it has everything you would want for a great little getaway for locals.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons Las Vegas the way to go. Luxury hotel with complete access to casino and the strip.”
Reviews.Author: amyhunter
Reviews.Content: Nice to stay in hotel with private entrance and yet still in hotel with great casino.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler2009Ny
Reviews.Content: If you want a quiet and relaxing hotel with no crowds and very customer service oriented staff, this is the place. The pool was never full, the staff were really friendly and attentive, and it was a very restful stay with no stress at all. Loved it here.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: shelligrrl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Four Seasons while in Las Vegas for my cousin's wedding in March. I was amazed to find such a bargain in a Four Seasons hotel! I was originally planning to stay at another well-known high end Las Vegas hotel, but was disappointed when I read reviews about the smoke and the noise at that establishment. I must say that The Four Seasons is an oasis of calm in the excitement of Las Vegas! I should state that the Four Seasons Las Vegas is a non-gaming hotel, but those who wish to gamble can walk through the sliding doors to Madalay Bay. The breakfast and lunch at The Verandah are superb. My family was staying at other hotels, but gravitated to join me for breakfast and lunch at The Verandah because the food, service, and atmosphere are delightful. The friendly conceirge staff at The Four Seasons was also remarkable for making tour reservations, obtaining last minute show tickets, and even arranging hair-styling services. My room was comfortable, well appointed, and comfortable. The pool area was serene and delightful. The poolside service was attentive and friendly. For those who enjoy a "party atmosphere," guests from The Four Seasons also have privileges at the pools at Mandalay Bay. Oh, I would be remiss not mentioning the spa. I used the immaculate locker room when I visited the pool and I wished I'd had time to indulge in the spa services. The only drawback to the The Four Seasons is that it is located at one end of "The Strip," so it is advantageous to take a taxi (or limo!) if you are going to a show or dinner at the Wynn or other hotels located past Ceasars. I had no trouble walking to Ceasars to shop. This hotel is a huge, huge, bargain for a Four Seasons hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: SusanFortCollins
Reviews.Content: This is the first time we've stayed at a non-gaming hotel, and I was a bit doubtful. The rooms were nice, but what impressed most was the staff. Anything we needed, they were there to help. I utiilized the spa and was able to make a same day appointment to have neck pain massaged away. Most memorable were the breakfasts on the patio at the Verandah restaurant.surrounded by palm trees and other greenery. It was so lovely to be outdoors at the start of our day. My husband loved the complimentary steam room with all ammenties included for showering such as razors, shampoo, combs, etc. There is a complimentary staff car that's available on first come, first serve basis. As far as the gambling there's a stop on the elevator that goes right into the Mandalay Bay casino. As it turned out, it was quite nice to have the quiet, restfulness of the non-gaming atmosphere. I know there are other, newer non-gaming hotels, but we were treated so well at the Four Seasons, it will be our first choice when we go back in October.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons is always the best!”
Reviews.Author: AlumofCU
Reviews.Content: The spa and gym are awesome. With the gym and locker room facilities included in your stay at no charge, at a minimum, check them out. Go to the pool area also for frozen melon balls, Evian Spritzers in the afternoon, and popsicles for the all. Gratis. The Sunday Brunch at Verandah is very good though a tad expensive. Explore where the doors lead you!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: theanglfac
Reviews.Content: We got married here and had such a great experience. The wedding team was fantastic,but everyone in the hotel knew we were the couple that was getting married. They were super accomodating. The room was gorgeous and very spacious for the bridal party to get ready. The breakfast and room service was great! All our guests that stayed at the hotel had a great experience too. They made sure my parents could get an early check in so that it would not interfere with wedding day photos etc.

Reviews.Title: “Calm, quiet oasis”
Reviews.Author: jennevans
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights and loved it! We would walk through the loud, crowded casinos and lobbies of other hotels, then return to the calm and quiet of the Four Seasons. We lounged by the pool under the misters and had a continuous supply of iced water and frozen grapes. Our kids could go play in the Mandalay Bay wave pool and river, but return to our comfortable lounge chairs at the private Four Seasons pool. It was a perfect stay!

Reviews.Title: “The entire team at Four Seasons Las Vegas are gracious and attentive hosts.”
Reviews.Author: dcadana
Reviews.Content: The hotel is filled with a team of hosts that are expected to give the most attentive and gracious service. They do so effortlessly and naturally.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and great staff, but that is what your paying for.”
Reviews.Author: baileaf
Reviews.Content: The hotel grounds and inside are meticulously maintained. The staff is knowledgeable and attentive. The food is above average. The prices for most things are way above average including the room price. You get what you pay for in most of Las Vegas, if you are willing to shell out top dollar then you should expect top dollar service and that is what you will get at the 4 Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed our second stay at the Four Seasons Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: LeisureTravelers_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons Las Vegas for the second time in June 2011. It was again a lovely experience. You really have the best of both worlds, in that you can enjoy the tranquility, luxury and professionalism that the Four Seasons offers, and at the same time go to enjoy everything else in Las Vegas whenever you want to do so. The concierge desk, pool / spa, restaurants, atmosphere, cleanliness and just about everything else would make it likely for us to return or recommend this hotel to friends and family. We also wanted to mention that we think of the door to the Mandalay Bay as a "secret portal", in that you would not know it's there unless you really look for it and it really is like going from one world to another. We prefer the Four Seasons world and it's worth paying for!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Luvmyfam4
Reviews.Content: Customer service is alive and well at the Four Seasons Hotel Las Vegas! Just don't eat dinner at the Veranda. The food is great for breakfast, brunch, and lunch, but we had horrible service for dinner. Otherwise, this hotel is excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Orange74
Reviews.Content: We spent two days at the Four Seasons. We were worried about traveling with our young sons to Vegas, but this hotel was the perfect choice to ease our concerns. It was clear from the minute we checked in that the hotel and the amazing staff was very welcoming to families. We upgraded to a suite so we could spread out. This was a convenient choice for us and made the stay much more enjoyable. The hotel staff made arrangements for family friendly dining, provided DVDs for the kids to watch on the in-room DVD player, and coordinated in-room childcare so my wife and I could enjoy a night out. The pool area was relaxing and quiet (I hear this is hard to find in Vegas). While my kids enjoyed Mandalay Bay's pool facilities, they repeatedly requested more time at the Four Seasons pool. The staff was attentive and remembered our preferences. Now my kids will expect frozen Snicker Bars at every pool we visit. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “A world apart”
Reviews.Author: Pb650
Reviews.Content: Attention to detail, a sincere welcome from every employee, and a keen understanding that hospitality is more art than science. Truly, I am most appreciative of the service rendered by the staff at FS Las Vegas during our two night stay in June 2011. The second the valet opens the door of your car, you know you will have nothing to worry about, and that your presence is appreciated and even honored. No, I don't work for them... it's just that they have the "hotel art" pegged. We had our 7 & 5 year olds with us, and arranged a two double-bed room. Plenty of space for us, and a welcome treat was waiting for our children, along with children's soap & shampoo & conditioner, bathrobes, etc. We had floor to ceiling views to the west, with a partial view of Luxor which was fun at night. The pool is an oasis, and has sun or shade for everyone. The pool staff makes continuous rounds, and service starts with breakfast. We ate most of our meals at the hotel, and really enjoyed all the food options. Verandah restaurant serves a filet mignon as good as any steakhouse's. Superb. The gym is very large for a hotel this size, and has all the equipment or free weights one might need. The spa facility was lovely, though we did not use any spa services. After we left we discovered we left our children's swim clothes at the pool. Hotel security located the gear for us and had it laundered and waiting for us when we returned. Just amazing. Thank you FS Las Vegas for a lovely respite.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas, Four Seasons style-a tranquil oasis”
Reviews.Author: MountainOceanGirl
Reviews.Content: In the middle of the hustle and bustle of Las Vegas is the tranquil and beautiful Four Seasons Las Vegas. The hotel has a gorgeous private entrance at the back of the Mandalay Bay Hotel and it definitely feels more like a Four Seasons than a Vegas hotel. We were very happy as we were traveling with small children, to be away from the casinos and no smells of stale smoke etc. that accompanies. Instead, we had a very clean and spacious room with a partial view of the strip from which to all admire the twinkling lights from afar. The children's amenities were delightful and appreciated. The pool was warm and fun with great pool- side service for yummy meals, drinks and nice chats with friendly servers. We are so glad we chose FS Las Vegas. It is a peaceful comfortable space from which to admire the non-stop action of Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place to combine Peace and Quiet with the Craziness of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: mulchmaster
Reviews.Content: Look, anyone going to the Four Seasons Hotel with the "Hard Rock" party till you drop attitude will be dissappointed. HOWEVER, if you are interested in going to a place with wonderful service, positive attitude and lush surroundings this is the place for you. In addition, it is very easy to get your fix of action, entertainment, gambling and clubbing by pressing the "C" button on the elevator. You are immediately transported to the Mandalay Bay complex and all of its amenities. As for the Four Seasons, its pool is small but tranquil and filled with great servers who get you drinks, food and even spritz you with Evian water in the hot sun. No Jersey Shore types in sight, fist pumping with 64 oz drinks, just great people having fun in th sun. The rooms are very well apppointed with wonderful beds and every housekeeper, doorman or front desk agent I met has a smile and a hello for me every time we passed in a hallway. Yes, the food and beverage in the restaurants Verandah &Charlie Palmer are pricey-but they are of high quality. Actually the Verandah has a happy hour every day with great drinks and appetizers for around $5, a nice treat. The Spa and the mens locker room is also high quality and I took advantage of the steam room and great showers and amenities several times during my stay. All in all the Four Seasons in my mind offers the best of both worlds, particularly for those who might be looking for an alternative side of Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in fabulous las Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: Crazywalrus
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel from reading reviews on trip advisor. Absolutely top notch. We were upgraded to a suite with 180 degree view all around the strip. The staff were very friendy & helpful. Fantastic bedroom with extra comfy queen size bed. Even had a separate dressing room, big bathroom & kitchen area. The pool area was adult only with a heated pool & helpful staff looking after you with jugs of iced water.. Was at the end of the strip, but walkable to most places. Buses right outside if you need them. Would stop here again if we went back to Vegas. Booked with American travel shop in Leeds & must say they really came up trumps with this trip. Went on to grand canyon, Sedona & Scottsdale after Vegas & it was an unforgettable holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great but no "RockStar" Magic”
Reviews.Author: SpiderBoy
Reviews.Content: The room rate dragged me to the Four Seasons and the "brand". It's a nice hotel with large rooms, luxury bits and good service. But it's the wrong end of the Strip. If you want to escape the maddening crowds and hustle & bustle of Vegas then this hotel is what you want. But wannabe Rock Stars should target the Wynn/CityCenter part of the Strip. Like all Vegas hotels it was an enormous property made larger by the addition of Mandalay Bay. Positives: Large room, upmarket decor, good service. Negatives: Not the main part of the strip; a less glamourous four seasons (still a great hotel); easy to get lost in.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Wacky_Jacky_11
Reviews.Content: We booked the Four Seasons for my daughters 21st birthday. We had an amazing time! This is the second trip I've planned using the reviews on Trip Advisor. I was not disappointed. The hotel was absolutely wonderful. We arrived in the morning and the early check-in was no problem. The rooms are beautiful and spotless! The beds super comfy. The turn down service exceptional. Every staff member we passed smiled and said hello. The girls loved the pool and room service most of all. The only negative, I can think of, is that it is located toward the end of the strip. If you don't like walking be prepared to shell out some money for cab fares especially on the weekends. The traffic is always congested and it takes twice as long to get anywhere. However, Mandalay Bay is next door and there is a private entrance from the Four Seasons. I just can't say enough nice things about this hotel. My daughter and her friend had an absolutely smashing time. They loved everything about the Four Seasons! If you prefer a quiet, non-gaming hotel with fantastic service this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite place to stay in Vegas. . . clean, smoke-free and luxurious.”
Reviews.Author: sfebtraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a girls weekend with my best friend, I'm newly pregnant so wanted a relaxing resort-style weekend by the pool with no smoke, partiers and casinos. It was the perfect fit, PLUS, we went to see a show (Lion King) at the Mandalay Bay theatre and never had to leave the compound. We had great food at the Four Seasons pool and Verandah restaurant and the other restaurants in the Mandalay Bay. Service was flawless, they anticipated our every need. Poolside pitchers of ice water, complimentary sunglass cleaning, frozen snickers, frozen watermelon at the pool was a great extra touch. Just an all around great experience. The only thing that could have made it better was free wifi, $15 per day is annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: grandmom32
Reviews.Content: Our room was huge! It was spotless and beautiful. The pool area was amazing - complimentary snacks (frozen pineapple was a favorite), Evian spritz and cold towels to keep one cool, beautiful landscaping and a variety of places to sit - lounges/towels that didn't blow away b/c they slipped over the top of the chair or a table/ chairs - we played cards there. The location @ the end of the strip was perfect - not noisy. The separate entrance to Four Seasons (top floors of Mandalay Bay) was much appreciated b/c it was blissfully quiet. However, the inside entrance from Four Seasons to Mandalay Bay allowed casino/additional restaurant access. Complimentary bottles of water each day and complimentary daily shoeshine were much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: Finediner17
Reviews.Content: Great food, service, spa. Very attentive staff. Only one drawback--is directly across from airport. You can hear airplanes, sirens, etc. Other than this, it is a tranquil place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: YYZ_TOGO
Reviews.Content: We returned to the Four Seasons for our fifth visit. We are in Las Vegas each year for a conference that my husband attends which is usually hosted by the Mandalay Bay on the same property. This year, the conference was at The Venetian, but we chose to once again stay at the Four Seasons. I can't imagine staying anywhere else! Verandah Restaurant is an oasis. The food is fabulous and the service impeccable. Hotel staff address you by name where ever you go which is a very nice, personal touch. Our suite was spacious and clean. At check-in, you can request what time of day you would like your room cleaned. Very nice touch. I spent most days at the pool which is usually quiet and serene. My only complaint is that the lounge chairs, although plentiful, are so very close together, literally touching each other. I seem to remember having some room between chairs in past years, allowing at least a little privacy and space. However, the pool was rarely filled to capacity, which makes me wonder if they could perhaps space out the chairs and add more if required. Since I was on my own, it was a little intrusive to be right beside a party of six people. In any case, this is a very small complaint for such a fabulous property. The General Manager, as well as his Executive Assistant, are incredibly accommodating and helpful. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this property and can't wait to return next June.

Reviews.Title: “Rare sliver of tranquility in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: writingiseasy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is generally up to Four Seasons standards but doesn't feel as nuturing as other properties since the guest rooms, the top floors of the Mandalay Bay, are disjointed from the lobby and front entrance. Our room faced the Strip - one of the best views of any hotel room in which we've stayed around the world. I was a little disappointed that the bed was lumpy and that the hotel had limited spa services (the staff directed me to the Spa at Mandalay Bay for other options), particularly in a city known for extravagence. Nevertheless, when the weather permitted, we sat by the gorgeous pool and were treated like royalty by the sophisticated staff. The price of food at the restaurants and poolside were, of course, extraordinary. We crossed the street for breakfast at McDonald's after we got our first breakfast bill for $50+, which included coffee for 2, oatmeal with berries and a couple of tiny danish. There's no excuse for that. Regardless, the Four Seasons provided peace and tranquility against the chaotic Vegas landscape, which was something we appreciated every time we walked in.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and comfortable oasis in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: thearndt
Reviews.Content: We chose the FS as the location for our wedding, and everything was really nice. All staff we met were nice and helpful, not arrogant as one might expect in this kind of place. There is a nice wave pool, our suite was really cool, the concierges (they have three) were very helpful, great room service, beautiful interior and hotel surroundings. The only thing we got annoyed about is the lack of free internet in the rooms (given the already high room rates - although they do have one internet terminal at the reception), and there is no self parking, only valet parking for which we had to wait a few minutes. Otherwise, a great hotel and excellent wedding location, if you want to have an in-suite wedding. We had a premier strip view suite which provided a good view of the beginning of the Strip, although also the airport and the surroundings. Means, if you want a hotel at the heart of the strip, this is not it, but that wasn't important for us. We still took a walk from the Wynn back to the Four Seasons which was very nice, on a Sunday night.

Reviews.Title: “I don't really get it”
Reviews.Author: FromAlaska
Reviews.Content: While the Four Seasons Brand is certainly high class and 5 star, I didn't get that great of a feeling at the Four Seasons Las Vegas. I read all kinds of reviews about checking in and being walked to your elevator, Evian spritz and sunglass butler at the pool, fabulous rooms and exceptional customer service. Don't get me wrong, it's certainly a nice place, but when I checked in the gal at the desk walked me to the hall and pointed to where the elevator is. Never saw anyone with an Evian spritzer and the sunglasses butler (saw her only once) pretty much smeared sunglasses with a fairly dirty cloth. The pool itself is awesome!! Coming and going from the entrance is worth the stay (no walking through a noisy casino on the way in and out), but with valet parking at $22 a day, who wants to pay that when you can park for free at mandalay bay . . . and internet is $12.99 a day (or close to that). If they wouldn't nickel and dime you to death for $300-500 a night, this would be a great place.

Reviews.Title: “I wished we could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: khakola
Reviews.Content: My 18-month old daughter and I tagged along with my husband for a mid-week Vegas vacation. He was playing some tournaments and we wanted to hang out by the pool. I didn't want to stay anywhere that I would have to drag my daughter through a casino to get to our room and the Four Seasons met this requirement. I didn't realize until we arrived that it is actually attached to Mandalay Bay, but it has a completely separate entrance. After dropping my husband off at the Venetian, I arrived with a sleeping daughter and the valet and doormen were very patient with me and so kind while I unloaded and gathered up things. Check in was fast and easy and our room was very nice - huge bathroom with separate shower and soaking tub. View was only so so, but we didn't upgrade our room to the better views. That night, they brought a dessert for my daughter with her name spelled out in chocolate (nice touch!) as well as a child's robe, slippers, diapers and kid's toiletries. My daughter loved the wading pool and we both enjoyed the bigger pool. It was Spring Break so there were lots of families at the pool, but it wasn't at all crowded or noisy. I was impressed when the lifeguard brought out a swim diaper for a family who were obviously not prepared. Everyone was very friendly and pretty soon it seemed that everyone knew my daughter's name.
