Waitstaff at the pool were also friendly and lunch was yummy and decently priced. Dinner at the Verandah was very reasonable, too bad the breakfast was so pricey (but, hey, it's the Four Seasons.)

Reviews.Title: “Love it!!”
Reviews.Author: Daylove
Reviews.Content: Booked a room at this fabulous hotel for a celebration and I must say wow. This is one of the best hotel I have ever been at. Checking in and out was a breeze. The suite was well decorated with a superb bed, the personnel was extremely helpful, the pool is great, and the place is very quiet and safe. Restaurants are plentiful and room service food was very good.

Reviews.Title: “The Las Vegas Strip Bubble”
Reviews.Author: WilliamHarrington
Reviews.Content: Four Seasons is eminent in luxury hospitality for any part of the world. The Las Vegas establishment is on the Strip, but once inside you are taken away from all the busyness outside. This is the perfect place to stay on business in the city, especially if you have to attend the Mandalay Bay Convention Center.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to Four Seasons Name”
Reviews.Author: DSandDS
Reviews.Content: Great oasis in Vegas to get away from crowds and tourists, the hotel is tucked away behind the Mandalay Bay and the rooms are the top five floors of that hotel. Great service and easy access to the Mandalay Bay casino. Pool was very mellow, but also had easy access to the wild Mandalay Beach area. Price was on the same level as the Wynn or other higher end Vegas hotels. The only downside was the $22 parking charge.

Reviews.Title: “Needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: PandM0
Reviews.Content: This hotel used to be tops in Vegas many years ago. But with the addition of Wynn, Encore, Aria, Vdara and Mandarin Oriental, it has fallen in appeal. The rooms are dated, as are public areas. This hotel does not remotely compare with other Four Seasons we've traveled to in Vancouver, California, Toronto, Hawaii, and Seattle. They need a big infusion of cash to do a substantial renovation if they want to be among the tops in Vegas. We were quite disappointed in our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Mysteryjam
Reviews.Content: Tripadvisor! How could you get it so wrong? This hotel styles itself as an "oasis of serentiy and tranquility". Whoever wrote this blurb for this hotel (it can be found in their room material) has clearly never stayed in it. Seduced by the many positive reviews on this site, and impressed by the fact that this hotel was "#1" in Las Vegas, I booked two nights in a 'superior' room as an anniversary treat for my other half. It was meant to be an expensive but luxurious and relaxing end to our holiday in the U.S. First of all - the few 'pros' about this hotel. The rooms were clean. We received a warm welcome. The hotel is nice inside, as you'd expect. The pool area is small but attractive. The 'cons'? I don't know where to start. First of all we were given a room on the 39th floor. Small for a 'superior' room, considering the massive (and much cheaper) suite we'd come from in the Platinum. All seemed ok until night fell - turns out it is very very windy at night in Vegas, and the wind howls through the hotel and the stairwells, causing a high-pitched and relentless noise that even my trusty industrial-strength earplugs couldn't silence. (I don't just mean "It was a bit windy" - this noise has to be heard to be believed). 2.30am found me wandering down in my complimentary dressing gown to the lobby to speak to the front desk about the problem. The chap was apologetic and pleasant and offered to switch our rooms the next day. Sleep on night one - around two hours, broken sleep. Morning arrived - phoned the front desk to arrange to swap rooms - put on hold for a very long time, probably 5 or 6 minutes. I expected they were just busy with new arrivals. The phone was eventually answered by a frankly rude man, who when I asked if we could use the pool first before relocating, replied with the puzzling question "To do what?" Very bizarre. After going to the unwanted hassle of having to use precious holiday time to pack our bags up again to move, we went down to the front desk to get the new keys. Same rude man on the desk - arrogant, dismissive, and spoke all over what I was trying to say. I was standing with my partner and was very embarassed to be spoken to in this way. Bear in mind no complaint was made to this man - he was just changing the room. We were very polite to him, and I cannot understand his attitude. Really not what I would expect from the Four Seasons. This nasty experience really ruined the rest of the day for us (our anniversary!) and I was really upset. But never mind - we could look forward to a good night's sleep in our new room - right? Ha ha! No wind noise this time, but plenty of noise from the strip and McCarron airport just across the road. Sleep time - probably 4 hours. 2 hours better than the previous night! (Other cons for this hotel - it is very far away from the strip. It is walkable, but your feet will be very sore when you get back! Also - rudeness again from other hotel guests noted at the pool area. Seems that some of the Four Seasons clientele think as much of themselves as some of the front desk staff! Perhaps they are well-suited.) In the morning I was seething, at having had such a poor experience, and wasting all that money for nothing. In our two week holiday, we had spend nights in much cheaper hotels and had great experiences. The Assistant Manager had left a message on the room phone to ask how the new room was going - I phoned her and calmly explained the terrible time we'd had. She was very nice, and did apologise, but it was really a laugh and a shrug. Apparently it is 'always windy' in the hotel, even in the lobby. As we left she gave me her card and said "When you decide to come back, phone me". This was a nice gesture - but giddy with lack of sleep, and fuming at the money I'd wasted, I had to resist the urge to tear the card to confetti and shriek into the lobby "Stay here AGAIN? Are you KIDDING?!" So, we politely took the card and left as quickly as we could. An Oasis of Serenity? Absolutely not. I assume that like me, you work hard all year, and want to spend your hard earned pennies well. We had never been to Vegas before, and did not know any better. But now you do!

Reviews.Title: “Arrival Staff undertrained for the Four Seasons Brand”
Reviews.Author: keithmauney
Reviews.Content: The physical property is unparalleled for Las Vegas. And the Front Desk staff CAN rise to a level that reflects this 5-Star brand, but as of this post, it's a serious bruise on what is elsewhere a system-wide superb level of service. Discordant, affrontive, evasive, and and unaccountable, save and except a sorely limited script, incongruent with its image. The core Front Desk staff (and admin) would do well to retrain from any other Four Seasons property professionals. Other than this downwardly-cascading series of missteps, the remainder of our stay was on par with any other Four Seasons. Two Tourist Destination cities share equal levels of difficulty securing and training-to-an-exceptional-level hospitality professionals: Orlando and Las Vegas. Disney delivers a 4-5 Star experience across the stay at its upper-end properties, and at least 4-Star at all its others. Las Vegas hospitality--in spite of its heavily marketed imagery--rarely rises above 3 Stars, even at its most exclusive properties. The Four Seasons Las Vegas may not hire (or be able to source) the career--oriented-best, but it's certainly capable of training and reviewing these staff to a level that will not blunt or bruise its brand relationship with its lifelong clients. The fundamentals from the Ritz-Carlton culture would be the essential retraining point. To the property's credit, every other division team in the entire resort fully met, and even exceeded my expectation from this unparalleled collection of fine properties. But 80-90% compliance at this level of business misses the mark by astrological measure. DO NOT let this tepid review of one segment sway you from planning your retreat here. The Four Seasons philosophy, detail, and execution is still alive and well. Know that there is still no other retreat of this caliber in Las Vegas, and I'll be back soon and often. The human resources problem can and (I'm confident) will be corrected. It's apparent that the mature professionals at higher levels here understand success and know how to execute; let's hope they bring the less experienced along the path.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay as usual at a Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: atlmom2
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 9:30pm on Wednesday, May 18th. We had previously been at the Bellagio and had a 1 night stay at the Grand Canyon. Fast check in and then we were up to our strip view room. 2 friends celebrating our 50th B'days. Room was wonderful. Beds were amazing. Kinda laughed at a previous review complaining about no pool chairs. I was there Friday and think I know who may have written that post. I saw someone complaining around that time. Well, IF you come to a pool on a hot day at 1pm and expect a chair, you are expecting too much. We got out there at 9am and had our pick of chairs. Even at 11 there were chairs available. There can be so many chairs and when the hotel has only 1 pool, the early bird gets the worm. Our stay was wonderful and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel with first class service and highly professional and attentive staff.”
Reviews.Author: gymjangym
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a four night stay having chosen the hotel to celebrate our wedding anniversary. This has been one of those rare occassions when a hotel not only lived up to the hype but exceeded. it. Its location is ideal being away from the hussle (and i mean hussle) of the main Vegas strip area. We paid extra to stay in room with a strip view (on the 39th floor). It was well worth it as the view is spectacular. It is not just the quality of accomodation, public areas, pool side etc we found the staff warm, welcoming and highly professional. Travel tips. You can travel the length of the strip using the bus service which is right outside the hotel - this costs $7 per person for a 24 hour pass. There are two to choose from - Duce and Express. The Duce has many stops and can take a long time to cover a relatively short distance but is worthwhile if you are trying to get a feel of where everything is - Express has far fewer stops but is only a single deck bus which can often get full. Taxis are plentiful but as with most things are not cheap. You can use the monorail between the Mandalay hotel and Excallibur hotel for free but this only covers a short distance. On the strip you are hassled by people trying to sell you something - time shares / show tickets or prositutes! A tip is to tell them you are going home that day and they will then back off. Avoid the north end of Vegas as this is tacky and can be threatening with some unsavoury caracters knocking around. In truth we would probably not go back to Vegas again. Its great to see once. As a place for families with young children - forget it. The highlight of our trip was the hotel and the helicopter trip to the Grand Canyon - expensive at £340 each but a worth while experience. In summary Vegas has an identity problem and seems unable to decide which market it is aiming for. Promoting prostitutes via large billboards on the back of trucks traveling up and down the strip seems to me a sure fire way to drive away the family dollar.

Reviews.Title: “May Long Weekend”
Reviews.Author: nyctravelgal007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights Pros: Sunday Brunch Service at Pool Spa Concierge Service Level Bath Products Cons: Small Pool Coffee Bar in Lobby only open from 6-8a and long lines at Starbucks in Mandalay Front Desk didn't tell us about shortcuts through Mandalay Long walk to other hotels Small Showers I wrote this because all the reviews seem to glamorize this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Does Four Seasons ever get it wrong?”
Reviews.Author: PrairieWoman
Reviews.Content: So this is my third stay at a FS property (after Scottsdale and Sydney), and I'm seeing pattern of excellence here that I'd love to get used to! I helped to organize a business event at this property, because I knew that they wouldn't disappoint. The hotel facilities, the meeting spaces, and the food were all fantastic. All received rave reviews, and my participants (and boss) were thrilled. This is not perhaps the property if you want to be in the heart of the LV strip, but it's close enough for our purposes, and provided a nice respite from the frenzy of activity further up the strip. Staff was second to none. Seriously. As I've said before in other reviews, I'm a picky guest, and this was a top-notch experience! BTW, if you visit their casual restaurant, but sure to order their truffle parmesan french fries...they're to die for!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff. Dreadful setting for staff lunch”
Reviews.Author: k9todd
Reviews.Content: We had lunch organised for 55 of our team. They expected us to eat on the fountain terrace with no shade in nearly 100 degrees of heat. Plain stupid. And to be told off for trying to cool down in the fountain added insult to a very poor performance. Not a very professIonal experience.

Reviews.Title: “Elegent, Impeccable, A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: travelledmuch
Reviews.Content: Words cannot express what I felt about this hotel. I could not fault it in any way as it was just impeccable. All of the staff have "bought" into the service concept which was demonstrated when I walked in on the housekeeper, who would not be expecting me, to be greeted by my name. This was my first visit to Las Vegas and I was a bit disappointed when my tour was changed from staying at Caesars Palace to this establishment at the end of the stripe. I am delighted that the change was made and would have loved to have stayed longer

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect, but the best in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jgallag
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on our anniversary night. $179+tax. Sunday night. Was upgraded to a view over the pool area. Rm 37118. B/c we had a 1 year old, they surprised us with a crib, a diaper basket/bin and a few diapers, which was really nice. They allowed us to check in ~ 12:30, which was nice as well. This was my wife's first FS experience and she was ecstatic. The past reviewers are correct. The Mandalay Bay is a typical casino. It is huge and the FS is just a relaxing reprieve. The MB elevators have 7 people in them and the FS elevators have your self and family. HUGE difference on so many levels. The FS provided my child with a sweets plate and we received an anniversary cake which was thoughtful and has been done often to other reviewers on TA. On our check in day, it was soo very windy that we stayed in one of the two secluded hot tubs outside. Unfortunately, we never received the sunglasses treatment or treats as previously reported. We were ignored, which was a bit upsetting to me since I was really looking forward to these treats and the typical FS service. The next morning we went to the pool section and my wife had her sun glasses cleaned. She was wow'd. I was not b/c I was hoping for what other received. In fact, it seemed that if you did not order any food, the staff rarely came by. Most of the staff at the pool were kids and did not seem to care very much in my opinion. I went swimming on the check in day and lost my card in the pool somewhere. At a FS hotel, I expect exceptional service. When I let them know at the pool, they coldly stated that I needed to go to the front desk. We were planning to check out the Mother's day brunch (we checked in on Mother's day). We arrived at Verandah at ~ 2:30 pm. They closed brunch at 4 pm. The four or five girls at the front desk (where you ask for a table) did not seem to even look up or notice when we arrived and then were overall not welcoming at all. They just wanted to talk among themselves about when they can shut down the buffet. Clearly did not want to be there. The buffet was $65/person and that would have been fine since it was Mother's Day and our anniversary night, but we said no thanks based on their attitudes and lack of even greeting us. My wife went in and looked at the food for a second. She said it looked great, but we decided not to pay the money for sub-standard service. Go to the SPA. It is complimentary (minus the massages/services) and offers a gym and sauna and showers, which are great!! This is a secluded hotel, which is great! As I am mentioning, though, it has some places to work on. We were really disappointed when we laid down in bed at night and our TV did not work. I thought, "Are you serious??" I screamed out loud I was so disappointed! I wanted a perfect experience, especially on our anniversary night and b/c it was a FS hotel and it was not perfect!! I called the front desk and let them know. They offered to move me or send up a technician. It was 9 pm or so when we called so we did not want to move. The tech needed ~ 5 minutes to diagnose the problem and fix it, but it just really disappointed me. My wife really enjoyed the hotel. I had higher standards. If I find my way to Vegas again, I will stay at the Bellagio. My wife loved the fountains and it is in the middle of the strip. I stayed there before with a buddy of mine and we had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “It’s Las Vegas a little grown up.”
Reviews.Author: Pastpage1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned form a long weekend at the Four Seasons in Las Vegas. The hotel (room) and service was fantastic. We aren’t gambles so not having a casino wasn’t a problem. We go to eat, drink, and have a good time. You can go downstairs to Mandalay Bay’s casino through your secret entrances if you need that. We are late 40’s so we love to go downstairs and be with the hip crowd, but return to our sanctuary. The pool is the best!!! The service is outstanding and attentive. Need more excitement? The Mandalay Bay pool has it next door. Your secret key (room key) gets you everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Really disappointed”
Reviews.Author: SJ118
Reviews.Content: Well this hotel was a mixed bag. First the good things. A warm welcome on arrival and a helpful receptionist who arranged for us to be able to be checked in. The valet service gave us chilled water for our journeys. We were there for a celebration and it was lovely of the hotel to send up a cake and card. The pool area was busy but clean and the cocktail hour 4 till 7 pm with 5 cocktails and 5 small plates for $5 each is a real bargain for a classy bar in Vegas. Our dinner in Charlie Palmer's Steakhouse was excellent with the food of the highest quality. The bed was uber- comfortable but the standard room ( and the bathroom) is much smaller than those in most Vegas hotels. The TV was not very easy or intuitive to use However the sink was draining very slowly and when I lifted the plug on my last morning it was clogged with hair ( not ours). Ugh ugh ugh. I felt really sick and was amazed that a chain which prides itself on good customer service had failed on such a basic. I mentioned it at check out and the chap apologised but did not do anything else. I presume he would have spoken to the hosuekeeping supervisor after we had gone. I was also surprised that the much talked about sunglass butler used the same cloth ( not disposable) to clean sunglasses of different people over and over. What about cross -infection of conjunctivitis or skin infections? Felt very sad that we had left the Encore to try this for a few days as the lack of sink cleanliness really upset me. After all the hype I was disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “The best place for a family with young children to stay!”
Reviews.Author: thedogshack97
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas is great! There is action if you want, great shows and restaurants,perfect spot to take day trips from-Grand Canyon,Hoover Damn, Zion National Park, Bryce Canyon,Sedona, etc. HOWEVER-there is a lot of cigarette smoke. Even the most beautiful hotels we visited smelled disgusting of smoke. The Four Seasons was beautiful,CLEAN, the service was terrific and most important smoke free! It is connected to Mandalay Bay, and you can use their amenities if you choose(casino, wave pool, lazy river), then go through the doors to peace and no smokey smell ! I would like to add that the staff particularly catered to my son. Busy,happy kids make for a great vacation for mom and dad!

Reviews.Title: “A great alternative to the mainstream in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: SMB_ftw
Reviews.Content: This is a quiet, pleasant hotel, situated at the end of the Las Vegas Strip. Because it is relatively small, the reception area is intimate and service is efficient, compared to the long lines in the major Strip hotels. The whole place is quiet and elegantly low-key, which is a nice sensory respite after a day in Las Vegas. Rooms are well decorated, well appointed and very, very comfortable (the beds and pillows are just fantastic). In room amenities are very good, and the coffee machine works, and produces great coffee, which is by no means usual in US hotels. The Service is efficient and friendly, with personal touches that make the difference. The whole place had a pleasant, quiet feeling to it. You really notice this when you go from the Mandalay Bay complex, through the keycard doors into the Four Seaons - the noise disappears, the decor is soft and you just relax instantly. Hell, even the carpets are soft. Outside, the pool area is small, but very well served - you are escorted to loungers and the waiting staff never let you go hungry or thirsty. There is some aircraft noise here, but with McCarran literally beside the strip, thats going to be an issue anywhere in the Casino area. Walking to MGM or Excalibur takes about 10 minutes, or you can take the tramway direct to Excalibur in 2-3 minutes. Overall, a great stay - all that stops this from getting a 5 star is the fact that it's not quite as accomplished as the other Four Seasons we've used in the past - but not far off it. If you want to be at the heart of the strip, then go for a different hotel - if you want the strip in walking distance, but want somewhere to hide afterwards, this is a fantastic choice.

Reviews.Title: “What a plesant surprise”
Reviews.Author: mtgops
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference toward the end of April 2011, which was being held at the conference center at the Mandalay Bay. Because of the nature of the conference, I registered for the conference, booked the hotel room and my flight a good solid 2 months ahead of the event, logically to get the early bird registration rate and hopefully find a competitive price on airfare. My options for hotel bookings for this conference were the Mandalay Bay and THEhotel, on the Mandalay property. Either was fine with me, but I chose the lowest priced Mandalay Bay room available under the conference rate. I found a competitive price for airfare, but it had me arriving in Las Vegas at 11:30 at night the day before the main events of the conference. I generally like to arrive the Sunday afternoon before the conference starts to get my registration materials and to do the early arrival meet-and-greet, but it wasn’t in the cards this time around. We arrived a little early in Las Vegas and since I was traveling carry-on I was able to get out of the airport by 11:30 and catch a shuttle that was immediately leaving for the hotel. After hitting what seemed like all the other hotels on the strip, we arrived at the Mandalay Bay. I found a very empty registration desk and an unoccupied desk agent. Our interaction was short and polite. I displayed my credentials and the agent asked if I’d stayed there before, my response was no, I hadn’t. At which the agents excused themselves for a moment and went into a back room. Less than a minute later they reappeared and announced that I had been upgraded to the Four Seasons. They pointed me toward a hallway and gave instructions to go to the circular stairs that were at the end of the rather long hallway and to check in with the Four Season’s desk. After a few minutes walk I arrived at the Four Season’s desk. The agent there greeted me as Mr. so-and-so (I’m not honestly used to being greeted by my last name), traded unexpected by reasonable pleasantries; how my flight was if I was attending the conference, if I would have time to enjoy other parts of Vegas. All very nice, and seemingly genuine. I was offered a bottle of water and an apology was made because they had run out of fresh fruit for the day. This is the first time I’ve stayed at a hotel and been offered complimentary water and fruit. As would be typical, I was asked if I needed any luggage assistance, but I declined because I had one bag with me and I’ve never been one to use porter or luggage services at places I stay. I figure I have a few more years left in which I can handle my own luggage. I make my way to the elevators. It turns out that the Four Seasons occupies the 35th through the 39the floors of the Mandalay Bay tower. My room was on the 38th floor and looked down upon the pools and out toward the distant mountains that surround greater Las Vegas. The room was very elegant and nicely appointed. The furniture choices were some of the best I’ve seen in a hotel in a long time. The obligatory lounge chair and ottoman were a welcome place to relax and read after a full day of meetings, slide shows and buzzwords. Most of the time I’m usually disappointed in the comfort of the furnishings in hotels, however the chair and ottoman were something I would have liked to take home with me for my living room. The room was equipped with a nicely stocked mini-bar, however I never hit the hotel mini-bar because the prices are just ridiculous. I’m not against paying for convenience, however a $4 can of Pringles (and it isn’t even a full sized can) is beyond a convenience fee. The complimentary Keruig coffee maker was nice. This is the first time I’ve stayed at a place where the in room coffee was provided using a real pod coffee maker. It was very good coffee, and the housekeeping staff noticed I was using all the k-cups provided during the day, so they double stocked me after my first day there (a very nice touch and very observant of them). This was the best experience I’ve ever had with hotel housekeeping staff. They must have been visiting the room multiple times a day. After my morning ritual I’d head down to the conference. During a break before lunch I’d head back to the room, freshen up a little, have a cup of coffee, and relax before lunch. During this time I’d usually use a hand towel after washing my hands. I’d return to the room after the afternoon sessions but before dinner and the hand towel would have been replaced with a fresh one and my dirty coffee cup would have already been replaced. After dinner and evening entertainment I’d return for the night and the bed would be turned down and pillows reconfigured. I guess this fully illustrates how little I know about luxury brand hotels, but I was amazed with how efficient and hidden the housekeeping service was. I couldn’t have asked for better housekeeping service. I was impressed with some of the complimentary extra services. The newspaper always arrived early, in a blue-green bag hung on the door handle. No leaning out into the hallway to pick a paper off the floor. I used the shoeshine service the first night I arrived. That morning my shoes were also hung on my door and were polished very nicely. If I had felt so inclined I could have used a pair of slippers. I found two pairs of slippers in medium in sealed bags in one of the closets near the entry to the room. I’ve never been a slipper person so I didn’t partake. The bathrobes were very luxurious, thought. In general, the upgrade, which apparently occurred because the Mandalay Bay had been overbooked, was a very pleasant experience, frankly beyond my wildest dreams. If I ever have enough of my own money to stay there again, I certainly will.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but not great”
Reviews.Author: julesabc
Reviews.Content: This was the first time that I have stayed at a Four Seasons and was really looking forward to it legendary service and hotel quality. In short I was disappointed. We stayed at some amazing hotels this trip and this was far from a highlight. If this is the best in Vegas then Vegas needs to step up. Marble everywhere only gets you so far. There was nothing wrong with the hotel per se. This was just nothing really worth remarking about. Some rooms had great views of the strip which would be great - ours had a view of the freeway and a roof. Some of our friends loved it. We didn't. The positives - The room was extrememly spacious, the pool area was good and people were nice and friendly. The negatives - I saw no evidence of great service. Friendly OK, but nothing more really. I suppose expectations were just higher. There was no free wi-fi and I also felt the bed was too soft (perhaps a personal thing) and air-con/heating kept changing and didn't allow for a good nights sleep. Overall, not a great first impression of Four Seasons. I'll clearly give them another chance, but they didn't live up to their reputation this time around.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasure to stay, with a great view down the strip”
Reviews.Author: KGTI
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay & we were upgraded to a one bedroom suite which was a lovely surprise. Our view down the strip was wonderful. They brought a birthday cake for my daughter's birthday which was a really wonderful touch for her 13th birthday, together with popcorn & lemonade for both my daughters. The only issue we had was with the upgrade the bed my daughters slept in was a sofa bed & we had to request every night for it to be made. This request was always responded within 15 minutes, but when you come back to the hotel late, you would assume that they would have done it already. But that is minor with the beautiful amenities provided. Also tip to get to the pool early at the Mandalay Bay if you want a lounge. We couldnt get one, so we came back to Four Seasons & left our daughters at the wave pool. We enjoyed the peace beside the FS pool & loved the breakfast & service provided poolside. Definetly a place to get away from the hussle & bussle of Vegas. Would stay there again. It is the most southern hotel of the strip, but that is what legs & taxis are for.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of quiet and good taste in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: highlandbride
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights during convention where every room in town was booked. Room very comfortable, ice in the ice bucket every night upon arrival in PM. The courtesy car was always busy so didn't get to use it. Plan to do a lot of walking to get around inside hotel, especially if you want to go over to Mandalay Bay side of complex. For all the late night claims of this city, there was only the Mandalay coffee shop open after 11pm.

Reviews.Title: “loved every minute sad to leave.”
Reviews.Author: cards091
Reviews.Content: my wife and i spent 7 luxurious nights at this beautiful hotel,our stay coincided with our 30th anniversary and my wifes birthday.all the staff in every dept from reception through to pool service treated us so well,a special mention goes to mr Daniel Weinstein [front desk] for his lovely gesture in which he sent to our room on two occasions a cake one for our anniversary and the other for my wifes birthday [thankyou Daniel]. we cannot praise this hotel enough.no wonder it is rated no 1 in vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we had stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: GallacherGlasgow
Reviews.Content: We fell in love with the Four Seasons, we've stayed in 4 and 5 star hotels across the world but this one will stand out for us as the best place we have stayed by far. the fact that it is non-gaming was the attraction to us - there is plenty of gaming to be had in Las Vegas but when we go back to Vegas there will only be one place we will stay, we couldn't find fault with Four Seasons in any way and we were sad to leave after a short 4 day stay - we'll make sure we stay longer next time

Reviews.Title: “Not your average Four Seasons, lacking in service”
Reviews.Author: Susanlynn53
Reviews.Content: Sadly below standards of Four Seasons. Waited over an hour for room service lunch and two items were wrong and then another 30 minutes for replacement grilled cheese and soup. We waited 45 minutes for the bellman to take our bags down and he never came (three calls to desk) so we finally took it down ourselves. The pool staff were very snotty to the couple in front of us in line to get a pool chair, almost mean. I had much better service at the Cosmopolitan and even at the Paris last year. Very unlike the service we get at other Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch but not the best in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jbafa02
Reviews.Content: Overall great experience but in my opinion this is not the best hotel in Vegas. The rooms are slightly dated and smaller than some of the other 5 stars. Additionally, the location stinks compared to Wynn/Bellagio. The hotel is at the southern end of the strip and the casino is less active than the others. The room was slightly dated compared to the Wynn. No refrig in room, which is annoying. My last negative is the $22/day charge for Valet. You can park at the Mandalay/bay self park and walk (about 10/min) but like I said you're at the southern end of the strip so you have drive a lot to get to shows, clubs etc. On the positive side the pools is amazing. The best part about this hotel is the relaxing pool environment. There was never a problem getting a chair and the pool is very quiet compared to other vegas pools. You can take a short walk to Mandalay Bay's pool if you're craving a beehive of children and the chance to see a boob pop out in the wave pool. Another plus is the fitness center, which has no additional charges like some places.

Reviews.Title: “As always A true Oasis”
Reviews.Author: booklover52
Reviews.Content: This was our third year in a row and fourth stay at Four Seasons. It would be difficult to find anything to complain about-- very,very quiet. We realized after our third day that a family with two small children was staying in the room next to us. The kids were tired and crying as they approached their room. Once inside, we heard not a sound! Our room was cleaned, refreshed and maintained in spotless condition. The staff at FS is approachable, friendly, and efficient. We especially enjoyed the fruit plates that were delivered and refreshed throughout our stay: apples, grapes, nectarines, and bananas. The pool area is tropical and inviting. The views of the strip and airport are hard to beat. Worth saving up for and Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very low budget Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: Whytex
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving was surprised to find out that it's not really a Four Seasons hotel but 5 floors on top of the Mandalay - they have tacked on a cheap lobby which means you have a long walk to the express lifts that take you to the Mandalay. The pool is seriously low ball and more suited to a highway chain hotel group. For some crazy reason the pool service shuts off at 5pm while the sun is still blazing & a swim & drink is all you want. If you want a drink they make you walk in your bathers into an adjoining hotel bar where your drink with be served in a delightful plastic cup. We have stayed at Four Seasons in Singapore, Sydney, Chiang Mai & Shanghai and can recommend these hotels as top class however, I can't say the same about this one. We were so disappointed we moved to the Mandarin Oriental and I can say all of our expectations were exceeded and our 5 star experience began.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, well part of a hotel, in Vegas...and bonus..no gambling on site but easy access to Mandalay”
Reviews.Author: Lambert B
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, comfortable..taking up six floors in the Mandalay. A bit hard to find at first. Wonderful views of the strip and the airport with planes landing etc. impressive. Close to other hotels, and in Mandalay Luxor complex, but secluded at the same time. I am not a gambler so was pleased not to have to walk through a lobby of slot machines to get to the reception. Excellent pool access, good conference location. Restaurants so/so but go to the Mandalay and there is lots of choice there. Best breakfast bet or lunch bet is the buffet in the Mandalay, easy access from the hotel. Note if you are driving the hotel has valet service only but you can easily park in the Mandalay conference centre parking lot (not the Mandalay hotel self park, it is too far)

Reviews.Title: “Allows you to maintain your sanity in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: tilmeg
Reviews.Content: Incredible service is the highlight here down to the housemaid wishing me a great day by name as I left my room on the first morning. The separate lifts plus separate pool ( from the Mandalay) give a welcome reprieve from the madness that is Vegas but the casinos and craziness are very easily accessible. Food on site is good and I loved the ability to eat outside in the evening instead of being in yet another dark restaurant in Vegas. Rooms are slightly on the small side ( a deluxe room for a family of four was definately too small ) but the children got welcome gifts robes and slippers plus their own toiletries so they were happy.

Reviews.Title: “Ammmmmmmaaaaaziiinnnng!”
Reviews.Author: fortisprincess
Reviews.Content: My friend and I traveled to Vegas to see some concerts last weekend and stayed at the Four Seasons. I had stayed at the Mandalay Bay for business a few years ago and liked it but got a better rate at the Four Seasons this time. I really have nothing but fabulous things to say. When I checked in they gave me some water and an apple. The room was great, very clean and spacious. Our scale didn't work and after calling someone came and brought a new one immediately. Bed was SUPER comfortable. Loved the complementary shoe shine service. Concierge got us on the VIP guest list at Marquee at the Cosmopolitan. My friend's Iphone needed to be charged and they plugged it in at the concierge desk while we ate lunch. Verandah restaurant had yummy food and good service. Because I stayed at the Mandaly Bay before, I thought we'd want to hang out at the Mandalay pool. But, actually, the Mandalay pool area was overrun with people with tattoos and kids. Unless you got up early (i.e. before 10 am) to get a chair they were pretty much all taken (save some padded chairs that cost $75 to rent for the day). Thankfully, the Four Seasons pool was never crowded and had amenities beyond belief. When you check in with pool concierge they set you up with an absolutely delightful padded chair, towels and ice water. The excellent service does not stop there. Throughout the day we were offered complementary: frozen snickers, ice pops, watermelon infused with lemon and basil, passion fruit pearls, sunglass cleaning, frozen infused pineapple chunks and Evian spray. It was truly the best poolside service I have ever experienced. In addition, the food menu had lots of options and was excellent. Oh, they also have free newspapers (USA Today, Wall Street Journal and a local Vegas paper), SPF 15 lotion and aloe vera. The last thing I want to comment on is check out. We requested a late check out (we were taking the red eye back to NYC) and unfortunately it was unavailable due to lots of people checking in. However, the front desk offered us the opportunity to check our luggage and shower in the spa. So, we sat by the pool all day getting pampered and then went to the spa which offered: robes, razors, lockers, an eucalyptus steam room, hair dryers, etc., etc. It was truly amazing! The only negative thing I will say is that the location is a bit far away from Vegas's hot spots. There is a tram in the hotel that will get you a bit further down the strip but to get to the Cosmopolitan, where all the action is right now, it's a $20 cab ride (or 45 minute walk - even though you can see if from the room!).

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Get a way”
Reviews.Author: SunandSkiers
Reviews.Content: The pros- Perfect place to stay. Quiet. Service beyond compare. Pool is excellent. The negatives-At the end of the strip. Would stay here everytime from now on.

Reviews.Title: “An experience you won't forget”
Reviews.Author: crocettesontour
Reviews.Content: Having travelled extensively and stayed in many hotels and class of hotels, this one comes out as one of the best. An Oasis of calm amongst the stress that is Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel (most of the time).”
Reviews.Author: Spursfan1961
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a conference to attend at the Four Seasons. Once the conference was over, we stayed on for a further 4 days. The week before we arrived the temperatures were record highs. The week we were there they had some near record lows. Figures. The four seasons has its own reception area, away from Mandalay Bay, to which it is joined. The top 5 floors of Mandalay bay (35 - 39) are actually the Four Seasons. The room was very nice, clean and well appointed. The view down the strip was spectacular day or night. All the staff was very courteous and helpful. Our shower door had a leak around the bottom seal. One phone call to the front desk and a maintenance man was there within five minutes, and replaced the seal. The doormen were always helpful and friendly, and would remember conversations from previous days. The front desk staffs, along with the concierge staff, were all very helpful and knowledgeable. The pool area the Four Seasons is exclusive for the Four Season guests. Again, all the staff are very friendly and attentive. Mandalay Bay patrons are not allowed in this area but we are allowed in there pool area. And now to the gripes. They shut the pool area off at night which is understandable. The trouble is if you're walking back from the Mexican restaurant let's say, you can't get back into the Four Seasons unless you go through the Casino at Mandalay Bay. This probably wouldn't be a big deal for most people, but my wife is allergic to cigarette smoke and recently had throat surgery. This being said, I'd imagine most parents wouldn't want to take their kids through that kind of environment either. We voiced our concerns at the front desk and they were very apologetic. They sent up some chocolate covered strawberries to our room as an apology. That being said, I would definitely stay at this hotel again next time I'm in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST OF THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: DIFFERENTCORNERS
Reviews.Content: We arrived on the 9th April for a three night stay to celebrate my partners birthday and our aniversary The check in guy was incredibly professional and really went the extra mile for us We were given a stunning room on the 39th floor with a view of the strip The hotel is at the far end of the strip on top of the mandeleay bay but the extra walk was really worth it as once you arrived at the hotel it was a peacefull and calm oasis where the staff couldnt do enough for you on arrival back one day the hotel had left us a beautiful cake and strawberrys with a card for our special occasions on check out the same guy took care of us called us by our names and asked if we had enjoyed our stay and the birthday / anniversary we were celebrating I have never been dealt with in any hotel (and ive stayed in some of the best) by a more attentive member of staff and the four seasons should be proud to have him on their staff Ive stayed at the Venetian and the Bellagio in the past and the Four seasons beats them hands down Go you wont be dissapointed! David and Laurent UK

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: BnBFinder
Reviews.Content: Our room was perfect and unlike most other hotel restaurants, we enjoyed dining on site at the hotel for lunch one day and dinner one night.

Reviews.Title: “Serene, seclusive, intimate, and great Service - hard to find in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: sander9t
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in a strip-view room on the 38th floor. This hotel is so unique from any other Vegas hotel in that it is hidden within the Mandalay Bay occupying its 35th to 39th floors but it has a separate entrance and lobby, a separate guest-only pool, a separate and beautiful spa and gym facility, and two restaurants. You get the best of both worlds - the serene and seclusive environment of FS and the busy vibe of MB. When you are in FS everything is so quiet, but once you walk through “the secret door” to MB you have access to its casino, a variety of dining and entertainment options, plus all its five crowded pools - you get the picture. The room and the all-marble bathroom are very clean. The decor is good but can not be described as stylish. The pillow-top mattress is extremely comfortable and linens feel great and smooth. The ceiling-to-floor window allows a fantastic view of the Strip - the only thing is that the green tint makes everything look different (i suppose this has to do with the golden coating of MB). The bathtub and shower are separate and there is a separate room for toilet. We loved the L’occitane AND (!!) Bvlgari toiletries. The bathroom is not as shining as newer hotels like the Trump if you would notice small details such as scratches on the bathtub and some peeling-off caulk, but generally it has been very well maintained. The service is the highlight of the hotel. Housekeeping was superb and cared about all details. On the first night the shower and bathtub did not drain properly, but they were fixed quickly after we reported it. We were not given the key to the minibar when checking in (why on earth do they want to have a key to the minibar at the first place?) and only found it out after we tried to get creamers in the morning; but they delivered both the key and extra creamers quickly. Another good thing is that FS is among the few hotels in Vegas that does not charge a mandatory resort fee. Well there is a catch: you pay for internet ($15) and valet parking ($19). The complimentary services include a house car that will drop you off within 3 miles radius (no pick-up though), overnight shoe shine, access to the spa facility (including the steam room) and the gym. We found out, as also suggested by other TA reviewers, that the house car is not really that useful during evenings due to high demand - we were told to wait 30 minutes and they got us a cab instead instantly (in those mega casino hotels there is always a line for cabs).

Reviews.Title: “A luxurious retreat on The Strip”
Reviews.Author: TravelSneak
Reviews.Content: The lobby, pool, and room were gorgeous. Service was perfect. It was nice to have access to the Mandalay Bay amenities (ie great pools) but then be able to slip into your quiet oasis when needed. We really enjoyed our stay here. It is the attention to details that count. For instance, when we drove away from the valet she gave us two bottles of water to drink on the way to the airport. Nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Extremely Quiet!”
Reviews.Author: ashleyogloff
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last year with my husband for three nights/four days. We were booked in to Mandalay Bay originally but were bumped up to the Four Seasons due to high occupancy- the hotel is beautiful with full amenities and great service, but most of all it's very quiet in this busy loud city! The room was spacious, clean, and had nice marble/granite in the bathroom and at the small mini-bar area. The view wasn't that great since it was at the far end of the strip closer to the airport... but overall it was a really nice stay. The lobby of the hotel is beautiful and the tram outside takes you further down the strip in 2 mins flat- so it's overall quite convenient. We had a great stay, I'd recommend this hotel- but if you're booking the rooms separately from flights it's a pricey one! We got a deal staying here since we were upgraded unexpectedly. Flights and three nights stay for two of us costed us $1,000.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vegas Experience Yet”
Reviews.Author: Goldy272
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons is truly a cut above the rest when it comes to Las Vegas. I will say that I have stayed in nicer, more up to date rooms at places like the Wynn or Palazzo but the secluded nature of this place along with the tremendous service is incredible. We are in our late 20's and came here for a long weekend. It was during the NCAA tourney so a busy weekend. Having the 4 Seasons to escape back to was a must. To have all the amenities of Mandalay Bay right there through the secret little door was awesome but we always breathed a sigh of relief when we got back to the serenity of our hotel. For a relaxing yet fun Vegas experience, the 4 Seasons is the only way to go.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but there are lots of nice hotels in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: cavvygirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed a few days at the Four Seasons in March 2011. I thought overall it was a nice quiet hotel, but nothing remarkable compared to the other hotels in the area. The room was clean and the bed was, in all fairness, pretty darn comfortable. We had a view of the airport, which was less than impressive. I think for the money I could pay the same amount at another hotel and be given a strip view. The saving grace of the hotel was the pool and the poolisde service. We were treated extremely well out there, not to mention the food was super delicious. A little on the pricey side, but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Not the usual Four Seasons Experience.”
Reviews.Author: kiwi089
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons is the top 5 floors of Mandalay Bay, which is right at the southern end of the Strip. It's okay; because there is a tram to get you up to the MGM Grand - which is good, it's much further to walk than it looks. The hotel is also just across the road from some sort of concert venue; which on Sat night was LOUD, all night.

Reviews.Title: “I've found my new home in Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: Ouiparis
Reviews.Content: I can see why the Four Seasons is the #1 rated hotel for Vegas on TripAdvisor (even though the TA ranking system is fallible due to all of the fake reviews that they can't seem to weed out.) Our one-night stay was exceptional. From check-in to check-out, we thoroughly enjoyed our time at the Four Seasons. The spacious accommodations were top-notch. There was plenty of space to store clothing and toiletries. It was the first time we had stayed in a room that had more than one luggage rack. The room slippers were the most luxurious I've worn and I can always appreciate L'Occitane products, which were stocked in the bathroom. We chilled out by the pool for a couple of hours on Sunday and ordered breakfast, which was a pleasant experience. I love all of the extra touches by the pool, like the complimentary magazines and sunscreen. At some point, a gentleman walked around misting everyone's faces with Evian facial spray. Every time we ordered our car from valet, two cold bottles of water were given to us. Finally, I love that the Four Seasons is a non-gaming hotel. If you want to get your gambling on, you can simply walk over to the Mandalay Bay casino, which is literally a five-minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquillity”
Reviews.Author: pipkduk
Reviews.Content: Great stay. Super comfy beds and good size rooms. Pool was out of action during stay and opened day before departure - however could use Mandalay Bay pool. Picked this hotel as read other reviews about being quite and away from the hub bub and service but easy to get to the heart of the action. Location at South of strip but can get there using the local RTC or Deuce buses outside Mandalay Bay ($7 for 24 hour pass which takes you either end of strip including the outlets) or if you like walking use the links and shuttle trams (easy once you get your bearing through the maze of the linked hotels). Alternately approx 20 mins brisk walk from outside of FS to MGM if you don't stop to browse on route. Comfy shooes a must - made a mistake in heels.. ouch. Went to celebrate special birthday - received a birthday greeting and cake on arrival and on departure more cakes and thank you note - nice touch even if they got gender wrong despite us all being females! Forgot our UK adaptors and mentioned this to concierge who promptly produced one for use for duration of stay at no extra cost - so they redeemed themselves. Easy access to Mandalay Bay Casino. Only gripe - cost of bottled water - $5 for a 250ml bottle! Suppose goes with the territory for this type of hotel. Anyway got supplies from local shops a lot cheaper for the same stuff. Hence the 4 stars for value. Had Yummy but expensive buffet breakfast day after we arrived. OK as one off but too expensive for everyday - other hotels offer better deals for daily buffets. Would come here again though.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: GJM1964
Reviews.Content: There were 4 of us staying at the Four Seasons and boy what a disappointment. We were with older parents who had a handicapped accessible room. When we entered their room it smelled like sewage. Anyone could tell the room wasn't used for a while and the shower drain dried and sewer gases filled the room. After calling the desk, the smell was covered up with spray and the drains were filled with water. The 3 days we stayed we had very inconsistent cleaning service. We would sometimes get drinking glasses and other times there were 2 for the bar area and none in the washroom. If you ever stayed at a Four Seasons you would expect much more. All of the pools and hot tubs were closed for the season (would have been nice to know this before making a reservation). The bar/restaurant in the hotel was way overpriced but had a great hambuger snackers. Most everyone working at the hotel was nice. The bell person and valets were attentive. The coffee maker in the room was fair but the coffee in the lobby was great. The elevators were slow. Overall, I would stay the star rating should be a 3 at best. Even though the prices are for low season, we probably would stay at the Wynn next time we visit Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Number One Hotel in Vegas Yet Again.”
Reviews.Author: buffgirl73
Reviews.Content: We said that we wouldn't stay here in February and would try a new hotel for our winter trip. Trouble is, we knew what everything had to live up to so we ended up giving in and staying at the wonderful Four Seasons again. We were booked in a one bedroom suite again but were presented with the opportunity to upgrade to a Sunrise/Sunset Suite for an absolute song - how could we turn it down? Suffice to say it was amazing. The suite is over 1500 square foot and unlike some corner suites, you actually benefit from all of the space so it felt much bigger. As well as the usual bedroom and bathroom there is an additional cloakroom, a huge living room with separate desk office space, and a wonderful separate kitchen area that can be closed off so that the staff can come in a stock up your ice, coffee machine etc whilst leaving us in peace. As before the suite was impeccably clean, the housekeeping very good and turndown a welcome touch after a heavy night on the tiles. One niggle is the change from a free bottle of water by the bedside with the turndown service, to a bottle of Smart water on each side which 'can be purchased for $5.00' - a bit tacky. We didn't drink it, it's just a shame that even the Four Seasons has resorted to that sort of money making tactic! The only thing that took the shine off this stay was the room service. We had a couple of breakfasts, a lunch and a dinner. The first breakfast was fine and both lunches were great but the dinner was quite disappointing, tough steak which didn't taste as it has in the past. The worst was the breakfast on out last morning. We ordered a continental breakfast and admittedly we misread the slightly misleading menu thinking we would be getting a small selection of pastries and toast alongside coffee & OJ. Nope, just got cold chewy toast! In fairness, when I complained we very quickly received replacement hot toast and selection of absolutely wonderful pastries! Note to self - always order the pastries! I would like to say that despite this, the wonderful little touches that the Four Seasons is famous for were very much in evidence. A complimentary birthday cake and cupcakes for my husband's birthday and on our last afternoon some strawberries and chocolate were delivered, compliments of the management, that always takes away any negativity. As always, all the staff were excellent from check in to valet and housekeeping to maintenance, we have never encountered anyone who is anything but friendly and helpful. We are due back here in the summer and I can't wait. I would highly recommend the Sunrise/Sunset suite to anyone who can afford the indulgence, especially in the winter when you tend to spend a little more time in the room. This is and I think always will be my number one hotel in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, Tranquil hotel!”
Reviews.Author: greg12319
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel and had a great time. The hotel is quite and intimate compared to the others on the strip. And yet it is not far from all the action of casinos and shows. Booked from tigerhotels.co.uk. Our room had a beautiful view of the strip thanks to the higher level and the floor to ceiling windows. It was comfortable and spacious. There were 2 restaurants to choose from and we also had the priviledge of 22 restaurants at Mandalay Bay next door. The staff were all friendly and hands on. Vegas has a lot to offer and as a result can get tiring. We enjoyed the spa at four seasons which was an oasis for relaxing. A great trip thanks to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique luxury hotel feel with easy access to a nice mega resort.”
Reviews.Author: HyannisSteve
Reviews.Content: We appreciated the quieter side of this extension of a large, nice resort. The secluded separate entrance near the casino gave easy access and exit. The staff was very responsive, without smothering. A bit removed from the heart of the strip, but that also helps to filter the bustle. When we return to LV, we're returning here!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. What you expect from a Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: sport10010
Reviews.Content: If I can stay at a Four Seaons when traveling I will. This one more than lived up to the reputation of the chain. Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in a lifetime of travel”
Reviews.Author: birdfarm
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my 40th birthday and loved every minute. I have stayed in all kinds of hotels including luxury hotels throughout a lifetime of heavy traveling and this - along with the Intercontinental in Paris and the Strand Palace in London - was one of the three best I've ever encountered. The view is spectacular (be sure to get a "deluxe strip view" room - I think the other rooms overlook the airport), and the room is spacious and inviting. We were there for pure romance and the room contributed heavily to it being a wonderfully romantic, happy time for us both. But most of all, the service was out of this world. The concierge took care of everything for us, room service was fantastic (I love good room service!), complimentary services such as the Wall Street Journal and shoe-shines were nice touches, and when we mentioned at check-in that it was my birthday, a divine chocolate mousse birthday cake appeared in my room! We also did the amazing Sunday brunch - highly recommended. The only down side was that the spa seemed under-equipped - no sauna or jacuzzi. There is a lovely steam room though and the workout facilities are fantastic. And, the massage I had was one of the best I've ever experienced. Oh, the other down side was the location - it's not very central - and Las Vegas is not an easy town to walk around in. But it was well, well worth it. I wouldn't rent a car - too much trouble to wait to get in and out of the parking garages. Although the cab rides to and from the central strip run around $7 - $10 (it's not far but there's a lot of traffic), you about break even with the hotel's $22/night parking fee.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: MiffyK
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights, including the new year's eve. A very busy holiday season, but we managed to have a perfect getaway thanks to Four Seasons. It is a bit far from the attractions, located at the far end of the Strip, but this location gave you the tranquility that you don't usually get in LV. Rooms were spacious, staff friendly. I highly recommend the restaurant, Verandah. We had breakfast, lunch and dinner there. Their Salade Nicoise was superb!! They charge you for the internet in the rooms, but you can print out your boarding passes for free and even get a free access to the internet for 10-20mins (not so sure) at a couple of PCs located on the 1st floor. Over all, I can't wait to go back, and I can't think of a better place to stay in LV.

Reviews.Title: “a little overrated I think.”
Reviews.Author: ExcursionHero
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, we've never stayed anywhere else in Vegas so I have nothing to compare it to. We stayed with our 3 children in a huge suite which was hideously decorated but I didn't complain as we got a good deal. Staff were very helpful, reception and concierge helped us with a lost passport and booking a nanny for babysitting. The restaurant was delicious and we were made to feel very welcome, even when we took the 3 children - beautiful wine from the sonoma region!! Obviously it's Vegas so not the most child friendly place in the world, I do remember being a little anxious when the kids jumped in the pool, the lifeguards were responding straightaway by telling me that wasn't allowed. You could though use gate to go through to the Mandalay Bay next door which was much livelier and more family oriented. Tipping upon arrival and departure though was pretty exhausting, particularly for the Brits!!

Reviews.Title: “good choice highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: pandycyf
Reviews.Content: This is the first time we have stayed at the Four Seasons based on the tripadvisor rating and would not hesitate to return. The hotel is well appointed and extremely luxurious.The rooms are very nicely furnished with great views of strip and mountains. We eat breakfast each morning at the Verandah Restaurant and had a romantic meal for valantines day, found it to be of excellent standard offering a wide selection . The hotel staff and restaurant staff were polite and helpful. The concierge was very helpful in assisting with our plans for day trips and shows. We stayed for ten days and It was a pleasure to return to our hotel each day after the hustle and bustle of the strip! If you have the chance to stay here, do so and give yourself the treat of a lifetime Kind Regards Arwel& Meinir Edwards North Wales

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, loved every minute of it.”
Reviews.Author: MarkKirsty
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel with service to match, the staff couldn't do enough for you, if you want the glitz, glamour and all that goes with Vegas but want to escape to a calm and tranquil hotel then the Four Seasons is for you. Occupying the top 5 floors of the Mandalay Bay at the far southern end of the strip your sure of a great view whether it be the mountains or the strip! The Four Seasons has it's own pool which is heaven, pool attendants see to your every need with complimentary iced water, towels, frozen fruit, ice lollies, cold face flannels and a constant bar and food service if you wish. If you want to use the more hectic Mandalay Bay pool you can, free of charge, this has a huge wave pool with sand beach, several smaller pools and even a lazy river where you can sit in rubber rings and float round at your leisure. Don't be put off by the hotel being at the end of the strip, it's so long it doesn't matter where you are, there is always going to be something far away! If I return to vegas, sorry, WHEN I return to Vegas I will definetely be returning to the Four Seasons. PS. Just booked again for this coming August aswell. Can't wait! Top Tip:"Use the Vallet Parking when you arrive to get your bags out and not have to worry about parking $19 for 24 hours, then get your car later or the following day and put it in the covered Mandalay Bay parking (which keeps it cool) and is free of charge. Ensure you visit the Premium Outlets at the other end of the strip for some great holiday bargains on top brands!"

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Lovely Hotel with Superb Service!”
Reviews.Author: dianbe773
Reviews.Content: I recently celebrated my birthday with five of my friends for a weekend at the Four Seasons. We arrived on Friday early afternoon and were greeted warmly by the front desk. After check in, we were all given bottled waters while the hotel manager escorted us to our suite. We had a King Suite with two additional adjoining rooms which was great so we could all be together. I had prearranged spa treatments for the group for Saturday am and everything was so relaxing and went off without a hitch. the spa treatments offered are plentiful with some really nice, relaxing options to choose from. My friend said the Champagne Mud Wrap was incredible. We relaxed in the steam room before moving on to the rest of our day. We had tickets for Donny & Marie and I have to say, the show was fantastic. A lot of energy, laughter and fun. The Sunday Brunch at the Veranda restaurant at the hotel was lovely. The choices were tremendous and the fresh fruit and homemade mini donuts were delightful. The weather was a breezy 73 degrees so I wish I had known to book our table outside on the patio but did not think that would even be an option in February. All in all, the service, hotel and spa were everything we had hoped for. It was great to get away from the noise and glitz of the strip but also to be able to take part in that when we wanted to. I would highly recommend this hotel and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous & Elegant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunshin924u
Reviews.Content: Hotel was delightful. Check-in was a breeze. Quiet and quaint with no casinos. Just what we wanted, but next door to Mandalay Bay for gambling, food and fun.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional in Every Way!”
Reviews.Author: MizzSpider
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful stay at the Four Season Las Vegas. This was our second stay at the hotel. From the moment you step through the doors, you enter the discretely hidden entrance inside the Mandalay Bay Hotel, you step another world that lends itself to the very best in elegance and luxury. This is a non-gambling hotel, so if you want a place to escape in Vegas, this is it. Upon check-in we were given an upgrade to our room, and as the Four Seasons occupies the top four floors above the Mandalay Bay, we enjoyed unparalleled views of the Strip. When we were not in our room, we were down by their beautiful pool. Ah, the pool... it is also like another world. It is not open to guests of the Mandalay Bay, who can sometimes be seen walking by to that hotel's pool, and peering longing through the fence! Four Seasons guests, however, have full access to the Mandalay pool. At the pool, attendants will frequently come by with frozen fruit, popsicles, or an Evian spritz to cool you in the heat of the day as you lay on their comfy, double-toweled sun loungers. There is also gourmet food and fabulous drinks that can be ordered from the poolside menu. My husband asked if it was possible for him to order something that was not on the menu and the waiter said, of course, this is the Four Seasons, you can have anything you want! Which says so much about their service. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic escape”
Reviews.Author: Klankers
Reviews.Content: Can't go wrong with this choice. It was so nice to escape from the lights of Las Vegas to this most welcoming retreat. Room was awesome, Staff was great. Pool was a highlight for our group.

Reviews.Title: “Peace and serenity in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: saopaulo36
Reviews.Content: Four Seasons is always a Four Seasons, even if you are in Vegas! Forget about the huge lobbies and endless lines. Four Seasons is an oasis of peace and serenity in the frenetic and crowded Strip. Even though it is located inside the Mandalay Hotel, it has a separate and very exclusive reception. Staff could be a little nicer though. Like in all Four Seasons, they are polite but snobbish at the same time. The rooms are big and clean and the bathroom is very sofisticated and modern. If you want to feel the energy of the Mandalay, you can do so through a door that gives you access to the Casino. But when you close the door and return to the Four Seasons you forget you are in Vegas. Expensive but very good!!!

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons Las Vegas - Another fantastic Four Seasons experience.”
Reviews.Author: silverlakerunner
Reviews.Content: I saw the massive check-in desk for Mandalay Bay, and at the far end, a discreet sign directing me to the Four Seasons check-in. As soon as I stepped into the passageway leading into the Four Seasons, I knew I was in a different world. The sounds of the casino and the crowds faded away. It was at once stately, luxurious, and serene. The staff was friendly, welcoming, and professional. I was only there for one night, but I had a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Better than home!”
Reviews.Author: CeceBee
Reviews.Content: I love the staff here. It is like coming home if you have a family who loves you unconditionally! The rooms need a bit of updating but who cares when the staff is so wonderful. It is such an oasis in the noise of Vegas--a place to breathe and get away from the hussle of it all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Oztripper_1
Reviews.Content: This is the second time that I have stayed at this hotel and I would not hesitate to return again. The hotel is modern, well appointed and extremely comfortable. We ate at the Verandah Restaurant frequently and found it to be of excellent standard offering a wide selection of menu choices. The hotel staff and restaurant staff were polite and helpful. The concierge was very helpful in assisting with our plans for day trips and shows. I stayed at this hotel over the Christmas holidays. The lobby was tastefully and beautifully decorated and hot cider was available for hotel guests. It was a pleasure to return to our hotel each day after the hustle and bustle of the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Typical Four Seasons Excellence”
Reviews.Author: SydneySydney66
Reviews.Content: A large, well appointed room in a very large but impeccable hotel. Whilst the location is peripheral it is away from (but still in walking distance to) the madness of Vegas and is an excellent place to hide after a day or night on the strip. The service was outstanding - competent, patient and unobtrusive. My only gripe is charging for wireless internet. In 2011 and at Four Seasons rates this should be free, it really is nickel and diming.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel but beware of using Debit card on entry.”
Reviews.Author: WiggleOxford
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel perched on top of the Mandalay Bay which is in itself unusual. We had a room on the 35th floor overlooking the Strip and it was faultless. Also the connection with the Mandalay Bay allowed us to use pool facilities even though the pool for Four Seasons was closed. The Spa and Fitness Centre were first class and were empty each time I used them. The Four Seasons offers tranquility away from the crazyiness of Vegas itself. One matter though that did upset me greatly. I know that Vegas has a lot of trouble with dishonest people and appreciate they have to take steps to ensure they are going to be paid. However I had prepaid my stay at this hotel and only left my debit card for incidentals. Even though I have a number of credit cards the exchange rate from robbing banks is always a rip off, so I use my American Bank Debit card. I have been using this for years and always have the "transaction in progress" marked on the account which secures the funds but does not take them as such. This has been a process I have had from Alaska in the North to Arizona in the South from hotels to rental cars and never has anyone taken advantage of this until now. The hotel has actually taken $750 from my bank account. This in my view is sharp practice and is well above the incidentals we have used since being here. This in my view calls into question honesty and integrity and leaves a very bad taste. When discussed with the hotel front desk and management a host of excuses was given but none that made sense, they even allege that this allows them to issue credits more quickly which is rubbish. The facts are simple they have taken the money in my view without permission and is sitting in their bank account and not mine. So if you are coming to this hotel remember the policy of these people which like so many hotels in the US is alien to the customer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: petereturra
Reviews.Content: This was our second time back to Four Seasons Las Vegas. As many reviewers have commented, this hotel is an oasis amongst the hustle and bustle of Vegas. Nice rooms, excellent staff, excellent restaurant (the Verandah) - we never got to try Charlie Palmer's Steak, but did have dinner a couple of nights at Charlie's other Vegas restaurant - Aureole - which was excellent. Location of hotel may be a small negative for some guests - being right at the southern end of the strip, and therefore a couple of miles from the main action - but you can't have the peace and calm of this hotel and be located next to Bellagio. For us, the compromise is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: platoaristotle
Reviews.Content: The hubby and I decided to splurge on this for Labor Day Weekend 2010 (they had a third night free special). Overall, this place was fantastic and the best place we have ever stayed in Vegas. It is calm and subdued inside (some might call it bland, but I think it is refreshing and relaxing after all the casinos, lights, and Vegas T&A). The strip view rooms are nice as the hotel is further down on the strip so you get to see all the lights from all the other hotels. I have seen some people complaining about the location in terms of the Strip. It didn’t bother us as we knew ahead of time, but if you want quick access to the party scene and want all the glitz and lights of Vegas, then this probably would not be the hotel for you. I thought that the FS had the perfect balance. As soon as you walk into the FS you have leave the smoke and clanging of the casinos behind and are in a calm oasis. But you can still leave and go to party on the strip. The pool is heavenly. There is a bar and comfy lounge chairs. They will set you up with ice water and sippy cups. They come around with popscicles, cucumbers for the eyes, and sunglass cleaners – however, the frequency of all of this seems to be hit and miss. We spent three full days at the pool. The first day, nothing. The second day, we got the popsicles. And the third day they came by with everything. There is somewhat of a sun/shade migration in the pool area as the sun changes through the day and reflects off the windows of the neighboring hotels. If you, like the hubby and me, need to stay in the shade, sit on the far side of the pool in the morning, but eventually you won’t be able to be right next to the pool as it is totally engulfed in sun. If you want a full tan after your vacay, you are at the right place. The food they served at the pool was consistently good. The frozen grapes are a refreshing and healthy poolside snack for a hot day. For the meals they set you up with a tray table that goes over your lap – heaven! We loved getting breakfast next to the pool in our bathing suit. The pina coladas were excellent and a must! My only complaint is that we found it hard to get the attention of the staff fat the pool for ordering. They seemed understaffed in the pool area. Sometimes we would get a menu and then have to wait for quite a while (like 30+ minutes) before someone would come by again to ask what we wanted to eat or drink. All guests get access to the spa locker room amenities. You can access it from the gym or through the separate spa entrance. In the women’s spa area they have a steam room, large vanities with excellent lighting and various hair care products. The hubby reported that the men’s spa area had a large flat screen TV always tuned into some manly sports show. The spa services are pretty pricey, but all spas on the strip seem to have a large price tag. The hubby and I got a couples massage, and I guess he found it so relaxing that he fell asleep during it. The FS has a town car that you can get to drive you around for free (tip the driver of course). But the staff seems to keep it on the down low; they will not volunteer the existence of the town car unless asked. FS guests get access to the Mandalay Bay pools as well (except I think you will still have to pay extra to get into the Mandalay Bay European Bathing (topless) pool area). Mandalay Bay has an extensive pool area – wave pool, lazy river, and more. It is a somewhat different scene. We liked the FS pool better. If you tell them you are celebrating a birthday or anniversary, they send a free cake to your room! After Vegas we went to the Grand Canyon. The concierge staff was extremely helpful with getting us directions to pickup the rental car and getting us on our way to the Grand Canyon. My husband and I still talk about the wonderful time we had here, and cannot wait to return. After staying at the FS, I told my husband that is the only place I will ever consider staying at in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Weird choice for the top 25 hotels in the U.S.”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous35972
Reviews.Content: I think it's interesting that this hotel was just voted into the top 25 hotels in the U.S. I didn't notice one thing that was special about it. I wasn't overly impressed with the staff, the rooms or the pool. It's a typical "pretty" hotel. My purse, my iPhone and my watch were stolen out of their "secure" pool area and they just weren't very helpful. They said it was the first time it had ever happened there. Ummmm.... I don't think so.

Reviews.Title: “the good life”
Reviews.Author: rlt_losangeles
Reviews.Content: I have never been so taken care of in a hotel. From the staff actually remembering my weird Dutch name to complimentary rides in their sweet Mercedes to the soft, soft, soft bed I was ready to move their permanently. When you don't want to deal with the baloney of other Las Vegas hotels, stay here and be happy.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm amongst the madness of Vegas but Bland”
Reviews.Author: Heather015
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons Las Vegas in April 2010 for 5 nights. We did appreciate that as it didn't have a casino it was a rare oasis within a sea of madness which is Vegas. My children loved the fact that the pool area is connected by a gate to the hotel next door sorry forget the name that has the most incredible pool complex, including a lazy river and fake sea with wave machine.
