We appreciated this as well as we could stay by the calm and quiet Four Seasons pool whilst they enjoyed the madness next door. Service was very good. My only criticisms are that whilst the rooms were perfectly nice and spacious they were very very bland including the bathrooms. The hotel is located at one end of the strip which isnt the end of the world but it is not in the heart of things like some of the other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous respite”
Reviews.Author: AEVH
Reviews.Content: We brought our young children here (age 8 and 6). For us, being able to escape the insanity of mass humanity was more essential than we could have imagined. We had a blast in Vegas, but it would have been all too much for us without the Four Seasons. We had a small suite for all 4 of us, which was perfect - lots of space but not too scary. The hotel is located on the top floors of the Mandalay, with outs own separate front desk, restaurant etc. Having taken the monorail back from the strip, we had to walk through the Mandalay, which was Mayhem. Our hotel, by comparison, was peaceful and positively homelike by comparison. We had the same impression every time we came back from the outside world. Ps, we came here hoping to drive to the Grand Canyon. Don't fall into the same trap: it's too far! We splashed on a 3.5 hour helicopter ride to the bottom of the canyon at the west rim. It's was SPECTACULAR. The concierge organized it at 5pm for an 9am departure the next day. Very impressed. Kids weren't terrified, which was a humble, but paid off handsomely - they were awestruck, as were we. If you can spare the $$$, it was well worth it. Could not recommend more

Reviews.Title: “They know how to say YES”
Reviews.Author: jtchan
Reviews.Content: This will be my "go to" hotel for any Vegas trip. The rooms are clean, the beds super comfortable, but their staff really sets them apart from any other hotel on the Strip (and I've stayed at them all). From the front desk, to the concierge, to housekeeping, to the spa staff these are folks that are folks that say "yes" more often than "no". Yes, we could have late check out. Yes, we could have extra bottles of water and more K cups for the coffee maker. Yes, we can wear the spa robes and slippers back to the room. We were also here for my birthday and the hotel staff delivered a small chocolate mousse cake, really going the extra mile to acknowledge their guests special celebrations. This place is truly an oasis from the hustle, smoke, and busyness of Vegas. We didn't get to check out the pool scene (closed for remodeling), but we will definitely will be back

Reviews.Title: “Another great visit at the Four Seasons!”
Reviews.Author: lisa1061
Reviews.Content: My husband always stay at the Four Seasons when we go to Vegas. It is very relaxing and they have the nicest, most accommodating staff! Everyone that works there greets you with a smile and hello, any request you have is no problem for them (and they seem to actually want to help you :-). We got to use the house car while we were there to take us to another hotel on the strip, it is a very nice S550 Mercedes- Benz. Breakfast every morning at Verandah is very good, we also ate there for dinner one night - excellent, and we also went there for their martini happy hour and sat at the bar. We always look forward to coming here, and have never been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “oasis of tranquillity”
Reviews.Author: cyclinglover
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel, as I dislike the hustle and bustle of Las Vegas. The room was very nice and silent. Service was excellent. No complaints whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: TravlersIndiana
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay - comfortable, quiet and most of all beautiful. Staff was excellent and friendly and helpful. Best bed we ever slept on.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully relaxed hotel - needs a couple more things to really finish it off”
Reviews.Author: TerriB_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week over the new year so you can imagine how busy Vegas was! However, you didn't get that feeling in the Four Seasons. There is a kind of calm, serene feeling wherever you go in the hotel. It's a welcome haven after days on the strip going to shows, gambling etc. The spa is lovely and so is the fitness suite which has everything you could ever need and the staff in there are very friendly. The only thing missing I would say is either a pool or a jacuizzi! The rooms are very well propotioned and very clean. Slippers and bathrobes are a nice touch along with welcome and leaving snacks! The only thing I would say as a negative is that if you have a particularly bad hangover and fancy spending the day in bed or just mooching around your room there are a lot of disturbances from the cleaning/just dropping things off staff. I mean lots. One morning we had someone walk in without knocking....and I'm talking 8.30am so chances are half of vegas would still be in their rooms! Would still stay there again despite this as lets face it a good old Do-Not-Disturb sign on the door should work! Oh the Verandah restaurant is lovely and when the weather is nice the patio would be amazing!

Reviews.Title: “My go to Hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Vomodo
Reviews.Content: For Business or pleasure for almost ten years I have found great value and service at this hotel. Some times I have four co workers here and some times I just come with my wife. Either way the service is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Oustanding service.”
Reviews.Author: B0bD
Reviews.Content: Four Seasons quality and service all the way around. The hotel is an oasis in the desert. This is a quiet and very elegant hotel located on the Las Vegas strip. It does not have a casino, however, does allow discreet and direct access to Mandalay Bay Casino. We dined at Verandah restaurant. The food and service during dinner were exceptional. This is the only hotel I would return to when visiting Las Vegas. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great food; non smoking; many many dogs”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaJEL
Reviews.Content: This hotel is unique as it avoids the smoky casinos. The room and bathroom we had was fairly large. Free bottled water was provided. The internet is not free which is a policy that should change. There were so many dogs staying at the hotel that it looked like there was a dog convention.The restaurant served very good food. We ate there numerous times. The service was excellent and all staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place if your visiting with little ones”
Reviews.Author: Rush&Min
Reviews.Content: We spent ages looking at all the big hotels in Vegas and decided to go with the Four Seasons. Located at the top 4 floors of the Mandalay Bay hotel it seemed bizarre but believe me it was so nice to come back to after busy days and nights. Firstly check & out was smooth... take a look at the line up and the Venetian and Bellagio and its nuts! Esp with kids!! It is located at one end of the strip but I loved it when the taxi brought us back because it was just so quiet and calm. Attentive staff and very chid friendly. When we checked in they asked our kiddies names as we requested a cot and when we arrived in our room we were welcomed to a beautifully made cot, m@m plates with the kids name in chocolate and lovely organic products for the kids in the bathrooms, as well as little sponges spelling out their names.. too cute! It was those touches that made it a nice stay... The view was a strip view and was good... the room in itself was standard but clean with comfortable beds. Disadvantages would be the room service for a glass milk was $12... I took the elevator to the Mandalay Bay store and bought it for $3! The walk to the room, but I have heard you get that with most Vegas hotels... All in all a great stay and a peaceful one.. no casinos to walk through to get to your room, quiet pool, nice breakfasts. All at a price but when you look at the other hotels and how rammed they are it was worth it... esp when you have an empty pool and you see people from Mandalay Bay peering in ;)

Reviews.Title: “Stay for the service and tranquility, but not the location”
Reviews.Author: Roamingtheworld
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a stay at the Four Seasons, and would agree with all the other reviewers that the service level was way above what you might expect in other hotels. There was a very high staff-to-guest ratio, and every single employee we encountered always made eye contact and greeted us in a friendly way. The view in our premium strip-level room was very nice, and as this was my husband and my first trip to Vegas, we appreciated being able to take in both the town and surrounding mountains. Beds were very comfy, and the concierge very helpful. We rented a car for a day from the hotel and drove out to Red Rock Canyon--very worth it if you like unusual outdoor beauty, and want a chance to see the area. Fitness Center was excellent. Since the hotel is really the top four floors of the Mandalay Bay resort, the casino and restaurants there are available to you. We ate some good meals at the Border Grille and Wolfgang Puck's Lupo in Mandalay Bay. House of Blues was also fun. The only negative I can think of isn't a reflection on the hotel or its employees; rather, it is the out-of-the-way location to most of the "action" in Las Vegas. I loved the peace and quiet of the hotel, but it is about a 30 minute walk to get to the Bellagio or other center-strip locations if you are wanting entertainment or a meal out. My husband and I are runners, and obviously don't mind exercise, but if you are female and want to dress up, a 30 minute jaunt in heels is not my idea of fun. If you want to take a taxi, plan to spend about $40.00 round trip every time you want to go anywhere on the Strip, which is about 4 miles long. There is a tram you can take which runs behind the hotel zone, but it starts behind the MGM Grand, and can be confusing to reach. Also, if you are allergic to dogs, you should be aware that the hotel allows them. We have two large labs and like dogs, but we had to chuckle at all the "yipe-yipes" we encountered. Lots of little white pooches in sweaters with painted hair and, in some cases, toenails! OMG--if you remember the Howells from Gilligan's Island, or have seen Paris Hilton's companion, you get the general idea. Overall, a great experience at this hotel, and if you are looking for peace and quiet, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great for family with kids, but far from from the action”
Reviews.Author: hotelking85
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews here, I really wanted to experience what the others experienced. I guess because of my high expectations, the Four Seasons was just alright. When we drove up to the hotel, there was no one there to help us. We had to drag all our luggage to the check-in. Even after checking-in, there was no one to help. On the bright side, the fitness center and spa was amazing. There was always someone there to give you water or help you. Would I come back? maybe if I get a great deal

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel, but not #1 in Las Vegas. A few minor issues.”
Reviews.Author: ChetX5150
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at most hotels in Vegas. The Wynn and the New Aria seem superior to the Four Seasons overall. That said, the Four Seasons is a nice quiet oasis from the wild casino's and offers good rooms and great service. EASY access to the GREAT facilities at Mandalay Bay... Great restaurants here and at Mandalay. Separate lobby is nice. Room service was also very good and rooms have what you need... except for two issues. 1) Most $500 a night rooms at other hotels have 2 sinks to allow both people to get ready at the same time. This hotel did not until you got up to specialty suites. You are always going out in Vegas, so having a bathroom built for ONE is a awkward. Second, our housekeeping was LOUD at 8AM in the hallway. NOT good for 8AM in Vegas. Loud in any language at 8AM is bad... and they used their radios too. Not very FOUR SEASONS like. Lastly, there is bit of noise from the nearby airport, depending on what side you room is on... not terrible, but mildly bothersome. Despite these comments, we probably would stay here again... if we wanted a mellow stay. For fun, THE Hotel at Mandalay are superior rooms and the Wynn caters to the Four Seasons money crowd. I feel the new Mandarin Oriental at CityCenter will top the Four Seasons SOON. As may Aria. Both look spectacular. Our next stay will be at the Mandarin Oriental to compare. Charlie Palmer steakhouse here at FS is great too. Heard spa here was good also.

Reviews.Title: “Refined and elegant, but a bit boring and out of the way.”
Reviews.Author: Kingman26
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons is very, very nice. The employees are wonderful. It's a really fine hotel. But to me, its location is pretty poor, at the very end of the Strip, and overall it is just a bit quiet for my taste; I like to be center-Strip, where I can walk out of Bellagio or the Cosmopolitan and be in the midst of a dozen other cool hotels. Stayed there at Christmas--pool closed. Spa being redone (but got to use Mandalay's workout/spa for free, which was excellent.) Room very nice, incredibly comfortable, but not that big compared to Wynn/Encore, Venetian/Palazzo, or as nice overall as Bellagio or some others. I cannot disagree that this place is an oasis, but I come to Las Vegas FOR the excitement. It is also great for kids and pets. But for me, Wynn/Bellagio/Cosmopolitan remain the places to be. I cannot say that this was 5-star. 4.5 maybe.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Xaby1
Reviews.Content: I still gave this hotel 4 rating because overall it was pretty nice stay but I don't think this property deserves a 5 rating for a couple reasons. First, the bathroom was surprisingly small. The tub was small (no jets), the shower was small and there was only 1 sink. Second, on the final day of our stay, there was no hot water; my husband and I both got a cold shower. I did tell the front desk about the hot water problem and they explained that a boiler at Mandalay Bay had gone down and was currently being serviced by their engineers. They did apologize but offered no concessions for the inconvenience. I know that both of these complaints are fairly picky but based on my experiences at other 5 star properties I expected more from the Four Seasons. On the positive side, I did like the location (in the Mandalay Bay) and it was a very quiet place to sleep but I would likely try and stay somewhere else next time I visit Vegas. Note: if you do decide to stay here, the parking is valet and costs $22/day; we decided to self-park in the Mandalay Bay parking structure for free.

Reviews.Title: “True Luxury in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: crash905
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Hotel Las Vegas is at the far end of the strip and is not associated with any casino however the hotel is part of the same building as Mandalay Bay. The rooms are tired, the restaurant is fresh and the spa is undergoing a MAJOR refurbishment as of December 2010. The biggest reason for staying here is because the service is the best around.. In Vegas so far, there is nothing better.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons Top floor of Mandalay Bay”
Reviews.Author: sedaygogirl
Reviews.Content: I was attending Steve Harvey's Hoodie awards show @ the Mandalay Bay. The rooms @ Mandalay were $260+, i got the the 4 seasons for $149 plus tax. 4 seasons allows you to use the amenities @ Mandalay, like the beach. If you want privacy you can hang out at the pool in 4 seasons. The hotel is beautiful, the service was average, not nearly as great as the service I received at the W hotel and the Fairmont. One great amenity is a mercedes house car that will take you up to 2 miles. Checkin was slow, the front desk lady spent too much time on the phone. I left my room Sunday morning @ 912a and returned at 2pm and my room had not been cleaned. I expected more from 4 seasons and will most likely not stay here again. the hotel is beautiful, but service not great.

Reviews.Title: “Top Floors of Mandalay Bay”
Reviews.Author: Braden1776
Reviews.Content: Four Seasons is simply the top several floors of the Mandalay Bay, Separate entrance and reception keeps you away from the Mandalay madness. Rooms are great and well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: PortlandWirenut
Reviews.Content: This is a first class luxury hotel that goes out of its way to make a person feel special. The attitude of everyone from the front desk to the valet service, the restaurant (Verandah and Charlie Palmers Steak House) personnel and the staff in general make it a very pleasurable experience. When you first come to the front entrance, you are greeted by valet service that after several times will learn your name and greet you by your name, welcoming you "home". The rooms are very nicely furnished with a very comfortable bed and a great view. The Four Seasons also has a very nice fitness center if you want to sweat a little and the hotel staff if you want will even bring you water while you are working out. If you have the $$$$ to stay here, do so and give yourself the treat of a lifetime.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality is their middle name.”
Reviews.Author: AVDude
Reviews.Content: When I can afford it, I will always choose Four Seasons for celebrating special occasions. They seem to understand what other hotels have forgotten, that you are in the hospitality business, not the hotel business. Thanks for making my 20th wedding anniversary extra special!

Reviews.Title: “Still Great”
Reviews.Author: Salthillhalli
Reviews.Content: I stayed here about 9 years ago (I believe they were open a year or two at that stage) and am happy to report it is still a wonderful hotel. It is such a reprieve from the "Vegas experience" which is still at your doorstep. Yes the hotel is in great condition, I saw several staff on different days touching up paint etc… our room was spotless, bed was excellent however the what really made the stay memorable were the staff. From the valet to check-in to the spa and restaurant everyone was fantastic, professional, friendly and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “It is a romantic hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarihui
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel. The room with the facilities, the friendly staff, the view, the conference hall. Every thing is perfect. Just proof it.

Reviews.Title: “The service was impeccable”
Reviews.Author: SteveL3010
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay here for my birthday as I was hosting a few get togethers and anticipated that the service would be good. I was not disappointed. The staff were excellent and really made a difference to my stay. I would particularly like to thank Shilpa on reception who was very helpful. The food was of a good standard and the pool was great.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for infant and family”
Reviews.Author: willtravel4food73
Reviews.Content: Had to make a trip to Vegas with our 1 year old infant. Definitely wasn't looking forward to hitting City of Adult Play with her because we were worried about accomodations. Decided on the Four Seasons because it was close to most of our events for the weekend at Mandalay Bay. Perfect stay. One bedroom suite gave us plenty of space with two bathrooms and french doors that seal off the master. The hotel knew of us coming with the baby and automatically babyproofed the room, had a full size comfy crib, humidifer, high chair with it;s own table, and diaper pail in the bathroom. She slept almost as well as she usually does at home. Our bed was super comfy and I actually slept better in that bed than at home. Had a wonderful time and a big reason was the Four Seasons making things as comfortable and easy as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel :)”
Reviews.Author: J0andJames
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing, we stayed her the night before and 2 nights following our wedding. I could not fault this hotel. The service was outstanding. Loved the complimentary tea and muffins in the lobby. We stayed at Christmas time and the Christmas decorations and huge tree were amazing. We were upgraded to a strip view room which was excellent, the best was the comfiest bed ever! As it was our wedding we also got some chocolate dipped strawberries delivered to our room, a lovely touch. I used the hotel car to get to my parents hotel on the morning of our wedding, it was very clean and the driver was really friendly and knowledgable. I can't comment on the pool because we did not use it but it did look very nice! The casino, bars and restaurants at Mandalay Bay (below the Four Seasons) are great, we especially liked Raffles for breakfast, their Heuvos Rancheros is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: AUKTourist
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons staff make the hotel. We stayed 10 nights on this trip and without exception the staff did everything they could to make our stay perfect. If you want the buzz and noise of Las Vegas then stay elsewhere, if you want to be able to relax and enjoy Las Vegas at your pace then say at the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “smoothing out vegas”
Reviews.Author: glwm
Reviews.Content: Yes,its away from the strip and glitz.but from the moment you arrive to leaving, all your concerns you expect from a hotel are non existent here.i am going back for thanksgiving weekend.and know after all the decadence from fun fun vegas you come back to a little breath of heaven that is Four Seasons hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Escape the madness of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Terence1809
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons is the top four floors of the Mandalay Bay, but has its own entrance and lobby, shaded by palm trees set back from the madness at the far end of the Strip. It is, as so many have said, an oasis of calm - although why anyone would go to Vegas to get 'calm' is questionable... It doesn't have its own casino, but from the casino of the Mandalay Bay you walk past the lifts, turn a corner and find a discreet single door that opens with your Four Seasons keycard. The silence and peace overwhelms after the casino mayhem and the express lift zooms straight up to floors 36 - 39, away from it all with a view over Vegas and the desert. Our room was spacious, clean, and had a huge comfortable bed - the turn down service was a little odd though. Every evening we'd come back to a nicely turned down bed, with little towelling mats to rest you weary feet on by each side of the bed and... the radio turned on. Why? I mean, if I wanted the radio on, I'd turn it on. And if I did, I wouldn't leave it on while I was out. The bathroom was rather large too, with the deepest bath I've ever seen, a vast mirror and L'Occitane toiletries ( a nice touch). And the obligatory phone in the loo. I mean, please, has anyone ever answered the phone while on the loo and carried on a conversation? Honestly... The entire outside wall was a floor to ceiling window, tinted gold which looks great from outside but cast the room and everything and everyone in it with a deathly jaundiced pallor. Wi-fi is available but at an alarming $14.99 a day. This is frankly an outrage when even budget hotels and any coffe shop you care to wander in to has it for free. We also had the oddest experience with the air con. We spent ages tracking down a weird howling, like a coyote falling down a lift shaft, which eventually turned out to be a fight between the wind outside (being on floor 39) and the corridor air-con meeting through the gap under our door. We had to stuff the bottom of the door with a towel to stop it keeping us awake at night. Very odd. Overall, however, we loved the Four Seasons. The room, service, staff all excellent. Happy to go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas without the Vegas”
Reviews.Author: vegas_local_2010
Reviews.Content: My wife and I live in the Vegas area. As with many locals, we get plenty of Vegas and were just looking to get away without getting away. Well, this is the place. From the moment we arrived until the moment we left, it was as if all staff were there to ensure our experience was perfect. The private pool is incredibly relaxing. Unlike the mega-pools at other resorts, this area was small and intimate without being crowded. It was easy to get a chair wherever you wanted. The staff wandered around with complimentary "cooling" items like popsicles and frozen snickers. This is not the place to go if you're looking for a crazy Vegas experience. If, on the other hand, you're looking to relax in Las Vegas without being overwhelmed by the bright lights, crowded casinos and overserved singles, you can't pick a better spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Devinka
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 nights during our journey accross national parks in California, Nevada, Utah and Arizona. To summarize our experience briefly – SIMPLY EXCELLENT! To start with location: Four Seasons hotel is located at the end of the LV Strip, which we perceived as an advantage. It was quiet, luxurious, just perfect for relaxation. You can use free tram that drives you to Excalibur hotel – very convenient to get closer to the „centre“. The hotel itself: to start with, this is probably the only hotel in LV that does not have casino on the ground floor. We are no fans of gambling, but I said to myself: OK, in Vegas I will try it. After walking into casino in one of the hotels we were so shocked from all the noise and cacophony that we literally run away... So, even after staying in Vegas, we remained gambling virgins :-) ... So, if your main purpose for visiting Vegas is not gambling, this is the right hotel for you. Amenities: you can use pools belonging to Mandalay Bay – there are several of them. We enjoyed the pool with artificial waves – a lot of fun. When you prefer quiet stay at the pool, stay at the pool belonging to Four Seasons. Perfect service, great drinks and food, not crowded at all. The pool was nice, the only downside was that the water was so warm that you did not feel a lot of refreshment. To be fair – the air temperature was over 45 C and one can understand that it might be quite a challenge to keep the water colder... Other: we took a trip to Grand Canyon West Rim – flying there from LV by a small plane, then by helicopter down to Colorado river, some 20mins by boat and back by helicopter to SkyWalk and Eagle’s point and back by plane to LV. WOW, what an experience! When seeing the Grand Canyon from the plane for the first time, while listenning to Armstrong’s „What a wonderful world“, we had tears in our eyes.... Very much recommended! Yes, it is expensive, however, it is much better value for money than spending the same money in casino! Overall, great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: darch
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the glowing reviews it has received and found that we were not disappointed. My husband and I stayed with our 3 kids (12, 10, 10) in a 2 bedroom suite which was beautifully appointed, spacious, and clean. The kid were welcomed with popcorn & soda, bath sponges which spelled out their names, and toiletry kits. My husband received a birthday cake for the special occasion, and we were provided with free water bottles every night and fresh fruit in our room for our entire 5 night stay. Car rental was a breeze with the concierge, and they provided us with cold water bottles for our day trip as well. Food at the Verandah was of high quality and fantastic. The pool area was quiet and pleasant, with great service. Any issues or questions we had with the front desk were dealt with promptly and courteously, and there were never any line-ups or waits. All in all a great stay, and we would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely escape”
Reviews.Author: wabc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated above the Mandalay which gives it the best of both worlds. You get all the access to the Mandalay resort/casion/pools and action yet have private access to the Four Seasons elevators, private pool, lobby. This allows you to escape from the noisey Mandalay side to the more quiet and elegant Four Seasons when you return to your room. The Four Seasons hotel is what you'd expect from their locations, excellent quality and service. The hotel rooms also have great views of the entire strip from the room windows.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful oasis in crazy las vegas”
Reviews.Author: mommd23
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a family vacation (children 8, 9,12); it was the perfect choice for us - the service was terrific, the rooms (we get 2 adjoining rooms) were comfortable and well appointed, the pool was peaceful (I thought we would use the Mandalay Bay Pools - but they were packed with the college spring break crowd); We used Vegas as a starting and ending point for our Grand Canyon trip; and the many other comments were correct- Vegas in general is not child friendly --BUT we did have a great time with the kids -- keep in mind we stayed off of the strip in general - but especially after dark; we did not gamble or enter into the casinos (other than brief walk throughs getting to shows or restaurants); we swam at the peaceful four season's pool; we rented a car and went hiking in the Red Rocks, went horseback riding at "Old Nevada"... As previously mentioned, one of the best things about the Four Season's was it's separate entrance - not having to walk thru a casino was key!! The kids enjoyed the special treatment they received !! (so did my husband and I)

Reviews.Title: “great service, very relaxing, a wonderful oasis in the craziness of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: dorjifan
Reviews.Content: Service was wonderful, especially around the pool. Rooms were well appointed, clean and fresh. Complimentary upgrade came with a wonderful view. The private access and private pool make it an oasis from the casinos and noise of Vegas. If you miss that, just walk into the connecting Mandalay Bay casino or use their pool. Would definitely stay there again. Downsides: If you are not a walker, be warned it is at the far end of the strip but the free tram stops at Mandalay Bay as does the very cheap city transit bus. Cabs are easy to obtain. Spa is very nice but only does massage/facial services--nails etc you are referred to Mandalay Bay spa

Reviews.Title: “No haven of peace for us at 11PM”
Reviews.Author: Noheabill
Reviews.Content: This year I have had 5 visits to Four Seasons properties and we obviously have enjoyed them or would have chosen somewhere else. Our last visit has given us reason to look elsewhere. We took my in laws who have always loved staying downtown and told them we have a haven for peace on the strip in Vegas. Our first couple nights went as expected then on our last night, my mother in law (who speaks little English) decided to leave the casino around 930PM or so. We came up an hour later, we found her scared, yelling, and pounding on the wall. At the same time we heard loud music and loud voices from the room next door…The Presidential Suite. We tried to calm her down and called the front desk, they said they had asked the group to quiet down but in hind sight I doubt such was the case. Instead of doing their part to insure a peaceful stay, they refused to quiet the party and offered to move us to different rooms... AT 11PM AT NIGHT! Hey if I was at Hooters Hotel and Casino, I would understand this action by the hotel but this was the 4 seasons Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Kinnagoebay
Reviews.Content: Four Seasons, Las Vegas is a wonderful hotel. I stayed three nights with friends celebrating a special Birthday. Management obviously hire the best personnel to work here - from the valet, to reception, concierge, housekeeping and wait staff in the dining room, all were friendly, professional and extremely courteous. The FS is so well managed, no matter what time of the day (or night) we entered, or exited, it was always calm and peaceful. The lobby has stunning flower arrangements that created a tasteful tranquil ambiance... it was very relaxing. We loved the 'hidden' door to Mandalay Bay - it was nice to come and go without an audience. Four Seasons, Las Vegas is the only hotel in LV without a casino and for that alone it is worth staying. Located at the south end of the Strip, only a short walk or cab ride to the hustle and bustle, however it felt like being at least a planet away from the ‘other’ aspects of LV.

Reviews.Title: “I found paradise in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: scubagirlfromsd
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted a quiet get away for his 40th birthday. We weren't sure we would get it when we chose Las Vegas, but we did! We stayed at the Four Seasons which is a part of Mandalay Bay. From the moment that we walked in, we had incredible service! We had a room overlooking the strip--marvelous view! I had a spa appointment the first morning . What a treat! I had the best massage of my life! And I love my massages so I am pretty picky. Bonnie was the best! The spa was wonderful and you are able to access it even if you don't have a treatment. The steam shower was heavenly and the showers were luxurious! I even went down the following morning just to sit in the steam shower and take my shower down in the spa!! Next...the pool! It was the most incredible experience! My husband, who does not like to sit for very long, found himself enjoying the pool so much that we didn't move all day. Every 30 minutes they would bring around frozen fruit, popsicles, cucumbers for your eyes, they would clean your sunglasses, aloe vera toward the end of the day for any sunburns, and ice, cold water pitchers all day long. Beers came in an ice bucket. The food was amazing and they bring you your food on a bed tray. Ahhhhhhh...it was definitely the most spoiled I have ever been. And to make things even better, you could stay at this hotel and never hear the "sounds of Vegas". (No slots dinging) It was the perfect setup because if you did want to have the crazy night life of Vegas it was right there. Also, if you wanted to use the Mandalay Bay pool you were able to. We loved everything about this hotel. Not one complaint except that we had to leave. We will definitely return to this hotel. Oh, I forgot, the reason for the trip...they had a birthday cake in the room for my husband with a nice hand written card. Very thoughtful! Did I mention how much I loved this place?

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Basil46
Reviews.Content: From the peaceful and easy check-in process to the incredibly relaxing pool and the trips in the luxurious house car, the Four Seasons never failed to deliver top-notch service. Everyone has been surprised to hear that our trip to Vegas was relaxing. But it was. And it was all due to the hotel. Yes it is a little far from the center of the strip, but it easy to get there if you are looking to walk off some of the calories that you've ingested or if you just take a short cab ride or ride in the house car. But given that between the Four Seasons and Mandalay Bay you have everything you need, there's really no reason to venture out anyway. Everything at the Four Seasons was perfect and we will certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Expectations not met”
Reviews.Author: ajax79
Reviews.Content: We were an Australian family of 2 adults + 23 month old child staying for 6 nights with high expectations of our stay at the Four Seasons. Unfortunately our expectations were not met and with hindsight, we should have paid less and stayed elsewhere. Here’s why: Internet. When you’re paying USD$350+ per night, internet should be complimentary. Courtesy car. We were unable to use this service because your child needs to be aged over 6 or weigh more than 60 pounds. Four Seasons pool. It is unsuitable for young children with deep edges and steps (eg. No sloping entry). The Mandalay pools are also hard work for families with young children. Most of the pools are like the Four Seasons pool (deep and steep edges). The only pool that’s not is the wave pool zone and young kids aren’t allowed in the height restricted main wave pool. Toddlers are restricted to an area of the wave pool away from the wave area that has an arbitrary blue line that you have to keep inside of. It was hard work explaining to our toddler why they couldn’t go beyond this arbitrary blue line, especially when we’re used to waves back home at Australian beaches. Last but not least, there is no shade over the pools. In summary, we thought we would be able to let our little man wander and splash around supervised by us, but with some latitude as to what he could and couldn’t do. In reality, we had to be hyper vigilant because the pools were all deep, the pool that wasn’t deep he wasn’t allowed in 90% of it and we had to watch the dreaded blue line and we always had to be vigilant about sun burn because there was no shade – not the relaxing pool holiday we envisaged. Location. We love walking and thought the Four Season’s out of the way location would be ok, but with a youngster in tow, we really underestimated the location. For starters, getting out of the Four Seasons takes about 10 minutes due to long corridors and a big lobby area. Walking to the tram and getting to New York, New York took approx 20 minutes. If you wanted to walk to, say, the Bellagio, you’d be looking at an hour walk one way. The reason for this is that along the Strip, you can’t walk down the strip in a straight line crossing at traffic lights. To minimise pedestrian accidents, all major thoroughfares have pedestrian bridges that mean a simple 1 minute crossing becomes a 5-10 minute crossing. It’s a long way with a tired toddler. In hindsight, we wish we had investigated the bus situation earlier. For $7, you get a 24 hour pass for the gold buses that go up and down the strip every 12 minutes or so. On the positive side, the house keeping was exemplary and the staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of quiet and class in, um, Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: pfmdallas
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons is actually located on the top floors of the Mandalay Bay hotel. It has a separate lobby and drive in entrance and is also connected to the Mandalay Bay lobby by a side hallway and by a "secret" door near the casino that requires a keycard for entry. That being said, it is an oasis amidst the frenetic world that is LV. This Four Seasons hotel is very similar in character to other Four Seasons' with a high level of cleanliness, comfort, plushness and service. The views are excellent since the rooms are located on or above the 35th floor; my room on the 38th floor had a fabulous view looking up the strip and to the mountains beyond. There are 2 restaurants, the Verandah and Charlie Palmer steakhouse - they are excellent. In the Verandah, you can eat inside or outside near the pool, but screened by some palm trees and plants. In fact, I ate all my meals at the hotel instead of venturing out to the other celebrity chef places in the Mandalay Bay complex as I had originally planned to do. You have the use of all the facilities at the Mandalay Bay hotel, including the pools. But after you're done with the gaming, shopping, entertainment and whatever else you're doing, you can retreat to the peace and quiet of the Four Seasons and that is worth alot.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: MattMichRO
Reviews.Content: Booked a one bedroom suite at the Four Seasons based on a special offer and had pretty high expectations given the reputation of the chain. They did not disappoint. Service was great and I was upgraded to a sunrise-sunset suite for free--which was fantastic! Pros--quiet, elegant facility with nice amenities, great service, pool, comfortable bed, good (albeit expensive) restaurants Cons--location far down the strip, not a big fan of the host resort (Mandalay Bay), relatively pricey In all, I would consider staying here again, as I really enjoyed being able to get away from the hubbub of Vegas and relax in a private retreat.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons Las Vegas is so great we go for every summer holiday weekend”
Reviews.Author: abbey_315
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here so many times over the past two years, I figured it was time I finally write a review! Any long weekend for a summer holiday that we have (Labor Day, July 4th, Memorial Day etc.) -- we spend at the Four Seasons Las Vegas. Everything is wonderful, and the staff go above and beyond. We have a 6 month old baby, and the staff are very accomodating to him, even giving him a toy at check-in. The pool service is always amazing, and the atmosphere of the hotel is so quiet and relaxing, you'd never know you were in Las Vegas. If you have children this is DEFINITLEY the place to stay in Las Vegas- you don't have to walk through a smoky casino just to check in or see people stumbling around drunk etc. My husband and I often comment that while we are sitting by the pool it feels like we are in some exotic location, not Vegas. The weekend breakfast/brunch buffet is to die for, the freshly made mini donuts are a nice perk. I can't say anything negative about this hotel. The only thing is that the rooms are smaller and less elaborate than some of the other hotels in Las Vegas, BUT the atmosphere, location, staff etc FAR outweigh that fact!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for my 50th”
Reviews.Author: STODJC
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights from 9/25 till 9/28 to celebrate my 50th. The service is first-rate, just as it is with other Four Seasons. the one bedroom suite is worthwhile for the space, and we also had a view of the strip. It took me a day to like this hotel, but I came to like it very much and will return in January. Staff and service were superb. I strongly recommend a massage from James at the spa; after 50 minutes you'll feel 10 years younger. Verandah is a fine restaurant for breakfast, but avoid Charlie Palmer's (great food, poor service). Also spend time at the pool; it's private, relaxing and the staff is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel with outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Onthegofam4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights in mid-September and we couldn't have been happier. The staff was fantastic and very helpful. The service in the restaurant was great. The room was comfortable, clean and had a great view. It was nice to be able to escape the chaos of casinos, noise and smoke. It felt like an oasis. We travel frequently and this is now one of our favorite hotels! We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: MABD
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights on 06 & 07 September and cannot say enough positive things about it. Reception was so friendly and polite and they even upgraded our room. The rooms were high quality. What we loved most was how serene it was to return to after all the noise and hype of the Strip. The pool was great as well, very attentive service and relaxing. We would definitely stay here again if we ever go back to Vegas. Highly recommended and worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: happytraveller1408
Reviews.Content: I love staying at the four seasons, as it is at the end of the strip (so you don't feel you are in the craziness at the time but are close enought to it if you want it), there isn't a casino in the hotel itselfs, but as it is part of another hotel you have access to one if you want one. For me it is a haven in the middle of a busy resort. The service is outstanding. The rooms are perhaps not as large and grand as other hotels in vegas, but classy. I would highly recommend it if you want an elegant quiet hotel in this busy resort.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Oasis in the Middle of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Bruingirl6
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to Vegas for a quick weekend get away. The check in was seamless with no line. It was quiet and smoke-free. The pool was wonderful, they brought frozen melon around, as well as popcicles and the Evian spritzer. The excitement of Vegas was just one door away though. There is a door that takes you directly into Mandalay Bay for all of the lights, actions, and activities typical of Vegas. I don't think I'll ever stay anywhere else. Also, there way no valet line! Anywhere else in Vegas it will take 20 minutes to get your car from the valet

Reviews.Title: “Private oasis with easy access to the action.”
Reviews.Author: unclejohnny73
Reviews.Content: Another excellent Four Seasons experience. Perfect for those who enjoy the action of Vegas, but appreciate a quieter place to rest and recharge for more fun. Rooms were standard issue FS - comfortable luxury, and the private elevator to the Mandalay Bay casino floor is a major bonus. Can't help but get a great view since all rooms are on the 35-39th floors. Separate pool, restaurant and spa gets you out of the overwhelming flow of the rest of the Mandalay complex which is teeming with people, and loads of children and young adults on their way to the wave pool. Service was very good, though not to the level of some other FS hotels at which I've stayed (this is my 8th). Room service was prompt and delicious, and the concierge was able to land our preferred dinner reservation which was unavailable when we called ourselves. This is my new go-to hotel in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, I couldn't find one single fault with it.”
Reviews.Author: Hazel042
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 6 nights in a luxurious one bedroom suite. We benefited from a buy one night get one night free deal which was terrific value. The suite was spacious and luxurious. Housekeeping cleaned to a very high standard twice a day at a pre-arranged time. The verandah restaurant provided beautiful open air eating, great food and attentive staff. The pool area was wonderful and staff were on hand with towels, iced water, frozen fruit, ice lollies, evian spritzer and a sun glass cleaning service - all for free! There were ample sunbeds and no queues. We visited the Mandaly Bay casino and ate in some of the restaurants there however were always glad to slip back through the secret door to the calm oasis of the Four Seasons. This was our first experience of a Four Seasons Hotel but hopefully not our last.

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed all Expectations - and they were pretty high!”
Reviews.Author: buffgirl73
Reviews.Content: It's very rare that we go somewhere that we cannot find fault with but the Four Seasons Las Vegas fits into this category for both me and my husband. We stayed for 14 nights in a one bedroom suite and from driving up to the entrance to checking out (very sadly) it was outstanding. The room was light and airy and impeccably clean. The bed was incredibly comfortable and the sheets soft and luxurious. We've stayed in more expensive suites in Vegas before and had scratchy sheets on beds made by maids who don't seem to see the benefit of covering the entire mattress - none of that here! I love the little touches, the fact that room service give you a time and stick to it, the fact that a light went out in the shower and before I could report it, it was fixed because the maids pay real attention. Normally we put the do not disturb on once our room has been done wherever we are but not here. We loved the turndown service and the refreshing of the towels and turning on the TV to the soothing channel - very nice. The cost of the food was very reasonable bearing in mind the place we were staying and the quality was always top notch. We asked for a late checkout and got it without query despite the fact that we were leaving on a busy weekend. The pool is as everyone says here and in my opinion crowns the whole experience. Even on Labour Day weekend when it was busy you felt completely like an individual. The frozen melon balls, spritzing and sunglass cleaning just make you feel like you are at a special place added to the fact that the staff remember you. You tell them you have a hangover and they treat you accordingly - always a bonus! The menu by the pool is great too and because of the way they serve you on trays it feels as natural as eating in the Verandah restaurant. I would highly recommend the foot massage by the pool - well worth it. As everyone says the secret door to the Mandalay is a fabulous touch and you can feel the looks from other people as you go through it as you do when the masses are going to the Beach looking through the gates and we're lazing by an exclusive pool. Personally I don't feel that the Four Seasons is out of the way but we always stay at this end of the strip, when we stayed at the Venetian it felt a little weird, and it wasn't very good! We also loved the amount of dogs around the hotel, they clearly look after our canine friends which in my opinion is a big thumbs up. The only problem my husband and I face now is ever tearing ourselves away from the Four Seasons. We have already booked to go back in February despite the fact that we said we would try and new place, it's just too much of a risk. I am not one for going in to raptures about a place normally but this hotel and the people who work there would not be out of place in Knightsbridge and you can see why so many Europeans pick it.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed: didn't live up to the hype”
Reviews.Author: Bob666
Reviews.Content: We had high expectations of this hotel based on previous TA reviews, FS brand and having stayed at another FS during our West USA trip. Unfortunately, our stay did not match our expectations due to low levels of service/quality of room. On the plus side, the hotel does match up to other FS hotels/5 star hotels in respect of ambience/lobby furnishings/pool/restaurant etc. I agree with previous reviewers comments on the tranquility of the pool area/relaxed oasis compared to the Mandalay Bay pool areas; although the MB wave pool/lazy river are good fun. The access to MB casino is good (although some people perhaps get too carried away with the private entrance). The quality of the food was also good. Our issue was with the service or lack of it. We had booked the hotel via a FS preferred partner & this included a room upgrade (if available); breakfast credit, spa credit. Prior to check in, FS had requested the names of my children. I had hoped that this would lead to cookies with my kids names on or a small gift with names on (as per some other 5 star hotels that we stayed at during our trip). No such luck, my kids received a packet of anonymous pop corn. On check-in, we were told that we had been given an upgraded room. Unfortunately, when we reached our room we only had an excellent view of R15, I realised that we had not been upgraded. When I called the front desk, I was told that we hadn't been upgraded and there was no opportunity to upgrade as the hotel was full (even though I was willing to pay for an upgrade). Not a big issue in itself as there was no guaranteed upgrade but not so great when you're told by check-in desk that you have been upgraded. Then on one of our visits to the pool, the poolside staff brought some towels to our chairs but no seat covers. No big issue as we went into the pool. Then my wife got out of the pool & waited for someone to bring her a seat cover. After 5 mins, I got out of the pool & asked someone to bring over some seat covers & got back into the pool. After another 10 mins of being ignored & comments from my wife, I had to get out of the pool & go over to ask again for the seat covers. Eventually they came with an apology 15 mins later from whoever was in charge of the poolside service. Again not a major issue but hardly the "cleaning your sun glasses" first class platinum poolside service that other guest rave on about. We had the same issue on another trip to the pool but I'd learned my lesson from the previous day & went directly over to the towel service to fetch them myself! I don't expect staff to grovel & bow as soon as my family arrive at the pool but some level of consistent service would have been good. I noticed some family's received the royal service: maybe I should have brought more $ to poolside. The AC in the room was very poor. The bell boy agreed & said that he could obtain a fan from housekeeping to keep the room cooler: so there was some quality service from someone at FS LV. When the temperature is 100F+ & the A/C claims to be at 60F but is in reality at 80F, it sums up a hotel that thinks its number one in LV for service and quality but the reality is alot different. On check out, we were overcharged for breakfast despite our credit. I wasn't even given the full breakfast credit as noted in my confirmation but by this stage I couldn't be bothered to question the point. I left the hotel disappointed with at least the thought that I wouldn't need to waste $$$ to be at the wrong end of the Strip again + the hope that MO hotel might live up to its hype! My overall impression is that the hotel doesn't try too hard to please as it doesn't need to.

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: MarMourinho
Reviews.Content: Great suite with a great view to the strip. The Hotel is very quite what is rare in Las Vegas because has no Casino, but has a direct elevator to the closest one, so you are in a exclusive place with a fast access to all entertainment. The concierge is simply the best we had ever had and the service is quite good. The pool area is a bit small, but once more you have direct access to other pools. The food at breakfast is delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Wow what a peaceful haven amid chaos”
Reviews.Author: EmilyCharlie
Reviews.Content: We are young and up for partying and gambling - however we didn't want to have a casino in our hotel (i.e. having to walk through an enormous casino just to get to the front desk). The Four Seasons is perfect. Whilst all other hotels are huge (with rooms in excess of 1000), the Four Seasons only has about 300 rooms and as a result you feel the service is very personal. It has its own nice entry. On arrival we were treated very well and taken to the front deak where the check-in was quick. The rooms are all on 34-38 floors of Mandalay Bay. Great views. I am scared of heights but I was surprised at how well I slept. This was probably due to the very comfortable room. Huge bed, soft sheets, L'Occitane toiletries (heaven!), turn down service was nice and convenient. Very quiet corridor. Lovely. Pool-side again was a haven compared to the next door choas of Manadalay Bay with fast food, tattoos and beers. It worth pointing out that you can't here this despite being close. We went into the pool area to try out the wave pool and lazy river of the Manadaly Bay which was fun but we were so happy to return to our haven of the Four Seasons. Service around the pool is top-class, just what you need in the hot temperatures. Frequently refreshed our iced water, cleaned our sunglasses and gave us froxen snickers (just what you feel like surprisingly). Great gym with all the amenities you would expect of a world-class hotel. Loved being able to go through the 'secret door' into the Mandalay Bay Casino. This meant that we could 'opt-into' gambling/bars/ restaurnats whenever we felt like it. Only downside is that the hotel is right at the end of the strip so you have to get cabs to get to the middle. Although the walk to Luxor/Excalabar/New YOrkNewYork is fun, it does take time. We arrived late to a rest reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless.”
Reviews.Author: SallyandDarren
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for our wedding anniversary in July. We had stayed here the previous year for our honeymoon and loved it. (See previous review). On arrival at the hotel we checked in effortlessly and our room was beautiful, overlooking the pools. Everything was as it was on our last visit, lovely furnishings, nice bathrobes and L'occitane products. A plate of strawberries with dipping chocolate was waiting for us on the table with another handwritten letter from the manager welcoming us back to the Four Seasons. The facilities of the pool are amazing, the staff so helpful and eager to please. I just loved walking through the corridors of this wonderful hotel with its eucalyptus scent coming from the spa, luxurious decor and the subtle classiness and elegance. The little touches make this hotel special. We were jetlagged on our first morning, waking around 4am, I went down to the pool area to look around and the night manager was there. He asked me about our trip and where we were from and told me that it was particularly hot at this time and to be safe in the sun. He said if there was anything we needed, not to hesitate to ask and they would accommodate us. Very friendly and kind. There was also complimentary tea/coffee and pastries (amazing) in the lobby each morning for guests to enjoy along with newspapers. Unfortunately, we had to leave early due to a family illness. Concierge were fantastic in assisting us to get a flight back to the UK that same night. I was quite upset whilst my husband was sorting our flight out and the concierge came over with bottles of water for me and my husband I feel that I had to mention the little details in this review to give readers an idea of the quality service of this hotel. It was personal and warm and I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to any traveller. If you want flashy and huge go to Bellagio or Wynn but if you want class and elegance then stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Wedding and Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: marlee576
Reviews.Content: We hosted our destination wedding at the Four Seasons in Aug. Our group stayed for 4 nights. The hospitality of the hotel and the wedding coordination was beyond our expectations and we had high expectations. Dennis, was our event liaison and he was on point through out the wedding planning and on the day of the wedding. We had a family brunch at the hotel's Veranda Restaurant- great food, lots of selections and beautiful setting! On the first night we received a complimentary antipasto and cheese tray with our turn down service. On our wedding night, we were greeted with champagne and chocolate covered strawberries. We have stayed at other hotels along the strip when visiting Las Vegas and during this stay we went out every night to enjoy restaurants, shows and casinos offered by other hotels, but it was nice to be able retreat to the quiet and comforts of the FSLV. Most of our guests stayed at this hotel as we were able to arrange a group discount and it was family friendly for our guests who had children. Everyone enjoyed the pool, the lovely rooms and the food, but above all everyone noted the amazing staff service. Fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotle that could be better...”
Reviews.Author: other21968
Reviews.Content: I had chosen this hotel because I needed a relaxing and quiet spot in Vegas, because as you know Vegas is quite noisy and agitated. The location of the hotel is correct, 40 minutes walk from Hotel Monte Carlo on the strip. I will relate two facts that could give you better idea of the hotel. Before booking, I wrote mail to hotel to ask if the was any music playing by the pool. I was answered that no music was playing near the pool. This was exactly what I was looking for. Big disappointment when I arrived: there was pop music playing all around the pool. Certainly, the volume was less loud that the next door hotel, but I was given false information. I told the reception that it was too bad that this hotel, not supposed to be like all the others in Vegas (it has no casino...) would gain on keeping the pool as a quiet zone. The second remark is about the laundry. I gave my long sleeve shirt to laundry to wash. It had the left arm cufflink that was missing. When I received my shirt back the next morning, they had sewn a new cufflink on the shirt with no extra charge. I was pleasantly surprised. By the way, they have wireless internet...at your charge (just a 24H formula, not even possible to subscribe for one hour). It is a deception that such a hotel doesn't offer free internet to its clients. In conclusion, it is a good hotel but a bit expensive.

Reviews.Title: “The best service in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: brianloasangeles
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at most of the mega-hotels in Vegas, and in many respects, they are all quite alike. The newest properties all have nice rooms (some larger than others). They all have a nice selection of restaurants and lots of sizzle. However, they all lack the same thing: service. For example: parking....you either park in a large structure and hike in, or you valet and wait 20 minutes for your car. Front desk: a line. Pool: large and good for large groups. you get the idea...large and impersonal. The Four Seasons is a stark contrast to these mega resorts. It's like a small hotel that happens to be within the Mandalay Bay, thus offering the best of both worlds. The Four Seasons offers great service...your car is brought up right away, the staff knows your name, there is service by the pool (although not quite up to par with other Four Seasons), the rooms are very comfortable with great beds, towels, bath products, etc. Because it is high up in the Mandalay, all rooms have nice views. If you feel like gambling, you go to the Mandalay. If you don't want it, it's not in your face. The Four Seasons is a great hotel. I don't think it measures up to many of the chains other hotels, but it is great for Vegas standards, a place where service is non-existent. My only gripe, as with many hotels, is that they charge for internet. I have never understood why lower end hotels, such as Holiday Inns, give free internet, but the expensive properties do not. Come on....throw it in...charging $15/day makes your guests feel like you are nickling and diming.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of peace and pampering in Las Vegas but close to all the action.”
Reviews.Author: lancetomooka
Reviews.Content: Went with my wife for a long labor day weekend getaway. We've stayed once before and loved it last time and loved it just as much this time. It's such a different experience compared to any other hotel in Vegas. The lobby is steps from the valet and had no line to wait in for check in. Bottled water handed to you as you check in. The lobby and the rest of the hotel for that matter is quiet and peaceful. The rooms are very nice (my wife appreciated the very high end shampoo, conditioner, soap, and lotion by L'Occitaine) but certainly not the reason to stay here. The pool is a very short walk from the elevators instead of the usual trek you have to make for the larger hotels. They set up a chair for you with towels and a pitcher of ice water. The attendants were handing out free popcicles for everyone at the pool and also came by with fruit slices and spritzes of Evian. All the amenities of the Mandalay are available and are just out the door from the elevator only accessible to Four Seasons guests. The contrast is stark as soon as you open that door that leads to the hustle and bustle of the main casino area. The last thing to mention is that the valet service is wonderful... hardly have to wait for your car at all and our luggage arrived at our room within minutes of us finding our room. My wife also wants me to say that the spa is the best she's ever experiencd. Definitely worth a splurge!

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: kendrsh51
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing! It is a must if you are going to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Top marks for customer service and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Tommo5434
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our wedding in October 2009 (got married at the Graceland Chapel - brilliant Elvis!), mainly because of excellent tripadvisor reviews, and couldn't have picked a better spot. The position of this hotel at the edge of the strip means that it is just near enough the action to be convenient (there is a regular monorail if you don't fancy the 10 min walk to main strip) but far enough away to be peaceful and a welcome break from the madness. The rooms, although possibly not as flashy as some other hotels, are spotless (beds are sooooo comfortable) and the strip view rooms have amazing views over Vegas. The hotel itself is beautiful and the staff very attentive to all your needs, with excellent personal service and attention to detail. The restaurant staff in particular were really helpful in planning my reception, which was a really lovely evening. The pool area is excellent and was never too crowded on weekdays. I loved the little touches such as free popsicles and evian spritzes. What was great is that we could use the Manadalay Bay pool (which was bigger and busier, with a wave machine etc) but the Mandalay guests weren't allowed to use ours (one day we saw some Mandalay guests looking through the gate at our pool with longing looks). The Four Seasons pool was a little slice of tranquility that I really enjoyed (except on the weekend when it did get a little crowded, although we still managed to get beds easily enough). The whole experience of staying at the Four Seasons felt very special and exclusive - especially when you walked the main strip and saw guests from other hotels lugging their cases through the main casinos to get to their rooms. With the Seasons being a non-gaming hotel, there was none of that nonsense. We also noticed that the other hotel lobbys (being casinos) were full of sales people stopping you and trying to give you free stuff if you look at timeshares etc - this sort of carry on was noticeably absent at the non-gaming Four Seasons, and it was always a relief to have a haven away from all of the madness, where customer service didn't depend upon how much you were gambling or whether you wanted to buy property or not! For those who want to be close to a casino, however, the Four Seasons is still handy for the Mandalay Bay casino, which is accessed via the main lobby lift and a strange little unmarked connecting door (again, we could get into the Mandalay to use their facilities but the Mandalay guests couldn't get into the Four Seasons, so it never got too crowded). Basically, if you'd like to enjoy Vegas in style and don't want to be right in the centre of the madness 24/7, you can't go wrong with the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “My husband and I have been coming here...”
Reviews.Author: NM-Foodie-57
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been coming here annually for almost ten years, and I can honestly say that every person should experience the Four Seasons Las Vegas at least once in their life (more if you can manage it). Staying at a Four Seasons hotel is unlike any other experience in that the staff will take every opportunity to dazzle you without seeming disingenuous: they sincerely want you to be delighted! (Hey ... If there's some happiness pills in the water, I want some of the pills and the water!)

Reviews.Title: “All I can say is WOW!”
Reviews.Author: Shar70
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked in the door we knew we had made the right decision. This hotel is such a nice break from the sights and sounds of the trip even if you are coming to Vegas to go to casinos and enjoy the night life. The pool, although small, is quiet and relaxing with a very attentive staff (and yes, they do bring around little treats every hour). The pool side food is decent and our room service dinner hit the spot. The hotel even sent up a little birthday cake for me when my husband had mentioned that the trip was a birthday gift for me. They have a small but nice fitness center that even supplies headphones for the TV if you don't have your own and a water and Gatorade dispenser. There is easy access to Mandalay Bay for restaurants, gambling and bars plus a little tram that takes you over to Excalibur which is just across the street from MGM and New York, NY. The only warning that I will make is that it is at the very end of the strip and the blocks are LONG. We ended up taking $15 cab rides if we were going any farther than MGM although we did manage to take the "house car" on a few occasions which was very nice. I would not have picked this hotel if not for all the positive reviews on this site and I am so happy that I did!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice of hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnHarrisDerby_UK
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on the basis of other reviews. They're right - it's a great hotel and base for a stay in Las Vegas. The Mandalay Bay swimming pools are great for kids but it's really nice to be able to retreat to the calm of the Four Seasons. The big strip hotels are visit locations in themselves but seeing them close up made us realise how nice and relaxing this hotel is. Stand out points are; great service from everyone, attention to detail, easy booking experience, great room, it's so different from all the other hotels. I would strongly recommend this hotel as a great venue.

Reviews.Title: “The "Can Do" Hotel with a Smile”
Reviews.Author: AroundtheWorld
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many high end properties around the world, but I have to say that this arises up near the top of my list....something I did not expect for Vegas. From the moment I set foot on the property, their "can do" service won me over. We arrived early and didn't expect immediate check-in, but they made us comfortable and our room was ready a little after noon even though check-in wasn't officially until 3. They also let us stay until 4 on the last day which made this a five day, three night stay. They upgraded us (Platinum Am Ex Fine Hotels program) to a lovely strip view room that was large with an accomodating bathroom that had the best hotel shower I have ever experienced. Nightly turndown service and cleanliness...perfect. We enjoyed the Verandah Restaurant for breakfast each day with a larger-than-expected continental breakfast. The impeccable service followed us to an evening meal and when we were needing to hurry to get to the Miss Universe Preliminaries in Mandalay Bay, they did it. Could they take the leftovers to our room? "Can do." The food were there, nicely wrapped up, when we came back from the pageant. We spent our mornings at the pool which included service I have never experienced. One young man named Craig (studying hotel management...he'll do well) went by us in a little trafficked area of the pool, saw we weren't set up yet with chair coverings and towels, dropped what he was doing immediately, and came back with the goods plus cold water. About the time you think the heat is going to overcome you, a pool attendant comes by with something....an ice cold cloth, a popsicle, frozen fruit, a cold Evian water spritz on your face....an offer for a drink or food....and my personal favorite, sunglass cleaning. The pool is refreshing with a life guard on duty which also keeps things in order.. We used Mandalay Bay for restaurants and other services since it was just out the door from our elevators. However, after coming back into our elevator area one night (you can only get in with a room key card...good security), we stepped into the encove of the Four Seasons and both of us sighed at the same time. It was so nice and quiet and elegant. Concierge services were great. She nabbed us a window table with a great view of the Ballagio fountains before our "O" Cirque show. Wherever we went, this hotel said, "What do you want?" With our request, they said, "Can do," and they said it with a smile. What more could a person ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: PALMA2430
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel, great pool, so peaceful unlike Mandalay Bay pool area! The pool and pool bar staff were brilliant, very helpful and so friendly. Rooms are a good size as is the bathroom and there was plenty wardrobe space. Wouldn't hesitate recommending this hotel or returning

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for family trip--something for both adults and kids”
Reviews.Author: tinapage
Reviews.Content: We chose Four Seasons because it allowed us to use the Mandalay Bay pools and also stay in a property that was of high quality. We were given a great upgrade to a suite that was complimentary, which they may have done since it was vacant and we were a couple traveling with one almost-teen child. Our son took the fold-out couch and enjoyed living like a mini-Trump in the living room while we had a great bedroom to ourselves. Great food by the pool, easy access to Mandalay Bay, and close to trams to visit other hotels. Thanks to the Four Season for a great room. I will note that since we have visited India and experienced that country's impeccable hotel service at the high end, most American hotels cannot compare, but the Four Seasons at least attempts to give it. Everyone was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel and oasis of calm in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: napurpleh
Reviews.Content: As we preparing for our visit to Las Vegas I had started apologising to the family for not having picked one of the more 'exciting' hotels in Las Vegas as there are no rollercoasters, gondolas, lions or tropical rainforests here. But I couldn't have picked a better location - given how loud and bright Las Vegas is it was lovely to be able to come back to the hotel to a quiet calm atmosphere. The casino of the Mandalay Bay hotel and all its facilities are open to Four Seasons guests so if you crave the nightlife it is a few steps away. But the Four Seasons was fantastic - excellent staff, great rooms, lovely food and we all felt very spoilt during our stay there, and as I say a real oasis of calm in the midst of a very lively city! The only disappointment was that everywhere else we stayed during our holiday had free wifi and this hotel didn't - given it was by far and away the most expensive hotel we stayed in disappointed that this couldn't stretch to free wifi for guests.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and Gorgeous Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: RennmausHamburg
Reviews.Content: This hotel definately deserves its number one position of the all Vegas hotels! We slept like a baby in the wonderfully cozy bed and the room was so spacious, elegant and immaculate. Housekeeping comes in the morning and in the evening! Returning in the evening from the town was a pleasure as a dim light welcomed us to the room and the tv was turned on a relaxing wellness channel. A lot of attention to details made the room also a pleasure to stay in. There was no resort fee, but valet parking does cost at this hotel as well as the high speed internet offered. The room also has a lockable refrigerator with a mini bar, snacks (all these items except the coffee provided do have a fee) as well as plenty of spacious areas to store clothes. A safe is provided as well. About the hotel: The Four Seasons is located within the Mandalay Bay on floors 35 and above. The reception is also at floor level but kept separate from the Mandalay Bay reception and the elevators from reception take you directly to the floors of the Four Seasons as well as the casino and pool. Four Seasons guests may also use the Mandalay Bay pools and wave pool as well as the Four Seasons pool. Would we consider staying at this hotel again in Vegas? Definately yes!

Reviews.Title: “The only way to tolerate Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ccs4756
Reviews.Content: What more can I say that hasn’t already been said? Oh, I know, no one mentions the best perk of all: the house car. Yes, on a first come, first serve basis, you can be dropped off anywhere on the strip in a Mercedes S-Class by the Four Seasons driver… for free (please, be classy and tip the driver though). As for the hotel, I cannot imagine staying anywhere else in Las Vegas. Even the more up-scale hotels (Wynn, Bellagio, Venetian) are limited and handicapped by their true focus: gaming. The only improvement that I can suggest is an upgrade in toilet paper; seriously, I’m staying at the Four Seasons, some 2-ply fluffy stuff would be nice! As an aside, I notice that several people mentioned bringing their kids. Perhaps it’s okay if you’re using this place to recoup from a long flight and are continuing on to a national park in Utah the next morning, but I saw WAY too many kids on the Strip (even at night). If you’re debating whether or not to bring your children to Las Vegas: just don’t do it.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay ever!”
Reviews.Author: jp5150
Reviews.Content: Expensive? Sort of. Worth it? Absolutely, positively YES! My family came with me and were treated (kids ages 8 and 10) like royalty without stuffiness. Best staff. Best beds. Best rooms. Best pool (yes, even for the kids). Amazing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon Stay - Peace in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: markstravels
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at the Four Seasons Las Vegas during our USA honeymoon adventure and we loved it. They were the ONLY hotel throughout our 3 week trip that acknowledged we were on honeymoon and subsequently upgraded us to a strip view room on the 39th (top) floor with great view and presented us with a little card and chocolate gift. A little gesture that went a long way. Hotel was a peaceful oasis as previously mentioned from the Vegas chaos and lets you have a bit of both worlds. We spent the days relaxing by the hotel pool, which was faultless in terms of service and set up with free ice water, ice pops, towels, sun screen, evian spritz etc etc, and was then able to pop north up the strip in the evening to experience the craziness that is Las Vegas. We found the staff super helpful and the concierge knowledgable and efficient at arranging tickets/tours. We booked Lion King Tickets (AMAZING show) and Maverick Grand Canyon helicopter tour through them. The room was large with all modern comforts. Large seperate Bathroom and good toiletries. Only real let down was the lack of free Wi-Fi - costing $14 a day. Maybe a little dated in terms of decor but pleasant all the same. Rooms were serviced 3-4 times a day and were very clean. Sampled the Verandah restaurant - reasonable price and good quality food. half price martini's between 4 and 6 pm Only possibly downside, with the Wi-Fi, is the location. It is at the end of the boulevard and it will take you up to 1.5 hrs to walk to the other end of the strip. Overall......we loved it and would stay again for a relaxing Vegas holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: OlgaandJan
Reviews.Content: The Four seasons is a hotel located on the 35th till 39th floor of the Mandalay Bay. The difference is that there are only 300 something rooms, so you feel like a customer and not like a number. We had an upgrade to a suite, so were extra happy. We asked a prolongation and we got it for anothe rnight for the same rate, Getting to the hustle and bustle of the casine it was just by opening a connection door, which could only be entered with your roomkey. Otherwise you could use all the facilities (restaurants, pools etc) of the Mandalay Bay. Room was beautifull and the view stunning. We loved it. The restaurant Verandah in the hotel was good. We had breakfast and finally good coffe (we are European and most coffee in US is for us like tea).

Reviews.Title: “LV was boiling, but FS service took care of every need.”
Reviews.Author: KRRG1
Reviews.Content: Yes, we actually visit LV in the summer! THere are great deals and everyone is happy to have you. This is the second time we've been to the Four Seasons in Las Vegas and they did it again -- nothing could have been better. They always figure out how to make it work.
