While at the pool (the ONLY way to deal with the heat) they make sure we have plenty of water, cool towels, Evian spritzer, cucumbers for the eyes, food/drink when we need it and of course fabulous foot massages. The rooms are well appointed and we've had good views in each. Definitely worth the price!

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel touches the skies”
Reviews.Author: mir_nasir
Reviews.Content: i stayed there for almost 10 days in May during CA World 2010 Event. Its nice and awesome hotel. Top 5 Floors from 35-40th Floor of Mandalay Bay is Four Seasons hotel. It has got very nice view, you will see who Vegas from your room window. Rooms are nice and good service. Liked the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Arash-GTR
Reviews.Content: The best hotel I have every stayed in the U.S Amazing rooms with great views, top of the line health care products in washrooms, and very large comfortable rooms. The reason we chose this hotel was because it was the only 5 star hotel in Vegas which allows dogs. We were given bottled water for our dog and treats on a daily basis. Fantastic Service all around.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to paradise.”
Reviews.Author: Smaaaarty
Reviews.Content: Our holiday did not get off to a good start with our flight being late due to bad weather and had to stay a night in the airport i phoned 4 seasons to explain that we would not be able to check in until the next day they said no problem we will deduct a nights rate from you bill i thought great most hotels would not do that.On arrival we were greated with smiles and check in was smooth our room had the best view on the strip looking towards MGM ,the beds were high standard and comfy,shower products were made by Loccitane and they were great .The 3 express lifts were the best with no waiting lines and a secret door to access the casino floor near the Mandalay check in desk.The pool is great and relaxing with ice creams iced water included, we visited the beach at MB but is was so busy we did a u turn fast .To sum it all up if you want to stand in line for a lift to your room or check in or fight for space at ther pool dont come here go to Mandalay Bay if you want relax stress free and great service and free ice creams pay the extra and come to The Four Seasons Las Vegas its your choice !.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: DizWiz99
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night with my wife and two young daughters on our way to Zion NP, Bryce Canyon & North Rim. Great for families that are looking for a place to start or end such a vacation in style. They take great care of all from beginning to end. Spent time at the pool and service & food there was excellent also. Only slight negatives... Very small shower in guest room and lots of stuff floating in and on the bottom of the pool. Never ventured over to Mandalay Bay. Why bother?

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay *.”
Reviews.Author: Funkydaddy59
Reviews.Content: My family enjoyed our 1 week stay at the Four Seasons, Las Vegas Our family holiday was not without a few surprises. We were warned during check in about the rock concert to be held on Saturday night. We were told we might be aware of it but possibly not. During the summer, every Saturday an outdoor rock concert blasts from the Mandalay Bay pool area from 9pm to midnight. Our south facing 37th floor room pulsated to the booming bass of Ziggy Marley and his reggae group. We were not able to get any sleep till the show ended. (this was the day we arrived, and as we are from the eastern time zone we finally were allowed to sleep at 3 am, our time) Standing next to my Harley Davidson Road King at full throttle in an enclosed garage is less bassy than Ziggy Marley 37 floors below. We were surprised that the temperature in our air conditioned room the first night was 80 degrees F. The day we arrived the outside air temperature was 115 degrees F. The thermostat in our room was set at 60 degrees F, the lowest it could go. The hotel was not able to find us a quieter or cooler room the first night of our stay, the hotel was full. Fortunately the temperature dropped by a few derees for the balance of our say and we kept our curtains closed. By the end of our stay the night time temperature in our room was 73 degrees F. There were many positives to staying at this hotel. The most guests I ever saw at the front desk was 2, by comparison the Wynn and Bellagio had hundreds when I visited them. The concierge service was first rate helping get choice show seats, restaurant reservations, helicopter tour seats, handling my car rental and arranging the return of my lost video camers from a restaurant at the MGM Grand were I had mistakingly left it (perhaps due to sleep deprivation the first night.) The secretive access to the Mandalay Bay was an enjoyable diversion. But the difference between the Four seasons and Mandalay Bay (by going through the door) was the closest I would like to come to shizophrenia. The valet parking service was first rate and provided cold bottled water to all car occupants. The pool was great and the service at the pool was great, they even provide free sunscreen. However the "free" cold snacks, sunglass cleaning and evian spritzing were spotty. I only received one of each during the 10 hours or so I spent pool side during my 3 visits to the pool. I find the glowing reviews of this hotel somewhat off the mark, while a wonderful hotel it certainly is far from heaven on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Retreat in a crazy city!”
Reviews.Author: Merlin5
Reviews.Content: Having heard about the level of service in Four Seasons I must say that whilst service was very good - it was nothing more than we've received at other hotels of a similar star rating. Having observed other hotel receptions whilst we were in Las Vegas what I can say is that there was never a queue to check in or check out or for the elevators - which is something we saw at most other hotels we visited. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived but they took our mobile (even though its a UK one) and called and texted as soon as it was. We had booked a Strip View King and got what we booked. The room was, as others have commented, a regular sized room - nothing ostentatious. It had plenty of storage space and the bathroom was reasonably spacious with an excellent shower. I was surprised that internet access was not included in the room rate. We were perfectly aware of the location of the hotel - that it is at the end of the strip and this didn't really cause us any problems. We started off by using the tram link to the Luxor and Exalibur and then walking to the tram that links the rest of the strip - but it was so hot when we were there - 113 degrees that I just couldn't handle the heat at the stations and after that we used taxis to get around which weren't as expensive as I had feared (but then I'm used to the price of London taxis). Talking of the heat, the one complaint I have about our room was that the air conditioning just couldn't keep the room to temperature - it never got cold enough. We reported it to reception and they sent someone up while we were out but I can't say that it made any difference. However we did notice that a lot of public areas in several of the hotels were quite warm - so I think it was to do with the extreme heat at the time. It was my birthday during this trip and the hotel sent up a very delicious cake which was a nice touch. The best thing about the hotel for us was that it was so quiet and calm - you could have the noise and bustle of Vegas just by walking through the door to the Mandalay Bay - but then escape back to tranquility when you wanted to. I know this wouldn't suit a lot of people but it was just right for us. We got a reasonable rate as we booked the 3 for 2 nights deal. If we return to Las Vegas, and we can get a good rate, I would definitely choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Elegance in a Noisy City”
Reviews.Author: Vinzeph
Reviews.Content: I got a wonderful deal through the internet ($110/nite) so I decided to book the Four Seasons, although we would have prefer to stay somewhere in the middle of the Strip. But because of the great deal we got, we decided to stay at the Four Seasons even it was a bit out of the way. Upon check in, the hotel was almost in full capacity and the room category that we booked was no longer available. So the nice gentleman at the check in counter upgraded us to a suite with a separate living room and bedroom. We feel we hit the jackpot and we totally enjoyed our stay. It is connected to the Mandalay Bay so it was easy to go around. After a very tiring (but exciting) day of walking, drinking, eating and gambling, it is always nice to come back to a serene, elegant environment and have a very good night sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - but not really Vegas”
Reviews.Author: UKLizzie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night when I was passing through Vegas and it was offered at a good rate. It offered exactly what I expected from a Four Seasons; wonderful service, lovely rooms, and a quiet, calm and upscale atmosphere. I confess to being slightly disappointed though. Many Vegas hotels offer such luxury that the FS room was nothing special by comparison, and it was much smaller than those at the Venetian or Encore for instance. And if you are looking to explore Vegas, then the location is not ideal, being on the top few floors of Mandalay Bay which is at the far south end of the Strip. The service was wonderful, and it was lovely not having to wait in line to check in, and the quiet serenity would be a nice escape from the Strip as part of a longer stay, but it is a bit removed from what I would consider a real Vegas experience to be.

Reviews.Title: “Defines 'perfection'”
Reviews.Author: CanadaFamily
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively for business and pleasure. I had some trepidation about going to Vegas with a young child and chose the Four Seasons as it is away from the insanity of the strip, while close enough to make accessing shows possible. Others may find the location too far from the strip action; for me that is the appeal. Check in was smooth. Many hotels give small children a 'goodie bag' and these are always a treat to my DD. At this hotel, however, she was given a full sized stuffed animal. She was floored. The private lobby area and elevator allows you to forget that you are connected to a mega resort, but the Mandalay facilities are there when you want them. We had hoped to use the wave pool at Mandalay, but DD was just under the height limit. I expected tears. Instead, she just asked to go back to the Perfect Pool-- the name she gave the Four Seasons Pool. It wasn't the pool itself which she loved, but the staff who catered to her every 6 yr old whim. The pitcher of ice water at our side, the frozen fruit... we spent hours at the pool each day. The lifeguards were attentive to safety, but warm and welcoming. The concierge staff embraces children and has a list of suggested restaurants and activities which are 'spot on'. The front door staff were so warm and welcoming that we felt we were coming home each day. The restaurant, while pricey, is quality and we loved having lunch at the pool. This is, bar none, the best hotel I have stayed at in terms of quality service. Attentive, but never intrusive. I would go back to Vegas simply to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Expected More. Better Hotels in Town”
Reviews.Author: jpmex
Reviews.Content: Really don't know why its posted as No 1. I've stayed at much nicer rooms at Encore, Bellagio, Wynn and Palazzo, which all have big rooms in comparison, better technology as controlled entertainment, curtains, lighting, etc. Four Seasons is updated. Looks they changed some lamps, rugs and curtains, but everything else is old. Never was greeted by my name. When we cheked in, it was early. They told me they would call me as soon as my room was ready. Never called. The only nice people where the car valet, helpful and liked the detail of putting cold water bottles in the car, although sometimes missed it. Expected more from room service in quality and response. I requested a type of cereal, they did not have it, a fruit, not either. I was surprised the attendant was sincere by saying they where out of many things. Quality was bad: cold toast, overcooked eggs, etc. For the price payed, would never come back at this location. I was dissapointed to see they manage the name Four Seasons compared to locations as London, Paris, Chicago or New York. They might as well change its name to Four Seasons Express.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in the Desert”
Reviews.Author: bekntony
Reviews.Content: We spent three days in the Four Seasons in Vegas for our first trip there last week. I was not sure what to thnk of the hotel after hearing it didn't have the "Vegas Casino" feel and there were no machines around. That lasted until I went into some of the other hotels where you were overrun by the smoke and noise of the casino when you walked in the door. The staff was extremely attentive (as usual at Four Seasons) and pleasant. If you want to be able to enjoy Vegas but not be stuck so to speak in "Vegas" then I would recommend the Four Seasons. The rooms are not extravagant but very adequate with GREAT beds, huge bathrooms and exceptional service. I would recommend the strip view as it's worth the few extra dollars. The bar has 1/2 Martini's every day during happy hour and the appetizer menu is priced well. The Four Seasons gives you what you would expect from a Four Season and nothing less. You get to "get into Vegas" without being stuck in it so to speak. If you looking for a bunch of insanity right away when you walk into your hotel then go down to New York, New York but if you are looking to be able to get into and out of Vegas without ever leaving then I would highly recommend the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis amid the chaos of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: southendgirlfriend
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons has always been exceptional every time I've stayed there and the Vegas location did not disappoint. We chose FS over our conference hotel because we didn't want to stay in a smoking/ casino establishment. The FS was immaculate, serene, and a total oasis, detached from the general activity of Vegas yet easily accessible through Mandalay Bay. The pool area was just unbelievably beautiful and spa like. The fitness center and spa were amazing. The room was huge, and well appointed. The marble bathroom was as large as a bedroom, with separate tub and limestone shower. Nice Occitaine products. The beds were luxurious, with feather beds, down comforters and pillows, and beautiful sheets. Concierge service was top notch. Food was great. Terrific coffee in the morning. Valet service very speedy. All what you expect from the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect way to stay in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: mkss
Reviews.Content: We came back to Las Vegas to celebrate my husband's 40th birthday. The Four Seasons is a sanctuary away from the hustle and bustle of the Strip and the casinos - so you can enjoy the best of both worlds. The quality of the room, cleanliness, service and restaurants are all top notch. We like the location at the end of the Strip. Travelling along the Strip is not difficult with a combination of the free Mandalay Bay to Excalibur monorail, and then the short walk to the MGM Grand monorail station - or if you can stand the heat it is walkable. During our stay we used the Spa and took Afternoon Tea, both were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed and quiet”
Reviews.Author: love2travel2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and really liked, it. We came right from Mandarin Oriental, and even though the service is a notch better at the MO pool and it is newer, We liked the FS better especially when travelling with children. The rooms are more about understated luxury and more comfortable, If I am to say one thing they could improve on it would be that orders made by the pool took a very long time to arrive and this was every time. The"hidden" door at the casino level comming from Mandalay Bay is really difficult to find if you dont know it is there so do yourself a favour and get of the the casino level at the FS elevator the first time and peak out the door so you know where it is. We had breakfast by the pool every day, and I can really recommend their "Healthy Start" - this was really good.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven”
Reviews.Author: beechbabe1222
Reviews.Content: My husband and I go to Vegas every year for our anniversary. We stayed at the Four Seasons Las Vegas twice. The service cannot be compared with any other hotel. Just to try to compare, we were married at the Bellagio and that was beautiful and we stayed at the Ritz Carlton Lake Las Vegas 3 years, but once we stayed at the Four Seasons that was it for us. It begins with check in, you couldn't feel more special. They take you on a tour of the hotel so you know where everything is. Then at the pool, it's the comfortable lounge chairs, it's the constant filling up of fresh iced lemon water, to the fresh fruits all day long. If that's not enough, the Evian spritz along with the sunglass butler. I had bought a pair of sunglasses from the Coach store where I live and when the arm was loose I asked if they could fix it. I was told no, but the sunglass butler not only fixed them but cleaned them as well, they looked better than when I bought them. The day of our anniversary there were chocolate covered strawberries in our room and we were able to bring a bottle of champagne to the pool that was given to us as a gift. I love everything about the hotel and will not stay anywhere else when returning to Vegas. The only down side to this hotel is that they charge $15 per day for internet service.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons - Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: twinponds21
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful escape in Las Vegas. I stayed there for 5 days with my daughter. We loved the pool side service. The pool staff was very attentive and we enjoyed having the little extras like - cold pitchers of ice water, freezies, popsicles and frozen fruit in the 100+ degree weather. I would recommend visiting the other hotels but I would definitely stay at the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay - worth the extra cost”
Reviews.Author: daveybigpotatoes
Reviews.Content: Couldn’t fault this hotel – very good from the moment of our arrival right up to departure. We stayed in a strip view room which was worth the extra money – great to be able to see all the vegas has to offer but reside in a lovely calm oasis. Private pool and wait staff whilst bathing were excellent. We went to Mandalay Bay for an hour and realised that the four season’s private pool was a real bonus. Sunday brunch was expensive ($35 each) but a luxurious splurge. Having the restaurant and facilities of the Mandalay Bay just through the doors also makes a stay at the four seasons the best of both worlds. When I return to Vegas I imagine we’ll return here.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service from friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Caf92
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated near the airport and so is a little out of the main action of Las Vegas, it is also non-gambling, We had had the full 'Vegas' experience at the beginning of our three week trip to the States so it was ideal for our last two nights. The level of service was exceptional. I was especially impressed by the pool staff. From choosing your sunbed, laying out towels, jugs of iced water, cooling Evian spray to the offer (free!) of frozen Snickers or melon balls - nothing was missed. Towels were piled next to the pool for after a swim and you could even help yourself to sun cream. My only gripe is that the pool is a bit small but the vast facilities of Mandalay Bay , next door, were open to Four Seasons' guests. We ate dinner, brunch and lunch at the hotel. The food was excellent and not overly expensive by Las Vegas hotel standards. The rooms were good but don't expect over the top decor like the rest of Vegas. One of the things we enjoyed was the fact the Four Seasons felt like a hotel not a theme park.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons has no equal in Vegas - maybe anywhere.”
Reviews.Author: loudsmith33
Reviews.Content: Four Seasons has no equal in Vegas. There are plenty of 5-star locations on the strip but none with the class and intimacy of this hotel. My wife and I went to Vegas to celebrate our fifteenth anniversary and we tried out a few hotels to see which of the five stars truly lived up to their billing. All of them were great - nice rooms, friendly staff, etc. But, none of them even came close to the Four Seasons. The calm of this place amidst the madness of Vegas was refreshing. The knowledge and kindness of every staff member was memorable. The front desk was gracious, generous and efficient. The pool staff and whole pool experience makes you feel like you are an honored guest rather than just a confirmation number. The food at their restaurants was just right. Proximity to Mandalay was perfect. It was a marvelous place - courtesy everywhere you go - High-class but not snobby - Friendly and helpful - They even blessed us with an upgrade and a mousse cake to help us celebrate. They blew us away. We have decided to come back every year and stay a week here at the Four Seasons - It is the place to recall that life is not just about busyness and work and that love can be rekindled in the right environments. To all who are considering Vegas and want something exquisite - this is your only option. To those who think it might be too expensive, I recommend giving up your daily Starbucks (or something) and save for the difference. The latte you will forget. The Four Seasons you will not.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Option for Las Vegas!!!”
Reviews.Author: Novemberbravo1974
Reviews.Content: The Four Season’s Las Vegas think Class without Crowds. A gaming free oasis discreetly tucked into the sprawling Mandalay Bay Complex which is a real win win situation for guest wanting every conceivable facility yet no compromising access to all the action Las Vegas offers. ( That being said the Mandalay bay is the eastern most resort on the Las Vegas strip and maybe viewed as too far from the action by some its really a personal viewpoint I guess) The Hotel features everything conceivable amenity expected from a Four Seasons and as previously mentioned located within Mandalay Bay means the choices are almost endless as both the Four Season and Mandalay Bay boast an exceptional choice of facilities and activities. The rooms are Vegas large and spacious ( Better than the Four Season Sydney in general ) I liked the subtle tropical pastels in the décor that gave a nice relaxed atmosphere and the marble bathroom was ample. ( Loved the well stocked Mini Bar and the Locitenne Toiletries ) Those Four Seasons Beds are divine and the views from the 48th floor over Las Vegas where fantastic. Service was in general very good, Concierge was generally good, Guys on the door and in the valet department ( Jay and his team ) where always friendly and helpful with the car always kitted out with Maps and Water etc. The Valet parking was $25 per day by Australian standards a bargain. All in all A great place I would return to in a second, If you can get a rate as good as I got on-line snap it up and savour the experience.

Reviews.Title: “ok i think best hotel in vegas”
Reviews.Author: revengeofaone
Reviews.Content: this was our 2nd time at the hotel. My wife is in love with the hotel. I think it's great but not to the level she does because the location sucks in my opinion. But that's because it's at the end of the strip in Mandalay, but aside from that, the hotel is great. Other minor irritation is that the valet charges each day, but you can 'usually' use MB's free valet unless they are crazy busy with their own guests. The best part is the high quality bedding and comfortable yet simple room. Also, they are very accomodating to kids, and gave our daughter a really nice little stuffed animal which she took everywhere including on the plane ride home as well as a plate of M and M's and white chocolate. They are also apparently very dog friendly because we saw many dogs with guests. The pool is great because it's possible to be in the sun, partially shaded, or shaded. Also the lounge chairs are padded and they completely cover them for you with fitted towels. This alone is worth the $20 per person per day that other hotels can charge (free at 4 seasons). The prices at the pool for food and drinks are steep (6 or 7 dollars per beer) but the food is quite good. It is very nice to escape the craziness of MB and vegas in the quiet of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location! Wonderful pool complex.”
Reviews.Author: SusieEK
Reviews.Content: We booked a three night stay at Mandalay Bay and were happy to find that we had been upgraded to a room in the Four Seasons. It was a fun start to our 11 day vacation. The kids, 10 and 12, loved the Mandalay Beach area with the wave pool and lazy river. My husband and I really enjoyed then being able to relax in the quiet of the four seasons pool. The room was very large with a great bathroom to spread out all of our stuff. Everything was spotless. We enjoyed several of the restaurants at Mandalay Bay, but the free tram made it convenient to get to locations farther down the strip. Our only disappointment was that the room had two double beds, rather than 2 queen beds.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: PeterJS
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the fourseasons in Vegas and everything was perfect!! thankyou for a great experience. This is truely deservant of its 5 stars and look forward to going back in 2011, for people who are thinking of going and not sure what to do about car parking i hired a good car and parked it in the car park beside the hotel which is free. The casino is next door, the poker tables are abit worn and in need of an update but this isnt the fourseasons

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: lanna43
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Hotel is rated the top hotel in Las Vegas for a good reason - Service. Although the rooms are not as "glitzy" as some of the other rooms on the strip, I found the service definitely superior to that of any other hotel I have stayed at in Las Vegas, or anywhere else in the world for that matter. Coming back to the hotel at the end of the day/night was, as other posts have suggested, like coming back to an oasis. This was important as I was travelling with my 11 year old daughter to attend a UFC event, and I knew she would appreciate the calm of the Four Seasons at the end of a busy day. We were both treated exceptionally well during our stay, and my daughter was always made to feel as a very valued guest. I would highly recommend the Four Seasons Hotel and plan to make this my first choice when returning to Las Vegas or any other city featuring this respected brand.

Reviews.Title: “The Absolute Best”
Reviews.Author: NapaSteveV
Reviews.Content: What more can one say about this property that hasn't already been said? Utterly fantastic. The best hotel experience I've ever ahd. Thank you, Four Seasons Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Weekend with a Romantic Uberoom Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: JKimbell
Reviews.Content: My husband and I needed to take a break for our 6th Anniversary and headed to the Four Seasons. I found the Four Seasons in Las Vegas better than most others around the US. The door people are always smiling and unlike the chaos that you'll find at other Las Vegas Hotels, this place was serene and relaxing. One of the best finds was this company called Uberoom that has packages to transform your hotel room. I ordered the 'Strawberry Nights' package from www.uberoom.com and the hotel staff set it up! It was just amazing. Our hotel was transformed into a special romantic suite with satin sheets, champagne on ice, even rose petals that spelled out happy anniversary. From what I understand you can get it set-up at any hotel, and the staff at Four Seasons took care of us. Highly recommended for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service Hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: m2mnelson
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in June for a 3 day weekend and came away very impressed. We do like to have have fun in Vegas going to nightclubs, etc and were a little worried that Four Seasons would be boring. Much to our surprise, Four Seasons was perfect! It was the perfect get away from the constant craziness of Vegas and allowed us to recharge each day before we went out. The highlights were: *The pool! There is nowhere else I will stay in Vegas during pool season. Pool was laid back with excellent service including free smoothies, iced water, evian misters, and foot massages for a fee. It wasn't overcrowded and shady areas were easy to find if needed. No need to pay an arm and a leg for a cabana. Best of all, YOU CAN USE THE POOL 24 HOURS A DAY. This is unheard of in Vegas. You also have access to Mandalay Bay's amazing pool complex and their european pool. *The Service. People were very attentive and knowledgeable. This is hard to find in Vegas due to the size of the hotels. Maid Service kept the room spotless and there is not a better feeling than coming back at night with soothing music on in your room and bottled water waiting by the bed. *The fitness center/spa. There is not an extra charge for this. The equipment is top notch and is in a convenient area close to the pool. The reason I only gave this hotel 4 stars in because 5 stars is only reserved for perfection. If the Four Seasons had rooms like the Palazzo or Encore, this would be 5 stars. The rooms are nice (the bed is amazing), but not up to what other high end Vegas hotels bring to the table. Also, they charge $19 a day for valet parking. This may be the only place in Vegas that charges for Valet. Not a big deal since you can use the free valet at The Hotel or Mandalay Bay as we did. I would recommend The Hotel valet since it is much quicker and better service than Mandalay. Another thing to add is that I was surprised how noisy the hotel got from the nightclub in the weekend. We could hear the music from the Foundation Room nightclub (on top of Mandalay) at 3am in the morning on Sunday. Didn't bother me, but I could see how it could bother others. All in all, I commend the Four Seasons. We will certainly be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!! Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: monalisada
Reviews.Content: WoW. This is one of my favourites!! Lovely!! we had room on the 39th floor(I think so, anyhow at the very top of the hotel), the view was wonderful. And the staff was so nice. When we got into the hotel, they already greeted us with our name. Great! And gave us free bottled water! Room was big, clean and the bed was so comfortable. Room was made twice in the morning and night. When we got back to room after shopping at night, the room was made again with another bottled water next to the bed. And sleeper was ready and the light was lit. The bed was so comfortable, I slept very good(after very plain and not so good lodge at Grand Canyon National Park, this was a treat for me). Also easy access to Luxor and other Hotels. We were able to use internet to print out our boarding pass for free of charge. It's just great! Cannot complain any!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: bexwz
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here five years in a row! The pool service is second to none and this is the perfect place to unwind. Verandah is a great place to eat at any time.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite Las Vegas Hotel - outstanding”
Reviews.Author: AUKTourist
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons is as reported by others a real oasis in the frenzy which is Las Vegas. Having stayed in many hotels, The Four Seasons is the one I will return to. Although the rooms are very much of the period when the hotel opened, the quality of furnishings and complimentary toiletries is very good. The constant attention to detail and ensuring that the needs of its clients are met underpins why the Four Seasons is so special. The pool area is equally pampering, with a sunglasses butler who, yes, does clean your sunglasses when needed. If you appreciate real pampering after a hectic night in the casino, then stay at the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “LOTUS IN A DIRTY POND”
Reviews.Author: harpreet1961
Reviews.Content: Stayed at four seasons during memorial day weekend,we chose after reading reviews .Excellent in almost all respects.With little daughter almost two years old,the staff bend over backwards to see all our needs.All the other hotels we visited were like a circus[too many people,drinking.jostling] The restaurant at' Verandah' was superb in every respect.It feels like such a homely feeling with world class cuisine.To compare with other venues,we went to Mirage' for there buffet which was pretty horrible and also their were drunks there creating ruckus and shouting profanities.For families with small kids four seasons is a no brainer.

Reviews.Title: “Truly An Oasis Amidst the Throngs of Tackiness...”
Reviews.Author: Rosiek28
Reviews.Content: Having been bugged by friends and family about staying in the Bellagio or Wynn, then being told off for taking our 8 yr old daughter to Vegas ("You wont enjoy it with a child!", we were truly grateful for having gone against all odds and booked the Four Seasons. We don't gamble - perhaps a flutter here and there, and we don't do pool party atmospheres, so this was perfect. The hotel is like a hidden building within the grounds of the Uber-Busy Mandalay, where the only time you realised you were in company with other guests was by the pool. Granted, the pool area is smaller than most, but it was well maintained with the most efficient staff and service. It was only busy over Memorial weekend (which we hadn't accounted for when booking, but it made for great young-people watching of a night-time), and guests soon filtered off as the temperatures soared. Our daughter is used to upmarket quieter hotels, and did not find anything at fault here either. In fact, the staff were lovely to her and she loved the pool with the constant free smoothies/frozen grapes/iced towels/iced water/floats/lollies etc... This was our first time in Vegas and my partner (who was very concerned about my choice of hotel) agreed that the Four Seasons was perfect. Our strip view room was spacious (slightly dated but we got an I Pod docking alarm clock which is more than you get in some brand new hotels around the world) and with a great mini-bar. Bed was soooo soft and we slept like babies. Room service was prompt and very generous - American sized portions are always welcomed! As for the location: Get a taxi. They know when to jump on and off the strip, and yeah, you'll get stuck in traffic, but we got some great video footage and its much nicer to arrive in an airconditioned taxi for your dinner reservations than hot and sweaty after enduring the heat and crowds. Reccommended restaurants: Picasso's in Bellagio (haute cuisine and very accommodating, right on fountains), MOzen in Mandarin Oriental (Yum! Think all things Asian), Mon Gabi in Paris (just for the outside dining, food not excellent), "Top of the World" at Stratosphere (again, do it for the views and for the sights of people jumping off the floor above you! Been around for ages and blatantly needs updating), Tao's in The Venetian (nice food, clubby atmosphere) and Olives at the Bellagio (great fountain views, simple but tasty menu). Mandalay Bay was busy, and we feel that if you like the Four Seasons, then the pool area over there may feel like a mob scene. The shopping here is nowhere near as plentiful or high-end as other hotels. We visited the Mandarin Oriental twice for lunch - great food, exceptional service and another little hidden oasis, and in the City Centre which makes for a great location! Thank you Four Seasons for making our little break so wonderful and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “A nice retreat from the artificial hell that is vegas.”
Reviews.Author: EdwardTylicki
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a lovely retreat from the articificial hell that is vegas. The pool is peaceful and quiet compared to the other vegas hotels. I especially enjoy breakfast outside at the Veranda restaurant. If you don't like vegas, this is the place to stay. I was spoiled as they upgraded us to a suite. The service is perfect. Much nicer than the snooty service at the Mandarin Oriental. Don't miss a drink at the Mix bar in The Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Getaway”
Reviews.Author: debbiep14
Reviews.Content: We went to Las Vegas to get married. We had booked to stay in the Four Seasons for 3 nights and then to the Venetian for 4 nights (so the Venetian was a sort of honeymoon). On the 1st night at the Four Seasons we had a heart of rose petals on our bed, on the second night we had strawberries dipped in chocolate which were decorated to look like a bride and groom. On the 3rd night we had champagne and a cake (this was courtesy of our friends though). We really didnt want to leave. The pool was wonderful - it is true, you do get iced water, sunglasses cleaned, frozen melon balls and a spritz of water - all complimentary. We had access to the Mandalay Bay too - the lazy river was great. The "beach" was just hundreds of sunloungers on sand. The staff were very pleasant and certainly made everyone feel as if they belonged. There was no complimentary car - this was charged per hour. The Ace buses cost $7 for 24 hours unlimited travel which took you not only to the Strip but also to the outlets (both ends of the Strip) and to Freemont Street. To step back into the Four Seasons after the bustle of the other hotels was pure tranquility. My husband went to the fitness suite which included drinks, hair wax and shaving kits. He could have spent the day there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Close to perfect”
Reviews.Author: DodgerJohn
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a long weekend with my wife. The Four Seasons really is a superior hotel to most any hotel anywhere. Door people always greet you with a smile (or a bottle of a water when you return from a run), front desk staff never make you wait, spa/gym staff are TOP notch, rooms are always cleaned (and beds turned down) without you seeing maids everywhere, food is good, pool is beautiful, and all told I would return here for sure. The only small knock was the pool was overcrowded for Memorial Day weekend and thus it was hard to get a sunny seat as the pool area is not huge. Having said that, there are tons of pool staff who do their best of the situation with attentive service. Oh ya, and the location isn't great as it's a hike to the other end of the strip but lots to see along the walk! However, lots to do right there at Mandlay Bay or at the hotel next door; Luxor. Oh ya, I almost forgot the hidden door from Mandalay Bay. Once you find that door it is the most awesome moment when you go from the incredibly busy Mandalay Bay casino to the calm and quiet of the Four Seasons elevator lobby. AWESOME!

Reviews.Title: “Service and comfort +++. But beware location....”
Reviews.Author: rendesvouz99
Reviews.Content: I would echo the reviews below....this hotel stands out in terms of quality of service and attention to detail. A few other points: - The pool area is lovely, with all the fancy stuff like free water jugs etc etc, but if you really want to have a good time by the pool, go next door to the partner hotel Mandalay Bay (several pools, wave pool with sandy beach) - Make sure you are happy with the end-of-Strip location before you book...we walked back every evening to the hotel but its a pain and in hindsight, the cost and luxury of the Four Seasons is not offset by the annoyance of the location....we also stayed at The Mirage during the same vacation and in my opinion, is far a better option overall. - They do take notice of things like birthdays and anniversaries, make sure you drop a hint and you will get a nice surprise in your room on your return in the evening. - No free internet. - Overall: great if your conference is here. If you are a tourist looking to spend a few days taking in Las Vegas, go elsewhere closer to the centre of the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Getting very tired and long in the tooth....”
Reviews.Author: marty550
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at Four Seasons Las Vegas for the past 22 years while attending an annual convention. We have stayed in just about every room catagory over the years also. I think this was our last stay there. This Grande Dame is getting long in the tooth Dont get me wrong, staff is great,but they can only make excuses for conditions and lack of capital improvements for so long....especially the condition of pool area. The pool furniture is truly awful, they have promised total upgrade for at least the last five years we have stayed there. Nothing has been done except removing umbrellas because they are too cheap to buy decent stands that will deal with the wind.Additionally no cabanas or other shade is available for most of the day ,which leads to the chair migration dance as sun moves,truly a bad scene. Also the helocopter noise has increased greatly in the last few years, very annoying. On the bright side staff is great and always right there and remembers names from year to year. Dont bother with Veranda for breakfast unless you have a couple of hours,it is painfully slow and average in food and presentation. Four Seasons was the only game in town for years if you wanted non-gaming luxury and quiet...now thankfully there are other choices. We are actually quite sad about this as we are huge Four Seasons fans and stay in many other fine locations...We all understand how hard it is to spend real money on improvements these days,but Four Seasons Las Vegas is being passed up rapidly by other properties....Mandarin Oriental here we come !

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet”
Reviews.Author: kpand
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons last September. We were upgraded to a strip view room and treated to great service. We loved the quiet location and ability to escape the craziness of the strip. This hotel is on the top floors of the Mandaley Bay Hotel which was crazy and had lines to their elevators. So we especially loved the private elevator to the Four Seasons floors! We aren't gamblers so appreciated the lack of casino. Loved that they gave you cold water when you got your car! Nice touch on a hot day. Pool seemed nice but not much shade for the 100 plus weather we had there, so didn't use the pools as much as we thought we would. On the bad side, it is a long way from most of the other hotels on the strip. A very long walk!! But, besides that I can't think of anything bad to say about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What makes Las Vegas Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: MadisonJack
Reviews.Content: Our second visit to this wonderful hotel. The welcome was warm, the room delightful, staff and concierge totally professional and dedicated. Verandah Restaurant superb for Breakfast and dinner. Poolside heavenly, quiet and civilised with fab service and snacks/drinks, frozen melon, sunglass butlet, cold towels etc etc. Will certainly return next year and can't wait to make this our base for another joyful vacation to a most exciting and vibrant city.

Reviews.Title: “This is the best place to stay in Las Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: KathyLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a weekend trip with my niece and my sister. What a lovely experience. From the moment we arrived to when we left we were pampered and treated wonderfully. Thanks to Justin for making great arrangements for us for dinner for 3 nights. All of our needs were met and the staff was excellent. The pool was quiet and beautiful (not the rocking scene for a younger person but great if you like to read and relax without loud music) and the service was outstanding. About once an hour someone was offering to clean our sunglasses, spray our face with Evian water or serving a frozen melon ball or Popsicle. When we left, they cleaned out our car and gave us cold bottled water for our trip. This was one of the nicest weekend getaways I've ever had. Highly recommend the Four Seasons anywhere but what a nice departure from the loud casinos in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “amazing holiday experience!!”
Reviews.Author: klynne1984
Reviews.Content: ....I laughed out loud after reading "Noisy for a quiet hotel"! Who are these people!!! Four Season's was truly an "OASIS" in the midst of a very busy, noisy city. From the moment we arrived and were greeted with a smile by the doormen, receptionist, manager AND staff members in the hallway! we were made to feel special, important and very valued by all!! I can't say enough about housekeeping! We never had any problems, and our room was always spotless, with abundant towels, toiletries and other little extras that we truly appreciated! We accidentally left our "do not disturb" sign on the door the day we went to the Canyon and when we got back and realized our error, they HAPPILY came right away to make up our room! Our experience at the pool was second to none. It was so nice to have access to all the extras that Mandalay Bay Pool area had to offer, but our experience at the Four Season's pool was an experience in itself!! We were greeted by name on the first day , and ALL our needs were met graciously and always with a SMILE! The staff at the pool could not do enough for you...you have to go just for the pool experience and its wonderful staff! We enjoyed lunch at the Veranda, as well as had Veranda's menu (with slight modification), poolside! What a treat!! With regards to the noise in the room. We were on the airport side...we requested this side so we could see the Strip at night. Yes, there are airplanes taking off...but not during the NIGHT!! What a treat to watch the planes take off and land! All in all, I consider my self spoiled beyond belief to have had the opportunity to stay at the Four Seasons! We are already planning our return next year! With thanks and appreciation to ALL the staff who made our trip so enjoyable!! Kelly and Kelly-lynne, Ontario Canada

Reviews.Title: “Best in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: DMR
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at almost every hotel on the strip and can say for certain that this is the best there is. Sitting at the top of Mandalay Bay, the Four Seasons is an escape to quiet and serenity after the bling, noise and crowds you will find everywhere else. The hotel knew that we were celebrating our anniversary and there was a cake awaiting our arrival in the room. This was our second stay and it was just as special as our first. The customer service is beyond excellent, the rooms are beautiful and you can enjoy their private pool or take advantage of the many pools of Mandalay Bay. Go to happy hour at the Veranda for yummy 1/2 price martini drinks. Steakhouse is excellent as well. All is great about this place. Do not hesitate, JUST GO!!!

Reviews.Title: “Sanctuary hidden in Mandalay Bay”
Reviews.Author: kitseng
Reviews.Content: I have been to Las Vegas many times and go for a variety of reasons (Business, boys trips, trips with partner). Prior to this trip, I didn't even know the Four Season existed in Vegas. This hotel is perfect for couples or families. The hotel itself is dead quiet, but the Mandalay Bay casino is just downstairs, along with all the restaurants and lounges. The pool area is small, private, secure and quiet, but the Mandalay Bay pool area with the wave pool and lazy river is right through a locked gate. I thought the hotel was great, the view was awesome and the service was what you always expect at a four seasons, outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “View from the Four Seasons is great”
Reviews.Author: CanadianCheese
Reviews.Content: Private pool for the Four Seasons guests was nice, quiet and full service. Right beside the big mandalay bay pool but yet still private.

Reviews.Title: “Mandalay Bay benefits & small high quality hotel benefits”
Reviews.Author: hey_scott_9
Reviews.Content: My ratings of other hotels have been bad. I can say this hotel was a pleasant experience. You get to choose between Mandalay Bay benefits or Four Season Hotel Benefits * Mandalay Bay pools or private Four Seasons * Mandalay Trams/Casino/Entrance versus Four Seasons Private entrance The housekeeping and staff were great. They met all requests timely and as expected. Included getting a crib, fridge, no feathers, printing boarding passes ... Had an airport view. Expecting the worse with noise, however, almost no plane or outside noise. Very quite rooms. You are on the top few floors of the Mandalay Bay and the views are good. I actually found the airport view interesting. A lot of hotels in this class charge a resort fee for some made up reason. None here. It is ironic that the one that has the benefits to support a fee does not charge. This is another sign that it is place that considers the lodgers. The only downside I could mention is the tubs in the bathroom are the half size tubs. Otherwise, I can not come up with anything negative. Tip - Find the obscure entrance to the elevators on the Mandalay Bay casino floor. Saves a lot of walking and puts you right at the action.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Perfection”
Reviews.Author: AnotherHoustonian
Reviews.Content: Just finished a stay at the Four Seasons and it was absolutely wonderful. The hotel is extremely quiet and has the feel of an intimate hotel despite the wonderful madness of Vegas that is so close by. The service was unbelievable. The pool is a bit small, but the comfy cushions on the lounge chairs, the service and the "half hour amenities" more than adequately compensate. Every half hour, an attendant comes by with a different amenity. This ranges from cleaning your sunglasses, to a cold towel, to a frozen melon ball or even a small smoothie. It is heavenly. The tranquility of the pool is also wonderful. Guests are free to use the Mandalay Bay pool which is much larger, has a lazy river, wave pool, etc. However, we were unable to tear ourselves away from our oasis at the Four Seasons pool. The workout room is great, and there are no extra fees for using it. Plenty of treadmills, weights, towels, water...whatever you need. Because of the time change we were bright eyed at 5 am on our first day. The staff actually opened the excercise room so we could go ahead and use it! They were amazing. The rooms here aren't over the top. They do have everything you would expect from a luxury hotel (fabulous bath products, super mattresses, high thread count sheets, bathrobes, etc.) However, the defining factor of this hotel is service. From the doorman, to your waiter, everyone at this hotel seems to be on a mission to make you as comfortable and happy as possible. The Mandalay Bay is easily accessible and had all the action we could handle. We used the spa at Mandalay Bay, which was heavenly as well as took in some nightlife there. The Mandalay Bay was a great spot for heavy duty fun, but it was sooooo relaxing to go back into the Four Seasons when we were done. The heart of the strip is a bit of a walk, but we certainly didn't feel unsafe when we walked it as one reviewer commented (and we were two women). One night at 10 pm we actually walked all the way from the Venetian. It was a bit of a hike but we were just enjoying the whole spectacle of Las Vegas. This hotel has spoiled me for all others!!! Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “A quite retreat steps away from the Vegas excitement”
Reviews.Author: John769
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons for 9 nights. The hotel is not like other hotels on the strip. While most hotels are mobbed with people and lines at the front desk, there is none of that here. It's quiet and relaxing in the hotel itself. The service is outstanding from the front door, to the pool. A pool attendant helps find a padded lounge for you and sets you up by covering the lounge with a fitted towel, and bringing a pitcher of ice water. Food/drink service is also available. The bed was the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in. I think I'm going to order a pillow from there. The maid service was outstanding. While the hotel itself is a quite retreat, there is a private door that leads right into the Mandaly Bay Resort & Casino. You also have access to the Mandalay Bay pool, but after experiencing the Four Seasons Pool, I didn't want to deal with the crowds in the Mandalay Bay area. There is a tram that will bring you to the Luxor, Excalibur, with walkways across the street to the MGM Grand and New York New York. I will definitely be coming back here again.

Reviews.Title: “POOR DIRECTOR OF HOUSEKEEPING!!!”
Reviews.Author: Shrimp17
Reviews.Content: The director of housekeeping was SO RUDE!!!! My husband spilt wine on an expensive linen shirt. I have never had a problem getting out wine/ dirt/ blood from a nose bleed out of ANY shirt. They didn't get the stain out-TWICE. It was a white shirt. All they had to do was bleach it. He insulted me by insinuating I was lying and said the spot was gone. I told him to come look and I would show him where it was. I don't think I should have to pay for a poor job. He laughed at me. I wasn't looking for compensation for a new shirt. I'll take care of it at home- myself. He was rude presumptuous and was very insulting. THIS is Four Seasons Service? I'll stay at Bellagio thank you. Ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “Four seasons- NO REASON”
Reviews.Author: robe1023
Reviews.Content: My wife and I (both 40) are travelers who seek out Ritz, Four Seasons or other fine properties when traveling. After reading all of the reviews of this being the #1 Vegas rated hotel we decided to give it a try after trying the Bellagio last year. What a disappointment! Lets be honest- if you want peace and quiet and all of the other reasons people give this hotel such great reviews maybe you shouldn't be in Vegas. I like to hit the tables early in the AM or late in the PM when the wife is sleeping or mid-day when the wife is shopping. Last stay at Bellagio was perfect for this- and guess what the room was quiet which is supposedly the allure of this hotel. This hotel is actually the top 5 floors of Mandalay Bay. Thus you use the Mandalay Bay casino. Here's the kicker- if you want to gamble forget it. The casino knows they absolutely have you. Vegas 6 months ago at Bellagio (and even on this trip) - too numerous to count $10 tables (and even $5) for Blackjack if you just want to chill and not get robbed- why because it is center strip and has to compete. This casino at 6am- only 6 blackjack tables open and only had one full daily am $15 dollar blackjack table (serving 2 hotels- 4 seasons and mandalay) and the rest were $25 or $50 per hand. They are making money on you creatively thru the casino- I know - that's what Vegas does- but it is not like that at the other casinos at the off hours or mid day. I want to relax, be mindless and play $10 buck blackjack or pai gow- there was no opportunity for such at this casino. This hotel is at the absolute far end of the strip- horrible location and not safe feeling to walk to at night. Means $15 cab ride (each way) just to get to center of strip- thus mid-day shopping/ seeing sites and a separate late night show and you've just added $60 to your stay daily- no biggie but it does add up so be aware of such. No romantic leisurely strolls along the strip back to your hotel after a show or dinner. You'd need your sneakers, a police escort and a flashlight. The lobby is about a 1/8th mile walk to the elevators, the pool is undersized, it has zippo shopping, you can't use your room charge for the shops at the Mandalay Bay (only for food) you are right across the street from the airport and hear the helicopters or planes go bye starting at 6am. The rooms are undersized (Bellagio regular lakeview was @ 1.5 x size and had automatic curtains and music playing to fountain show for same price). Rooms are small and starting to look worn as is the trim work in the lobby. The stripview (if you regrettably do go here make sure to ask for the 100 wing) means you look down the road a mile away at the other hotels and it makes you actually want to be in Vegas- even though you are there- but oh so far, far away. Do yourself a favor- Bellagio , Palazzo, or the Wynn. All are walking distance to all shopping and shows, have the extravagance that reminds you why you are in Vegas and not somewhere sedate, you'll sleep on a quiet floor, and all have to compete with each other to have reasonable gaming tables. Pass on this one you won't regret it. For the Four Seasons experience do it in any other city. This particular Vegas hotel is grossly overrated.

Reviews.Title: “So nice”
Reviews.Author: nickied
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights- had the third night free from a promo on their website and it was the best value of any of the five star hotels. I would definately stay here again on all future Las Vegas visits. Check in was very nice. offered a bottled water and apples. Quick delivery of our bags to the room. Room was quite large with two beds and chair and desk. Bathroom had separate soaking tub, but only one sink. Typical FS bathroom. Had a refrigerator that had space for my own waters. also a free coffee maker was nice. The spa was small but very private and quiet. the workout facilities and spa faciltities were free for all guests and well worth it- the workout room has many cardio machines and a well equipped weight area with machien and free weights. all with headsets and water and towels. The pool area was so nice. They set up your chairs for you with towels and water picther and glasses. the food was prompt and well worth the money. ordered off the kids menu due to large portions. decent pour size of the wines. Pool was heated and the two smaller jacuzzis were nice. quiet even though next to the mandalay beach, which is free to all FS guests as well and worth at least one visit, though so loud and busy. did not eat at Chrles Palmer, but looked very nice. Best part was that the noise and hustle of the mandalay bay was just a doorway away from the FS. starbucks and other cheaper paces ot eat available. LOVED Stripsteak and RM seafood at mandalay place was SOOOO GREAT! best veggie pasta I have ever had and the sushi was better than NOBU. Border grill was just ok. good margaritas. Hope this helps and enjoy. only downside is that it is not walking distance ot other larger resorts, like the Wynn or Bellagio, but you can take the tram to Excalibur that is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise and tranquility in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: dooleymom
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this wonderful hidden gem in Las Vegas, where the service was exceptional from everyone we came in contact with. The food was perfect in taste and a culinary experience with every meal. No detail was left out.We were on the 39 th floor with a postcard picture of Las Vegas Blvd. The bed was extemely comfortable. My only down side was the phone system in the room needs updating, and there was only one sink in the bathroom .Otherwise an absolutely perfect experience Jan D Newport Coast,CA

Reviews.Title: “Without a doubt the best service and value in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: otjedi
Reviews.Content: What a great experience ! The Four Seasons really took care of us. It was my 50th Birthday and my wife and I celebrated in style at the Four Seasons Hotel Las Vegas. We were so happy to get a complimentary upgrade and loved our room. The concierge took good care of us when asked for help setting up my Birthday dinner . He recommended a variety of choices at the Forum - Joe's Seafood, Prime Steak & Stone Crab - had no wait and a great dinner. The Car was available and the driver was pleasant though he took us to the opposite side of the Forum than our restaurant. The pool was very comfortable and relaxing. We were set up with a pitcher of water , towels and given evian sprays. Food at the pool is fantastic. A gift of frozen grapes for my birthday was received from the pool server and that was a very nice touch ! The room was perfect , clean and spectacular. Ate at Rick Moonen's RM Seafood - Mandalay Bay - Upstairs - This was a 5 course dinner I will never forget ! ] I will be back for sure to both the Four Seasons and the RM Seafood for more of the best service and value that I have seen for a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquility in Sin City”
Reviews.Author: ACERYork
Reviews.Content: My thanks and congratulations to the staff and management of The Four Seasons, Las Vegas. I have stayed in hotels all over the world, luxury and otherwise, on business and for pleasure. This is the best run hotel with THE most pleasant, courteous and efficient staff I have ever encountered. The hotel is luxurious, peaceful and tranquil. The latter two attributes being no mean feat in this fast, mad, crazy city. It was wonderful to be able to climb above the Mandalay Bay, out of the noise, hustle, bustle and congestion walk through the doors of The Four Seasons and feel the quiet and restfulness roll over us. My parents celebrated their 50th wedding anniversary during our stay. Mum and dad would like me to publicly pass on a huge thank you for all of the "treats" organised for them by the team at The Four Seasons. An especially huge thank you to Manager Rajiv Malhotra...this gentleman is a true star of the hospitality industry. As an aside - go see "O" at the Bellaggio. Cirque du Soleil at it's finest.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely but not perfect service or attention”
Reviews.Author: Holbecks
Reviews.Content: Having read such amazing reviews I was expecting a lot, but ended up dissapointed mainly because I did not feel we received the service and attention other reviewers had talked about. When we arrived the doorman asked our name but by the time we got to the check in desk he had already forgotten it and had to ask us again no-one after this addressed us by name so I never felt any kind of personal service. The pool was one of the main reasons to book after reading about the service, again we were not asked our names were we arrived and were only once offered frozen fruit, did not get offered evian, sunglasses cleaned etc. Rooms are a nice size but not overly big but we had an amazing strip view which we had not booked so I appreciated this. Bed I have to say is the best ever! and house keeping spotless which is becoming rarer and rarer. We were not told about the house car when we checked in, which makes me think again its only offered to certain guests. I hoped the hotel would treat its guests all the same but left with the impression that if they think you are welloff you are largely ignored.

Reviews.Title: “perfection”
Reviews.Author: mrssmith99
Reviews.Content: we had the most amazing time. incredible service we are just about to book this years holiday and are on a budget this time so nothing will compare. Would go back any day.

Reviews.Title: “Over-Rated Oasis in the Desert!”
Reviews.Author: Dalecorp
Reviews.Content: Truthfully, everything was great about the hotel outside of a location on the far end of the strip. However, there are many nicer hotel rooms available for less money at the likes of the Encore, Palazzo or Venetian. In comparisson to these other hotels, the room was considerably smaller with inferior finishes and furnishings at a higher price. Having stayed at both the Palazzo and Encore in 2010, there is no question in my mind that I won't be returning to the Four Seasons! On another note, having paid a premium for this hotel, one would expect a superior level of service: This past Sunday, I left my room at 8:30am only to return at 4:00pm to discover that maid service had not been in yet. They showed up at close to 5:00pm just as I was about to jump in the shower only to be turned away. I had to call them later on that evening for service and was once again surprised on returning to my room after a night of gambling that the soaps had not been replenished. Definitely not characteristic of a 5* hotel if you ask me!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful retreat away from the glitz of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: austinmdpedi
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Four Seasons Las Vegas for three nights in March 2010. My wife and I had a wonderful stay. We are perhaps not the typical Las Vegas visitors. We went for the food and to take in a couple shows ("O" was wonderful, Blue Man Group was very good) but were not interested in the casinos and all the glitz. So in that way the Four Seasons was perfect. We knew that every night we would come home to peace and quiet and be sheltered from some of the chaos. The style of the hotel was like most Four Seasons. It was very nice. Very clean. Very quiet. Our room had a nice view looking North toward the heart of the Strip. The grounds were beautiful. The public spaces were very nice as well. The staff were very professional and courteous. There was not a single glitch in our stay. We ate at Verandah for our first breakfast upon our Thursday morning arrival and also for brunch on Sunday. Both meals were wonderful. Two things to remember: 1) This hotel is at the VERY South end of the Strip and is a bit of a haul from everything. So if you stay here you are going to spend some time in and money on taxi services. On only one occasion were taxis not readily available at the hotel. Its about $15-20 for every ride to the central and north strip so it does add up. On occasion we wondered if we were to come back if we would try a hotel that is more centrally located. 2) This hotel actually takes up the top floors of the Mandalay Bay. Its not a big deal, as all of the entrances, elevators, grounds, pools etc are private. But, the way things are set up, it is a bit of a longer walk from the lobby to the elevators. Probably 75 yards? Just a hassle if you get to the front of the hotel and you realize you left something in the room. Overall, we had a great stay. Other trip highlights: B&B Ristorante, Nob Hill Tavern, and Rosemary's restaurants. Also Titanic Exhibit and Imperial Palace Auto Museum. Overrated: Prime Steakhouse

Reviews.Title: “Generic Oasis in Gaudy City”
Reviews.Author: Dangank
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons is a pleasant enough refuge from loud machines, loud people, and the debauchery machine that is Vegas. The reception staff were terrific and the lobby and public spaces an excellent tonic to the mega resorts. However, the rooms are boxy and unremarkable and the location at the airport end of the trip a tad stifling especially if one wishes to leave the Mandalay Bay-Four Seasons complex. The Mandarin seems to be the best option for a non-0casino experience. N.B. the Four Seasons pool area seems good for families.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Trip!”
Reviews.Author: G-Money59
Reviews.Content: I've been going to Vegas twice a year for 30 years. I've stayed in all of the major strip hotels with the Encore being my previous stay to this one. The Encore had become my favorite property...until this trip. The exclusive and luxurious feel to the Four Seasons can't be overstated. The cleanliness is 2nd to none but the service surpasses every expectation. My friend and I had breakfast at one of the restaurants(the Verandah) each morning. The service provided by every employee was top notch, particulary by our server Maria. Her attention to detail equaled any dining experience I have ever experienced. We also had one dinner at the Verandah and had the filet. It was a cut above the filet we had experienced at Prime in the Bellagio the evening before. The private Elevator alcove just off the Mandalay Bay casino is so convenient and accomodating. The room, amenities, and comfort are simply the best. It's my new favorite place!

Reviews.Title: “WOW - what an amazing trip!”
Reviews.Author: aliwat
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Four Seasons Las Vegas and seriously, the staff couldn't have done anything else to make us feel more welcome or more appreciated as guests. I'll admit it - I am the "demanding but very appreciative/good tipper" type and the Four Seasons staff was amazing! My husband and I were traveling with our 9 month old son and by the time we arrived they had upgraded our room, added a crib, highchair, refrigerator and microwave. They had even babyproofed the room and left diapers/wipes/baby toiletries for us! The hotel itself is gorgeous, smoke free and spotlessly clean. The room was perfect - comfortable and clean - and the hotel facilities are first rate. We also had a wonderful time enjoying the Mandalay Bay pools, especially the wave pool and the lazy river ride. I can't say enough wonderful things about the Four Seasons Las Vegas - we would visit again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to the 1990's!”
Reviews.Author: rockyhilltop
Reviews.Content: I can't add much more to Japan_gaijin's review of 3/3/10. It's spot-on. The institutional 1990's feel might be appropriate for the average Four Seasons, but the hotel is starting to feel a little dated. Lots of new competition at the 5-Star level in Vegas means that the younger segment of their market niche may bolt for more fashionable better-located properties. Nevertheless, there are some great advantages to the property as Japan_gaijin pointed out. Best thing: pool. Worst thing: service not quite up to par.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: mudra99
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Four Seasons Las Vegas! As another reviewer stated, its an oasis amidst the Vegas flash. The staff and service was great - felt very special our entire stay. Our group ranged from the age of 2 to 70 and every one of us had fun. The casino is easily accessible but not in the hotel so allows for quiet relaxation when you want it. The rooms were lovely - spacious, clean, tastefully decorated. We would go back in a heartbeat. Thanks Four Seasons!

Reviews.Title: “They anticipate your needs”
Reviews.Author: servicespecialist
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons is an excellent hotel. I work customer service for a living and I know what to look for. I had told them at check-in that me and my husband were staying here kind of as a honeymoon. We had left to do a few things and when we returned at night, the room was dimmed and they had chocolate covered strawberries out for us....WOW! I always teach everyone that its the little things that matter and I wasn't expecting them to do that, but they did. I could go on and on, but I want to keep it short. The Four seasons is quiet, clean, and beautiful, something that isn't common in Las Vegas. They passed my test and I do this for a living!

Reviews.Title: “oasis but close to the action”
Reviews.Author: sck1
Reviews.Content: perfect place to outpost in Vegas. We dont like too much smoke and action, so the 4 seasons was perfect. We picked this non-gaming hotel because of its rep. It was like an oasis on the strip. while other hotels try to fall all over themselves to knock out the guests this hotel does it with a luxury understated way of service and ammenities. If you want smoke,noise,hustle,gaming and all the rest---- go somewhere else. this hotel , on the top floors of the Mandalay Bay, was perfect. Private, secluded, classy entrance, supurb staff and service ( always around, but never in your way:just when you needed something) nice but not huge rooms, a wonderful bed and bedding, good food, spa,shop and only a hidden corridor from the inside of the Mandalay Bay and all it offers.The staff from the front desk,pool,spa,housekeeping , valet and doorman were all great. I especially ejoyed the professional staff at the concierge desk. They were very helpful and on top of the scene.Wonderful 3 nights for our style.I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of sophistication and class in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: ticket2ryde
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Four Seasons often when traveling, in my estimation they are the # 1 hotel chain... most of their properties are exceptional. This hotel is so relaxing and lovely, with spacious rooms and sweet amenities for children... I travel to Vegas twice a year on business and am so happy to be able to escape the madness of the city and luxuriate at the Four Seasons spa and pool at the end of the day. They also boast an excellent breakfast and two good restaurants...

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is for the traveler who truly wants a perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: vacationauthority
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons is simply on another level than any other hotel. Not only do they offer a perfect stay, they always exceed my expectations (which my husband will tell you are excessively high). The Four Seasons is simply perfection in every way. We were married at the Four Seasons Boston 19 years ago and our wedding could not have been more elegant and perfect. The same elegant offerings and impeccable service were prevalent at the Four Seasons Las Vegas. We have stayed in many of the top rated resorts in Las Vegas and The Four Seasons is just in a class by itself, there is no comparison. In addition to the beautiful room, the housekeeping is unrivaled with extra touches that are exclusive to the Four Seasons, the spa is immaculate and fantastic in every way. The Verandah restaurant in the hotel was also outstanding in service and quality. It was fabulous for breakfast, lunch and especially cocktail hour with the most beautiful organic pear martini’s. If you are looking to have a perfect stay, where everything exceeds your expectations and you feel as if you are royalty (or perhaps you are) the Four Seasons is the only choice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: angelah321
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the four seasons on a Vegas trip from Australia and could not fault it in any way - loved the hotel, loved the service, loved everything about it.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet oasis”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaDaisy
Reviews.Content: Just back from four nights at Four Seasons. Service was professional, prompt and courteous. Room service was good, service good. One meal at the Verandah, very good with excellent service. Compared to other Four Seasons the room rate is excellent for the services provided, compared to other properties in Las Vegaas this is on the top price point. Worth it if you desire quiet, nice room with good service and amenities. Would definately recommend and return in future.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: April_1Toronto
Reviews.Content: Connected to Mandalay Bay, lovely private pool with access to Mandalay Bay beach.

Reviews.Title: “Good---but not great”
Reviews.Author: 10000000spikes
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 2 nights at the end of february 2010... i was at a conference at mandalay bay (four seasons has ~4 top floors of 'the bay'). anyway, the room was very adequate, but not fantastic. the TV armoire was dated and the hinges were not 100% functional, but the big flat screen was nice. not providing free internet service is just silly these days---they charge $15/day for that--a real 'nickel and dime 'move. i did book the room for $160/night through 1800hotels.com which was a nice deal. if i had paid more for the room i would have felt that i was overcharged.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: gktmd2
Reviews.Content: Well, I'll be a bit of a contrarian. I was expecting more being this is the top rated hotel in a town where hospitality is king. First, the positives. The common areas are luxurious and nicely decorated. The Verandah martini happy hour was excellent. The spa/fitness facility is very well attended to by the employees who are helpful withoug being intrusive. The rooms have very nice bathrooms. I had been in contact with Yuki, one of the conceierges, before my trip. I mentioned we were celebrating a birthday and she had a cake sent up 5 minutes after we arrived. It was delicious and very thoughtful on her part. As has been mentioned in many reviews, this hotel really excels as a respite in the midst of the Las Vegas madness. That was its best feature, I thought. It was close enough to Mandaly Bay where you have everything you could want on a vacation. I am not a meat eater but was surprised how busy the on-site steak house was. It must be great. The beds are nice and the hotel very quiet. The employees were helpful overall but with a few the Las Vegas attitude comes out (no surprise I guess). The breakfast at the Verandah is way overpriced for what you get. We went there once and didn't go back. The spa and workout room are nice but I am a fitness fanatic and thought the exercise room could be a bit better. My partner had a massage and it was nice but overpriced. We were not offered an upgrade at check-in despite the hotel being relatively empty. My partner speaks spanish and had a conversation with one of the housekeepers where she was complaining about a certian class of guests and I thought that was inappropriate (on both of their parts). The location is far south of all the action in the central strip. Cabs are expensive. I found the rooms a bit small but that could be due to the oversized and luxurious bathrooms. If one wants to walk out of the hotel at the street level to go to the stores across the street you have to walk in the driveway. It is also an area that is not kept up very well with trash, etc. The pool was closed. We knew that going in but is it really necessary to close from Nov to March? Overall I liked the hotel but if it had a different name, like Hyatt or Marriott, I wouldn't have known the difference (Yuki's thoughtfulness aside). And given the deals you can get at a solid four star hotel on the strip I am not sure it is worth the extra cash just because it carries the Four Seasons moniker.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Baby”
Reviews.Author: PamEwald
Reviews.Content: A stay at the Four is a must! No glaring sign on the strip, no mega crowds. It is tucked atop the Mandalay Bay, accessible by its own, discrete entrance. The best of both worlds. No, slots, loud music or crowds. Just the gracious understated luxury you expect. Cross through a private door and you are in the hustle and bustle of the Mandalay Bay. The Four is a relaxing oasis in the middle of the madness. The staff inside and out is fabulous. Worth the price of admission for the car service alone! Have been many times.The girls from Boston stay no where else when in Sin City. Why would we?

Reviews.Title: “5 star and pet friendly”
Reviews.Author: BrianB6
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, large rooms, suites. actually. 5 star. Inside same bldg and adjacent to Mandalay Bay hotel and casino.

Reviews.Title: “Reputation is well-deserved! Vegas with small kids - this is the way to do it.”
Reviews.Author: GratefulTravMom
Reviews.Content: I got the bright idea that instead of watching NYE fireworks from our couch again, we could watch NYE fireworks from a nice hotel room couch instead. That was the impetus for our trip to Vegas. I looked on this site and decided on Four Seasons based on all of the reviews, and they did not steer me wrong. We booked a strip-view room, third night free, but when we arrived we found that they had comp upgraded us to a suite - quite LUCKY and surprising that we were able to get that on a holiday! The suite made the whole experience magical. We just soaked up the luxury and room service the whole time, in between select activities I'd planned (Beatles' LOVE Cirque du Soleil at the Mirage, fountains at Bellagio, etc., not too much busy stuff.)
