And the fireworks did not disappoint, either. Just a perfect family trip. Note: the pool was closed for the season but we didn't come for that, anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: d_gaffney
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located on top of Mandalay Bay, and you don't have to walk though the casino to enter. This is definitely a five star hotel. Everything was excellent from the food and decor to the concierge and the rest of the hotel staff. They were so helpful in assisting us with picking shows and finding places to eat. They even found a yoga class for my wife to attend during our trip. The hotel was surprisingly filled with families with young children, yet it didn't take away from the "getaway" feel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Choice”
Reviews.Author: janegf
Reviews.Content: I liked the Four Seasons very much. Exceedingly friendly, positive staff. Spacious, clean, comfortable rooms. The hotel is tucked away such that you can escape from all the hustle and bustle below. That said, it is a little challenging to find some of the entrances on the casino level of the Mandalay Bay. It is sort of your "secret hotel." It is also at one of the far ends of the strip, away from many of the other main attractions, restaurants, shopping, etc. Not a problem if you like to walk, or don't mind getting in a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service all around”
Reviews.Author: Chario
Reviews.Content: First time in Vegas and glad I chose this hotel. I've had a good time at this hotel -- as my tour guide put it Four Seasons just needed a location on Vegas and they don't aim to be the most luxurious or have many guests, but they have a way of making yourself feel welcome at it. The elevator was pretty quick and never crowded like I saw at other major hotels along the strip. Room service was excellent, just remember to give a tip of $1~2 and they were nice enough to keep me well stocked with the L'occitane bath products. Downturn service of two water bottles was always provided. There were also more than enough doormen/helpers at any time for the time, so you never really had to wait for service if you so require. I also tried the spa (separate review), and it was good. The only downturn was that the Mandalay Bay tram to Excalibur was out of service during nighttime, which made it a walk to get back to the hotel from the strip sometimes.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet hotel. Lovely toiletries”
Reviews.Author: luci5
Reviews.Content: Checked into the Four Seasons around 1pm on a Saturday afternoon and our room was ready. Had booked a superior room through City & Show for 113 GBP and we were upgraded to a deluxe room which we were told was bigger, Room 38307. We were escorted to the elevators and given 2 bottles of water. The Four Seasons occupies the top 5 floors of Mandalay Bay hotel and has its own pool with Jacuzzis and a Sunglasses Butler to clean your sunglasses. You can also get misted with Evian water and there is frozen fresh fruit provided. The room was really spacious with an extremely comfortable king size bed, armchair and pouffe, desk with wired or wireless internet access, 42” plasma TV, DVD player with games console and a keyboard. We were given a key at check in to access the well stocked mini bar and there was a selection of snacks. There was a coffee maker and coffee and tea was supplied. Large bathroom with separate toilet, single sink, bath and separate shower, L’Occitane toiletries. There were 2 bathrobes and slippers. The view was of the mountains to the west and THE Hotel. The only complaint was that the air con didn’t go cold enough, only down to 60F. As well as the exclusive pool we could also use the beach and pools at Mandalay Bay. There is a house car available to hotel guests. It provides complimentary transport within a 3 mile radius. It’s on a first come first served basis and they can check how long it’s going to be if it’s out on a job. The hotel is at the far south end of the strip and a car would be recommended, but we managed fine without one. Service in the hotel was superb and I would have no hesitation staying here again if I got another good rate. We paid £113 a night and it is normally over £300. Only problem was that a charge was made against my credit card after we checked out. I called the hotel and they said it was for a bottle of beer. We didn't take anything from the mini bar and only opened it as the creamer for the coffee was inside, otherwise we wouldn't have touched it. The charge was refunded.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay all round.”
Reviews.Author: Looseal
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel late on Friday night to find we had been upgraded to a suite, it was very luxurious and extremely well appointed. It was Strip/Airport facing but their soundproofing is as good as the rest of the hotel, there was no noise at all from the Airport/Strip or any other guests. All of the staff were brilliant and so helpful, most of the time I forgot that we were in Vegas at all. The Valet staff are great and left little bottles of water in the car, how thoughtful. The secret exit into the Mandalay Bay was very useful when we wanted to enter the hussle and bussle of Vegas but it was easy to get back into a great hotel, where the service is great, the beds are fantastic and nothing is too much trouble. Skip all the other hotels/Casinos and go here, you will not be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice”
Reviews.Author: TomRitucci
Reviews.Content: Typical Four Seasons with perfect service and everything you would ever need served directly to you.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: mjssta
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel may be more expensive than the others on the strip, the service level is truly a step above. It is also the only pet friendly hotel on the strip that I could find. We certainly felt welcomed. There was a doggy bed, doggy bowl, treats and water set up in the room waiting for us when we checked in. The valets not only retrieved our cars, but they always offered to give us directions before we drove off. We also found bottled water in our cup holders. The front desk escorted us to the elevators after we checked in rather than just leaving us to find the elevators on our own, and when the bell hop brought up the luggage up to our room, he hung our coats in the closet and put the luggage on the racks. The housekeeping staff was unintrusive and respectful of our privacy sign on the door. The room was spacious and clean.The atmosphere was calm and quiet. There was a grassy pet area with trash cans close by. It was a great place to escape the craziness of the strip. In closing, while we could have had a comfortable stay in another hotel for a lower price without these little extras, these extras certainly made our time in Vegas feel extra special.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended - Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: mike-lcf
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Las Vegas two weeks ago and had a lackluster experience at the Aria, which has been heavily billed as the "new" four star hotel on the strip. The Four Seasons was running some sort of corporate rate promotion so the rate was actually lower here than at the Aria, despite it being further from the main part of the strip. (It must be the recession, but they are offering some pretty decent rates for a 4 star hotel). I could not find any significant negatives about this hotel, and I am usually pretty picky. The service is among the best I have ever experienced at any hotel. Everyone from the valet to the doorman to the check in staff were exceptionally well-trained, polite and helpful. This hotel has its act together. The common interior area is typical of a Four Seasons -- which is to say, elegantly but casually decorated to give a peaceful aura. The room on the 36th floor was very clean and decently sized. The bed was very comfortable. Nice floor to ceiling windows and my room had a view of the mountains and part of the airport. The spray starch next to the ironing board and the free overnight shoe shine are nice touches and similar to what hotels do in Manhattan. The car valet service was also quick. Each time I picked up my car I was asked if I needed assistance or directions anywhere by the concierge. The internet charge is $15 per day; I hooked up to the ethernet cable service and it was fast and stayed on the entire time. Everywhere you turn they try to give you complimentary bottled water. At checkout, in your room, and even when they pull up your car at the valet there are two bottles waiting for you in your car. Only two items I would point out, neither of which outweigh the positive aspects of this hotel: The bed linens had a very slight but noticeable odor that is difficult to describe. Something akin to chlorine or scented bleach, but not exactly. It wasn't overwhelming but noticeable. Also, unfortunately the pool is "closed for seasonal maintenance" during February. You have access to the Mandalay Bay pool, but winter in Las Vegas is actually a pretty good time to spend time by the pool. Overall, this is a top notch hotel. I felt well-rested when I left. It is a bit aways from the main part of the strip so you will need to drive or take a taxi if you want to get over there, but in my opinion its worth it to stay at this excellent hotel. I would not hesitate to return to next time I am in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't get any better...”
Reviews.Author: NhLulu
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Four Seasons was the last night of a 2 week trip staying at a number of hotels on vacation with my daughter. I have also stayed at some of the nicest hotels in the Caribbean, US, Italy, Spain and Canada. Four Seasons is Exceptional in every aspect and was the perfect way for me to end my trip and drive to the airport the next morning at 5:30am. The room was immaculate, calming, and comfortable with a wonderful evening view. The bathroom facilities were luxurious, but the attention to detail in the room and facilities is what makes Four Seasons a step above the others. Check in and out went smoothly, the fitness facility and spa were a treat, and the quality of the restaurant food and attentiveness of the waitress were above reproach. I would highly recommend this hotel to discriminating travelers who want an exceptional hotel in a convenient location without all of the noise of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I have had the pleasure staying in!”
Reviews.Author: IRINC
Reviews.Content: I stayed four nights in a premium strip view room. The hotel is on top of Mandalay Bay. You can come and go and not even walk in casino. When you want to go to Mandalay Bay then there is a private entrance way for guest to use. This was nothing short of perfection. Every detail in every way. I especially liked being able to valet park all day while I ran in and out and then could park in self park over night. Food was great Concierge was top notch. Can’t say enough good things about this place. !!!!!!! THE FOLLOWING IS NOT A REFLECTION ON THE FOUR SESONS !!!!!! Note for those traveling to Vegas with Kids. If you walk up and down the strip you will be hounded by dozens of people "flicking cards of nude women to get you to call the escort service. It was so annoying and pervasive it was almost a form of touture. I am not a prude and the images did not offend me. It jsut is not appropriate for children and the overwhelming persistnace for bocks upon blocks is toutourous. If Vegas wants to see $$ flow back in town get rid of this one thing. You should not be accousted in public with this type of material.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing.....”
Reviews.Author: hm21999
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay and I cannot say enough about the FS! The hotel, the staff, the rooms, Verandah, and the service were all simply amazing! One day we wanted to rent a car and go to Red Rock Canyon. One call to the concierge and everything was set. The restaurant packed us picnic lunches that surpassed our expectations. After spending the day on the crazy Vegas strip, we could not wait to get back to the peace and quiet of the Four Seasons. It was the absolute best of both worlds! Welcome home indeed.......

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but Inconvenient”
Reviews.Author: Nahas
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Four Seasons, Las Vegas for 7 nights. The bed was outstanding as was the bathroom. The steam room in the spa was amazing. It is impossible to relax in the room and watch TV because there are no decent television channels, forget ordering room service because the food is dreadful. I tried ordering 3 times and nothing was even remotely OK. The night I arrived in Vegas I was too tired to head out so I ordered spaghetti with meatballs, I couldn't eat and had to put it in the hall so as not to stink up the room. I had viewed the menus online and couldn't wait to try the french toast with brandied bananas, it was dreadful. If you are planning to use the hotel for nothing other than sleeping then it is lovely, but be prepared to venture out to eat anything!

Reviews.Title: “Newest "Most Want to stay here while in Vegas"”
Reviews.Author: yellowrosetexas3
Reviews.Content: Oh my goodness! It was perfect here, quiet, clean, exceptional service and I got such a deal on our room for two nights! I found out they do accept pets under 25# and I only wish I had known this before hand. So wonderful to have calm and peace, yet Mandalay casino madness was only a few steps away if we wanted it. We dined at the Veranda and loved the ice tea and they have a very good Martini Happy Hour. Food was very good as well there. We drive to Vegas several times a year and have stayed at several really nice places there but without a doubt 4 Seasons will be our mainstay from now on, even without the great deal on the rooms...can't say it enough..it was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Most peaceful place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelhk
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here twice and we love this hotel. We would not stay anywhere else! It's one of the only hotels in Vegas that does not have a casino downstairs so it's like an oasis. Rooms are fantastic - very spacious, beds are very comfortable .. Service is top notch!!

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: mmalina31
Reviews.Content: I first want to say I stayed here with no planning, I simply called the reservations desk, told them what had happened and what I needed. Traveling with a newborn, and sad family is never fun, and if there was any positive thing to come out of this was the first clss service we recieved from Matt, and Courtney. He have a new born baby, the entire room was baby proofed, and other things were done out of the goodness of PEOPLe. They didn't have to do what they did however they did ,and I will never forget that. The room was amazing, clean, and everyone was so helpful. The reason f for the trip was a unexpected passing of a family member and let me tell you, I didn't have to do a thing, THANK YOU !!!

Reviews.Title: “Questionable at best.......not what I expect of a Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy F
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Four Seasons for 4 nights in January 2010. My room number was 39703 which was a standard room with a king size bed overlooking the Mandalay Bay's parking deck and the Western mountains further out. The reason for my stay was business, having a conference on site. The conference was excellent at each corner - the staff being very helpful at each request. However, my room experience was very mixed. So much so, I would hesitate to recommend this Four Seasons. Read the below for details. The usual; The Good, The OK, The Bad, and The Ugly. The Good 1. Concierge's desk - excellent staff in helping with every request. Job will done. 2. Food/drink at both restaurants - Charlie Palmer and Veranda. Good service, food very nice, expansive wine list at Palmers. 3. Laundry service / shoe shining - both were timely and well done. 4. The bed. Clean and comfortable with a nice selection of pillows. The OK 1. The room. Nice, large room with all of the expected amenities. The Bad 1. My room key would simply not work each evening. Not a problem typically, however the distance back to the front desk is about 10 minutes. Each night I called the front desk asking them to send security to my room. I can understand the first night, but each night? Something is wrong. 2. On my final day of checkout, I requested a 18:00 checkout which I was granted. However, upon return to my room at about 17:00, my room key didn't work. I was no longer in the mood. The security personnel said the room keys are only valid until 16:00 when asking for a late checkout. Why didn't the front deck advise me of this so I could have my keys exchanged? 3. Room noise. I could hear a quite loud "running water" sound at various times during my stay. I thought it may have been the neighbors shower, but never figured it out. It was very loud, but I luckily only heard it a couple of times and never reported it. 4. Internet service. Very s....l....o....w..... Don't even try the wireless service in the rooms, it is painfully slow. The Ethernet cable worked better but still lacked the speed you would expect from a 5* hotel. 5. Television. The channels were very fuzzy (not clear). I thought maybe it was an issue due to the weather, but it continued throughout my stay. The Ugly 1. Daily room key issue (see above). 2. Upon checkout the front desk advised they would have their car take me and two colleagues to the airport. But since we had 4 suitcases, the driver said we couldn't fit into one car and put us into a taxi - where all of our bags fit. Are you kidding? The s500 cannot fit 4 standard sized bags? When I asked, the driver seemed miffed and didn't want to deal with it. Not good service at all and left a negative impression on my entire stay. I would not spend over $150/night to stay there again. The $150 is a maximum the property deserves taking everything into consideration. Believe me, there are much nicer properties up and down the strip. I am actually not too happy writing this review - I would rather have had a much more pleasant experience...... Taking my entire stay into account, I would hesitate to recommend this property. Jeremy

Reviews.Title: “Not the best service”
Reviews.Author: AVA2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the four seasons with our 6 month old, thinking that the hotel would cater to our needs. We have been to Vegas many times ( before having a child) and new that we wanted to stay away from the mass crowd during New Years Eve. The hotel provided us with a high chair, fridge, and diaper genie. They tried very hard to make our stay " a home away from home". Unfortunately, we had to change room because it smelled like an ashtray and after we moved to a different room, they did not deliver our items needed for our 6-month old until later that evening after our baby was asleep. I ended up stuffing the bar fridge with the bottles and feeding the baby in a hotel chair, try to balance her upright. The service was not there and it was way to much money to spend for that. I would recommend stay elsewhere where you can bring all the things you need for a child. Also, there was alot of dog dung on the floor.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: JourneysTraveler
Reviews.Content: Great stay at the Four Seasons. I am a travel agent (Journeys Around the World) and have stayed at many of the hotels in Las Vegas and this was wonderful. As with all the Four Seasons I have stayed at, the service was outstanding and you truly feel the staff want to assist you! When checking in I had a bottle of champagne in a small bag; when my bags were brought to my room, the staff told me they saw the bottle and had ordered an ice bucket and champagne flutes to be delivered! And when my friends and I asked for a cab to go to a show, the hotel offered the hotel car rather than our taking a taxi! There are many other examples of how wonderful everyone was. And we loved the peacefulness of the hotel, only venturing into the Mandalay Bay casino when we wanted, not everytime we left our hotel room. Also ate at the Verandah for lunch which was good, and Charlie Palmer's for dinner, which was great! So if you want true luxury and service in Las Vegas.....this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Truly Excellent. Stellar service”
Reviews.Author: blossom
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Four Seasons Hotel Las Vegas with my husband to celebrate our 25th anniversary, and am so glad we chose this hotel. At check in, without any request from us, the reception desk autuomatically upgraded us from the Four Seasons Room we'd reserved to a 1 bedroom suite. Such a nice touch! The suite was spacious (1100 sq ft.) and immaculate with floor to ceiling windows and a great strip view, and 1 1/2 baths. At first, I found the suite just a little bland -- it wasn't an over the top suite with lots of bling, no tv in the bathroom, etc., but it was such a comfortable, thoughtfully laid out room, that by the end of our stay, I loved it. Watching the lights of the strip from our bedroom was wonderful. Overall, this hotel may have offered the best service we've ever received in a hotel. They left us an anniversary cake at turndown, and left ice in the room while we were out because we'd mentioned to the bell man we might get some later. I've stayed at a lot of Vegas hotels, but if you want to make sure you're well taken care of for a special stay, this is a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Serenity in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: NyctravelRN
Reviews.Content: We travel to Las Vegas every year for CES. Out of the 8 years we have been going the Four Seasons is now our go to place. It is located at the end of the strip on the top of the Mandalay Bay. There is a private entrance for Four Seasons guests. When we entered the lobby the very first thing I noticed was the silence. No drunk guests, no casino. We stayed in the strip view suite on the 37th floor. Amazing! 2 bathrooms, large room, and the view. I have to say we looked out the window all the time. The strip was visible in both the living quarters and the bedroom. The room was well appointed and lives up to the the brand name. All the staff were exceptional and friendly. We also enjoyed the spa. It is small for Vegas standards but quiet and relaxing as it should be. The massage therapist was one the the top I have EVER experienced. And if you want the nightlife and gambling the hotel is just an elevator stop from the Mandalay

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at a serene hotel on the Las Vegas strip”
Reviews.Author: dcla
Reviews.Content: We went to the Four Seasons in Las Vegas from February 14-15, 2009 for Valentine's Day. The hotel is located on the top five floors of Mandalay Bay, so you get a beautiful view. The room itself was clean, quiet, beautiful, and relaxing. Since the Four Seasons itself does not have a casino, it felt more relaxing than the usual Las Vegas casino hotels. However, if you want to play, there is a convenient door from exclusive Four Seasons elevators to the Mandalay Bay. The staff at check-in was friendly. The Spa was on the smaller side, but it was still nice, and the therapist was great. There was no jacuzzi to soak in, but it was still relaxing. Room service, as always, was delicious. The creme brulee is amazing. The breakfast buffet Verandah was delicious. It has a great omelet bar, and it even had a donut bar where mini donuts were made fresh, and you can add various toppings. Tip: the Four Seasons Las Vegas does not have its own parking lot, so you would have to valet your car for about $18. If you want to self park, you can park in the Mandalay Bay parking lot and walk through the casino to get to the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “"Best Luxury Award" Well-Deserved”
Reviews.Author: GottaRun
Reviews.Content: The reviews here at TripAdvisor are confirmed to be dead-on. NOT staying at this hotel would be a mistake. For the past ten years we have stayed exclusively at the Bellagio, multiple times a year, all comped. Because the last few times we felt more like another cow in the herd and the comps were not as generous, we decided it was time to venture out of the Bellagio. When we arrived for our 5-day anniversary get-away, the Four Seasons was uncharacteristically not Vegas (QUIET) and we found the room very comparable to the Bellagio (beautifully-appointed, but expected). My “Vegas attitude” kicked in and we immediately made reservations to spend our last two nights at THEHotel just to give it a try. Big mistake. Four Seasons then brought up a “happy anniversary” cake, all the staff greeted us by name (how did they do that?), work-out facility was fabulous, and the hot cider waiting for us when we returned from the cold won us over. I quickly appreciated what Four Seasons had to offer and did not want to leave. As a personal note, any hotel that provides suggested routes to run deserves extra kudos.

Reviews.Title: “The best of both worlds when looking for quality, relaxation, and Vegas fun”
Reviews.Author: LLLMaryland
Reviews.Content: When you arrive in the lobby of the Four Seasons Las Vegas you don't know you are in Las Vegas. Everything is Four Seasons style and Four Seasons quality (no casino in the lobby!). And since it is the top floors of the Mandalay Bay hotel you get the best of Las Vegas fun (casinos, pools, Mandalay Bay amenities, view, and fun) with Four Seasons quality, serenity, service and attention. We were not sure that we wanted to vacation in Las Vegas due to the smoking and the fact that we are not big gamblers, but the Four Seasons gave us the best of both worlds: a relaxing, first class non-smoking hotel experience with Las Vegas fun just an elevator stop away.

Reviews.Title: “the only place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: vacationer71
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Las Vegas is unmatched. Everything you expect in a Four Seasons -- elegance, comfort, quiet, family friendly, terrific amenities -- together with everything that you want about being in a first-tier Strip casino-resort (on top of and connected to Madalay Bay). We were back and forth through the lobbies and port cocheres of half a dozen other properties, including many of the best, and every time at least one person in our party (we were mostly all staying at 4S) would remark how infinitely worse the experience was compared to the Four Seasons. Gym, WiFi, television service, all great. Rooms huge and well-appointed.

Reviews.Title: “The ONLY place to stay in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: NachoLibre99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a couple nights to celebrate our anniversary. This was our 6th or 7th time staying here over the last 10 years. The Four Seasons Las Vegas continues to impress. Fantastic service you come to expect with this company. We had a spectacular view in the "Premier Strip View Suite" category.....definitely worth popping for the view....straight down the strip on the 39th floor. At night it is nothing short of mesmerizing. Staying here affords you easy access to all the great dining and casino at Mandalay, and yet allows you to escape the insanity. Breakfast at the Verandah is outstanding. Dinner at Mix (atop The Hotel at Mandalay) is not to be missed......I highly recommend opting for the Chef's Tasting menu with wine pairing.....$155 but worth every penny. The weather this trip did not allow for any pool time, but make no mistake....this hotel's pool and staff cannot be beat, so if it's warm...don't hesitate to spend your day there. Ask for Zlada to be your server and you will not be sorry. We have stayed at many other hotels in Vegas over the last 20 years, but over the last 5 or 6, have stayed nowhere else but here......there simply is no reason to. If you want to be treated like royalty, and have a beautiful, smoke free sanctuary to return to after a crazy day/night out in Vegas.....this is the ONLY place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not a typical Vegas hotel”
Reviews.Author: NRT
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Las Vegas is unique because it feels like a luxury hotel you might find in any city. It's located on the top floors of the Mandalay Bay, but has a separate entrance. It's quiet, not crowded and has exceptional service. There's no waiting in line to check-in or battling crowds. You also don't have to walk through a noisy and smoky casino everytime you come and go. But because it's located at the Mandalay Bay, you have easy access to all of that hotel's amenities. I noticed a lot of guests had their dogs with them, and the hotel seems very pet friendly.

Reviews.Title: “It’s All About the Service”
Reviews.Author: Theate3541
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Four Seasons Las Vegas quite frequently, and while it may not be the flashiest resort in town, where it continually surpasses all is in its service. From the front desk (who do much more than just hand you a room key – they’ll print documents, help you with faxes and more, all free of charge) to the Concierges who actually knows Vegas and won’t just send you to the places where they get kickbacks. In sum, they run a five star hotel the way a five star hotel should be ran. The only asterisk to the place is unfortunately it is attached to Mandalay Bay, which has seen better days. That said, the hotel provides a complimentary car service, and cabs are very easy to get – so you’re never far from anywhere you want to go. Overall, the Four Seasons is a tough place to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis”
Reviews.Author: etan92612
Reviews.Content: What a nice peaceful place. It was such a relief walking in and leaving the crowds and noisy slot machines behind. It started with the cordial valet, then the doorman and then the front desk. Everyone was classy and polite and our fur child (toy poodle) was treated with equal respect. We had the option of being in the Vegas chaos or retreating back to our hotel. Wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hotel In The U.S.”
Reviews.Author: Jtorsney
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Four Seasons Las Vegas five times now. The hotel is simply spectacular. Guest rooms are located on the 35th-39th floors of Mandalay Bay's main tower, while reception, the hotels restaurants, and pool and spa are in separate quarters. I have never waited more than 5 minutes to be shown my guest room here. Rooms are well appointed are are tastefully, rather than dramatically decorated. Each room has a coffee maker and private bar. Standard rooms are something like 525 square feet or so, which is neither tiny ot huge by Las Vegas standards. Guest bathrooms are quite large, and include separate soaking tub and shower stall. The hotel's restaurants are very good. I rate Charlie Palmer as the best steakhouse in the city. Verandah is a very nice New American restaurant open for breakfast, weekend bruch, aftermoon tea, and dinner. The high tea is a must. Four Seasons has its own pool which allows guests to avoid the crowds at Mandalay Beach next door. Poolside service, like all service at this hotel, is perfection. Morning newspaper delivery and nightly turndown service are great touches. The property is very relaxing, but guests have immediate access to Mandalay Bay's restaurants, casino, and facilities. All of this luxury comes at a high cost, but I find it worthwhile. Pros: Great rooms, service, food, and pool Con: Pool should have either cabanas or some area that would be shady even in the summer

Reviews.Title: “Love/Hate the Four Seasons Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: DRLMM
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons for 3 nights during our family vacation. The staff were responsive and gracious. The room was quiet, clean, and expectedly luxurious. It did feel "away" from the noise and bustle of casino life. The door from the large Mandalay lobby into the Four Seasons was the clear "dividing line", between loud and quiet. The exclusive Four Seasons pool was great for these reasons: Poolside dining and service was great. Being close to the Mandalay Pools and Lazy River was great. I had a hard time with the pool staff telling us that our children needed to be more quiet while they were in the pool - I would COMPLETELY understand if they were being rambunctious and out of control, but they were not. My children were actually being VERY well-behaved. In fact, the drunk adult patrons the next morning were 5 times louder than my children were at any point, but nobody asked them to be quiet. I resented the double standard. However, when we tried to hang out in the Mandalay Bay section of the pools, we found that we were unable to order any food and have it charged to our room. So we had to go back and forth: Lazy River for play, back to the Four Seasons for food, etc. This was frustrating. BUT the food at the Four Seasons pool was 1000 times better than what was being served at the Mandalay. So I definitely appreciated the good that was there. But I left there with entirely mixed feelings, and unfortunately remained somewhat resentful about how unreasonable they were regarding children at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding in every way...”
Reviews.Author: Impressed_Guest_01
Reviews.Content: Everything about our stay was exceptional. The rooms were outstanding and the service was impeccable. Others have correctly described the Four Seasons as an oasis. It was wonderful to return to the calm, uncrowded feeling of the hotel each evening. Derek, the front-desk clerk who checked us in, was simply amazing. Though a bit on the expensive side, the hotel represented an excellent value for the price. We look forward to staying there during our next visit to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel with wonderful people”
Reviews.Author: mcr0132
Reviews.Content: Flew in to Vegas for the marathon. From the moment I pulled into the complex the doormen who greeted me and the lady at the front desk was extremely helpful. I was able to check in early into a lovely moderate room that faced the beautiful mountain range. Some have complained about the noise from the planes taking off/landing from the airport but I found it hardly bothersome. The bathroom had wonderful bath products, and the tub I wanted to just live in especially after running the race. After the second day I had asked if a simple cotton comforter could be placed on the bed instead of the very comfy but extremely hot at night down comforter and it was done by the time I got home from my extreme shopping adventure. The maid service was wonderful and turn down service/newspaper every morning made me never want to come home. This was a perfect location for the marathon and I have already made my boyfriend agree to it next year. The spa massage was worth the long flight alone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice to be away from the crowds and gambling”
Reviews.Author: HotelSnob2006
Reviews.Content: FS was having quite a few specials for their most basic room so we decided to try something different on this trip to Vegas. Got a rate of about $330 a night including tax. FS is by far my new favorite in Vegas until the Mandarin opens and I check that out. If you are looking for a place that is away from the gambling sounds and crowds, then this is the perfect place. For a basic room, our room was spacious and had quite a large bathroom. Bed was extra comfy and we had a view of the Mandalay pool area. The FS pool area was exceptional. Pool staff walked around giving out fresh fruit, lemonade, and doing sunglass cleaning and evian spritz. Had a great lunch poolside, highly recommend the grilled cheese sandwhich with tomatoe soup. The only odd thing was that the pool did not have a drink menu, the waitress just said, ask me what you want and I'll see if we can make it. It would be nice if they had some special drinks or at least listed some basics in a drink menu. Brunch in the restaurant was not bad at $35 pp, especially if you are hungover from the night before and just want something close by. Spa and gym facilities were excellent as well. There are attendants in the gym handing out towels, water, and gatorade. Hotel guests can use the steam room in the spa even if they are not having spa treatments. Service all around was the usual FS polished treatment that guests are used to no matter what FS they stay at. The only negative I think of is that it is at the end of the strip, attached to mandalay bay so it is kind of a hike to get to the middle of the strip for shows and dinner. This didn't bother us as we wanted to stay a little further away, but it might be an issue for others.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best!”
Reviews.Author: ledcam
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from an eight night stay at The Four Seasons. We were celebrating our anniversary. We could not have made a better choice of hotel. We were upgraded to a Premier View Strip Suite in advance which was simply stunning - views, amenities and acres of space. A celebration cake and a selection of fresh fruit were awaiting us in the room on our first night which was thoughful and much appreciated. Thoughfulness seems to sum up this hotel. The staff are there if you need them but never intrusive - you are made to feel safe from the outset. Several times during our stay messages were left on the answer machine from the on-duty manager just checking if everything was going well and if anything was needed. We ate in Charlie Palmers, the in-house steak restaurant on one night. It was quite expensive - the wine list in particular is eye-wateringly so, and although the food was good the experience was marred to a considerable extent by the noise coming from a nearby table. We had expected a quiet intimate dinner but...Not the hotel's fault but disappointing nonetheless. Although at the extreme south-end of the Strip there is a free tram which runs between Mandalay Bay and Excalibur. Getting around is easy. We booked to see three shows when we were in town and had no problem travelling about. The monorail is a frequent, fast way to travel to most of the points of interest. We bought an item which only after buying realised we would not be able to take back as cabin luggage. It was expensive and we were not keen to put it in the aircraft hold. A quick word with the Concierge staff and it was arranged through their in-house business department for the package to be posted home to the UK - do you prefer UPS or FedEx I was asked. Marvellous! We have stayed in a couple of the rival hotels before this visit - Bellagio and the Venetian to name two but neither come close to The Four Seasons. If you fancy a treat go for it - you won't regret it. I have read reviews here where people have complained about the noise from McCarran Airport. Our room overlooked the airport and the noise didn't bother us at all - in fact is was interesting to sit by the huge floor to ceiling windows with a glass of wine in one hand and just watch the world rolling along. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Raised the bar”
Reviews.Author: GaryMel
Reviews.Content: Spent last weekend at the Four Seasons, and now I will not be able to stay anywhere else. Yes, it's expensive, but we appreciated being removed from the glitz etc. of Vegas, yet being able to enjoy everything Vegas has to offer on our own terms. Strip view is worth the upgrade. We ate at the restaurants in the Mandalay Bay Casino area, and were impressed by Border Grill and Strip Steak. We were happy to leave it all behind at the end of the night, and slip back into the luxury of the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Actually a good value, believe it or not!”
Reviews.Author: jbillin
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the end of October, and booked through American Express Fine Hotels & Resorts. The package gave us the third night free, plus breakfast either in our room or at the Verandah Restaurant, plus one free dinner at Verandah. Our final per night cost was $109, which is unbelievable for the Four Seasons. The only reason I gave them 4 rather than 5 stars for value was the internet access charge. It really should be free at that level of hotel. The rooms are large, the beds are comfy and it really is an oasis of calm (just as they advertise). We actually experienced culture shock when we opened the "secret" door into the bustle that is Mandalay Bay. We forgot we were in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “On oasis of calm after the full-on Vegas strip.”
Reviews.Author: lonewayfarer
Reviews.Content: As a traveller who usually stays in budget hotels this was a bit of a treat for me. I had the opportunity to stay in this wonderful hotel and I do not use the term lightly. I have to admit that I do not get the opportunity to stay in 5+ star hotels on a regular basis so my review will be based on my limited experience of them. The hotel itself is located at the top of the Mandalay Bay complex located on floor 35-39. It has it's own independant lobby and elevators at ground level, so you do not need to walk through any casinos to get to the hotel. From the beginning we were welcomed. On our arrival from the airport we were checked in swiftly and courteously then shown where the elevators were. We got given cold bottled water to refresh us after our journey. The elevator goes to the floors 35-39 and you have access to the casino level if you wish. Our room was on the 39th floor with a strip view. The room was a twin room with two very comfortable queen sized beds. It was well very clean and well decorated with solid wood furniture and soft furnishings. There was a large screen television with access to many channels, movies, games and the Internet. The bedside table had a lamp, ipod dock and bedside alarm clock. There was a large comfortable chair and footstool to relax as well as a desk and two chairs with writing equipment. There was a well-stocked minibar with snacks and drinks and plenty of closet space. The bathroom was clean and bright with a marble suite and a great shower and bath. Plenty of clean towels and bathroom products like L'Occitane soap and shampoo. Our room service was super-efficient and we often returned to find our beds had been made and the room had been cleaned. Fresh fruit was delivered on one of the nights as well as bottled water on a regular basis. There were lots of other services that we had access to that we didn't necessarily use like laundry services, in-room dining and use of the business and conference centres. My colleague did visit the spa which is at the ground level and he was full of praise about it. The hotel has got a steak house as well as a contemporary Italian restaurant called Verandah. I'll write a seperate review about that. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone who has the opportunity to stay at it. It was an oasis of calm after the full-on sights and sounds of the Vegas strip.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: Gerpatrick
Reviews.Content: We arrived on oct 16, we had booked for 6 nights, at check in my girlfriend had asked for a room upgrade to a strip view, we were told that the hotel was full for the weekend but on monday the 18th there would be a strip view available, we checked in and found our room on the 36th floor, beautiful room, just what I expected from a four seasons hotel, on the 18th we recieved a message from reception that our new room was ready, within 15 minutes we were in the new room, an awesome view looking straight down the strip, a room that would have cost $100 a night extra if we had book it form the start and all complimentary, everybody we came in contact with that worked in the hotel were very helpful and really made our stay in Las Vegas a great experience, we stayed in the wynn last year but i think if you want a hotel in Vegas with the ultimate luxury, the most comfortable beds, most pleasant staff, great pools, then the four seasons it has to be, we'll be returning again next year and I think we already know where we'll be staying. Well done to the Four Seasons Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons - Five stars”
Reviews.Author: JacquieP
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at this hotel recently and loved our experience. We did book through Wot-if and got a heavily discounted rate- so our views are based on that. The room was a decent size , decorated in what Icall bland traditional america style but we did have a fantastic view looking right down the strip. The in -room service was excellent. Bed very comfy and bathroom beautifully appointed. We enjoyed the atmosphere of the poolside restaurant and fantastic service by pool attendants who set up your loungers with covers and towels and bought iced water and glasses to your table. To clear up any confusion the Four seasons is on the top 4 or 5 floors of the Hotel Mandalay Bay.This is located at one end of the strip , very close to the airport. Its about a 10 minute walk up the strip to the Belligio ( centre of Vegas) It has its own lifts, restaurant and pool but no casino. There is direct access to the Mandalay Bay casino. I

Reviews.Title: “Truly outstanding - one of the better Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: Consultant2468
Reviews.Content: All Four Seasons are top-notch - this one is slightly better. The service is relaxed and not scripted; the rooms are clean and well maintained; room service is very good, both the food and the service; and the hotel is a delight to stay in. If you want in the frantic world of Vegas, look elsewhere - this is, as they say, the one place in the city you will find serenity.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more consistent service and problem solving”
Reviews.Author: jenskar
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas to see U2 at Sam Boyd, and as such booked our rooms months ago with a 3 for 2 rate -- strip view. Call me crazy, but then the bed should face the strip too. Room was definitely clean, concierge for the most part extremely friendly, food and nummies in the restaurants were tasty but oh no, don't order room service. Soggy pizza, burnt pancacks, a sickenly sweet smoothy. Based on a quick dinner downstairs they can do better. Encountered very loud disco one night -- front desk tried to convince me it was from the roof top but no, next night not so (thank heaven). Definitely nice to be off to the side with fewer waits for things. Bathroom -- the hairdryer blew all the fuses, then they brought a new one and it died. My hair is not that thick. Those L'occidente products are extremely drying -- don't think of that as remotely high end -- give me some good Fresh Rice bath or Bergamot age delay body creams -- then I'd fee like you went the extra country mile. So, would I stay again for about 350 a night? Not sure. Did appreciate concierge getting us a fountain view window at Olives. But hey, it's Vegas, one can just lighten up and go with it. One aside -- Balinese masages a must - they really know where they're doing and you're going to be transported to another planet. Go there. It's a pretty planet !! U2 were amazing, as was the Valley of Fire National Park. Could have camped out there -- looked so interesting.

Reviews.Title: “great as usual”
Reviews.Author: skingKansas
Reviews.Content: We only stayed 3 nights, but the staff is really what makes the stay. Very friendly! My husband had left his CC and the staff was more than willing to call and help locate it. Also, I liked the quiteness of the hotel. There wasn't a noisy crowd in the hall which is usually what keeps me awake at night.

Reviews.Title: “Exclusivity on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Notsolittlebird
Reviews.Content: My partner and I travelled to Vegas for our friend's wedding as part of a group of about 20 people staying in the Mandalay Bay, THE Hotel at Mandalay Bay and the Luxor next door. We booked on late and while others where only staying in Vegas a couple of nights before moving on we decided we couldn't be bothered with travelling around and opted to soak up some winter sun by the pool instead, so were looking for a base for around 10 nights and couldn't get into any of the hotels above. The closest we could get was the Four Seasons which takes up the top five floors of the Mandalay Bay, allowing access to all the facilities of all the hotels on the complex as well as some exclusive areas for FS guests only. Staying in Vegas for 10 nights seems fairly unheard of unless you're headlining somewhere but we got a great deal on the FS - expedia was pricing around £220 a night but we shopped around online and got it for about £120. For this money I think the FS is fantastic - I'm not sure I'd pay £220 - there are lots of good hotels around in Vegas for less. We stayed at the Bellagio last year for around £100 a night and it's much more central to the main attractions on the strip and similarly luxurious. We also got and $50 spa credit each on check it which we didn't use cos the treatments were a little pricey. We got a fantastic room literally looking right down the strip, like something out of a postcard. Watching the news in the morning for the weather forecast the webcam view was almost identical which shows it's one of the best views around. The room itself wasn't huge but, as they say, it was perfectly formed. A nice big bed with good quality linens, big TV and lots of wardrobe space. The bathroom wasn't huge and the bath and shower seemed smaller than standard, but BVLGARI toiletries were great! I really liked the ipod docking station but I thought the WiFi charge was excessive at $14.99 for 24 hours. Heres a tip though for wifi addicts - if you go down to the beach at Mandalay Bay which you can use as a FS guest there's free wifi there. I thought the hotel did well on special touches - we had a hand written note in our room from the manager with truffles on arrival, saying if we needed anything to just ask. On the last night we got another note with melted chocolate and strawberries. We ordered room service a couple of times and always thought it good value and good quality. By the FS pool the staff cannot do enough for you, they set your sunlounger up with super fluffy towels and bring iced water jugs to your side - and that's before they come around cleaning your sunglasses, spraying Evian mist on your face and dishing out complimentry smoothies, ice lollies and melon. The pool itself is only small but it's much quieter and more relaxing than Mandalay's beach which was bustling in October so imagine would be crazy busy in summer. All in all we liked this hotel - it's just a little way out for wandering up and down the strip. You can get on the free monorail as far as Excalibur but it is a long walk up to Bellagio/Paris/Venetian/Ceasers or the Mirage, which is what I would describe as central strip territory. The facilities in the Mandalay or OK - we ate there a couple of times - but the casino was quiet and lacking in atmosphere compared to other hotels with more passing traffic. For daytime gambling we really enjoyed the dealertainers at the Imperial Palace of all places for a real laugh and great atmosphere with low minimums... but the Bellagio casino is good at night and you can't beat the restaurants around the hotel's lake for pure views and experience. Bit pricier this year than last but that was partly due to a poor exchange rate for us Brits! Hope this helps - if you are heading to Vegas we saw the Beatle's LOVE show at the Mirage this time and would highly, highly recommend it. Best thing we've seen in Vegas by a long chalk :-)

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay there again in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: HKJoey
Reviews.Content: My wife and I lucked into a great rate at Four Seasons Las Vegas for the U2 concert weekend. Not only is the hotel a luxurious oasis in the city of sin, but the service is by far the most consistently outstanding we have ever seen in an American hotel... from bell services to housekeeping to front desk and management... everyone had a smile and something nice to say. Wow! We were amazed. Budget permitting, we won't stay anywhere else in Vegas ever again!

Reviews.Title: “A Relaxing Oasis on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: kristin8788
Reviews.Content: Went there this last week with my husband who was on a business trip. From the moment we stepped out of the taxi, we had a fabulous experience. The staff was always helpful and friendly. They even upgraded us to a suite, which was beautiful. Everything was clean and comfortable. Don't miss hanging out at the pool. I sat down there for hours after braving the strip with my book and a cocktail and I felt reenergized.. The hotel is at the south end of the strip but you can take a tram from Mandalay Bay (which connects with Four Seasons) to Excalibur--very convenient

Reviews.Title: “This was a very nice luxurious hotel with great service.”
Reviews.Author: LACims
Reviews.Content: We have been to Las Vegas many times, and have stayed in the nicer hotels most of the times and the Four Seasons beats them all. It starts at check-in, when they saw our daughter, they gave her a very nice furry toy. Check-in was fast and easy, they walk you to the elevator and show you how to get to Mandalay Bay. The rooms are located on the top 6 floors of the Mandalay Bay hotel, thus you are guaranteed to be high up. The room was very nicely furnished, comfortable bed, large bathroom with a separate tub and shower. They had a kids "toiletry bag" with shampoo, conditioner, lotion for my daughter. Also a nice touch - they had my daughter's name spelled out with those sponge letters that kids play with in the bath-tub. It was difficult to figure out the TV channels but we were not in the room much to worry about it. It was great to be able to use the Mandalay Bay beach as a benefit of staying here, we loved the lazy river though were disappointed that we could not use the wave pool due to my daughter being too short. We went in summmer, it was extremely hot and we spent half a day just staying in the lazy river. The pool at Four Seasons was nice and way quieter. After all the noise, crowds and racket at the Mandalay beach, it was nice to go to the Four Seasons pool and just relax. This pool is for Four Seasons guests only, and so it was never crowded. Service was great, they bring out a jug of iced water when you get there, and the staff is always walking around making sure everyone is taken care of. We had breakfast at the hotel one morning, the buffet is expensive but has great choices. Loved the choices of bacon, and sausages, the berries bowl, mini doughnuts and pastries. All in all , this was the best hotel in terms of service and attention to detail. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views, awesome bed!”
Reviews.Author: WIWanderers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two days. We had a late check in and all the king rooms were full so we were upgraded to the 180 degree strip view suite. It was fantastic! While it was definitely more room than we needed it was absolutely beautiful with a great view of the strip, airport and the mountains beyond. Even though the hotel was right across from the airport we couldn't hear any planes, just an occasional helicopter. The spa was really nice and the fitness center was well equiped. Both were free for hotel guests. The pool was very nice. You could use the Mandalay Bay pools as well, but the Four Seasons pool was much less crowded and more relaxing. We had breakfast at the Veranda. The food and service were both excellent. The Four Seasons only has valet parking at $19/day, but you can park for free over at the Mandalay Bay and walk through to the Four Seasons. Internet was $15/day. Overall an excellent hotel that I would definitely stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice! Only issue is distance from everything else.”
Reviews.Author: ackdaddy90
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a couple buddies at the Four Seasons. They overbooked the first night and gave us a free night at the "THEHotel" and it was nice, but our room smelled like smoke. The room at Four Seasons was really nice and everyone was always nice as you would expect at a Four Seasons. Only complaint is that it is too far from all the other casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place - great pool”
Reviews.Author: ChrisV17
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business conference held at Mandalay Bay. This hotel is attached and is much nicer. They have a smaller private pool with a guy walking around misting people with an Evian water aerosol mister. Service at the pool was top notch too as was the room service. Prices were higher than other Vegas hotels but not outrageous.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel as are all the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: CVUblue
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons occupies the top 4 floors of the Mandalay Bay Hotel. Elegant private lobby that is separate from the Mandalay Bay Hotel with separate elevators to the rooms. The rooms are all tastefully decorated which is wonderful in Vegas. Strip views are nice but the non strip views are not bad. The only negative are the tour helicopters that come so close to the hotel you almost feel like you are under attack.

Reviews.Title: “I felt like Cinderella.”
Reviews.Author: tlsagrl
Reviews.Content: My husband had meetings to attend at the hotel and I got to go along. Before we even entered the hotel there were people to help us with our bags and offering to do anything they could to make sure our stay was enjoyable. The people at the desk were sooo polite and helpful. And then we got to our room....it was like walking into paradise. It was BEAUTIFUL. Slippers and cozy robes and the shampoo and conditioner and lotion was to die for. The room service was above par. And the bed!!!!!!!!! Oh my gosh. The pool service was exceptional. The food... everything perfect. We couldn't have asked for a better first experience in Las Vegas. Thank you so much for making me feel like a princess for a couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL & STAFF”
Reviews.Author: kaznelson
Reviews.Content: Our final destination after touring the USA was Las Vegas. We were amazed that we managed to book the Four Seasons for less than £100 per night. We had paid much more than this for some horrid hotels. We received a fantastic welcome from the Valet staff who quickly parked our car and took our luggage to our room. Check in was swift & a complimentary bottle of chilled water. Our room was on the 36th floor, overlooking the bottom of the Strip/Mountains. Great room, decorated in a traditional style & very clean. Huge Bed with wonderful bedding. The most comfortable bed we have ever slept in. Large TV & Internet available at $15 per day. Bathroom was spotless with quality towels & toiletries. Room Service was fast. Maid Service was twice a day. Turn down service was an extra bonus at the end of a long day. We were treated to a surprise birthday cake on our arrival. Pool area was very nice and again the service was 1st Class. The concierge staff were fantastic, returning our hire care, taking bookings and phoning bars in advance to notify them of our arrival. Casino of Mandalay Bay is on the 2nd floor and is reached via a private entrance. We tried to book the hotel car twice but it wasn't available but taxis are waiting at the front of the hotel. However it was available to take us to the airport. I have no idea how anybody can find fault with this hotel. Compared to other hotels on the Strip, this really is an Oasis not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but..."”
Reviews.Author: Travelgirl056
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a long weekend at the Four Seasons Las Vegas. I read many great reviews of this resort and wanted to check it out. Very nice private entrance you do feel like you're pulling into a Four Seasons. Very helpful and polite staff at check-in. We had a little issue with our reservation which was solved quickly and efficiently. We were on the 39th Floor. I think the Four Seasons has the 4 top floor of the Mandalay. The room is clean, new but very plainly decorated. We had a smallish room with a view of the strip. The bathroom is big, marble, large area, but only one sink and the world's smallest shower. Just a bad use of space. The pool area is smallish, but nice and private. You can access the Mandalay Bay pool with your Four Season's Key. I was a little disappointed with the pool, the lounger cushions are faded and a little dirty. We walked around the Wynn and the Encore and their pool loungers were far superior. I hate to nit pick, but just being honest. The staff at the pool were very friendly and helpful. They came and set up the lounger for you immediately and someone came by to take your drink/food order. There's a small bar area with a little place to eat. Overall it was a good experience, but given the options in Vegas, I won't stay there again. I've stayed at the suites at The Hotel and I would much rather go there. We did visit the spa and did an 80 min treatment. Very expensive and really not up to standards. Save your money and go to the spa at the Mandalay. A little less expensive and bigger spa.

Reviews.Title: “Wow what a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TynesideGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Four Seasons for 3 nights last week and it was an excellent hotel, the check-in was very quick the bags were in the room before we arrived there, the room was fabulous it was on the 39th floor with a spectacular view over Vegas and the airport. The Four Seasons is like an oasis after walking on the strip the pool area is very good and the food was excellent. We have now moved on to San Deigo, think 3 days is more than enough for Vegas unless you want to gamble. Well done Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Vegas, but could improve around the edges”
Reviews.Author: aleromm
Reviews.Content: Im giving this hotel 5 because its really the best hotel in vegas, it may not be the best hotel out there such as Beverly Hills, NYC, or London but i understand hotels in Vegas come in #2 compared to rest of it out there. We were celebrating two birthdays so we chose vegas. We arrived around 1:30, of course the room wasn't ready, so we walked into the Mandalay bay and grabbed lunch, something cafe right by the guest elevators.... Yummy. The room was ready after lunch so we checked in, nice thing is this hotel is on the top floors of the Mandalay so your gonna have a great view. Guest reception agent, was really nice and helpful, pointed us in the right direction and headed on our way... 36th floors later, we arrived. Nothing to impressive except the view. Bed, simple decor and large bathroom. Nothing really new but not worn out as well. Stayed 3 nighst, and did not regret choosing this hotel, even though it was at the end of the strip. Good thing is, the Luxor and Excalibur all connect together, so you never have to walk in the hot sun to get down the strip. Things we loved: *The hotel driver; Escalade is better to ride in then a cab any day *Being able to escape to a separate 4 season lobby with no crowds *Housekeeping was able to get any items we needed up in a really quick manner, very professional and polite. *Separate pool from the Mandalay, but having access to the big pool if needed... *SPA was great, steam and great showers, Gatorade in Mens and tea in the woman's... cute touch, but what if i wanted tea?? Not no keen: *Pool girl seemed not to be happy to be there, orders took a bit too long, the order wasn't to hard btw *No birthday amenity in room, after telling the hotel we were there to celebrate our birthdays ( no wow factor) *Hotel staff used the guest elevators which seemed weird when we were in a rush and kept stopping on floors to pick them up *Walked in the lobby restroom to find an associate using it (awkward) We never used our car once for the entire time we were there, seemed funny to pay for valet if its gonna sit there for days, we parked in Mandalay for free, and it only took 5 minutes from our car to the room If you want the best in Vegas, this is the place. Unless your paying 5-20k for a suite at other hotels that come with a personal butler, this is the best service on the strip. I stayed at the Wynn my last trip and was a bit disappointed so decided to try 4 Seasons and was happy i did. Like I said maybe a few errors but no ones perfect

Reviews.Title: “Best in Vegas (after a poor start)”
Reviews.Author: londongavin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for four nights in September 2009. I had been to Vegas once before and chose the Four Seasons as we liked the idea of being able to escape back to somewhere quieter after venturing out into the hustle and bustle. I got a great deal on the BA website and had booked a Superior Room. We arrived at 3.30pm on a Thursday afternoon to be (after an excellent welcome from the valet parkers and door staff) to be told by the woman on reception that our room wasn't ready but that we could upgrade to a suite for $100 extra a night. When I said that I had no interest in paying to upgrade to a suite, I was basically told that I was being foolish as this was amazing value and that we would therefore have to wait for a room to become available. At this point I was very unhappy, firstly for being told how I should spend my money (I was able to find better ways to spend that $400 in Vegas!) and secondly that, despite it being after check-in time, the room that we had booked was not available... this was their problem not mine! I therefore asked to speak to the manager at which point the reception woman mysteriously managed to find us a room... and what a room. We were upgraded to a strip view room although the silly reception woman didn't actually bother telling us that she'd upgraded us and therefore missed out on a great gratuity! This was the only negative we had about the stay. The view from the strip view room was amazing and the room was a good size (although probably small by Vegas standards) and comfortably furnished. Decent L'Occitaine toiletries and I didn't think that the minibar prices were too crazy compared to other hotels (although the $15 internet charge a night irked slightly). I will just echo what others have said on this site about the hotel being an oasis of tranquility; it was great being able to go through that door from Mandalay Bay into a world of refined luxury (and we managed to find the door fine after a while!) and we quite liked being down the south end of the strip away from the "mad" middle section. The pool service is everything that has been reported, jugs of water, frozen melon balls, evian spray etc etc, and I thought that the fitness centre was very well equipped. There was a good range of food and drinks available at the pool and again it wasn't stupidly priced. The only time we properly ate at the Hotel was the Sunday breakfast buffet; I would strongly recommend this to anyone. I've seen alot of breakfast buffets at a lot of hotels around the world, but nothing could beat this for quality! Not only were there some interesting options (including doughnuts that you could take away in a box for a midmorning treat!) but most of the options were small portions so that you could have a wider variety. We utilised the concierge desk on a number of occasions and were very impressed. They managed to get us a table for Prime at the Bellagio at 8pm despite us having only been able to manage 9.30 when we tried to book ourselves and their advice was generally useful and impartisan. Overall, I'd recommend this over any other hotel in Vegas if you want a more chilled, relaxing experience but it's likely that it wouldn't be the right place for you if you want a typical Vegas stay! So saying that, the new Mandarin Oriental could be interesting when it opens....

Reviews.Title: “Ahhhh... Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: rolandws
Reviews.Content: I recently enjoyed a wonderful and relaxing stay at the Four Seasons Hotel Las Vegas. During my previous trip to Vegas, I stayed at the adjacent Mandalay Bay hotel and expected the two properties to be more-or-less the same. While I enjoyed the Mandalay, I LOVED the Four Seasons. Even before I arrived, I emailed the concierge to see if he could secure dinner reservations for us at the Foundation Room - an exclusive members-only club at the top of the Mandalay Bay. I'm not a member, so I wasn't optimistic. However, I soon received an email confirmation saying it had been arranged! From the moment you pull into the driveway, the staff is incredibly attentive. They escort you to the registration desk where you are immediately made to feel like royalty. The other reviewers have nailed it with terms like magical, oasis, luxury... even the simple act of retrieving your car from the valet yields a pleasant surprise - two bottles of chilled water were placed in the cup holders waiting for us! On our last day, I called down to the concierge to see if they would print our boarding passes. They made a point of logging into the airline site the minute I was eligible to login and they scored two slots early in the boarding order for us - that's a big deal if you are flying Southwest! Of course, the room we were assigned was impeccable and spacious. We were offered an upgrade with a view of the strip, but opted to keep our original room with a panoramic view of the desert and mountains.

Reviews.Title: “Peace and Quiet Next Door to Hustle and Bustle”
Reviews.Author: TouristSanDiego
Reviews.Content: Tucked away on floors 35-39 of the Mandalay Bay Hotel at the far south end of the strip, the Four Seasons Hotel offers a quiet lobby decorated with beautiful fresh flowers that feels a million miles away from the rest of Vegas. A security concern exists as no room key or ID check is required for elevator access to any floor. The Mandalay Bay Hotel is just an unlocked door away. Through the casino, one can walk across Mandalay Place into the Luxor. The small pool area is physically separated from the busy Mandalay by a large privacy wall. We dined at the Veranda restaurant, a nicely decorated space with both indoor And outdoor seating. I recommend the bento box with tomato soup, pesto pasta salad, Italian panini, and delicious crime brûlée for dessert. There was a constant flow of upper end weddings. Both nights such events closed the pool area early. Now to describe the room accommodations. We booked under the "suite package" which included buy one, get one night free and $50 off a 80 minute spa treatment. We upgraded our suite for an additional $300/night ending up with the "sunrise sunset suite" normally priced at $1,800 per night for $ 969 per tax for 2 nights. 73% off. Parking is an additional $20 per night. The suite was a huge 1,500 sq feet complete with 1 1/2 baths, pantry, dining, living room/ study, large walk-in closet, and marble bath room. The furnishings and artwork were traditional. Floor to ceiling windows on 3 sides provided panoramic views of the strip, airport, and pools. Bed linens were comfortable, but the bed lacked the required support and left me with a back ache upon waking each morning. Vanity items were never replaced during our 3 day stay and the towels were small and not luxurious. There was a small, but deep tub and no TV or sit down vanity in the bathroom. Robes and disposable slippers were provided. Turn down included bottled water but no chocolate or other treat. If you want a morning paper, you will have to find the request card on the turn-down tray and hang it on your door. Complementary shoe shine bag can also be found on the tray. The spa is small including a locker room, gym, steam room and treatment rooms. I did not use my spa credit because an 80 min treatment cost $230. Overall the stay was comfortable and quiet. We saw one actor and other people who were happy to keep to themselves, not the typical drunk and rowdy Vegas crowd. I do not think we would stay here again since we enjoy trying different hotels, but rather opt for a more modern 5 star hotel closer to the center if the action like the or the new Mandarian.

Reviews.Title: “No noise, no crowd's, and no problem's.”
Reviews.Author: David1988
Reviews.Content: I stayed two night's at this hotel located in the top part of Mandalay Bay Hotel on Las Vegas Blvd. It is at the very southern part of the "strip" and the first hotel you see when traveling from the airport, all gold and shimmering in the sun. The concierge was particularly accomodating. The soap's used at this hotel, by request, is Bvlgari and worth the phone call to Housekeeping Department to have delivered to your room. The view was splendid, and we had access to all of Mandalay Bay's puplic area's. The wave pool, casino, restaraunt's, etc.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING...OUT OF THIS WORLD...”
Reviews.Author: edjen
Reviews.Content: First of all I read many reviews of Las Vegas hotels and it came down to Wynn or Four Seasons and sooo happy we chose Four Seasons. It occupies the top 5 floors of Mandalay Bay. We have stayed at many 5 star hotels throughout the states and the Caribbean and this one is on the top of my list. Upon check-in we were upgraded to a 2600 sq ft suite for my husbands b-day. The check-in process was easy and fast, only 4 people in line ahead of us, unlike other Vegas hotels where check in wraps around 100 people deep. The lobby was beautiful. (Just a tip in the lobby every morning they have complimentary coffee and tea til 8am). Are bags were taken from us even before we walked into the lobby and was told they would be brought up to our room immediately. They arrived 5 min after we walked into our room! There was a compl. cake delivered for my husbands bday also. We did utilize the room service for a late night 2am snack and it was hot, delicous, and delivered as promised within 30 min of ordering. The pool was beautiful ate lunch there daily, and again outstanding. My favorite part of the pool was the frozen towels they would pass out, evian spritz, and frozen melon balls they would come around with. The pool was very nice, relaxing, and quiet. Loved the fact that you could use the Mandalay Bay wave pool and lazy river but they cannot come to our pool! The workout facility was top of the line with a Gatorade dispenser and lemon water We did use the concierge one time and they were incredible! The hotel does have a house car (09 Cadillac Escalade) where the driver will take you anywhere in a 3mi range. We used this feature once and did tip him well. Nothing like pulling up to a restaurant and getting out of the car and everyone looking to see who it is! Very cool! Just ask the door man if the car is available (it is 1st come 1st serve:) I really can't say enough great things about the hotel, it was just incredible! I read all the reviews on this hotel and some people complained and I was thinking they are just miserable people if they couldn't love everything about this hotel. The Casino (Mandalay Bay's) was easy to find and had lots of fun there too! We are already planning our return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Raising the Bar As Always”
Reviews.Author: QuestForTheBest
Reviews.Content: A luxury oasis in this overglitzed city. Rooms are well equipped, remarkably clean with great views. Food is always excellent and the Sunday buffet brunch is in typical Four Seasons style.........a treat! From the time you enter, you know its simply the best.Pool staff is wonderfully attentive. Cant imagine staying anywhere else in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay anywhere else!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! What a treat !!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: claudine646
Reviews.Content: My husband nor I knew nothing about the Four Seasons Hotels. We made a short stay in September 2009 and could not believe hotel stays could be this wonderful. I will seek out the Four Seasons Hotels from now on, no matter where we do. The food was the best, beds were unbelievable to sleep in and the service what what you would expect and more in a hotel such as this. Four Seasons Hotel in Las Vegas gets 6 star from us!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Claudine and Bryen Walker

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel BUT somehow expected more”
Reviews.Author: Tarps
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the FS over the Labor Day weekend for four nights on a great buy one night get one free "Sweet Summer Suite" deal. Previous reviews all give good descriptions of the entrance and lobby so I won't go into that area. We stayed in a strip view suite on the 39th floor. The view was absolutely amazing with almost the entire lower end of the strip spread out before you, from Mandalay Bay all the way to Treasure Island. The surrounding mountains and cityscape were also incredible. We also had a view of the airport which I find quite fascinating. The airplanes taking off and landing was not the least bit intrusive to us. The nightclub above our room was much more noticeable, especially at 1:30 in the am. While it didn't interfere overmuch, we still noticed it each night. Those who are light sleepers might wish to put a floor or two between themselves and this area. The furnishings in the room, as others have pointed out, could definitely use some updating. The two large plasma screen tv's were nice as were the addition of large potted ferns. However, the rest of the decor lacked the expected richness that goes with other FS properties. Our biggest letdown in the room was, by far, the bathroom. I would rate it as adequate rather than good. In this price range of hotel, I would expect a double vanity as well as a slightly larger shower. The deep soaking tub was the one standout in this area. The service was certainly above average but I can't, in all honesty, rate it as exceptional. While I can't give any one example of poor service, overall, it just seemed not exactly what I expected. Upon check-in, we were asked about our preference of newspaper but one was never delivered, valets seemed very harried when there were more than two vehicles present at the same time, taxis weren't moved through this area very smoothly. Just small, somewhat annoying little things. After check-in was completed, we were walked around the corner and simply told the elevators are "that way". No effort was made to explain any of the hotel offerings (i.e. the pool, spa, restuarants etc). I must reiterate what others have pointed out about the cost of valet parking. Paying over $350 a night for a room, you would certainly expect this sort of thing to be included. Every other hotel in Vegas has figured this out. We used room service three times and each time it was delivered promptly, at the proper temperature and the presentation was very nicely done. Nothing was forgotten and they really seemed to anticipate everything that could possibly be needed. Very well done. While we certainly enjoyed our time at the Four Seasons Las Vegas, and we would recommend it, I can't say we would necessarily pay quite this much again to stay here. However, with the right deal, we would definitely consider it.

Reviews.Title: “What is the Four Seasons Las Vegas Worth? Every penny.”
Reviews.Author: skipnatl
Reviews.Content: My partner and I decided to celebrate our anniversery in Las Vegas during a long Labor Day weekend. After reading the great reviews I decided to spend the extra buck and go with the FS. My experience could not have turned out any better. From the moment we walked in and were greeted with a "Happy Anniversery" I knew it would be a special stay. Our room was a strip view suite on the 38th floor. The lights and glitz of Vegas spread out in the distance - truly a great sight. The room was simple yet well decorated - it felt classy without resorting to dark colors and funky lighting. The bathroom was spacious and the powder room huge. The scent of the hotel from the lobby to the elevators to the rooms set the stage. Every facet of the FS service was top notch.
