At the pool we were shown to chairs and once again greeted with "Happy Anniversery" when I gave my name. The pool staff was very friendly and always made sure we were kept happy. One of the hotel managers came up to us and said champagne was on him for our anniversery if we so chose. Housekeeping was professional and attentive, with twice daily cleaing and turndown service. The sheets and towels were in perfect condition (a great tell of what class of hotel you are in). I can go on and on... Was it perfect? About as perfect as any hotel I've been in. I had friends staying at THEhotel in a suite and I could see the envy in their eyes. Any thing I would change? Well, only one: double ply toilet paper would be the only suggestion. From now on, when I travel to Vegas, I know where I'll be staying.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure I would return”
Reviews.Author: HenryBrentwood_TN
Reviews.Content: Although those items in control by the Four Seasons were excellent, I was surprised by the number of small children in the pool and the noise they and their parents could generate. When you are spending $300-$400 a night for a room, you would not expect this to be a problem. I complained to the pool staff and the lady said they have subtle ways of addressing the problem, but it was a constant problem all weekend. One Middle Eastern couple with two young boys, must have thought they owned the place. Those kids were terrors either in the pool or at the Veranda for meals. Otherwise everything was fine. Was checked into my room at 9:00am after an early flight from Nashville. The spa is spotless clean. The room was perfect. I did not really like seeing people with their dogs in the hallways. The Hampton Inn does not allow a dog, why does the Four Seasons? Maybe I am becoming old and grouchy at 56, but there used to be a time when luxury meant something more then what used to be the Holiday Inn pool.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Trip to Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: pnaj
Reviews.Content: Finally...a place to stay in Las Vegas where you can relax in an entirely peaceful environment yet be just a door away from the typical hubbub and activities of a higher-end casino, and only a short drive from the main part of the Strip. My husband and I were at the Four Seasons 4 nights over Labor Day weekend. Arrived Thursday night and had a very relaxing light (late) dinner at Verandah with excellent food and service. Spent our days at the pool with excellent pool service (not sure what the staff to guest ratio was but it was high enough that we felt really well looked-after.) When we first arrived and chose our lounge chairs we received a full pitcher of ice water that was refilled throughout the day along with nice treats throughout the day (popsicle, bit of frozen banana, iced towel - scented with eucalyptus on one of the days, evian water spritz, frozen melon ball) which were really nice. The pool service was very attentive and genuinely friendly. The pool area is not huge as in some of the other Strip hotels but it was completely adequate for the number of guests. Some lounge chairs had all-day sun exposure whereas others had all-day shade and some had partial sun/partial shade depending on time of day (which can be a good thing in Las Vegas in the summer!) Rooms were very nice and very clean. Bed was very comfy (not too soft and not too firm!) Twice-daily housekeeping service was really nice. The FS has two restaurants: Verandah for breakfast, lunch, dinner (all excellent) and Charlie Palmer for dinner - really wonderful food and especially wonderful service. Logistically, the Four Seasons occupies the top 5 floors of the Mandalay Bay Hotel. Its ground level facilities (lobby, restaurants, pool, spa, exercise room, etc) are completely separate from the MB. The elevator takes you from the lobby straight to the 35th-39th floors. If you were to never take the small side door on the "C" level (for casino) into the MB you'd never know you were next door. Being separate from the MB allows the FS to remain completely without a bit of cigarette smoke in case that is important to you. If you DO go into the MB you will find that you can easily walk to the Luxor (without having to go outside into the outdoor weather) and thereby be almost to hotels such as Excalibur, MGM Grand and New York...so the rest of the Strip is not far. If you want to go much farther than MGM Grand/New York New York take a cab and make sure the driver takes the freeway 1 or 2 exits north (depending where you are going) rather than Las Vegas Blvd because the traffic can be a giant mess. Cab fare to the central strip area (Wynn, Mirage, Venetian) was about $15.00-$16.00 without tip. Speaking of tips: make sure you tip for good service! I always say "feel good about your tips" and that means if someone has done something to make your life easier or more pleasant...return the favor! I see waaay too many people forgetting to tip...especially if you are going to stay somewhere as nice as the Four Seasons...tip it up! The doorman, the person checking you in, the bag attendant delivering your bags, the pool attendant setting up your chaise lounge, the housekeeper...don't forget! (Especially you young ones...get in the habit!) (Sorry to be preachy...) So, in all, if you like Las Vegas for the fun options but would prefer a calm and quiet place to stay (especially if the noise of Las Vegas gets to you...) stay at the Four Seasons. You can have your fun and return to the "oasis of serenity" just by passing through the door. Have a great time! We did!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Longhorn1
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Las Vegas was supposed to be a nice treat for us during our recent trip to Las Vegas. We were disappointed. I have stayed in most of the hotels on the strip, and recently in both Mandalay Bay and THE Hotel. I would recommend staying in either of these hotels over the Four Seasons. The Four Seasons rooms are very much like any regular Mandalay Bay rooms. The lobby was nice, but way too far from the rest of the Mandalay. Valet parking was $18. How does every other hotel have free valet and Four Seasons requires you to pay for it, that makes no sense to me. I parked at Mandalay because I never saw a point to paying that fee. The alure of the Four Seasons is the service. However, I found their service to be lacking. The front desk nicely offered to walk us to the elevator which honestly turned into a elaborate sales pitch for the spa. He never even told us where anything else was. On the walk between the front desk he told me all I needed to know about the spa, but not how to get to the pool, fitness, or even the elevator. In fact, when he left us in front of the spa I had to ask him how to get to the elevators from there. He also asked which paper we would like, none was ever delivered. The true test of our trip came on Saturday night. My wife with 30 minutes left before meeting friends for a show panicked because the hair dryer in our room was not working. I thought, not a problem, a hotel known for service should have a new hair dryer here in less than 5 minutes. I called and told them the problem and I needed a hair dryer in a hurry. Saving you the long story 30 minutes, 4 phone calls, and 1 trip to the front desk later we left.....and just as we were walking out the new hair dryer finally shows up. Was this a big deal? Not really, but if you are going to run an upper end property this is a simple guest request, they failed! In summary, most reviews rave about the Four Seasons. It is nice, but I would recommend going eslewhere....we certainly will.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Matthijs
Reviews.Content: Well, where to start? We had stayed one night in the Planet Hollywood and decided to move to the FS after one night. We had a brilliant time and decided to extent our stay at the FS by one night (making it a two-night stay). The room was wonderful - overlooking the swimming pools. Spacious bathroom and bedroom. The FS pool is excellent, quiet and much quieter than the main Mandalay pools (which FS guest can also access free of charge and where we saw The Wailers perform a live gig - on a stage in the pool area - on the Saturday night). Bar service in the FS pool area was great, staff friendly and responsive. Lounge chairs were always available and we never had a problem finding one. We had lunch and dinner in the FS Verandah restaurant - great food and service - highly recommended. The location is excellent - it is not the most centrally located hotel on the Strip but everything is within walking distance. If we ever go back to Vegas we will definitely stay in the FS.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, EXCELLENT service.”
Reviews.Author: Ariktravel
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons is the 5 top floors of the Mandalay Bay. The entrance is private and you have keyed access from the Mandalay directly into the Four Seasons. The pool at the Four Seasons is private, however you have private access into the Mandalay pool area. The rooms were beautiful with large bathrooms. I never saw an unhappy guest here. They also have a tremendous amount of meeting space and a nice wedding and or reception setup.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel experiences we've ever had”
Reviews.Author: ibshaz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted to go to Vegas for a quick weekend getaway for our anniversary. I read the reviews on tripadvisor and was having a tough time deciding between the Wynn and the Four Seasons. I chose the Four Seasons, and boy I am so glad I did! I have stayed at my fair share of luxury hotels - Ritz Carlton, Mandarin Oriental, other Four Seasons, and I can say, without exaggeration that our experience at the Four Seasons LV was the best we've ever had. The hotel itself is not austentasious like other Vegas properties. It's subdued, but very beautiful. When we checked in, we were upgraded to suite for our anniversary. There was a lovely chocolate anniversary cake waiting for us as well. The suite was great! Plasma television, very comfortable bed and large, beautiful bathroom (Bulgari toiletries were a nice touch). Since we were there for only one night, we caught an early morning flight from SFO. We were at the hotel by 10am but check-in wasn't until 3pm. No problem, the front desk gave us access to the beautiful spa where we changed. They then held our bags while we lounged at the pool. By noon, we got a call the room was ready and our bags were taken up. Now that's service! The concierge got our great dinner and show tickets, my wife got a great massage, and the maid wished us a happy anniversary when she showed up for turn-down service. The brunch is not one of those huge Vegas chow-down sessions. It's was smaller, but the quality more than made up for it. And even though we had to check out by 11am, the hotel again held our bags while we sat by the pool. We used the spa again to shower and change and we were off to the airport for our late afternoon flight. If you are thinking of going to Vegas and can't decide which luxury property to stay it - do yourself a favor and pick the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons does it again.”
Reviews.Author: shayonie
Reviews.Content: by far the best place to stay in Las Vegas. Very quiet and seems to far away from the chaos of Vegas.. yet if you want it..its right next door. The concierge got us tickets for the Lion King show and they always do a fabulous job. I agree with the other reviewers about the Four seasons pool and the pool side service is great! The pool did clear out in a hurry when somebody's little 2-3 year old decided to pull his little swimmers down and pee in the pool! We tried the Mandalay bay pool after that.. but it was too crowded.. oh well! Here's a tip.. four seasons has a house car and can drop you to the middle of the strip. If its around , you could use it instead of waiting for a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch”
Reviews.Author: drbrksmith
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Las Vegas is a beautiful hotel with extremely impressive service and very friendly staff. I have previously stayed at the Bellagio and as a hotel the Four Seasons far surpasses this in terms of luxury and comfort. Arrival and check-in was amazing, bags efficiently whisked off, two people to open the doors, and we were personally escorted by a very friendly doorman to the queueless check-in desks and introduced there by name. The receptionist (Cara) was exceptional and was genuinely warm and welcoming and we instantly felt like valued guests. We were lucky enough to be given a great upgrade to a beautiful suite, and recieved several genuine apologies that there would be a delay getting it ready for us (this delay was a grand total of 4 minutes 10 seconds!). Incredible! The standard of service at the hotel continued to be exemplary for the remainder of our stay. Concierge service was excellent and they always went the extra mile. The suite, needless to say, was beautiful and enormous. The bed was easily the most comfortable we have ever slept on, with amazing sheets and the softest pillows. Turn down was excellent every night, with water by the bed, slippers and robes laid out, and all the towels in the bathroom replaced. Housekeeping was always exemplary. All the furnisings in the room were clearly very high quality and the decoration was very tasteful. There were two huge HDTVs in our room, each with a DVD player. The pool area is lovely, and each guest is escorted to there chosen sunlounger which they make up for you with soft white towels. Ice-water was always promptly delivered. The two jacuzzis were lovely and always quiet. Excellent pool service as has previously been described. We went to the Mandalay Bay pool once, which was a busy fun place and great for kids and party-people. We were definitely glad to have the Four Seasons pool to come back to though! Location is probably the worst thing about staying at this hotel - however we really didn't think its as bad as some others have made out and definitely would not put us off staying here again. The walk to the midstrip was completely manageable and actually fun (though prob not with kids). We also used the posh hotel car once which provided an excellent free service. Taxi to the Bellagio cost about $12. All the lifts at the Four Seasons stop at the Mandalay Bay casino, which is lovely and one of our top 3 on the strip. It is very easy to find the door back to the Four Seasons, it is signposted everywhere, contrary to what other reviewers have posted. You will love the immediate calm hush once you pass through it to come back to your room. All in all a fantastic hotel with true 5* service. I would recommend it to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: AZMama
Reviews.Content: Just returned this afternoon from a 2 day quick away with my husband and couldn't wait to write a review. I LOVE this Four Seasons. We've stayed at all the other high end casino/hotels in LV, and FS is the absolute best. Serene with absolutely top notch service. We were upgraded to an incredible suite because our room "wasn't ready" when we arrived early...how terrific is that? Staff is incredibly well trained, helpful and solicitous without being in your face all the time. Both restaurants are terrific, and Charlie Palmer's is now my favorite steakhouse, ever. I can't imagine staying anywhere else for all our future quick aways to LV. Oh, and the spa is very very good.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: jollyjenks
Reviews.Content: As in the Title this is the best Hotel in Vegas, they treat you as Guest / Person and not a just another number. EXcellent Service alround, the Pool service is great. Well done four Seasons - we will be back

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Indeed”
Reviews.Author: dickie98
Reviews.Content: Entering the Four Seasons is so different from entering any other hotel on the Strip. It is peaceful and calm and there are no slot machines. Check in was quick and friendly with no delays. The room was delightful, spacious and comfortable with a large bathroom (separate bath and shower) with L'Occitane toiletries. The floors the Four Seasons uses are obviously part of the Mandalay Bay tower, as the layout is immediately recognisable, but that's not a bad thing. The only con, if it is one, is that the elevators are quite a walk from reception. As the rooms are in Mandalay Bay really you need to go that distance in order to line up with that building. You also need to be aware that you are right at the bottom of the Strip, so if you want to see the Ballagio fountains or the Star Trek exhibition at the Hilton etc it's a very long walk. I didn't use any of the facilities, only having time to sleep and shower but overall this is a very nice and comfortable hotel and an oasis of calm amidst the mad glittering neon of Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “loved it.”
Reviews.Author: bembridge
Reviews.Content: Four Seasons Hotel in Las Vegas? That was my initial reaction as I had never seen the hotel. That is because it is an hotel within a hotel! The Four Seasons takes up the top floors of the Mandalay Bay hotel block. The only sign for the hotel is an entrance sign on Las Vegas Boulevard South near the Mandalay Bay Conference Center. The lobby is on the ground floor and unlike other strip hotels it does not have a casino nor a parking garage. There is easy access direct into the Mandalay Bay casino, and if you don't want to use the valet parking ($19/ night) you can park in Mandalay Bay. The Four Seasons is a great place to stay if you want to be in Vegas but avoid the full on Blitz of casino noise and bustle every time you leave your room to go anywhere. You can easily come and go without seeing a casino area. But there is easy access via a room key controlled door directly into the Mandalay bay casino. The pool at the hotel is great. The pool is on the ground floor and fenced off and although it gets busy it does not feel as packed as other pools in Vegas. Service at the pool is outstanding, they set up your beds, you can order food, they bring round jugs of ice water all the time, bring round small smoothies, popsicles and iced fruit. If you want it is a short walk to the Mandalay Wave pool and pools. The pool at the hotel tend to be mostly adults. The service overall is what makes the hotel so good. There is a lot of attention to detail everywhere. The room cleaning is meticulous and they take time to sort and tidy your toiletries even! In the excellent (and quiet) fitness room they check if you want a drink as you work out. Overall the four seasons make you feel like a guest, not just a number. As the hotel is at the end of the strip you also feel a bit out of the madness. But as there is a tram that runs every 5 minutes to Excalibur you can get to the strip fast. But is a long walk to places like Caesar’s palace, so cabs or a car is a good idea. The rooms are a good size and comfortable. We chose a strip view which I highly recommend as you get a stunning view both in the day and especially at night. As the hotel takes the top 4 floors all are great. We were on the top floor (39th) which was amazing. It is worth watching the four seasons site for promotions, we got 3 nights for the price of 2 which is a great deal. It is also best to try and stay in Vegas and the hotel in the week if you can, as it is clearly quieter and even the casino at Mandalay bay, restaurants are quieter - and less drunk and loud weekend partying crowds!

Reviews.Title: “Sorry but... mixed feelings..”
Reviews.Author: andrea.italian
Reviews.Content: Back to the FS Las Vegas another time. I was and I'm a frequent guest of this beatiful hotel where service , rooms , overall ambiance are really outstanding. But this time was different than the last time and I had a very difficult approach with the front desk and the first day of my stay was simply a nightmare. Did a check in around noon and the room was not ready. They simply promised me to call my mobile phone when the room was supposed to be ready but never received any call. Four hours later finally I've got the room ( deluxe room ) but it was different than the one booked trough their local reservation system ( strip wiew). Back to the front desk and moved to the right room but ... it was dirty especially the bathroom.. So called again the front desk , talked with a manager and receive a free breakfast for the next morning. That room was really noisy despite to my specific request by the time of my booking. So the next morning had a breakfast at the Verandah restaurant and unlike the promises of the front desk I had to pay for it.. Too many mistakes for me , when you plan to stay at the FS you deserve the best and this is was not my case- So talked with the Front Desk and ready to leave the same day even if I had a reservation for six nights.. Finally I was able to talk with a very nice manager and I did receive a wonderful upgrade in one of their beatiful suites overlooking the entire strip. It was a very nice present really appreciated. From this moment everything was perfect , the hotel is really nice and I loved the overall quiet , really unique in Vegas. Compared with the last time they are charging for wlan-wifi while the last time was free. I personally found the service at the pool not on level with my last stay and the prices for breakfast at the Verandah too expensive even for a FS ( thye charge 35 $ for the breakfast buffet )... So ready to leave and at the check out they did take care of my breakfast of the first day but they simply charged around 1000 $ more than due to my room account.. Another mistake really not understandable at any Four Seasons. I will return ? I don't know.. the new Mandarin Oriental scheduled to open by beginning of December this year or the Wynn are at the moment great alternatives to the Four Season and to try something different.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon 08”
Reviews.Author: Green038
Reviews.Content: Apologies for the late review! Amazing hotel! We would not stay anywhere else in Vegas - it is just shut off and tranquil enough to enjoy the calm atmosphere, but linked to everything so you're right back in the hustle and bustle just by walking through the doors. Service by the pool was great, and as it was our honeymoon, little extras like the cake in our room etc, made all the difference. Very helpful concierge booked a trip out to Hoover Dam for us - just watch out in August, we didn't do the Canyon as it was SOOO hot! We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Urban_Traveler_100
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over the 4th of July holiday and was really blown away by this hotel. The hotel itself and rooms are nice, but what really sets this hotel apart is the service. From check-in to check-out, my friends and I were treated fabulously. We were celebrating my friend's birthday, so the hotel sent up a small cake to the room. The concierge made reservations for us to get our party of 15+ people into Tao free of charge. The pool service was the best I've ever experienced -- every 30 minutes or so they come around with little treats, like frozen melon balls, Evian spritz for your face, cleaning your sunglasses! This is definitely my new favorite hotel in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Ahhhh....”
Reviews.Author: BethTO
Reviews.Content: What a great feeling it was to leave the hustle and bustle of the Mandlly Resort and walk through the Four Seasons door. It was a different world (in the same building!). We upgraded to a suite (Our only complaint was that our family of 2 adults and 3 kids was over the 3 persons-per-standard room capacity. Come on now, does the fire marshal really think that 500 sq feet is too small for 5 people??) . We had 1,000 sq feet of luxury for a fair price. Instead of renting a costly cabana at the Mandalay pool (which was PACKED) we hung out at the Four Seasons pool and walked over to the other pools. This is a perfect place to stay if you want to be pampered without being surrounded by the Vegas crowds.

Reviews.Title: “If you want quiet and relaxation this is the place to be..”
Reviews.Author: DaveRuss
Reviews.Content: OK, it's all been said in the previous reviews so I am not going to repeat it all here. Enough to say that we spent four nights here for our anniversary. We were upgraded for free to a strip view room which was much appreciated. Perfect hotel for getting away from the LV hustle and bustle. We used the valet parking during our stay and it was worth every dollar. All the staff we encountered were friendly and very helpful. However, I did not give the 4 seasons a five rating because of a couple of points. Why oh why do some hotels chains persist in charging for internet access? 15 dollars per 24 hours is outrageous and also charging for local telephone calls. Come on four seasons sort these items out. Also pool service seems to depend on where you are located. Excellent service if you are around the pool edge, along with all the screaming kids! When away from the immediate are of the pool service is very slack, seems you get forgotten about.We had to ask several times for the iced water. Having stayed previously at the Venetian, Bellagio and MGM Grand the four seasons is the best so far and would possibly use again, however I think we will try for something more central next time as we like to try different establishments..

Reviews.Title: “Great option in Las Vegas, worth the money just for location and privacy”
Reviews.Author: TallTaste
Reviews.Content: We've stayed many times at different Four Seasons resorts and agree with many reviewers that this one is not the as good when to compared to others around the world ( Maui and Dublin come to mind). That being said, it IS a beautiful hotel, located at the south end of the strip with a private entrance and pool. The hotel is relaxing, airy, and provides a refuge from the "Vegas" experience. However, we found the service to be impersonal and standoffish. Tried the Charlie Palmer restaurant for the second time and were equally disappointed by rude staff and mediocre food. Perhaps, it is because their prices have decreased. We'll definitely consider the 4S again, but if there are better values at the Wynn or even the MB; it'll be a tough choice. P.S. My spouse turned 30 during our trip and their "gift" was a cake and to offer us an upgrade for $100 dollars a night.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Four Seasons Experience”
Reviews.Author: GG1429
Reviews.Content: A true oasis. Great service from the moment we checked in throughout the resort. Pool attendants were very attentive. Restaurants were nice. (We had a minor hiccup at CPalmers) The Car Service was great as well. This is one of our favorite destinations while in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at The Four Seasons Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: quita19426
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great trip visiting the West and had the pleasure of staying at The Four Seasons in Las Vegas. I can take Vegas for only a few days (too much noise, too many crowds). The beauty of The Four Seasons is that it's tucked away inside the Mandalay Bay and you escape all the noise, people and goings-on there. (The Mandalay Bay lobby was always crowded no matter what time we walked through.) As soon as you enter The Four Seasons, it's very quiet and tranquil. We stayed in a one-bedroom suite on the 35th floor. Loved it! We had an abundance of room for 3 people. (Really, the suite was huge!) We need to be able to spread out and had plenty of room to do so. Housekeeping provided great service and they were always leaving bottles of water. (I guess they don't want you to dehydrate in the Vegas sun!) There was also a candy dish on the coffee table that kept getting refilled, to my son's delight! Guests of The Four Seasons also have access to the Mandalay Bay's pool/wave pool/beach area, which my ten-year-old son was anxious to try. We walked over during our first afteroon and was shocked to see how crowded it was. (I thought people avoided Vegas in the heat of the summer!) There was nowhere to sit, so we thought about renting a cabana for the afternoon as there were plenty which sat empty. I'm sorry, but at $400, there was no way that was going to happen! Absolutely crazy! (It's the Mandalay Bay, for Pete's sake!) We thought about trying the lazy river before heading back, but you have to purchase an inner tube for almost $50!! We were happy to head back to the pool at The Four Seasons. They know how to treat their guests. The staff immediately came over to us with towels, set up our chairs and brought us a pitcher of ice water. Throughout the afternoon, they offered us complimentary Evian mists, popsicles, frozen melon, and chilled towels. No one provides service like The Four Seasons. We had dinner and breakfast at The Four Seasons' Verandah restaurant. We had dinner our first night and were exhausted, so we wanted to eat quickly and go to sleep. I ordered the short ribs which sounded so good. Unfortunately, when my meal arrived, it was cold. Not even lukewarm, but cold. On the plus side, the few bites I had were delicious, but I wasn't going to eat a cold meal. They, of course, offered to make a fresh plate for me, but I was just too tired to eat, so they removed it from the bill. We also had breakfast there which was alright, but nothing great. I recommend eating elsewhere as there are so many great restaurants in Vegas. We did ask the concierge for restaurant recommendations as we were meeting up with family near Caesar's and wanted to find a restaurant to suit everyone's tastes . The concierge recommended Spago in the Forum Shops at Caesar's. It was excellent! Everyone enjoyed their meals and I was very impressed with their food and service! When we return to Vegas, we will definitely stay at The Four Seasons again. Top notch!

Reviews.Title: “bargain at the 4 Seasons”
Reviews.Author: Mark W
Reviews.Content: Very well done hotel. Amazing prices great service housekeeping is awesome concierge staff is also well done This an amazing find. Upgrades are for the asking. Las Vegas is a getaway.....more than affordable! I have never found a Four Seasons so amazingly priced. The hotel is well done.

Reviews.Title: “Superlative (with one small niggle)”
Reviews.Author: luxurytravelonly
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are great. The rooms are a good size and more than adequately provided. The food at the Verandah restaurant was the best we had on our trip and the weekend buffet breakfast is simply to-die-for. The concierge had excelled in organising super tickets for a show in Vegas. Nothing seems too much trouble for the staff and they do go out of their way to help. The only small niggle was the laundry bill... Now I'm no stranger to hotel laundry bills as we rarely travel with enough clothes and need to get them laundered. However $300 seems hefty even by my standards but there was no choice. I was almost on the point of asking a member of staff whether they wanted $100 in the pocket to take it home and do it for me. Am I too tight? Possibly. As to the reviewer who found the "secret door" to MB a bit hard to locate; this is a bit disingenuous as there is a clear sign next to this door and it is in an obvious place close to the lobby of the MB. It is down the far end of the strip and this does mean quite a bit of trekking about, but Hey, what else have you got to do?

Reviews.Title: “Glad we tried it”
Reviews.Author: JB33
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 3 nights at the Four Seasons LV. We originally booked for $380 per night with the 3rd night free. Two days before I checked the rates and found $260 (?) per night with the 3rd night free as well. Being it was past the time needed to cancel and rebook, I decided to wait and ask for the new rate at check in. They had no problem with adjusting to the new rate. The room was a fairly typical hotel room, though the marble bath/entry, towel/sheet quality, cleanliness were superb. The bed was like sleeping on a cloud. Little touches included a wonderful turndown service with bottled water, slippers, comp. shoe shine service and an expansive mini bar with room to put in your own items were appreciated. The bellman even removes the airline luggage tags prior to bringing to your room, which I can't recall ever having been done for us before (a small thing, but noticed just as well). The pool service was phenomenal (with one exception, we spent 3 full days by the pool)! When you arrive to the pool area, you are greeted near the front by a pool attendant. The attendant escorts you to your chairs, lays down a chair cover (huge towel), gives you another towel and places a pitcher of ice water next to you on your table. They continually come around to make sure your water is iced and full. We only had to wait one day (saturday @ noon). They put you on a wait list and take down your cell number. We went to the pool bar, ordered drinks and lunch and within about 10 minutes our chairs were ready. The bartender then brought our drinks over to our chairs so he could see where to send our lunch. We ate lunch on our lounge chairs everyday. Attendants periodically come around with various items....Evian spritz, cold cucumbers for your eyes, cold towels, frozen melon balls, popsicles, etc. We had excellent service from everyone, except one female food server, who shall remain nameless (a complaint was made, so hopefully she will straighten up, or maybe was just having a really bad day). The house car service was great. We used it several times, including to return to the airport. The longest we had to wait was 10 minutes. The pros (as listed above) will bring us back, though only if we are going to pretty much relax around the pool, go to the spa or generally just be spoiled. There are not many restaurants (only 2 at FS, though Charlie Palmer was excellent) or lounges which match our taste. The scene around Mandalay Bay is just too hectic and does not provide enough options as far as fine dining, shopping, shows etc. We prefer the more upscale feel around the Wynn and Palazzo, though customer service is, by far, not as spectacular as at the FS. By the way, don't waste your money at Minus 5 (ice bar)....$25 pp to get in includes one small drink. It is neat for about a minute, but you're ready to leave after that (I was really excited to go too).

Reviews.Title: “OMG it is Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1Denver_Co
Reviews.Content: Read my reviews and you will see that I am critical of many hotels. This hotel, however, is absolutely amazing by any standard. I have stayed in hotels all over the world and never have I stayed in one that got everything perfect...until this one. The staff, the rooms, the amentities, the everything is just the best. Congratulations to who must be the best hotel managers who ever walked. You have done an incredible job making this the best hotel possible!

Reviews.Title: “Stuck with the impeccable Four Seasons!”
Reviews.Author: Fleetcat
Reviews.Content: Second trip to Vegas and second stay in the Four Seasons. No doubt where we will stay on our third trip. Just a complete haven of tranquillity and civilisation among the madness. From the a la carte breakfast (no scrabbling round buffets here) to the excellent concierge service this hotel is simply impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “Serenity & luxury in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jcmjcm
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 3 nights at the FS, Las Vegas. Overall, I was very satisfied. The reason why I picked the FS for my trip was the serenity that I was looking in Vegas, and I got that. The FS is located on the top floors of the Mandalay Bay, but thanks to separate entrance, pool, valet etc, it feels like a completely different, non-hectic hotel. PROs: - Complimentary upgrade from 1 king size room to 1 king size handicapped accessible suite. I arrived early and there were only 2 rooms available at the time, a 2 queen size beds room (I felt the beds were too small, and only wanted 1 bed anyway), and the suite, which was of good size and had a great bed - Again, the bed - felt extremely comfortable. The girl I went home with loved it, too. - General service level; close to perfection as usually in Four Seasons properties. Special praise to valet guys, housekeeping and the guy who carried the bags to my room - Meeting the Detroit Pistons summer league players in the elevator. DeJuan Summers comes across as a really great guy. - Lunch at the FS restaurant. Tasted good, plus good service. CONs: - Only one really, but that almost led me to giving this hotel only 4 stars: At the pool, none of the employees bothered to provide me with towels or water. Everyone else was served, I was ignored for 2 hours. Completely ridiculous and not typical for the rest of the employees (outside of the pool area).

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: k_dwyer_01
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, wonderful, wonderful! Everything about it!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: KNBDenver
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at a Four Seasons Hotel and it won't be our last. We were celebrating our 31st anniversary and we were upgraded to a one bedroom suite. It was well appointed and extremely comfortable. While we were out to dinner, a cake was delivered to our room. A very nice touch indeed. What really separates the Four Seasons from the rest of the hotels is the service. From the time we checked in to the time we checked out, everyone was extremely accommodating. We spent our days by the pool and every 30 minutes someone came by checking to see if we needed anything. I have worked in the hotel business, and I can honestly say that the Four Seasons have set the bar high in the hospitality industry. The general manager of this property should be extremely proud of his staff. The did an outstanding job. We enjoyed ourselves so much we are returning to the Four Seasons for my husband's birthday in September. We travel to Las Vegas several times a year and now would not consider staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but Pool Service has declined”
Reviews.Author: HotelUser018
Reviews.Content: One of our favorite hotels. Valet, front desk, spa, gym and maid service is excellent! Friendly, professional and helpful service at all times. Pool however has declined. Staff has been reduced, service is not as good, and there is a bit of an attitude. Still nice, but not at the same level of service as the rest of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Stay”
Reviews.Author: Shotlady
Reviews.Content: Celebrated my birthday and treated myself to a 3 day stay with my daughter. Upon arrival, a nice birthday cake was delivered to the room big enough for 3 people to share. We aren't big on gambling and prefer to spend our days poolside and at the spa. I loved the fact that you don't have to get up at 7am to rush down and reserve your spot at the pool. We could take our time, have breakfast and be down around 11 am and two chairs in partial sun would be set up for us. The only complaint about the pool was on the first day, we had to ask several times for the pitcher of water while everyone else who arrived received theirs immediately. That pitcher of water is replenished constantly and is what keeps you from feeling wiped out after a day in the sun. A waitress knew it was my birthday and brought me complimentary frozen red seedless grapes. Excellent on a hot day! She continued to wish me happy birthday throughout the day and into the next as well. The room was quite nice, great view, nice amenities,and very very comfortable beds and bedding. Used the concierge for booking dinner reservations and they were quite helpful with all my inquiries. Pleasant staff, a pleasant stay, what more could I ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort”
Reviews.Author: JohnMichaelsDad
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Four Seasons for 4 nights the first week of July 2009. It was a great experience! We love the fact that the hotel is smoke free and doesn't have a casino.The lobby is quiet and serene and the staff is outstanding. We had an issue with our bill at the spa, but the manager, Dora, cleared it up immediately. The pool was great. All the little touches like ice water, evian spritzes, frozen treats, etc. The service was great 90+% of the time. Our only small negative point was our first day at the pool. One of the nice things about high level hotels is that the staff tries to use your name when addresssing guests. Our waitress, Zlata, did not ask our name during the whole 4 hours we sat at the pool. Her service was spotty also. I had to flag her down a couple of times instead of her asking what we needed. We spent another 2 days at the pool and had fabulous service from Chris and others. Try the chicken flat bread sandwich at the Verandah. One of the best sandwiches we have ever had. We were also very impressed with the concierge. They had lists of restaurants and clubs with descriptions that were very helpful. We certainly spent more than other hotels in Vegas, but it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience, One to remember !”
Reviews.Author: EddieToccoa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons to celebrate our 25th Wedding Anniversary. Facilities are expected to be excellent when mentioned in the same sentence with "Four Seasons" but the personal attention and anticipation of your wants and desires really separates the hotel from any other. Especially for your special occasions in life. With their knowledge of our 25th anniversary, Kimberly and Martha upgraded our room to a suite on the 39th floor with a perfect view of the "strip"! The suite has everything that you want/need...1 bath and another 1/2 bath, marble shower, fully stocked mini refrig (price list), 3 closets, sofa & 42 inch plazma TV area, business desk area, king bed & another 42 inch plazma TV. Upon arrival, Oscar met us at our room with chocolate covered straberries and a very pleasant welcome. The hotel offered us use of their car service which we used a couple of times. Again, very polite attention during the ride. Pool Area - You arrive and give them your name. Each visit to offer you a service begins with a personal greeting and an inquiry into whether you would prefer whatever their offering as they make their way around the pool. Let me see if I can describe this. It's very hot in LV in July and being by a pool is nice. At the Four Seasons you are offered - first they walk with you to your desired lounge area with soft covers for the padded lounge chairs, along with all of the towels that you want, along with a picture of lemon ice water, followed throught the day with - cold cucumbers for your eyes, an Evian spritz for your face, a cold towel, frozen mellon balls, and Haggen Daz popcicles. The best to me is the the staff's attitiude. It's their desire to make your day a little better. It's always works! We saw some dogs on leashes during our stay ( we have a dog - but not with us ) This was somewhat amusing to see ! I will return to the Four Seasons for our next special occasion!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Four Seasons Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: lisa1061
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our long weekend to the FS Las Vegas. Such a great place to stay. Four Seasons is known for their great service, which they always seem to deliver. The serenity of the hotel is so nice from the crowds of the casinos. The service at the Verandah restaurant is great, as is the food. Service by the pool is outstanding also. There is always someone to give you cold water or a fresh towel and drink. We will always stay here when we go to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Serene”
Reviews.Author: zsazsa
Reviews.Content: We stayed from June 28 until July 2nd. We were upgraded upon check-in without asking because I had placed a prior request with the hotel for a room near the elevator as I was recovering from a broken foot. We arrived at 11:30 am on Sunday and our room was not ready, our room was ready by 3:00pm and our luggage delivered to our room. The room we were upgraded to was a Premier Strip View room, number 38 107 , what a fantastic view at night! The room seemed smaller than the rooms at the Wynn, however, they really know how to utilize space. Scale in the bathroom, stocked minibar/refrig., choice of newspapers for morning, and great Plasma TV and yes, I watched it! The bed was soft, to me incredibly comfortable. The hotel itself was quiet, tranquil and refined. They had lots of little places to just sit, by the pool or in the lobby (that weren't in front of a slot machine or gaming table... big plus here). If you want something extra without having to pay for every little thing this is the place to stay. For example, they delivered bottled water with turndown service, free coffee in the morning in the lobby and an in-room coffeemaker, the use of the spa steam rooms and fitness center are also included in your room rate. The pool service is amazing, they set up your chairs, bring pitchers of water, magazines to read, etc. The pool itself is really nothing fancy, however, the water temperature was perfect, and you can use the expansive Mandalay Bay Pool/Beach Complex just for showing your key. Room service was fast we ordered 2 bottles of champagne late at night and let them sit overnight drank them in the morning. We did not try the restaurants at FS. We were offered the car service (we did not ask for it ) and used this twice, perhaps because no cabs were around. We tipped $10 for 1 ride and $20 for the other. It made us feel special that they offered us the car. We went to Vegas with two other couples that were not staying there and it made for a lot of cab rides, tram rides, long walks so being offered the car was nice. I would stay here again only if it was just my husband and I alone and also if we were going during pool season. We really enjoyed the pool! PS It is non-gaming, and I do not care for the Mandalay Bay Casino, so keep that in mind. It is a long way to anywhere, if you don't like the MB, NYNY, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquility in busy Vegas strip”
Reviews.Author: joanrosario
Reviews.Content: **Note: since this is Four Seasons, I expected the BEST in everything** The good(s): 1. Outstanding hospitality; there was only ONE service staff who did not greet us. Every staff would make eye contact and greet you with "good morning" or "good evening". 2. My boyfriend had placed "birthday celebrant" as a special note on the reservation and when we checked in the hotel, there was a personal chocolate mouse cake (every night for the two nights we stayed). 3. Connection to Mandalay pool and hotel. 4. Swimming pool: perfection at it's best. 5. Room: we were on the 37th floor with great views of Mandalay's pools. Note that the Four Seasons rooms are located on the top floors of the Mandalay Bay hotel (i think from 35 - 40 before the penthouse). The bad(s): 1. Service: Our room was not ready when we checked in at 2:00 (it was okay since checked in was @ 3, but we did note on our reservation that we would be arriving at 2). Because this is Four Seasons, I expected something more than an apology; the front desk should have offered water or some beverage. We ended up walking over to Mandalay for food since we were starving. 2. Room: The only defect I could find in the room was the shower head and soap that was loose from the wall (see pics). And, the tv drawer where there was chip (didn't take a pic). 3. Transportation: Shuttle service to/from airport. 4. Business Center: closed on the weekends. 5. If this is a pet-friendly hotel, it should be CLEARLY noted on their website. I heard barking and saw two small dogs with their owners going to their room.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons does not disappoint”
Reviews.Author: EvanPSP
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons over the 4th of July. Just a beautiful property. Absolutely top of the line services. Food was creative, innovative and excellent. Truly hard to top a hotel experience like the Four Seasons. You simply cannot go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful.”
Reviews.Author: SallyandDarren
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons for our honeymoon for a week. When we arrived from the airport, the doormen are there to open the car door, a bellboy takes the cases and we are ushered to reception. Check in was smooth, no problems. Our room was spacious, clean and beautifully furnished. On arrival to the room, there was a knock on the door and a waitor had brought up a platter of fresh fruit with a bottle of spring water, two glasses and two plates with silver cutlery. There was a hand written letter from the manager welcoming us to the hotel. The pool area is beautiful and there were always plenty of sunbeds no matter what time of day we arrived. The staff ensured every guest was comfortable. Regular ice pops, fruit, cucumber slices and drink samples were brought round for each guest along with evian spray for face. Iced water was regularly topped up. Fresh towels were placed at each step out of the pool for guests to take. The lobby and corridors are immaculate, lots of polished marble floors, beautiful ornaments and furniture. The Spa is beautiful, my husband went overy day to use the eucalyptus steam room, showers and shaving facilities. Lockers are provided with shorts, shoes, robes and shaving equipment. Iced handtowels and water/juice are provided complimentary. The use of the facilities at Mandalay Bay is superb, the pools and lazy river are fun and the whole atmosphere is that of a tropical beach party. Brilliant for younger guests and families. It was lovely to get back to the peace and tranquility of the Four Seasons if thats what you wanted. The Mandalay Bay hotel is great, with a plush lobby and casino and a lovely coconutty/suntan cream smell. Try the shark reef aquarium. the underwater shipwreck is amazing. Found the restaurants at Mandalay Bay quite pricey but then thats only to be expected in Las Vegas. The casino is fab, the dealers and staff are really friendly and remembered us each time we visited. The monorail from Mandalay to Excalibur is convenient and runs approx every 5 mins. It also stops at the Luxor hotel. We were lucky to get upgraded to a strip view room because on a particular windy day, the wind was whistling under our door and they were unable to fix it immediately. The strip view was amazing, especially at dusk when all the lights come on. Totally fascinating and we couldnt take our eyes off the view. The rooms were really beautiful, towels changed twice daily, linen is lovely crisp cotton. They even turn the clock to face you on the bedside table at night so you can see the time in the morning!!! We got lovely little cakes left in our room on our last night. They replenish the L'occitane bath products whenever anything is used just once. Bathrobes and slippers supplied. Lovely power shower and deep bath. Hairdyer, iron and ironing board supplied. Minibar in fridge along with snacks very pricey. Coffee maker and tea making facilities supplied, a kettle is available also when requested. This hotel along with the location made our honeymoon the best holiday and experience we have ever had and we have stayed in mainly 4/5 star hotels whenever we go on holiday. If you like tranquility and very good service then try this hotel, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: WillTravel123
Reviews.Content: Exceptional service. Wonderful amenities. Loved the secluded pool. Fresh watermelon slices a special treat. Access to Mandalay beach and wave pool for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Good but could have been better”
Reviews.Author: Janil
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Las Vegas is a haven for those that want to get away for a few hours from the overkill of casino's, noise, heat and people. Tucked away on the side of the Mandelay Bay hotel it is capable to give you the look and feel of relaxed quality. The service is good to excellent at reception, the swimming pool and breakfast. The rooms are spacious, well furnished and have all that one needs. A remark though is that, where one gets free WIFI connections all over the States in RV parks, hotels, café's etc, this hotel charges $14.99 for a one day connection. In a world where communication is the standard and no longer an option and in a expensive hotel such as this one the WIFI should be free. One other remark is that the noise from 35 floors down comes into the room. Unfortunately only double glasing was used and this could have been better. The swimming pool is too small for the amount of people using it. Four Season quality involves enough space in and around the swimming pool with soft music making the stay at the pool more enjoyable. In our case there were hardly any free spaces and the pop/rock music may blend in well with Las Vegas but, to me, was too loud and not at all relaxing. Other than that this is a great hotel and again, compared to the rest of Vegas, a heaven on earth.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave....”
Reviews.Author: mobert
Reviews.Content: All I can say is wow. Finally an oasis of serenity, service and elegance on the chaos and ugliness of the Las Vegas strip. I didn't think something like this existed in Vegas but now I know better. If that's what you are looking for all by all means, check in and don't leave. The hotel will cater to your every need and comfort. And if you need a little action one night, go over to Mandalay Bay, take a look at those souls not lucky enough to be staying at the Four Seasons, and hustle on back. There's plenty of expensive hotels in Vegas but they're just poseurs whose idea of service is allowing you the priviledge of overpaying to stay in tacky properties on steroids. They'd love to be what the Four Seasons already is, but they haven't any idea how to do it because they're all in the Entertainment business. The Four Seasons is in the hospitality business and the difference shows. Three cheers. We loved it and look forward to going back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the 1st visit to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: vandf
Reviews.Content: 2nd visit to Las vegas the 1st was nearly 3 years ago. First time in Bellagio this time in the four seasons at Mandalay Bay. The Hotel was fantastic with its own private pool area away from the big groups at Mandalay Bay although you can use both pools. If you have kids Mandalay bay is better as it has a massive pool with wave machine if you are a couple and want peace and quiet the Four seasons every time. The hotel is situated right at the South end of the strip which has it's advantages in that you are out of the way so no really big crowds but makes going up and down the strip a bit longer walk. If you are 20's - 40's you are fine if you are over 60 stay in the middle of the strip to save the legs :-). I would recommend the hotel to anyone, when we go back this would be very high on my list of were to stay but we might try the new Palazzo or Encore as they both looked great hotels when we went and looked at them.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Wedding”
Reviews.Author: Ksp48a Posted by a Luxury Link traveler
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Four Seasons in Las Vegas for my daughter's wedding late last summer. It was spectacular and magical. The wedding itself was outdoors (behind the waterfall near the pool ) on a relatively cool and windy night. The banquet (Kosher) was superb as were the suites and rooms. We spent a considerable amount of time at the relatively small and mostly private pool. The restaurants and food were wonderful. Each night we went to a different show up the strip (since the Four Seasons is at the extreme end of the strip in its own lobby and top floors of the Mandalay Bay Hotel). I don't gamble, but the Mandalay Bay casino is next door through a doorway. Expensive, but well worth it. I've stayed at the Bellagio and the Wynn and this was the best.

Reviews.Title: “The best of both worlds”
Reviews.Author: v121kky
Reviews.Content: The perfect base for experiencing the amazing Las vegas. We spent three nights in a strip view room (highly recommended you can't stop looking out of the window!) The room was fabulous and well stocked with everything you need and more. Friendly and helpful staff and beautiful pool and surroundings. You really are in the centre of all the excitement here and only a few steps away from the action of the casino hotels. However at the end of a long night it is just bliss to walk into the calm of the private elevator room and be whisked up to the luxury and comfort of this fabulous hotel. We don't really have the chance to stay in luxury hotels very often, but I would highly recommend spending a little more and staying here, it really is the perfect antidote to the sometimes overwhelming hustle and bustle of Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “I miss it already! They spoiled me!”
Reviews.Author: NYCgiirl
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel. Expensive but wonderful (and no high-roller rooms to get comped because there is no casino!) My fiance and I went to Las Vegas to celebrate my 50th birthday. We live in New York City and wanted to relax by a pool and do nothing but we wanted a night life, too. We were staying for 8 nights, and I wanted to be treated like a queen for my birthday. So when they found out it was my birthday, they were going to send a cake to our room. But I explained to them that I'm diabetic and they offered me a sugar-free cake, but I asked for fruit instead. Well, they sent fruit up to our room every day for our whole stay! And then, on our first day and on my actual birthday, they sent a fruit and cheese platter! Everyone who works at the Four Seasons addresses you by your name and everyone is extremely helpful and friendly - from the Front Desk staff to the maids. Speaking of the maids, they do a phenomenal job. They thoroughly clean and change the towels, etc., twice a day (more if you request it for some reason). They pay attention to what you need and you don't have to ask. For example, I use a lot of towels when I shower and she noticed that so she started bringing a lot of towels and putting them on the shelves in the bath area for us. I never had to ask for extras. Shower was excellent (separate from tub) - great water pressure. Separate toilet area so your roomie can tinkle in private while you're brushing your teeth. Room darkening curtains were great in the morning after a late night out - couldn't tell if it was day or night. Nice big flat screen TV. VERY comfortable bed (king with pillow-top mattress). Lots of great pillows. Wonderful bed linens (very soft cotton, including the duvet cover, so you're never touching anything that someone else's behind touched). Lots of little touches like bottled water by your bed every night, great thick terry cloth robes (one for each of you), a pair of slippers for each of you (they're pretty cheap disposable slippers - nothing to write home about, but they lasted all week very nicely). We got upgraded to a "strip-view" room. From what I understand, with the exception of the view, the room is identical to the "superior" room, but I didn't see those rooms. The view of the strip is no big deal during the day but at night, when all the neon goes on, it's really cool. We live in a high building at home, so maybe the day view just reminds me of home but if you're from a small town, you'll be amazed by the view. I think the room could have been bigger but it was very acceptable. I would like to have seen a suite (I tried to upgrade but they were full). My guess is that they are incredible. Free WiFi if you have a laptop otherwise you can access the internet via the TV but it's $14.99 for 24 hours and it's very flakey. You're better off using the PC's in the business center. You run your credit card through and get the first 10 minutes free (after that, however, it's $1.00 per minute and be careful about printing anything...it's $1.00 per page to print!!!). There are two phones in the room and one in the bathroom by the toilet. The phone by the bed is a cordless, which is very handy. There is a safe in the room that is easy to program. An iron, a hair dryer, and really nice soaps, shampoo, conditioner. lotion, shower gels in the bathroom. You have full control of the central A/C in the room, which works very well. Unfortunately, you cannot open the windows at all, though. If you put your "do not disturb" sign on the door, they are extremely respectful of it...we ordered something from room service and forgot that we had the sign on the door. The delivery person didn't knock on our door and, instead, walkie-talkied to the office who called us to ask if it was OK for the person to knock! Speaking of room service, it's great, but it's really expensive. That said, if they tell you they'll be there in 20 minutes, they are there in 17 minutes! There is a mini bar in the room and a tray of delicious looking snack foods but they're expensive and we didn't make use of them - except for a bottle of Fiji Water. Concierges are very helpful but don't expect them to be able to recommend anything inexpensive. They don't seem to have a grasp of how espensive the restaurants are when you ask them to recommend something reasonable. Do your own research to find inexpensive options. But do use the concierge to make reservations at restaurants in other hotels for you. Speaking of which, the two restaurants in the hotel are excellent. Verandah has very nice food, serves breakfast, lunch, tea, and dinner. They also have a really nice outdoor seating area just off from the pool. In addition, they serve as the source of food that you can order when you sit by the pool. All good. The other restaurant is Charlie Palmer's Steakhouse. Amazing food and service. Top notch. The hotel's private car (a Cadillac SUV) is available to anyone in the hotel who requests it if you are going within 3 miles of the hotel - but it's first come first serve, so when you walk outside the front door, ask the doorman if the car is available. If not, take a taxi, but if it is available, it's free (tip the driver), really comfortable, and a wonderful option. They won't pick you up from wherever you go, though, once you're there, you're on your own to get back (taxis are easily available everywhere you go - but they don't cruise on the strip...you have to get one at a taxi stand at any hotel or store). The hotel really is an oasis of serenity, as advertised. It was such a pleasure coming "home" to our peaceful lobby after being in the casinos and/or the other hotels. Our stay was for 9 days, which began on Memorial Day weekend. It was a madhouse everywhere that weekend - it was like being on Spring Break in Cancun with a ton of young 20-somethings. Noisy, crowded, overwhelming. But not in OUR hotel. Oh, it was busy - and full. But the only place it was any sort of issue was at the pool. Well, not an "issue" - it's just that there were way more people at the pool on the holiday weekend than there were at any other time. But it was an easygoing relaxed crowd. Unlike right next door at the Mandalay pools with thumping loud music and waaaay too many people. By the way, when you stay at the Four Seasons, you can use all of the Mandalay pools but not vice versa. We only used the Four Seasons pool...just simply more relaxing and a better class of clientele (not drunken loud kids showing off their boob implants). Order lunch while you're lounging by the pool. They bring you a tray and the food is really good. The poolside service is excellent. On the slower days (non-holiday weekend), they come by and spray you with water to cool you off, offer you free popsicles, frozen melon balls, and even asked if we needed our sunglasses cleaned! Casino...there is none. But Mandalay Bay is actually part of the same building as the Four Seasons and they do have a Casino. I didn't see every hotel but I can say this - I thought the Bellagio was the nicest casino I've ever seen. I thought the Venetian was a beautiful hotel and the casino was nice. I thought the MGM Grand stunk from cigarette smoke, even in the restaurants. I would not be able to gamble there. I thought Caesars was a horror show and just gave me a bad vibe from start to finish. Mandalay Bay's casino is relatively small if you're a table player. Tons of slot/video machines, though. But I'm a blackjack player. There are no non-smoking areas, but it wasn't too bad. Smoke really bothers me so I wasn't thrilled. At night, you can't find anything lower than a $15 minimum-bet table. But - it's all really easy to get to from Four Seasons. You don't have to leave the building to get there. So that's where we played. It would have been great if the Bellagio casino was that close but we just simply didn't feel like jumping into a cab to go there. And when the gambling is over, you walk through the (virtually unmarked) door and go from a loud, boisterous casino into a very quiet, clean, peaceful hallway at your private Four Seasons elevator and leave the noise and smoke behind. Aaaahhhh....Wonderful! Ultimately, I was very pleased with our choice of where to stay. I was just about to book the Bellagio when it occurred to me that it was a holiday weekend and it might be crazy there. Boy, was I right and I'm glad we chose the Four Seasons instead. Expensive but worth the money. If we go back, that's where I'm staying. My only complaints: There was an odd smell in part of the lobby for the entire time we were there and another guest told me it was the same last year. The spa was beautiful but there is no hot tub / jaccuzzi in there. Mandalay has one but you have to pay $30/day to use it and you have to walk through the casino after your massage if you come from Mandalay - that would un-relax you in a hurry. Also, although the bathroom has a "soaking" bathtub (very deep), it also has no jaccuzzi jets and there is no curtain or glass door around it, so the hot bath gets cold very quickly. Oh, and no chocolates on the pillow at night, LOL! (I can't eat them anyway but I can dream, can't I?)

Reviews.Title: “World Class Service... World Class Stay”
Reviews.Author: MooneyPilot
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a trip to Vegas at the Four Seasons. The hotel is absolutely fantastic in all regards. I must admit that we are loyal Ritz Carlton fans and regularly choose the RC as our brand of choice, but this stay may have changed that. The staff is truly focused on outstanding service beginning as you first walk in the door. The porter opens the car door for you and asks your last name as you are checking in. From then on, you are greeted by your last name. It is actually quite impressive. Equally as impressive was the service both at the pool and the spa. The rooms are nice and what I would call "standard" for a RC or FS brand. The robes were true terry cloth and actually nicer than the RC robes (spa robes). The slippers were terry cloth as well and more comfortable than the RC (spa slippers). The bed was nice and I slept well with no complaints. The black out curtains were truly best in class and enabled me to really sleep in without any sign of light coming through. The towels were ok, but not quite as nice as I would have expected (they were a bit worn and thinner than the typical RC towels). The bathroom was quite nice and the shower had some of the best water pressure that I have experienced in quite some time. The absolute best part of the hotel was that there is no casino noise. If you want the casino it is right next door and easily accessible, but you don't have to walk through it on your way to your room. On our departure we asked for a cab to the airport and the porter informed us that he would have the hotel car (black escalade ext) take us. This just capped off and absolutely perfect stay. All in all, the Four Seasons exceeded my expectations and I will absolutley make this my hotel of choice for all of my future visits to Las Vegas...

Reviews.Title: “Elegance near Vegas Decadance”
Reviews.Author: shami287
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for two nights after a trip to Utah for hiking and had a Strip View room.  It was an extremely elegant, quiet respite from the loud Vegas scene.  We loved the spa, restaurants pool and overall service.  Our room was on the small side, but the view made up for it.  We have stayed at other Vegas hotels, most recently the Wynn, and found that the Four Seasons offered true relaxation with the ability to get to a casino or some other  vegas-style action within minutes.  I loved the fact that there was never a line for a cab and one could arrange spa services at any time one desired.  The pool area was small but beautiful and the attendants were so helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Top Class”
Reviews.Author: Addicked
Reviews.Content: We've visited Vegas a few times but this was the first time at The Four Seasons. The standard was as high as you'd expect from this hotel chain, but the real bonus was the escape from the madness of the town, which was only a short step away in the form of The Mandalay Bay. We had young children with us and found the ambience and service second to none.

Reviews.Title: “Accessible Rooms are not up to Par- But Spa and Spa Staff great”
Reviews.Author: dirigible
Reviews.Content: Stay was one year ago. Birthday trip for me and my 83 year old Mom. Check in smooth and Spa treatments (a suprise gift from a family member) were over-the-top fabulous. Family member also suprised us with Champange and Chocolates placed in our room upon our arrival. Flowers delivered for birthday sent by family member and Cake compliments of Four Seasons were nicely done. My Mom had her first facial and loved it (and thought the esthetician was great). My extra long (180 min?) massage seemed a little decadant but it was one of the best deep tissue massages ever! Warmly greated by spa/gym staff every AM when I went to work out at the gym. Gym small and (a year ago- hopefully this was fixed) individual TV's on treadmill were controlled by a remote control that was not dedicated to your treadmills TV. A woman next to me kept pointing her remote my direction and changing my TV. I could not have been more irritated by this! Also, the Temp controls in the Accessible Spa shower were tempermental and I was glad I was present to help my Mom out, otherwise, the drastic change to hot water could have caused problems. The spa area was smallish but luxurious with a very nice staff. We enjoyed breakfast and afternoon tea (reserve ahead) in Verandah. Room service for breakfast was wonderful and toiletries luxurious. However we were very dissapointed with the accessible bathroom. A standard tub was fitted with bulky huge bench/chair but there was nothing to sit on in the shower. I was very disappointed with the response that I recieved from the front desk when I called down to ask about a shower chair for my Mom. "No we do not have one." There was a shower chair in the accessible bathroom in the spa so I ended up packing everything in a big tote and wheeling my Mom down to the spa so she could have a nice shower (with the iffy temp. control). The spa staff was gracious but I felt a little bit like a couple of ragtag refugees schleping down to the shower every day when I know the Four Seasons could afford to get a $45 shower chair to be sent up to our room. (The huge bathtub chair woud not fit in the shower). I was also unimpressed with the front desk staff on the one occasion I was having problems with my key-card. Mom and I had been by the pool and we approached the front desk ( I was pushing Mom in her wheelchair ) and asked if I could get another key card for us to use. The front desk attendant looked at us and said " we need to see your ID". I was loaded-down with pool/sun gear and my Mom in a wheelchair. I explained that my wallet was in our safe in the room. Basically he said (I'm paraphrasing here): "too bad". It really would have been nice if he had offered to send someone up to our room with us and they could check our ID there. We did enjoy the non-gaming oasis and quiet retreat of the resort, but the two incidents with lackluster staff really left us feeling lukewarm (at best) about the Four Seasons Vegas. When we chose to stay at the Bellagio this year our experience with every staff member was wonderfull and the accessible rooms had a much better shower for someone with disabilities.

Reviews.Title: “Should have been better”
Reviews.Author: bigbasin
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at a Four Seasons. I stayed at the Four Seasons Easter Weekend. I was assigned a room with a pool view. The Associate at the front desk was top notch, while the Associate at check-out was impersonal. The hotel has an understated scent of luxury. The room, on the 38th floor, was clean and in perfect condition. Room Service staff were cheerful and polite. The front desk spa staff seemed to be from a casting call of Sunset Tan - valley girls. Compared to the Canyon Ranch Spa at the Venetian, the spa lounge is tiny. Here is why I didn't give this hotel 4 or 5 stars - each morning the jets across the freeway would start their engines at 6am - I was taking some time off and didn't want to get up at 6am. ugh. I'm taking some time off around Memorial Day in Arizona and decided to stay at the JW Marriott Camelback instead of the Four Seasons - didn't want to take a chance that my quiet would be distrubed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay at the Four Seasons Vegas”
Reviews.Author: JenniferJE
Reviews.Content: After reading the great reviews of this hotel, we decided to check rates on the internet. The hotel was running a "3rd night free" prromotion, so we ended up paying an average of about $189 per night, which put as around the same pricepoint as any of the other high end strip hotel. The room was beautiful with plenty of space. There was a large bathroom with serparate shower and tub and a large vanity. The bed was large and comfy. The room had a small sitting area which was fine for my husband and I. There is no casino in this hotel, however it is connected to the Mandalay Bay, so you have easy access to there casino and ammenities. We loved utilizing the Mandalay's amazing pool area for some fun in the lazy river and wave pool, then laying out by the Four Season's private pool area for some relaxation. The Four Seasons pool area is first class. We loved ordering frozen drinks and appetizers poolside and being spritzed with Evian water by the poolside attendants. This hotel is first class all the way. It is a nice oasis from the hustle and bustle of the strip, but close enough to all the action.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly Wonderful - Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: Lovz2Travel
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. This is the only hotel in Las Vegas to stay at. It is peaceful and quite. The staff are incredible as they are knowledgeable and want you to enjoy your stay. Though it is the most expensive hotel in Las Vegas it is well worth it to get away from the regular Las Vegas with slot machines, rude staff, and lots of cigarettes smoke. Words can not say enough about this palace. I have stayed at other Five Star hotels in Las Vegas including Bellagio, Wynn, and Venetian. After staying here, I will never stay at any of those traditional Vegas hotels ever again!

Reviews.Title: “Welcome change from most of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Ocean_gal74
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the Easter weekend. Check-in was fast with no wait. I requested a room that faced away from the airport to avoid the noise others have complained about. The room overlooked an unattractive parking garage but it was super quiet at night. The room was large and the bed was as comfortable as you would expect from any Four Seasons. Housekeeping did a fabulous job and were prompt when requested. Overall, we had a great stay but if you're a regular at the Four Seasons, just lower your expectations slightly. The service here can be spotty and just not up to the usual standards you would expect. And it is Vegas so it will be more crowded, especially by the pool. But it's still the best option in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis”
Reviews.Author: Katkin1965
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for Xmas / New Year (2nd year running), Once again stayed in a Suite and whilst expensive it was worth every penny. The hotel is an absolute bastion of calm, quiet and elegance. Lovely spa, the only downside is they don't do manis / pedis. Charlie Palmers serves perfect steak. The valet has your car in a couple of minutes. Rooms are warm and comfortable. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, expensive but worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: Barrythecat
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel for fist 4 nights of our honeymoon. It's not cheap but you get what you pay for. We loved the fact that it doesn't have a casino and is consequently much quieter than the majority of Vegas hotels. Also,being at the airport end of the strip, it's just not as busy. We stayed in a Premier Strip View room which did indeed have the most amazing view of the strip. We were treated to the most fantastic "free" firework display on New Years Eve which we watched from our room on the 18th floor. The service at this hotel is faultless. Roomservice plates were removed the second they were placed outside the door. The whole hotel was immaculately clean. We ate in the Veranda restaurant one evening and the meal was beautiful with attentive service. Everything you would expect from a 5 star Four Seasons hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Another quality stay at FS”
Reviews.Author: lovemypup
Reviews.Content: I am becoming a "regular" at FS properties. I love that they are so dependable, and you will always get what you pay for. I will say that I was a little disappointed in the "blah" room decorations here, but it was minor. CHECK-IN: Easy. I arrived at 11:30am on a Thursday and my strip-view room was ready. This was nice since I wanted to have lunch before my 2pm spa appointment. ROOM: Strip view was nice, but I am honestly not sure it is worth the tremendous jump in price from a regular room. At night it was cool to see the lights. . .but you could also walk outside at night see them. I would definitely not pay for the view again, although I appreciated others' recommendations here about it. I think I would have wondered what I was missing--now I know. Bed--typical, comfortable, clean and nice, cool, soft sheets. Bath--I didn't like the showers here-the water pressure was actually too hard, and there was no way to adjust the shower head to make it softer. I know, picky, picky, but not everyone likes to blasted out of the shower. Desk/chair/tv: Very utilitarian. I could have been anywhere. . .not as comfortable as other FS properties. FOOD: I have the brunch at the hotel restaurant--it's a bit pricey and probably not worth it. the food was "typical" brunch food, and after having "The Buffet" at Wynn for 1/2 the price, there really is no comparison. The remainder of my meals I ate next door at Mandalay bay--nothing I would return for, including the much-heralded "Burger Bar." It was good, but $25 for a burger and fries??? POOL: The pool area is lovely, and the pool itself is warm. The attendants were great--constantly checking on you, even bringing nuts or chips if you want them. Spending an afternoon here was definitely my most relaxing day. SPA: I had a facial here which was lovely. The facilities are top-notch, and the services comprehensive. They have people on "stand-by" so you can generally walk-in and request a same-day service.
