They were also very generous with samples of the products they used during my service, which is helpful before committing hundreds of dollars to a new routine. CASINO: This hotel is attached to Mandalay Bay--the casino is disappointing, as is the Luxor, which is also close by. It is very easy to tell the difference in the older casinos and the newer ones. This is definitely "old." LOCATION: This is the biggest drawback to an otherwise nice stay. The FS is so far away from everything that you are constantly renting a cab. . .it's 3 miles to Bellagio, and 6 miles to Wynn/Encore, which can be a nice walk unless you are dressed for dinner and a show. . .this is also the main reason I would not return to this property.

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate Luxury in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Love2DineOutNJ
Reviews.Content: I’ve only vacationed to Las Vegas once, but now that I’ve stayed at the Four Seasons I can honestly proclaim that I will never stay anywhere else but there in future visits! The hotel was immaculate—the design, the casino-free atmosphere, the pampering service…all top-notch. We stayed in a “premier strip-view room” on the 36th floor and the windows were floor to ceiling offering sweeping views of the entire strip. It was simply breathtaking to look at both day and night—the best part about the location of the Four Seasons on the top floors of the Mandalay Bay tower is the fact that it is at the far end of the strip, not the middle, so you can see everything and not just half of the glamorous hotels. Our room was spacious and comfortable for 4 adults. We also loved the pool area because it was a beautiful, quiet retreat from the rowdy Mandalay Bay wave pool, although we could go over there whenever we wanted if we desired to soak in the party atmosphere at any point. It was awesome that Four Seasons guests had the option to use the Four Seasons pool or Mandalay’s pool, but Mandalay guests had to stay at Mandalay. Some of the little things that we loved about our stay as we lounged by the pool for 5 days in the hot July sun were the amenities at the pool. Throughout the day, attendants came around and offered us mists of Evian and eucalyptus-infused chilled towels to cool us down, as well as periodic offerings of fresh fruit, cucumbers for our eyes, and popsicles. We also had a pitcher of ice water refilled constantly throughout the afternoon, and there were plenty of servers to take food and drink orders at any time. They had a fabulous menu to order breakfast or lunch at the pool, and they actually brought over a nice tray that fits over the lounge chair so you could eat right there without having to get up! It was so comfortable. One of our primary reasons for selecting the Four Seasons over other luxury resorts like the Bellagio or the Wynn was the fact that even though those resorts are nice, they are still huge and simply cannot offer the level or personalization or quiet pool area feel that Four Seasons can offer. If you want pampering luxury and personalized attention throughout your stay, I highly recommend that you stay at Four Seasons and then just visit the other top hotels for dinner and shopping each night. We are non-gamblers, so this was another plus for us, but even if you gamble recreationally and you still want top-notch service and luxury, you will not be disappointed in the Four Seasons. I suppose the only reason to stay elsewhere would be if you really need to be steps away from the tables and slots or the non-stop party atmosphere of the other casino hotels. For us, we loved the Four Seasons, and the next time I find myself in fabulous Las Vegas, Nevada I will find myself checking in at the Four Seasons without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful haven away from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: thezaz
Reviews.Content: We toured the other hotels on the strip and went to shows, etc... but just LOVED being able to get away from it all when it came time to rest and go to sleep. The hotel is beautiful and serene. There were NO crowds whatsoever. Check in was a breeze, lots of room at the pool, very comfortable rooms, service was friendly and helpful. The spa is georgeous and one of the best I've been to (and I love going to spas). They also don't charge extra for things like gym use, DVD player, pool use, etc.. Really great place to stay. Only thing to be cautious of is some of the rooms face the airport and you might be bothered by plane traffic if you're a light sleeper (we asked for a room away from the airport and it was very quiet).

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality from personnel was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: HLplace
Reviews.Content: As a Texas girl visiting the western United States, I never know what type of service I am going to get. There are times that the services can be haughty and lacking in the genuine personalization I am used to getting in my southern state. The Four Seasons Las Vegas more than exceeded my expectations. The staff was welcoming, and treated me like a person rather than a commodity. My husband and I were visiting Las Vegas for the first time for our 20th wedding anniversary. We arrived to receive a delectable chocolate mouse cake with "Happy Anniversary" beautifully writen on it. We were also going to be picking up a new puppy while visiting the area, and the Four Seasons went above and beyond to lay out a doggy bed, bowls, and treats to wecome our newest family member. Our first night I also ordered room service by phone from a very cheery attendant. She was also more than helpful with my wine requests. The room service arrived prompty with a smile and a waiter that was also more than helpful with information about the food and wine. After we dined, all I had to do was make a phone call and someone came and picked up the table and dishes. Great service! As a topper, when we were leaving the hotel I forgot some jewelry on the glass above the sink. I asked the front desk clerk at check out and he quickly called security and within minutes my jewelry was delivered to me in the lobby while I sipped my morning tea. I will definitely be looking forward to my next stay at the Four Seasons Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with great service but...”
Reviews.Author: swuwhit
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at many Four Seasons and this one is very nice. Quiet, away from the strip, with access to the Mandalay Bay casinos, shops and restaurants if you want it. My biggest complaint was the airport noise. The planes started around 6am. We were on the north wing facing the airport. I don't know if you can escape the airport noise along the Strip as the airport is pretty much adjoining the Strip. On a side note--the access to the Mandalay would also give access to their pool which has a big wave pool. We didn't bring the kids this trip, but would consider Four Seasons again to get access to their pools.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay - and that bed!”
Reviews.Author: godiva136
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons over New Years Eve. First off, my boyfriend is a 4S devotee. He's been prodding me to stay at one for awhile now, so we finally did on this trip. Things I liked: * Excellent service - and I do mean excellent. Only matched thus far my MGM Grand Skylofts. * The BED! Oh my gosh, the bed. This is the best bed I have ever slept in, without a doubt, hands down. I'm trying to figure out where they sell them. I would get in and never want to leave, which wasn't so good when it came time to go out. :) Best in comfort, hands down. I haven't slept in a bed that comes close to it. * Room service was stellar and delicious. * The Spa was fantastic for treatments. The interior was unremarkable otherwise, but the quality of treatments was amazing. * Very quiet. * Close to a casino (Mandalay Bay). * Room staff were stealthy and hyperaware - we'd go out for 45 minutes for lunch and come back to a spotlessly clean room. Disliked: * Didn't deposit you on a casino floor, and the doors leading from 4S to the Mandalay casino floor were rather hard to find and out of the way. Which isn't SO bad, I guess, but irritating nonetheless. * I'm not a huge fan of the Mandalay casino... so that didn't help! * The rooms were fairly small and understated, which is okay, but boring. * No 'fun' amenities (I'm constantly finding interesting stuff all over MGM Grand Skylofts for example - like televisions situated in strange places, personalised stationery, etc) All in all, it was very nice, and I would stay at a 4 Seasons located elsewhere, but for Vegas I think there are better options.

Reviews.Title: “Good but some issues”
Reviews.Author: KEWLBEANS
Reviews.Content: I was very happy that we chose to stay at the Four Seasons but might think twice about staying here again. Here's the good and the "areas for opportunity". For the most part, service and atmosphere were excellent. Only one exception was dealing with a staff member trying to resolve a billing error. It was unnecessarily difficult and uncomfortable to fix thanks to a not-so-pleasant front desk receptionist. Otherwise, it was refreshing to be treated so well. Christian, a bell stand staff, and May in reception were very pleasant and professional. We paid $100 to upgrade to a larger room. We did not get a strip view. Instead we got a lot of airport noise (starting at 6am Sun-Wed, 5am on Thurs). We were also next to an ice machine/room. A few times during the night we were woken by the noise (either a door slamming or the ice machine). The bed was very nice but not as comfortable as the Signature beds or the LV Westin beds. The rooms were wonderful though. We did have room service several times. Dinners were good but breakfast was overdone and way over -priced. The room service orders were always correct (yay) but we always had to ask for the bill. The server never offered it. It was very nice to have special access and separate elevators to the Mandalay Bay area. Kudos to the staff though for really making our stay pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: JJJC_Family
Reviews.Content: Although we occasionally stay at some very nice hotels, we try to keep our lodging costs reasonable. Our attitude is basically that we typically get in late and are only there for sleep and showering, so why spend a fortune, particularly as we tend to spend only one or two nights in one place. While on a trip we just finished, we had to change our itinerary due to bad weather. I went to check what was available on some travel web sites and found what I thought was an incredible deal for the Four Seasons - $200, after a credit. I had never stayed in a Four Seasons before and I was curious to see what it was like. In a word, it was fantastic. First, we were upgraded to a suite. I expected a nice, roomy place. We got a huge place with a very, very large living room and a very large bedroom. It had a large bathroom in the bedroom and something I had never seen before, a half bath for the living room. We loved the huge LCD television in the living room and the still very large one in the bedroom. The floor to ceiling windows gave a dramatic cast to the suite, even though we probably didn't have the best area to view. The decor was modern, but not extreme. Everything about the suite was high quality and the fit and finish was excellent - no squeaky doors or loud, obnoxious heating unit here. Finally, the bed was the best I've slept on and the towels and bathroom were plush and wonderful. Service was excellent. They quickly brought a refrigerator needed to store medicine. Valet and bell staff were quick and pleasant. While very pricey (2 pancakes and 2 OJ's were $58 - it is a luxury hotel, after all ), the pancakes were the best I have ever had. We just did not want to leave. It was delightful. It was so good, in fact, that if we can get similar deals in the future, we intend to go several times a year just to relax there and enjoy ourselves in the room itself. We're frugal, but some indulgences are worth splurging for and this is definitely one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel -- A little away from the craziness”
Reviews.Author: TorontoDebbie
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Las Vegas is a little away from the centre of all the action. However it is a short cab ride away or you can walk if its not too hot. However, if you are looking for excellent service and quality and some peach and quiet, this is the place to stay. The pool area at the Four Seasons is just lovely. The rooms are perfect -- with spectacular views in the strip view rooms. The gym was also great. Love this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Only worth it for the view and tranquility”
Reviews.Author: VickyBristol
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading the reviews and could not ignore it was the no. 1 hotel in Vegas. We decided to splash out on a premier strip view room as we were getting married in Vegas and wanted the stay to be extra special. Good points; The view from our room (floor to ceiling window) was amazing especially at night. The hotel is so quiet and relaxing. The quietest hotel we have ever stayed in. Vegas is crazy and it was lovely to walk through the "secret" door in the hectic Mandalay Bay into the Four Seasons away from all the hustle and bustle. The hotel is immaculate, clean and staff very polite. Stress free check in, which is just what you need after a long flight (we noticed massive queues in other hotels for check in) If all of this is important to you and money is no object , then book this hotel. However.................. Location wise, it is the most southern hotel on the strip so not ideal (taxis can be quite expensive as lots of traffic ) Eat all you can buffet breakfast at the Verandah was the best ever although expensive - about $80 for 2 of us. Room service breakfast on our wedding day was $50 for bagel, toast, grapefruit, coffee and orange juice (we only received 1 and got charged for 2) and it wasnt worth $10. Had to ring to find out where it was as we were trying to get ready for our wedding (it took nearly an hour to be delivered) We ended up having room service one evening (not out of choice - Mandalay Bay was chaos and all the restaurants had queues outside them) Very good pasta and reasonably priced although we had to ring twice to get them to collect dishes which is not ideal when you are exhausted and want to go to sleep! Nothing free in room (other than one bottle of water each and tea and coffee) We had some mints from the mini bar and got charged $6! We didnt get anything "special" from the hotel (they knew we were getting married) so this was very disappointing. My wedding dress was ironed by hotel (apparently same day service) It was collected early on Saturday and was not back in the room Sunday evening so panic set in. It came back with some stains on it and it was being looked into however no-one ever came back. It was taken from the room without its plastic cover so not sure if they covered it? Could not say 100% it was the hotels fault though although apparently they do inspect garments before they are worked on. We were not charged the $75 ironing fee. NB after Vegas we stayed in a 5 star hotel (Le Blanc spa) in Mexico. Same price per night, amazing room/view, all inclusive and we were treated so well as we were on honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury as it was meant to be”
Reviews.Author: schintz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week, right before the holidays. In fact, we were here when Vegas had snow! What a sight that was.. So this was our first stay at the Four Seasons and I have to say, they do live up to their name as the quality and service of our visit was over the top. Yes, it is very expensive and you know the old saying, "If you have to ask the price, then you can't afford it". So this is not for those who are on a budget. We had booked a moderate room and when we checked in, was offered to upgrade to a one bedroom suite. The room was beautiful and spacious and quiet! Never heard any of our neighbors the whole time we were there.. The Verandah was a nice place to have cocktails and a bite to eat.. No smoking or loud casino noises there, which was a nice retreat after going to different casinos. I have to say, the customer service is the best ever, with people always making sure every need is met. I have been spoiled and can't imagine staying at any other hotel while I am in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the peace and quiet & "Non-Vegas" atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: Trip Advisor from Dallas, TX
Reviews.Content: We went to Las Vegas to celebrate my son's 21st birthday and to get away for a few days. Had not been to Vegas in 30 years & it has really changed. What we really enjoyed about the Four Seasons was that it was so quiet , beautiful and small. There is no casino in the hotel like the other hotels there. The Four Seasons is actually the top 5 floors of the Mandalay Hotel and the Mandalay has a casino. It is easy to reach the casino but the Four Seasons has it own entry so you never have to go through the casino if you don't want to. Our rooms were very nice & the service/concierge was wonderful. We were able to find a very good rate/package on the Four Seasons website and that is how we booked our room. We had breakfast each day at the hotel restaurant & it was great. It is very relaxing to go out to see the other hotels which are so crowded with people and smokers, etc & then come back to the lovely Four Seasons. We also visited the Hoover Dam & took the tour where you go inside the dam workings. Then we drove over to Red Rock Canyon & took the drive through the canyon. It is a very short drive & very scenic. If we went back to Las Vegas, we would definitely stay at the Four Seasons again.

Reviews.Title: “Way too expensive”
Reviews.Author: loanwriter
Reviews.Content: The Four Season was very nice. However, EVERYTHING is EXPENSIVE and they nickle and dime you till you get armed and legged! The staff was just OK.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zim12345
Reviews.Content: It is an ok hotel. Not worth all the money paid. Not the best Four Seasons hotel either.

Reviews.Title: “A top hotel should ever be perfect”
Reviews.Author: fabry73
Reviews.Content: Someone will disagree with my review, but my point is that an hotel should be reviewed regarding how luxurious it is (pretends to be) and how pricey it is. While I can easily give a 5* to a 60$ nt motel showing itself surprisingly nice and clean with courteous staff and forgive some minor issues, the same issues can never be forgiven in a top class hotel. I reserved a three nights stay (stay longer promo - 3rd night free) in a one bedroom suite. Rate was 650$ per night. Check-in was perfect, staff absolutely amazing, a massive lobby well-appointed, and an upgrade to a sunrise/sunset suite. The suite was absolutely perfect (about 1500 sq f.), an entry foyer with a large secondary bathroom and a very large living room. Living room has 3 floor to ceiling windows, on 3 different sides (this suite covers more than 180° view, being on the far end of the floor/building). A walk-in closet, large bathroom with lots of amenities, bedroom. A kitchenette. 2 lcd tv (living room/bedroom). Nothing to say about the suite, but keep in mind it's rated 1800$ per night (!). Now, let's talk about issues. After check-in hotel requested a 1300$ authorization on my credit card, more than my final bill (I payed 1st night yet and 3rd was free). Maybe in US everyone normally has 5-6 credit cards, but in Italy (I think I could say in Europe) this is not usual, and an authorization remains as a lowered availability for 45 days. Luckily I have 2 c.c. with large availability, but a 2700$ charge (1300$ authorization, 650+taxes payed as 1st night and 650+taxes on check-out) was quite heavy. Not an issue but a wrong (imho) hotel policy. On final bill I found 15$ "business center charge". They said "it's for parcels you've received here" (great service for this). I will never argue for a 15$ charge on a more than 1k$ bill and I didn't complain at all, but I think every charge should be showed before. I e-mailed the hotel asking for the possibility of receiving parcels, they answered "Yes,no problem", but never talked about charge. Anyway, not important. No tv in bathroom, no jacuzzi. I can easily survive shaving in the morning without watching tv, and without bubbles too, but I found tvs in bathroom in the most part of major hotel strip (Media suite at MB, normal room at THE hotel, salon suite at Wynn, Fortuna suite at Palazzo, one bedroom suite at Palms Place, normal room at Trump, you just have to choose. That rooms are all rated 1/2 to 1/10 than sunrise/sunset at FS) and same about jacuzzi, so it's hard to think a 1800$ nt suite doesn't have this stuff. I used internet tv access for a fee 1st day (and others). Wireless keyboard didn't work. I informed immediately front desk about it, but keyboard was not changed during my stay. Luckily, I found another one in bedroom 2nd day and I used that. 2nd sink in bathroom didn't work (water didn't flow at all). I informed front desk only on check-out, but it's hard to think a sink become obstructed in a day, and no one informed front desk about this before. Anyway, it's possible. On 2nd day I used trash bin under sink in kitchenette (coffee filter, sugar pack, paper). The next day, after housekeeper cleaned room, trash bin was still full (I would say I tipped 10$ every morning, I'm a very organized person and room was generally very tidy when I went out every morning, so this shouldn't be an issue). On 1st day, I had my coffee in a cup (two were in the kitchen). Housekeeper took it but didn't replace. On 2nd day I had my coffee in the second cup. On 3rd day, I didn't have my coffee because there were no cups left (never replaced). That's all. Maybe they're not big issues (I've said it). But I asked myself what I would have thinked, after paying 1800$ nt for a suite, finding a full trash bin reentering in room and other things noted (and my 1400$ total for 3 nts weren't that bad too to deserve this...).

Reviews.Title: “In love with this place...”
Reviews.Author: Morlaque
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 1 AM from JFK and it was just fantastic feeling to know that we are staying a great place like this hotel! The only minor issue we had was that the person next door (room 39218) was SMOKING at 2 AM and the smoke that came through the connecting door woke me up. Other than that, it was a great place and it really spoiled us for Vegas since I don't think we will ever stay in any other place!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: MandyCardiff
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here on our first stop of our round the world trip. We received amazing customer service and stayed in a great strip-view room. The hotel was quiet and relaxing, which was great to get back to after visiting the loud and bright vegas strip! Breakfast was delicious. We had a helicopter trip to the grand canyon at sunset while there, which was simply outstanding! This hotel is highly recommended and we would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons LV is the best Hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: TIALAURA
Reviews.Content: This is the second time this year I have stayed at the Four Seasons Las Vegas and as always I loved it. I was greeted immediatly upon arrival and introduced by the Bell person to the front desk Lady as a repeat Customer. I had an event to attend to so the Front desk was able to immediately get me into my room which in my opinion was excellant service. One night there was a horrible odor in my room which came from the room next to me and after 1 phone call someone came up and sprayed and I was assured that if the smell did not disappear they would move me to another room. Thanks to Alex at the Front desk. I had 2 lovely breakfasts at Verandah, was waited on and pampered by Heidi- ask for her she was great. The weekend breakfast buffet was wonderfull well worth the $35.00 per person.

Reviews.Title: “Class in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: JoycePeoria_AZ
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons has an understated elegance which is rare in this flashy town. The atmosphere is relaxing. There is little glamour and glitz, but the calm luxury is very welcome. The rooms are spacious and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Heaven”
Reviews.Author: oliver_chance
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Bellagio, Wynn, Venetian. And once we stayed at the Four Seasons, we had no reason to ever stay anywhere else. This place is pure heaven. The pool is divine. Special kudos to the pool staff who are ever cheerful and eager to please -- no matter the request. The view from the rooms down the Vegas strip is breathtaking. Housekeeping is perfect. Everything is perfect. After 3 trips to Four Seasons we still cannot wait for our next one.

Reviews.Title: “Great oasis on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: jascherer
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with fantastic rooms, beautiful common areas and great customer service - everything that you would expect from a Four Seasons. We loved having a quiet retreat from the chaos of the Strip. It's also convenient to have amenities of the Mandalay Bay - we took advantage of the tram that left from there and the wave pool.

Reviews.Title: “Service was just unbelievable”
Reviews.Author: Lynda&Gary
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at this hotel, we were made to feel special. The Four Seasons is the top 5 floors of the Mandaley Bay hotel, but with your own reception and no fuit machines in the lobby. If you want all the action you just getthe lift to a different floor and you come out in the Mandalay Bay. You can use all the facilities of the MB including the pool which we thought we would use a lot. But once we had been to our own pool, we never ventured from there again. You have towels laid on the bed for you and iced water placed next to you, this is constantly changed as it melts in the heat. A lady came round to clean our sunglasses and then we were offered a fruit kebab, another time an ice drink and another time 'Evian' spritzer on our face. It was not over the top it was just right, even when we got into our car there were little touches like 2 bottles of cold water. Could not fault this hotel one bit - we are now 'Four Seasons' converts.

Reviews.Title: “The Only Place To Stay In Vegas”
Reviews.Author: westvaner
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at all the top end hotels in Vegas (except for Wynn) and this by far is the best. You can have the best of both worlds with a very relaxing time on one side (Four Seasons) and then go to the Mandaylay Bay with lots of action on the other side. If you have well behaved kids your ok here not too stuffy. The only thing missing was wireless internet, but overall this is the only place to stay in vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Les666
Reviews.Content: Booked trip with Virgin holidays; flight from UK London Gatwick..delayed by a few hours. Flight staff were more interested in talking about what they were going to do when they got there rather than service the passengers..plus they looked in the most part like they had just left school and should be with an adult. Food was BAD, one glass of water was offered the whole trip, plus i got 1 can of drink the size of a mixer, pressing the buzzer was pointless and when people started to queue down the aisle for water they put on the seatbelt sign and made everyone sit down... Was VERY glad to get off the flight. HOWEVER this is not about the flight unless your from the UK.. So onto Vegas.. On arrival Virgin Holiday rep made us queue up for 5 mins then gave us a letter explaining all about the welcome meeting which we always avoid..we were then told to get a cab as they didnt do transfers, waste of time that was..Cab to the hotel was easy to sort out, a short (avoid the tunnel) trip later we arrived. Like many others we assumed the 4 seasons was a hotel alongside the Mandalay bay...well its not its the 5 floors ABOVE it..??!! We were welcomed in a warn friendly way, helped with bags and were made to feel special.. Check in was fast, we were offered a bigger room at $175 a night more but declined. We were taken straight to the room and it was ready, but then we did arrive 4 hours late.. We have stayed at several of the best hotels in Vegas and this has the edge on being smaller, friendlier and generally MUCH BETTER than any of the others. The only other hotel which I would ever consider would be the Venetian which has much larger rooms.. The Four Seasons has its own entrance, no casino, it's own pool, etc., but guests have access to all of Mandalay Bay's amenities. It has a spa and a restaurant which we ate in and found to be very good. A private lift to the Casino gave access to the Mandalay bay and all the shops.. My wife says that although the shops were very similar to each other in the hotels Caesars palace were the best. Getting around.. There is a train that goes to the Luxor and Excalibur. From the Excalibur cross over to the New York then to the MGM via the a couple of walk ways over the roads. From the MGM there is another train that goes the length of the strip and right to the convention centres. This train you have to pay for and its worth getting a pass. I would like to point out that our room at the 4 seasons was SPOTLESS, the room was cleaned every day, clothes that we left out were folded...The bathroom stock of shampoo etc was added to every day and we had loads of towels. We ordered room service twice, it was on time, hot and good, plus not expensive..frankly the 4 seasons is a place where you can have a lovely quiet, relaxing holiday...trust me you notice it when you open the door to the Mandalay bay and see and hear the difference. checkout was fast, no queue at all..taxi to airport simple.. Decided to get a burger in the airport and so not rely on the flight food, just as well I did...it looked like a bowl of cat sick in a tin tray, it was probably the worst food I have had on a flight since a trip to Larnaca with Cyprus Air. All in all, hated the flight...everything about it, seats, food, staff everything...however we loved the hotel and would happily stay here again...but next time fly with BA and AA ..

Reviews.Title: “Oasis”
Reviews.Author: redsunset
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons promotes itself as an "oasis" amidst the hustle and bustle (tackiness?) of the Strip. I am pleased to report it is exactly that. The hotel occupies the upper six floors of the Mandalay Bay. It has its own entrance, lobby, pool, spa, etc. You would not know you were on the Strip, yet to get to the action all you do is push the "C" on the private elevator bank. You are delivered to a private alcove in the Mandalay lobby just steps from the casino. The room I had (deluxe) was roomy and quiet. Breakfast could be taken outdoors or in, in a restaurant just off the lobby. A good steak house (Charlie Palmer's is there also). The service, as you expect, is top notch. No nickel and diming. The gym is quite complete and you get access to the spa's locker room and steam bath. As for the pool..........what was the last time someone asked if they could clean your sunglasses? You get the idea. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Shoddy housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: KT8888
Reviews.Content: This spring I stayed at the Four Seasons Maui while writing a book. It was pure heaven in every respect. Because of my good fortune, I wanted to share the "Four Seasons" experience with my husband as he has to stay at Marriott's for business. This trip was for my business, but we had planned a little romantic escape. It is Vegas, after all. When we checked in, the valets came running and the check in went smoothly. We were told we were upgraded. I had purchased a three night stay through Hotels.com because they had a buy two nights get one free offer that was too good to pass up. When we got to the room, it seemed small and we weren't sure what the upgrade was. But, what kept my attention was the bathroom. I kept looking at spots on the floor -- especially around the commode. We were tired from travel and went to the Charlie Palmer Steakhouse, which was very nice. The hotel was very relaxed and very clean in the public areas. It is, indeed, an oasis from the Las Vegas casino atmosphere. The next morning as we got dressed to go to some meetings, the spots in the bathroom kept bothering me, so I wiped at them and it was evident there had been a male guest with poor aim that housekeeping failed to clean up after. I left some spots for a manager to look at, too, as there were plenty. My husband went to the front desk to tell them about the dirty bathroom and was told they'd send a note to housekeeping. Mind you, we did not say that there were no towels. We told them that there was urine from the previous guest on the bathroom floor. So, I started looking around and found nuts and crumbs on the carpet. I moved an ottoman and there was a peanut. It became clear that the room had been changed but not cleaned. We just hoped that the sheets had been changed. We called the front desk again and asked for a manager to come and look at what we were looking at. A manager did come and was very responsive and said we'd be moved, which we were to a slightly nicer, but much cleaner, room. We also were sent a small dessert and a note from the housekeeping manager. Frankly, we should have been moved immediately when my husband went to the desk and not after a second call so that the manager could come view the debris of the previous guest. On leaving, I was asked about my stay and I replied that it was OK. Then, a manager was called to give her apologies. This is what really left a sour note. I told her I was disappointed by the initial reaction that the bathroom had not been cleaned. She asked me why I waited a day to call and report it. I told her that I kept thinking there was no way that would be urine on the floor -- this was the Four Seasons, after all, surely that can't be. I didn't mention that I was extremely tired because I had been in the emergency room the night before with my parents who were in a car accident. So, instead of apologizing and letting me go on my way, she put the responsibility for my unclean room back on me. That's when I became angry at this situation. I just spent a lot of money to have a "Four Seasons Experience" and had to walk on the urine and crumbs of the previous guest -- and maybe sleep on their sheets. Ugh. And somehow this was my fault -- because I didn't point out their inadequacies sooner? Instead of filling out a comment card, I wrote the manager of the Four Seasons Worldwide. I got a response within an hour of my email and my stay was refunded. I was asked if I wanted to stay again at the Las Vegas Four Seasons, which I didn't because I won't be traveling there again. I would have preferred a stay at another Four Seasons location, but was told that the offer was non-transferrable. So, in the end...the very end... I was repaid with money. But what 's more valuable is my time. I would have preferred another stay at another Four Seasons because I am 1 and 1 with the Four Seasons. One stay was great, one was nasty.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of the best in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Luxrus
Reviews.Content: This was the fourth time we stayed in this place and everytime it has been perfect. There has not been a single complaint and yes, it is a relaxing place to stay in the midst of the hustle and bustle of the casino hotels. The pool is just great and besides that you can use all the facilities in Mandalay Bay. The pool attendents are some of the best all around. The food is awsome but avoid the steakhouse at it is nothing special for the price. Try the M. Bay restaurants. Rooms are roomy and ahhh the beds....... In summary, the best you can find for comfort and easy access to M. Bay casinos and other facilities (in some ways, even easier to access than M. Bay rooms).

Reviews.Title: “Don't think we can stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: CCLPHA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned a 6 night 7 day trip to Vegas for our 1st anniversary and my birthday Sept 28 - Oct 4. I used this website to pick a hotel and while it was more than I had originally planned to spend, the 3rd night free was a deal too good to pass up for the quality of the Four Seasons. Right from check-in, we were pleasantly surprised. The staff who checked us in walked us to the elevator to show us around. When we arrived there was a happy anniversary cake and card waiting for us. Our room overlooked the pool and mountains. You could see a part of the airport but I only heard a plane once, not inconvienient. Bed was as good as our Sterns here at home. The furniture was nice and heavy, very well made. Loved the understated "feels like home" not overwhleming decor and the fresh flowers around the property were amazing. Toiletries were rich and abundant. Turndown service was comforting w/ water at our bedside, soothing music, and nice slippers. I called one day for extra bar soap, explaining that it wasn't needed until evening time and within 10 minutes two bars were delivered to our room with a smile. The same soap sold in the gift shop for $9.00 a bar! Pool was beautiful and true to reviews the staff was perfect. Drinks were not too pricey $10.00 crown and worth it. I even got spritzed, just like the reviews say! I was a little skeptical about this but what the heck, I had to do as part of the FS experience. They also sent up a cake for my birthday and when chamber staff saw it was uneaten, sent up a 2nd one the next day, so we could enjoy a fresh cake when we were ready for it. Great friends from work called up and ordered chocolate covered strawberries for my birthday and a card. They were perfect and they mentioned how sweet the staff was on the phone. We had bruch at the Verandah on Saturday and it was over $90.00 for 2 including tip. Pricey and while the food was good, the breakfast at Mandalay Bay was just as good. Every staff member was warm and friendly beyond expectations. The price overall was worth it and my husband now doesn't even want to try out the Wynn or Bellagio which we'd heard so much about. BTW since this hotel is on Mandalay Bay property I'd like to mention the casino staff who was excellent as well. We left some pics from the Stratosphere on the casino floor and realized it the next day and they had been turned into lost and found and were back in our hands after eating lunch. All in all a perfect trip. I will say this, FS is a hell of a walk even w/ monorail, and tram service from Excalibur/Luxor. So get comfortable shoes or be prepared to shell out a heck of a lot for taxis. The deuce was worth it for Fremont St. but the wait seemed too long for daily use. I'm now obsessed with Vegas and we'll be back every 4 months or so.

Reviews.Title: “By far the best”
Reviews.Author: H0bster
Reviews.Content: Having read all the previous reviews I was a little unsure of how this hotel could possibly live up to the high standards I was expecting - it delivered 100%. We stayed at the Four Seasons Vegas for 6 nights in September 08 followed by a 6 night stay at the Tower Suites Wynn and there was really no contest. The Four Seasons was by far the most pleasant stay we have spent in Vegas - I would put this down to 2 main factors - the people and the service. Our Strip Room was very tastefully decorated (not super flashy or oversized but perfect for our requirements). The registration and concierge services were extremely polite and helpful. The pool was perfect - a nice size with amazing pool staff who catered for our every need from constant iced water and evian face spritzing to smoothies and popsicles. The service was provided in a totally non-intrusive and professional manner by staff who appeared to care about whether you were enjoying your stay - and without any snob factor - every single guest was made to feel special. We have stayed at numerous other hotels on the strip - Mandalay Bay & The Hotel, Bellagio, Caesars, Mirage, Venetian, Wynn, MGM and I would definitely rate The Four Seasons as top of the pile. Obviously the size of the hotel allows for a more intimate and personal service - if you can afford it then it is well worth paying for.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Sealover2008
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days in Vegas and really enjoyed the Four Seasons. Vegas is not our typical destination, as we are not gamblers, but we need a warm place with no hurricanes for a last minute sun/pool change of scenario for our kids. They absolutely loved the Four Seasons and the pools at the Mandalay Bay (the lazy river and the wave pool), jsut across a gate. The scenario at the Mandalay was overly zoo-esque, crowded, with a mass-mentality but the kids liked it for a couple of hours and when we got overwhelmed we would go back to the private pool at the Four Seasons and truly appreciate life in luxury! Food was great, service was exceptional. Kids felt pampered and cared for, everyone chatting with them, sending complimentary ice-cream, etc. Bed and pillows were unbelievable. Rooms are nice and big. Great little vacation!

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis of Elegance”
Reviews.Author: Traveler2980
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Las Vegas is both upscale and elegant . The staff could not be nicer. Housekeeping is unobtrusive and helpful. The facility is beautiful. We were upgraded upon our arrival to a Premier Strip View Room. The floor to ceiling, wall to wall, view was awesome. The pool is relatively small, but there was more than enough room for all the guests. At the pool, The Hotel provides free ices. For the Lazy River, the Wave Pool, and much better people watching go to The Mandelay Bay Pool which is just next door, and it only requires that you utilize your Four Seasons room key. The Charlie Palmer Steak Restaurant in the Four Seasons was excellent and reasonably priced. Do NOT have breakfast at The Mandelay Bay. The layout is poor, the lines are long, the food is horribly presented, and the service needs improvement. Instead spend the extra money, and go to Verandah Restaurant in The Four Seasons. The Hotel does not provide van service to the airport, but out taxi cost only $16 including a good tip. The taxi is a good way toget to the airport. Now here are two things we didn't like. 1)The location of The Hotel is far from the main drag on South Las Vegas Blvd. It is more or less isolated unless you want to utilize the far lesser nearby hotels (Mandelay Bay, The Luxor, or The Excalibur). 2) The Hotel's computer service costs a dollar a minute. You might be able to use a computer through your television for less, but we didn't try. It is a good idea to have your boarding passes ready prior to leaving for the airport, and the concierge will gladly print the passes for you. We had a wonderful vacation at The Four Seasons, and we plan to return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: SSpade
Reviews.Content: If you enjoy the Vegas glitz but dont want to stay in it, 4 Seasons on the top floors of the Mandalay is a perfect base. Discreet, excellent service, courteous, excellent concierge. Only gripe, the music at the pool needs to play a different selection of music each day; did get to the point where you could tell time of day by CD being played. Large, comfortable bedrooms and fabulous bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “refined haven in the desert”
Reviews.Author: rustymomo
Reviews.Content: Dont be put off by the 'lack of gaming' the four seasons is the top 4 floors of the mandalay bay hotel. So in essence you are right on top of the casino. Get in the lift and be at the blackjack tables in 5 minutes. This was my main concern when staying, but being a frequent FS guest they very rarely get it wrong. Smart lobby, attentive staff, lovely rooms on the top so a brilliant view, if you can wangle a upgrade to the strip view... do it, its worth it, but probably not worth the extra $400 a night they are asking for. I was there at xmas so the pool wasnt in use, but it looks great for summer. Nicely suprised by the champagne bottle in my room on NY eve, nice touch. Costs a little more than the other places on the strip, but amazing to escape the mayhem of vegas and take a deep breathe for a moment... "ahh im at the fours seasons :)"!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!”
Reviews.Author: Deanne08
Reviews.Content: I have to say that if you are ever going to Vegas, this is the place to stay!!! We were looked after sooo well!! We were travelling with a baby and we were upgraded about 5 times into a room on the top floor and then we had our baby who was 13 mths and they did everything, from bottle warmers, baby genies, play pen, and even a present for her a bear to take with us... Also, they had arrival platters of food and we have allergies, so it was not easy and they catered totally for us!! We were soo happy!! Nothing was a problem!! I think it was a little bit more expensive than everywhere else, but it was worth it!! I would definitely stay here again and the facilities, the service, it was the highlight of our european/usa 5 week holiday!! We are coming back very soon and would never stay any where else!! Also, must mention was a bit scepticle, but had a look around in vegas and did not regret our choice, not far from everything and great room, outstanding service and fantastic facilities!!

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Pub2
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons in Vegas advertises itself as an oasis in Vegas. I could not agree more. The staff, service, food and environment is one of the nicest I have stayed in the U.S. If you want a break from the strip but still want to be close enough to visit this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “A Sanctuary Amidst the Chaos”
Reviews.Author: timrobin
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 day stay during which we married at one of the local chapels. This resort is exactly as represented – a perfect respite from the Vegas madness. The service is top-notch with extreme attention to detail. The rooms are beautifully appointed and cleaned several times a day, yet the maids are rarely ever seen. We worked out in the incredible gym (best hotel gym I’ve ever seen) and our room was already cleaned by the time we returned at 9.30 or 10 am. The view down the strip (we had room 36131) was incredible. The pool is excellent, if a bit undersized. The service at the pool was also excellent. The concierge desk was outstanding and highly informative. They arranged dinner reservations, show tickets, golf and other things and did so with consistent enthusiasm and grace. They followed up to see if we enjoyed ourselves at the events they had arranged. At one point, we arranged a town car to take us to the courthouse to fill out the marriage application (a few days before the wedding). The car was 15 minutes late and when I notified the concierge about the late arrival (we had another appointment later that day and were pressed for time), they comp’d the town car, a $75 expense, and I hadn’t even asked them to do so. The senior concierge said, this is the Four Seasons Las Vegas, and if it’s not perfect, then there is no charge!” This was just typical of the incredible service this hotel provides. We also had spa services, which were outstanding as well and the spa itself is lovely. We are not huge fans of Vegas overall and this was our first trip to Vegas and we went specifically to get married and to enjoy this hotel. We will probably return just because we loved this hotel so much and, or course, because we were married in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Four Seasons experience, especially in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: poet283
Reviews.Content: We go to Las Vegas twice a year for a business meeting, and stay at some of the nicer hotels: Bellagio, Wynn, Signature Towers, THE Hotel, and now Four Seasons. I think we will be back here, especially with the online special that allowed us to upgrade to a strip view room. At first, I didn't think the view was that special, but at different times of the day and night, it was very beautiful to see how the buildings were lit and the mountains in the distance. I spent some R&R at the pool, and appreciated the ability to go to Mandalay's pool to "people watch," and then return to the tranquility of the Four Season's pool area. And talk about attentive service! At one point, the place was so busy that three managers in suits were assisting with picking up towels, serving food, refreshing ice water pitchers. The team didn't miss a beat and I was impressed how they all worked together, whether they were lifeguards, wait staff, or hotel managers. We had a nice lunch upon check-in at the Verandah, and a fantastic dinner at Charlie Palmer's Steakhouse. We thought Tommy was a great bartender, but be sure you seek Scotty for assistance with selecting wine. He does a great job as he knows the small Italian vintners on the menu. I much preferred this ambience over that of other steakhouses like Prime and SW. This is a non-traditional Las Vegas hotel, by that I mean no gambling, no crowds, no lines, no buffets, no themes, ... but you can get all of that through the connections with Mandalay Bay. We've been to Vegas enough that we don't need to partake in some of this other excess, so Four Seasons was ideal.

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is...”
Reviews.Author: eyechip
Reviews.Content: It is a Four Seasons. And it delivers well the Four Seasons level of quality, and at rates that are a bargain compared to other global FS properties. Great staff, comfortable and well-appointed furnishings, and a discreet and quiet atmosphere. It is what it is though...a classic Four Seasons atmosphere smack dap in the middle of boom boom Las Vegas. I find it to be a perfect place for this reason, in giving one a reprieve from the Vegas experience of the long-lines, long-walks, and loud atmosphere that the big luxury casino hotels all suffer from. But the secret of the Four Seasons is that it is connected to the Mandalay Bay through a well hidden door - so if you want a bit of the casino action it is as easy as an elevator ride to the second floor and three steps out through this magic door. Thus, it is my hotel of choice when having to be in Sin City and if defined in one sentence it might be "The best of both worlds." The Scorpion

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hi-Voltage
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 days as part of our visit to California/Nevada. Booked with a website called Lowcostlasvegas.com with no problems. Arrived on the Sunday about 4ish, check-in was a 5 minute easy welcome and refreshing compared to the usual LV hotel queues. Went to our bedroom and incredibly the room had not been made up from the previous guests stay! I immediately informed reception & within 5 mins the Asst Manager was escorting us to a new room. Due to the above mistake we were upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite which was without doubt truly great. During our stay it was our 18th anniversary and we were left a bottle of champagne and a cake, which was a nice touch. The hotel itself is very,very good. An oasis of serenity in Las Vegas which is truly unusual. Good points The rooms are spacious and very well finished. The toiltiries (Bulgari), bed linens, tv's, furnishings are superb. The spa & fitness facilities are very good The hotel is immaculate, clean and always smells nice The Verandah restaurant is very good Overall an excellent choice Bad points None

Reviews.Title: “Calm, quality and class”
Reviews.Author: voyagersLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Four Seasons for 4 nights following a 4 night stay in the Bellagio. A massive difference in calm quality and class was apparant. The check in took 1 minuite of total attentive staff instead of 30. Our bags were whisked away and were with us in minutes. Very nice rooms situated within the Mandalay Bay but not quite the expected 5 star ,more like a 4 star. The pool area was a dream you were totally pampered by very attentive staff with sunglass cleaning, Evian face spray, cold towls & endless supplies of iced water and ice cream all complementary. Lovely friendly staff who couldnt do enough for you. Hotel decor in public areas is up to the four seasons high standard and has class written all over it. It was good to have the access to the madness that is the Mandalay Bay resort hotel and when you have had enough to go through your own dedicated entry door to the sublime calm and quality of the Forur Seasons.Location is not the best on the strip but access to the busier parts is easy using the free tram which takes you to the Luxor and Excaliber. Some noise fro the airport but not enough to spoil the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent”
Reviews.Author: mickbarwood
Reviews.Content: We arranged our trip for our 20th wedding anniversary. The hotel asked us if we were celebrating any event, we said yes, obviously. Upon arrival we were treated very well and congratulated on our anniversary. We were upgraded to the strip view rooms and within an hour we were brought a lovely chocolate mousse cake with a happy anniversary piping. We were also left fruit and a large bottle of water. Every day we were left fruit thereafter. The in room entertainment is a step above other hotels with an ipod player and charger and a TV system to die for. The hotel has no casino, accordingly peace and quiet is everywhere. The hotel rooms are atop of the Mandalay Bay hotel and casino floors 35 through 39. We can thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Enclave - You Can RELAX in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: worldtravel15825
Reviews.Content: As noted in several reviews, this is an oasis in busy Las Vegas. Stayed with friends from France, and we actually became so comfortable with the room, pool, spa and restaurant we had trouble to pull ourselves away. We finally figured it out - wake mid morning, breakfast on the Veranda, then poolside (great service at every turn, try the Miami Vice or Mojito varieties), massage, walk next door to the wave pool for 30 minutes with the teenager, then late in the afternoon leave the pool for dinner and shows. The hotel really feels exclusive and clubby, you can't help but feel a little above it all (literally - top floors) and you pick and choose when you wish to indulge in the Vegas "mass attractions" ;-) Highly recommended, and I've stayed in many casino hotels in LV, but none have this level of comfort, seclusion, and service. This is a great hotel for folks with teens. Our 17 year old boy may have gone astray with more available attractive nuisances! PS we had a really excellent dinner at the restaurant in the "Eiffel Tower "of the Paris hotel/casino, our French friends were amazed to find the duck (canard) superior to any in France!

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect, but most likely one of the top hotels in the USA.”
Reviews.Author: dsnarl
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel multiple times. On my recent check in, the hotel informed me that they cancelled my reservation, and that they were full. When I requested both the Hotel General manager, and called american express they did relent, and charge my Amex and give me an upgraded room. However, as Amex had zero record of declining anything, and the hotel didn't have any record of contacting anyone, I'd reccomend anyone with reservations call the hotel the day of arrival and make sure someone didn't screw something up. Beyond this, this is truly adult fantasy land. Any request that you would make (as long as it's legal) would most likely be acted with pleasure. My wife was talking in the pool, saying that it was unusual to be thirsty standing in a pool of water. Within 3 mins, there was a glass of icewater in her hands. The rooms are a similar layout to the Mandalay bay, but the place is immaculate, the "Magic" icebucket is almost always cold and full. The Spa is small but extremely nice, and the Verandah is on par with just about any restaruant in Las Vegas. (Breakfast, Lunch or Dinner) Pet Friendly.

Reviews.Title: “This is pure luxury, supreme service, welcoming and just fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: DMSLeicestershire
Reviews.Content: Firstly, we also stayed at the Wynn whilst in Vegas, which was fantastic but this Hotel is the best hotel of all time!!!!!! We were on our honeymoon, which my husband and written on his internet booking, so when arriving, they had obviously noted this and congratulated us. Therewas such an air of calm at reception, I couldn't quite believe we were in Vegas! We had been automatically upgraded which was nice as we hadn't asked and then our room was just beautiful. We were so happy. A cake had been left for us (Happy Honeymoon) and a handwritten card congratulating us, which was very sweet. Bathroom was immacuately clean, luxury L'Occataine toiletries......nice touch!, Gorgeous, powerful shower, big bath, the expected fluffy towels and robes. Brilliant wardrobe space. Nice mini bar and a coffee making machine which would not normally interest us but as we were Jet Lag Disasters my husband thoroughly enjoyed is freshly brewed coffee for a caffeine fix. Again, mini bars don't normally interest us or affect our reviews but it was very good value. So, if you did fancy a treat whilst getting ready to go out, I would just help yourself, it won't break the bank. Turndown service, just makes you feel warm inside anyway when fluffy slippers are left by your bed and the laundry package to see if you would like anything cleaning, pressing or ironing for the following day. Your ice bucket would also be filled. The Verrandah Restaurant............Oh my goodness!!! This place was to die for!! Nicest breakfasts ever, total calm surroundings, lovely gentile service, the Juice of the Day were always fresh, fruity and did wake up the taste buds!! The first morning of our honeymoon, I just couldn't stop smiling, somebody (well, my husband) had transported us this Eutopia! Romantic, Serene and just fantastic. AS others have commented, the pool side service was totally unreal and didn't mean loads of tipping. We were left pretty speechless as we were chaperoned to our sunbeds, the towels were put on for us, two jugs of iced water then appeared. It didn't stop there...Evian Water was then sprayed on your face throughout the day, sombody offered to clean your sunglasses, fresh orange slices, cucumber, cold flannels (it was soooooo ho,so they were greatt!), endless supply of towels by the pool so you didnt have to dampen the ones on your bed. We were really fussed over and it was always with a smile. Poolside lunches were tasty, (which we did tip for as it's a specific service for you). We never had to ask for our water jugs to be topped up because hey were done automatically. The best!!! There were only around 50 people bathing and it was so peaceful unlike the madness at the 3 big pools, wave machine fest at te Mandalay Bay next door (which you couldn't hear but could well imagine) We did not eat here in the evening as we tried a few places in Mandalay Bay which were nice too. We didn't try the spa but the treatments did look rather amazing, Concierge were great when booking a hire car and concert tickets. Nothing was too much trouble. We loved this hotel, the location isn't brilliant if you wanted to be in the middle of the Las Vegas Bling a Ling but we didn't mind as we walked back from strip each night into what was heavenly quiet. I can't imagine anybody not liking this hotel We were sad to leave for our road trip to Zion and Bryce but had to see some major attractions before getting too settled into that rather plush lifestyle!!

Reviews.Title: “Simply The Best”
Reviews.Author: bigmarklasVegas
Reviews.Content: Simply the best Hotel in Vegas, They give you the service you expect from a 5 Star resort, unlike many others where they could not care less. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left we could not find fault with anything. The Pool is top notch. - We will be back

Reviews.Title: “SPLENDID”
Reviews.Author: TSKeefe
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Four Seasons was fantastic and thought that it was a true oasis and would love to visit again someday. The service and attention to detail around the pool and conceirge was wonderful and also the bed was the best bed I have ever slept in . We visited other hotels in Vegas during our stay Belligio, Wynn , Ceasars Palace etc etc and every time we returned to the Four Seasons we breathed a sigh of relief saying that we had made the right decision with the choice of this wonderful hotel.......gives you the best of both worlds whilst in Vegas Both our two children loved this hotel and a great hotel choice for children whilst in Vegas, but not over run with children.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: shortnspeedy
Reviews.Content: All the compliments the other reviewers give this hotel are true, leaving little else to add. I will say that we stayed at The Hotel at Mandalay Bay as well as the Four Seasons on one trip, capping the beginning and end of a trip to the southwest. The Four Seasons absolutely blew away The Hotel. The Hotel felt like a tourist trap compared to the Four Seasons. You'll feel the difference from the moment you walk into the lobby at the Four Seasons -- it's different here. If you've got the dough, it's definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: bobolito
Reviews.Content: We originally chose the Four Seasons because it was the only dog friendly hotel that was of high standards but ended up not bringing our dog when we found out you can not leave your animal unattended in the room alone as they will come and bring your pet down to a cage while you are out. Although our little dog would have been perfectly fine lounging in the luxurious room while we were out, we did not want to break any hotel rules and opted to leave her at home. I am also sure the care she would have received would of been of high standards given all of the staff we encountered working here. After I read all of the reviews we still opted for the Four Seasons over the Wynn, Bellagio and the Venician and I am glad we did! Getting away from the noise and hustle and bustle is so nice even in Vegas. Service doesn't get any better. Upon arrival we had a cake in our room as it was our anniversary week. All service and food was wonderful and our strip view room was spotless and cozy. You never wait in lines like other hotels for check in/out, cabs or concierge duties. We walked over to Mandalay pools twice and turned around immediately realizing there was no service, no shade, no comfortable chairs and no quiet. Although the Four Seasons pool area was crowded each day, I always found a chair. I understand they are expanding the deck so more people will be able to be poolside. There is only seating for 100 and they told us there is a wait list to have a lounge chair at the pool in high season. Although, once you have established your lounging seats expect the finest service ever...cold towels, pitchers of iced-lemon water, popsicles, fresh fruit, cucumbers for the eyes, face misting, eye glass cleaning, magazines....service, service, service but never did it once feel over the top like I was being huddled over or bothered like many other 5 star properties. These servers have it down pat! The spa and gym are fabulous and the gym and locker room come as complimentary even if you do not use the spa. It is loaded up with ammenaties and state of the art equipment. The showers are excellent. You may not use your own hoel room to shower! I had six different spa treatments and all were wonderful! Heather was a fabulous massage therapist and I wish I could remember the other therapists names, they were all good. The rooms were cozy and pristine. The Verandah restaurant was wonderful for breakfast and the server Leo deserves major praise. He remembered things you liked and desired from other visits....what a memory, what excellent service he provided! Each day was a wonderful experience. Getting to the casino is a breeze, Mandalay has a lot of play just downstairs but hop in a cab for action down the street if you desire more. Also a tram will take you right to New York New York and the MGM. It really is not out of the way to go to other hotels like previously mentioned reviews. At most hotels you would use cab service for going to other strip locations anyway, especially in 107 degree weather. It boggles my mind that people complain that this hotel is out of the way. The sushi bar in the MGM is great and the Italian restaurant in the Venician is excellent. I do not remember the names. The only restaurant we were not crazy about was Shanghai in Mandalay Bay. Service was not up to par and the food was rather blah and boring for that type of restaurant. Decor was lovely however. The Four Seasons Charlie Parker restaurant was closed for renovations, otherwise we would have tried it also. I found myself retiring early to the comfort of my Four Seasons bed and hotel room nightly while my husband played into the wee hours of the morning. There is something for everyone here. There is definitely a reason why this hotel is rated number one. I guess it really isn't a secret! We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Far from the madding crowd!”
Reviews.Author: croakies
Reviews.Content: This hotel is consistently great! The rooms are comfy with great beds and a great view straight down the Strip. The pool service and attitude is fantastic with Eric our bartender leading the drive for excellence! The hotel is on top of Mandalay Bay and there are hidden doors to get in and out of the casino area back to sanity! One word of caution...the mini bar is not rotated so order champagne from room service as the bottle we opened was past it's best and by the time we received another one the moment had gone! Or ask them to switch out the bottles when you arrive. Hmmm... note to self for next time! This is a summer trip yearly for us, I would not bother to go in the winter as the pool is what they offer!

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: Travelingwithstyle
Reviews.Content: The Best hotel I ever stayed at. Quiet and nice. Do check out private pool.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Oasis in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ottawaon
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Las Vegas is actually part of the Mandalay Hotel. It occupies the top floors of the Mandelay but has a seperate entranceway, lobby, pool area, a fantastic health club and spa, recreation area, private parking, posh restaurants and express elevators. The Four Seasons offers serenity from the ruscus of Las Vegas. If you do feel that urge to join the Vegas madness, all of Mandalay Bay resort's offerings are available to you as well. Due to the very limited number of guests, there are no lines at check-in/check-out, no waiting in line for elevators, pool side chair availabilty is not an issue, etc. The rooms are decorated in neutral colours with plush comfortable furniture and a large 40+ inch plasma TV. Bathrooms are large with marble, a separate shower and soaking tub and water closet. Overall, a fantastic experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Ever”
Reviews.Author: winetravelDallas
Reviews.Content: We were concerned when we found out the Four Seasons had no casino that the stay would be boring. We found the Four Season's service to be above all expectations starting with the greeting at the front door by the Valet. The treatment of their guests was sincere and appropriate. The hotel was quiet, yet all needs were met. Mandalay Bay is immediately next door for shopping, food, and casino wants. The Four Season's pool was wonderful. No splashing children, wonderful pool service from towels to food. The pool workers were friendly and knew our names and treated as long time friends. The Spa was the best I have ever experienced, with considerate workers and top of the line supplies. The on-site restaurant, The Veranda, had excellent breakfasts and dinners. Room service was prompt and maid service was unobserved and wonderfully done. They also provide evening turn down service that was a pleasure to return to. I would recommend Four Seasons to any traveler and plan on using their franchise again wherever I travel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Ryno98
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews leading up to our recent stay at the Four Seasons, my thought was there is no way it will live up to it all. I was wrong. The Four Seasons blew away everyplace else we have stayed in Vegas. Arrived at 1:00. People talk about the flora scent as you walk in the lobby, wow. We figured if the room was ready great, but realistically planned to leave our bags with the bell desk, go get some lunch and come back in a couple hours. (check-in time is 3:00) They apologized that the room wasn’t ready, took my cell number and off we went. They called right at 3:00 to tell us we were good to go. When we got back they apologized again for the “inconvenience” and went ahead and upgraded our room. Calling this room an upgrade is the understatement of the century. It was more like an apartment. Quite a treat, but completely unnecessary, especially when they were technically not even late. That evening we returned to our room to find a hand written note again apologizing for the inconvenience along with some chocolates. Then again at check out they apologized about our room not being ready when we checked in. We originally figured we would wander over to the MB pool complex at some point to enjoy the lazy river, wave pool, etc. But after one walkthrough over there we never strayed from the FS pool. Everything that has been said is so true. You are walked to your choice of location, shade, sun. Padded chaise. A pitcher of water with glasses is delivered immediately. There are servers around whenever you need them, but not hovering either. We had breakfast at the pool each morning and stayed until noon. At no point were there chaises unavailable for arriving guests. The thing that I kept being reminded was how the FS is a contrast to everywhere else on the strip. Never waited more than a minute or two for a cab. Other properties had cab lines that were so insane we just walked. Never waited at check-in, check-out, or at the concierge desk (which was amazing by the way). Other properties we walked through had lines dozens of people deep checking in or out at all hours of the day. The FS is quiet and peaceful and the other properties were a zoo. All that said, you literally can be in the MB casino complex as quickly as you can walk to the front desk of FS. There is an abundance of dining and gaming options. Same with the pool, if the FS pool is too tame, you walk through a gate and are at the 11 acre MB pools. The only critique of the property is its location at the very south end of the strip. We had show tickets at Palazzo and wanted to shop at the Forum shops, but a few cab rides took care of that. In no way would that deter us from staying there again. In fact, I can’t imagine staying anywhere else after staying at the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, But Room For Improvement”
Reviews.Author: incguy
Reviews.Content: First off, I agree with the good reviews here. If you are looking for a get away in the middle of the craziness that is Las Vegas, you can't do better. I strongly prefer it to the Belagio and the Wynn. Having said that, a few things reminded me that we're still in Las Vegas, where things aren't always quite as polished as they are at other Four Seasons properties. None of these things would stop me from visiting again, but hopefully putting them up here will help the hotel to focus on improvements for next time around: 1. Room service screwed up twice. Completely forgot a dish one time and took 30 minutes to bring it up (they did comp the meal). The second time they forgot the ponzu sauce that came with a sushi/sashimi style dish. Sounds minor, but when you're hungry you don't want to wait another 20 minutes for them to bring the sauce. 2. The business center charges $60/hr to use a computer with an internet connection. I didn't have my laptop and had to take care of a few things while there. I understand charging for the service so people don't abuse it, but come on...$60/hr??? The center is run by a third party AV service, but the Four Seasons shouldn't allow them to rake guests over the coals like that. 3. One particular front desk staffer, who will remain nameless, was not all that friendly, and tried to charge us for a half day rate on our last day, even though we'd been given a 4pm checkout when we originally checked in. The staffer should have checked the room notes carefully before telling us pretty coldly that she'd charged us-- when I alerted her, she easily found the notes, but it felt like she would have been happier being able to stick us with the half day. 4. We got upgraded to a "Strip View" room, so I am not complaining, but note that many of the rooms on the even side of the North wing don't really have much of a Strip view. Looking straight out the window we had an airport view. Walking up to the window and craning to the left you could see the MGM...If I'd paid extra to be in that room I would not have been happy. If strip view is important to you, ask what the view is of when they assign the room at the desk. 5. The TV's on the cardio machines in the fitness center were hit and miss. Some had too much static to watch, others had no sound on some channels. I know it's a minor detail, but the Four Seasons is supposed to be about paying attention to minor details, and this is one that should have been easy to see. 6. My in room TV didn't play sound in the PPV movie section (menu or move). Engineering came up quickly to fix it. But they could have prevented it by having houskeeping turn on the TV and listen for sound from the movie menu system before a guest checks in. On the very positive side, everything from Valet to the food to the pool service was excellent. The pool is a real standout and the manger, Haytham, from the Four Seasons in Cairo, was very kind and helpful. Everything from the roaming Evian mist to complimentary creamsicles delivered to free sunglass cleaning makes you very glad to be at a place where someone cares that much about making you happy. The spa was quiet and nice. Didn't use the services, but showers, steam, lockers and fitness center were all very good. Having said all that, the hotel was a real value for the money. I will stay again without a second thought, but I hope that the Four Seasons management reads this and addresses some of the little issues that are keeping this hotel from being at the top of the top, rather than just outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely The Best!”
Reviews.Author: Vanderneucker
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 32nd wedding anniversary with a three night stay at this hotel. We arrived, check in was flawless and we were upgraded to a king bed strip view suite. The suite was absolutely amazing. It had a sitting room and a bedroom with a stunning view of the strip from floor to ceiling windows. The master bath had a shower and a soaking tub. There were three (yes that is right) three closets to hang clothes in. There were bathrobes and slippers placed at the each side of the bed. The room was serviced twice a day with the second service being turndown. This hotel is one of the most serene, relaxing hotels that we have ever stayed in. You can "pass" through a door into Mandalay Bay and use all their facilties, but their guests cannot use yours. There is no casino, but the Mandalay Casino is right through the door. The pool is small but divine. The pool attendants place towels on your chairs and serve ice water, popsicles and spritz you with Evian water. We ate at the Verandah restaurant for lunch and Charlie Palmer's Steakhouse for our anniversary dinner. The food and service were superb. Lastly, we paid for two nights and got the third night free. This is a great place to be pampered. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of calm in a crazey city”
Reviews.Author: aboxall
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights in the Four Season. The hotel is very welcoming, quiet and comfortable and is a good choice if you want somewhere where you can take a rest from the crowds and noise of Vegas. Our room was fantastic and well furnished. The gym is well equipped and the pool area is nicely designed. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Undeniably Vegas' Best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dana4U
Reviews.Content: We have been taking our annual pilgrimage to Las Vegas for the past 12 years and have finally found the crown jewel hotel. We have stayed at almost every premium hotel up and down the strip and the level of comfort and service is unparalleled with what you receive at the Four Seasons. For example, if you hang out at the pool, you receive continuous free water, popsicles, sunglass cleanings, Evian water face mistings and timely visits by the poolside staff for your beverage orders. The pool is for exclusive use of the Four Seasons guests which means you don't have to get to the pool as soon as it opens for a chair. You can also use Mandalay Bay's wave pool or the Moorea Beach Club (topless sunbathing) if you choose, although Moorea is not free admittance. The hotel is peaceful in that there is no noise from kids running up and down the hallways at night like many of the other strip hotels. The casino and hotel lobby are reachable through three Four Seasons only elevators. On the surface, this doesn't seem like a big deal, but wait until you see the lines at Mandalay Bay or The Hotel to use an elevator. People in Mandalay's casino were complaining of a twenty minute wait just to get onto an elevator. And worse yet, an one hour line to check-in. We waited two minutes to check into the hotel and no wait to check-out. Everything in the Mandalay complex can be charged to your Four Seasons room as well (e.g. restaurants, bars, lounges, etc.). The conceirge can get you a reservation at almost any restaurant on short notice and even got us access into the Foundation Room on Saturday evening for no charge (Foundation Room is a private nightclub atop Mandalay Bay). As we told the front desk on check-out, we have now found our new home in Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Vegas has to offer”
Reviews.Author: Tuckerbob
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are not your typical Vegas fans. We don't gamble and we don't like to stay up late....but we do like the great shows Vegas has to offer. So when we had tickets to Rod Stewart this past weekend, the Four Sesaons was our only choice for a hotel. Unfortunately when we called to book they were sold out. We were put on a wait list and made a reservation at the Bellagio just in case. I was so glad when they called in time for us to cancel Bellagio and tell us they had a room for us for the weekend. Everything about the Four Sesaons is over the top great. We love it. It's a hidden Oasis and you are only an elevator ride away from the craziness of Mandalay Bay so you can get your Starbucks fix and visit the wave pool if you have kids. We can't wait to go back. The beds at the Four Seasons are the most comfortable and they are the same at any Four Seasons you visit. The service and food at the pool was perfect. They even cleaned our glasses! Don't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “"Non-Vegas" Vegas”
Reviews.Author: BrewsterCruiser
Reviews.Content: When your head is spinning from the lights and bells in the Casinos, this is an elegant and beautiful refuge.
