Our standard room was very spacious, and immaculately clean, with a large plasma TV, superbly comfortable bed, and large floor to ceiling windows overlooking TheHotel. The hotel was quiet. The pool area was beautiful, and you can dine in the open-air restaurant that overlooks the pool. We did not eat dinner at the Four Seasons, opting to instead try restaurants at the Bellagio, the Wynn, and Mandalay Bay. But the breakfast and lunches we had at the Four Seasons were excellent. After enjoying this oasis in a city of Glitz, you have the option of returning to the lights, bells, and action.

Reviews.Title: “only place to stay in vegas”
Reviews.Author: jfhbryon
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Bellagio and Wynn which I both liked, i decided to give Four Seasons a try and have option of quiet time with action nearby. What I discovered is the only place I will stay in Vegas again. The moment you turn the corner from Mandalay Bay foyer it goes quiet, with a faint floral scent that is relaxing. The service everywhere was amazing. The service was professional, but also relaxed and never stuffy. Everyone was always smiling and behaved like they were there for more than collecting a paycheck. The room is very comfortable. The separate pool is a huge bonus as it is quiet and you can relax. You have access to Mandalay Pool, and after five minutes to check it out I I could not get back to the Four Seasons Pool. When you are ready to party it is a short walk away, then you can go back to piece and quiet to recover. The General Manager is doing a great job running a great hotel. Thanks for an amazing stay.

Reviews.Title: “great one year anniversary”
Reviews.Author: ligyrl
Reviews.Content: we went for our one year anniversary. they upgraded our room from a four seasons room to a one bedroom suite. the room was exremely spacious, we didnt know what to do with all the space. the bed was so comfy. my only complaint was the shower and tub were a little small. service was amazing as usual. brought us champagne and a cake to help us celebrate. the pool was nice but small. the gym was excellent as usual. it was so quiet an serene but convenient at the same time. the view from our room was amazing. the food at the verrandah was good. we ate there for breakfast and lunch. the breakfast menu was better.

Reviews.Title: “A sanctuary in the midst of chaos”
Reviews.Author: karenr58
Reviews.Content: This is our third stay at this property and we would not go to Vegas unless we were able to stay at the Four Seasons. As soon as you walk through the front door, you forget that you are in Vegas. The entire staff is super accomodating and extremely well trained. There are no lines to contend with for check in, taxi service, etc. like at the other hotels on the strip. The spa facilities are spotless, the staff is professional and the treatments were sublime. I had the raindrop masage and a facial. I left the spa feeling like I had been on vacation for a month. It was my friend's birthday and she left with a "birthday" bag of samples and full size products from the spa staff. All dinner and show arrangements were handled prior to our arrival by the concierge. The tickets they got us for Beatles Love were first row center. The seats (and show) were fantastic. The one glitch was the Sunday breakfast buffet. Similar to an experience we had three years ago, the hot items on the buffet were room temperature. Our friend however, gave his plate to one of the waiters who promptly brought it back to the microwave and heated it for him. The food is first rate when it is hot! The pool area is slightly crowded, but you can always find a chair. The staff is always around offering to clean your sunglasses, spritz you with Evian, bring drinks/lunch and offer free creamsicles which are nice when it is 107 degrees! There are also misters around the entire pool area to help keep you cool. One negative is that you can hear the booming music from the Mandalay Bay pools, but that cannot be avoided since they are situated so closely. This was another great experience with the Four Seasons which never fails to disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded My Expectations-Awesome!!!!”
Reviews.Author: c0ast2c0ast
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a Vegas 4th of July holiday /anniversary celebration weekend. Stayed 4 nights at the Four Seasons. This was our 1st trip to Vegas, and what a fantastic trip. After reading numerous reviews about the Bellagio, Wynn, Venetian, Ceasars Palace, Mandalay Bay, and the Four Seasons...we decided to take a gamble before gambling in Vegas, and chose to stay at the Four Seasons. It was fantastic!!!! Great excitement, fun, and plenty of action, and just enough quite R & R to balance out our 4 night stay. Having access to the Mandalay casino, pools, restaurants, etc was non-eventful because everything is literally right there together and really all located within Mandalay Bay. The room was beyond awesome, and definitely offered the peace and quiet we were looking for, whenever we choose to retreat back to the room. We have already decided that our next trip to Vegas, will be complete by returning to the Four Seasons!!!

Reviews.Title: “The quietest in Vegas....”
Reviews.Author: hollyx113
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to lie. I gave this property five stars because, well, its an excellent hotel. But would I stay here again? I don't know. The truth is, The Four Seasons in Vegas is great if you are looking for a little down time. You can go spend your entire night in the casino at Mandelay Bay and then step into the FS elevator and its instantly quiet. But is that a good thing? It is Vegas, after all. It worked out well for us because I was staying with my family, that tends to be a little quieter and hates noise at night. However, if you are here for outrageous Vegas-themed suites, late night parties, etc., this place is NOT for you. Aditionally, since this place does not have a casino it is VERY expensive. You could book a much larger suite in another Vegas hotel for nearly half of the price. Then again, you would not be guaranteed this quiet. So it's really up to you when traveling in Vegas what kind of atmosphere you are looking for. By the way, pool is very nice. Pool attendants were very nice, and I was the only one in the pool. Very relaxing. Also you may want to be aware Mandaley Bay/FS is at the very beginning of the Strip, so you will have to walk (don't even try to drive/take a cab...it will take hours) a pretty decent distance to get anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel on the Vegas Strip!”
Reviews.Author: iloveloveseaotters
Reviews.Content: Last year was our first trip to Vegas and spent two days of Hell in the adjoining "THE Hotel" in Mandalay bay. We checked out and made the long trek to the Four Seasons (Note; If possible, use the private entrance on the other side instead of walking all the way through the Mandalay Bay. However, be aware that there are no sidewalks around the entry way). I'll be completely honest in saying this: Walking into the Four Seasons was like walking into paradise. The quiet, the beautiful ambiance, the smells. There are no casinos, people greet you at the front door and they quickly learn your name. If you have to stand in line at the front desk, the service is quick and efficient. Being that Vegas is hot, there is always bottled water available. Sometimes the doormen/valet will give you some after they bring your car to you, or call you a cab. Talk about service! The hotel set up is a little strange; The lobby and so forth are on the ground level, and there is another level that will take you to the door that leads to the Mandalay Bay Casino (for those who want to have easy access). The room floors don't start until floor 38 or so, and the main floor elevators have a side door that leads to the Four Seasons private pool. Inside, is just gorgeous; marble hallways, subtle beige tones; it's like walking into a mansion. Rooms are large and comfortable and my favorite part about staying at the Four Seasons is that they have Turner Classic Movies! Hopefully if you are a classic movie fan (who finds this info useful!), they will still offer this station! The bathrooms aren't huge, but they are spacious, with tubs, a fairly good-sized shower, robes, a vanity section with a magnifying mirror and double doors to the bathroom for total privacy; as well as a separate commode area. The last time we stayed here, we were given (without asking) a room with an incredible view of the strip. Just amazing. I could have stared out the window for hours! The pool is wonderful and I have learned from other reviews that there are special amenities available, which I will definitely inquire about. The nice thing is that the employees will find you some chairs, drape the towels over them for you, and generally give you whatever you need. The only thing I don't like about the pool is that (like Mandalay Bay), it closes at 7pm. However, the spa is open until 9pm and it deserves it's own paragraph! The spa use at the Four Seasons is FREE (except for of course, treatments and massages, etc), if you can believe it. Something Free in Vegas! Last time we took advantage of it after a long day sightseeing at Hoover Dam. The pool had already closed, but we took a change of clothes and went down to the spa where we took showers in the huge individual shower rooms. The showers have amenities like shampoo, soap, conditioner, you can get razors, feminine products, q-tips, cotton balls, moisturizer... almost anything you can think of. It's here. There is an area that has vanity mirrors where you can sit down (in the plush robe that you get when you ask for a locker key-even slippers and a towel!), and they have hair dryers, hair gel, etc. There is even a couples lounge which is wonderful for husbands and wives. Just ask the attendant to show you the way. Once inside, the lights are already dim (to the point that I could have slept for days in there), and very soft music plays in the background. There are magazines available to read, and I must mention the steam room with its eucalyptus steam. Absolutely heavenly! This is the ONLY place I will stay when I am visiting the Las Vegas area and plan on spending time on the strip. Need I say more? It's SO worth the splurge! I should also add: This year, our staying here was contingent on whether or not we would return to Vegas and I think it will continue to be that way.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nancygamez
Reviews.Content: First time to Las Vegas and I will be coming back to this hotel. I noticed that at the Four Seasons you didn't have thousands of people not staying there just walking through like at all the other hotels. This hotel was private, clean, friendly service, great food and an awesome pool. Valet took a few minutes to get your car but we didn't mind. No casinos in this hotel which is just great! Overall, perfect 10!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible”
Reviews.Author: aliii
Reviews.Content: My husband and young 5 year old stayed at this hotel for a week in June. The service was fantastic, from complimentary smoothies and popsicle at the pool to a special welcome plate of treats for my son. Even the lady filling the bar noticed that we often ate the potatoe chips and she asked if we would like any different flavors. The private pool at the four seasons is so quiet. If you want more excitment you can always stroll over to the pools at Mandalay Bay. One of the best four seasons I have ever stayed at, we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: AndrewR2
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Venetian before, and believe me, if the Venetian is 5 star, the Four Seasons is a 6 star hotel. Service is outstanding, it's quiet and comfortable, there is no smoky casino you have to walk through to get to your room (although the action at Mandalay Bay casino is just seconds away through a special door). All employees were extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms are all located on the top floors of the Mandalay Bay, so views are interesting no matter if you get Strip view or not.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Two_Way_Yo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are in our early thirties and made our tenth trip to Las Vegas. For reference, we have previously stayed at Caesars Palace (three times), THEhotel at Mandalay Bay, Bally’s, Mirage, the Rio, and MGM Signature. Instead of the play by play, this time I’ll just hit the highlights. We stayed at the Four Seasons from June 10-13. Four Seasons: My wife was looking for a great pool, I was looking for gambling. With the Four Seasons we got both. You get the use of all the Mandalay Bay facilities, with the exclusive use of 4S’s. We have stayed at other 4S properties and hoped that the service would be as good in a city known for great service...it was even above par for a 4S standards. Room: We had a regular room reserved but I accepted the offer to upgrade to a strip view suite for an extra $100 per night. The suite was really impressive, with two sitting areas, marble entry, and a walk-in closet that is bigger than our closet at home. The room also has a coffee maker, which was nice for first thing in the morning. Some of the reviews mentioned that the room was looking dated and not up to the 4S standards but ours was not. It had a very nice ~50” plasma and the furniture and linens were in new condition. When we were called to be notified that the room was ready, by the time we got up to the room, our bags were already delivered. Nice touch. The view. It was on the 37th floor, windows ran the entire width of the room, and faced directly north up the strip. Best view I have ever had in Vegas, and I’m usually one of those people that says view doesn’t matter. Pool & Fitness Center/Spa: This part of the hotel was very important to my wife but we both ended up using it a lot. First, the fitness center amenities are complementary. The biggest deal about this was that I got to use the eucalyptus steam-room before hitting the pool. I never used one of these before but it did wonders on my hangovers. The pool staff were every bit as attentive as the rest of the hotel. Even though the pool is not as big as the MB or other strip hotels, the pool covers, ice water pitchers, popsicles, frozen fruit, and evian spritzers made up the difference. All of these were free but the normal pool bar and food menu was available. We ended up having breakfast each morning at the pool. Other things about the hotel: The valet is not free at this property ($18/day) but we knew about this going in. It was very quick and we always had cold bottled water when we retrieved our car.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WAN25
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Four Seasons for a business meeting in May, 2008. Really interesting in that it is actually the top floors of the Mandalay Bay, but with its own lobby, elevators, hallways, meeting rooms, pool, etc. This gives it a peace and quiet not seen in the Mandalay Bay or other Vegas hotels I have experienced. There is no gambling in the Four Seasons itself, but Mandalay Bay's huge casino is steps away. Again, contributes to peace, quiet and elegance. Room was very nice, bathroom was great, service and food were excellent. Would definitely stay here again! One comment- the property is at the very end of the strip, so if you mind being away from the heart of the action, may not be ideal for you. Didn't bother me a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: mpl3
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Four Seasons for 3 nights over Memorial Day weekend. While Vegas was totally overcrouded and packed with people as usual it was a pleasure to stay at a hotel with such outstanding service. The hotel is expensive but having stayed at many other hotels in Vegas well worth it. The concerege, pool staff, spa staff, waiters etc were all outstanding. In a city that can nickel and dime you to death with added costs the Four Seasons offers many extras at no charge. Simple things like printing a boarding pass or use of the fitness center that others will charge you for the Four Seasons will not. Do not stay anywhere else....

Reviews.Title: “Great time with 8 year old daughter”
Reviews.Author: ocattorney
Reviews.Content: My 8 year old daughter and I stayed at the Four Seasons for the weekend of May 16 - 18. We had a wonderful time. Vegas is not a place for children, but when we had relatives going to Vegas to visit other relatives that live in Vegas, I decided to go. Our stay was great. The hotel is an oasis amongst the hustle and bustle of casinos. The room was nice, nothing real special, but had all the amenities of a 5 star hotel. We ate breakfast at Veranda and hung out at the pool most of the day. Service at the pool was excellent. We went over to the Mandalay Bay pool to check out the lazy river and had fun doing that. I felt somewhat out of place there because of the party atmosphere. As the day got longer, the lazy river filled up with cocktail in-hand people so we retreated to the 4 Seasons. I would recommend this hotel to families and anyone looking for a “non vegas” vegas trip.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Private Hotel”
Reviews.Author: coastalrides
Reviews.Content: This hotel was cool, relaxing and elegant, the service was brilliant, exactly what we expected from the Four Seasons, the staff were helpful and polite. My husbant tipped the man who got our car for us and amongst the 1 dollar bills there was a hundred dollar bill, the guy called him back to tell him he had made a mistake. This was not a gaming hotel which made it very relaxing, it was not lie the other hotels that were more like cattle markets. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. Top quality, top service, peaceful, relaxing etc etc

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MassTravelers
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th visit to Las Vegas but our first stay at Four Seasons(3 nights). My wife and I absouletly loved this hotel. It is close yet so far from the hub bub of Mandalay Bay. We were celebrating our 20th anniversary and upon returning to our room we found a "Happy Anniversary" cake in our room. What a pleasant surprise. The entire hotel staff was pleasant and attentive. We had a premier strip view room with a spectacular view of the entire strip. Room was a good size and VERY clean with NO hotel type odors. We would definately stay here again! We have stayed at Bellagio and Signature but Four Seasons has them beat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifull retreat from chaos”
Reviews.Author: ibelvis
Reviews.Content: Service is what separates this property from all others in Las Vegas. Valet, front desk, spa, pool... every staff member is happy and makes your needs a priority. Enjoyed coming back to my room after a long night to find everything cleaned, lights dimmed, soft music and slippers/ TV remote at bedside.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel NEVER dissapoints”
Reviews.Author: esposch
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned to our favorite LV hotel and, like always, it was fantastic. We chose this hotel because of the great spa facilities, proximity to the strip, and most of all, the best pool experience we have have found on the Strip. We arrived pretty early in the day and, of course, our room was ready. Check in was quick and simple. Bags promptly arrived. The room decor and technology was upgraded since our last stay and now includes HS internet and a large flat screen TV. Carpeting was also new. The staff throughout the entire hotel was friendly and most of all, very helpful. The staff around the pool is great. You never have to ask nor wait for drinks or food. Nice selection of items from the menu are delivered right to your lounge chair along with Evian sprays, cucumber slices, and smoothies. The pool scene is very quiet (unlike the mayhem at Mandalay) which is why there is a locked gate separating the properties. My wife raved about her spa treatments. Housekeeping was always prompt and never bothered us nor did the nightly turndown service. We felt very pampered for our five day stay and would highly recommend this property. We'll be back in October.

Reviews.Title: “Serenity in Sin City”
Reviews.Author: t40sr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from a 3 night stay at the four seasons for our anniversary. This hotel more than met our expectations. We did not want to enter the hustle and bustle of a casino. At this hotel you arrive at a seperate entrance. Check in was quick and efficient and we were upgraded to a room with a view of the strip. The hotel is on the top 5 floors of the Mandalay Bay Hotel. The room was lovely. The service was everything that you would expect from a four seasons. You would never guess that you were in Las Vegas. We were never bothered by any noisy guests. If you wanted to go to a casino all you had to do was get off at the "C" level on the elevator and go through a door. A nice touch was when you returned by this door to the serenity of the hotel you were greated by a lovely scented entrance. The pool was wonderful and the excercise facilities were some of the best that we have ever seen. We didn't go to any shows. Instead we dined each night at a different restaurant, Guy Savoy, Picasso and Nine. I will return to this hotel and recommend it. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Did not want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: kguerra
Reviews.Content: Had the most perfect stay at the Four Seasons. The hotel is beautiful and quiet. It's a nice diversion from the loud noises of the Vegas casinos. The rooms are tastefully decorated and we had THE view of the Las Vegas strip. It was truly amazing. The pool is lovely and the service is spectacular, as is the service throughout the hotel. There will be no other hotel for me to stay in Vegas other than the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but net”
Reviews.Author: livingthegoodliezzz
Reviews.Content: Nothing but net, Perfect in every way. I have stayed at all major hotels in vegas and will never stay anywhere else, again. Service , service,service, its all here. We had waited for a cab and after 5 min the Vallet said that was long enough and Took us to our dinner reservations in the hotel Escalde. The pool is great. Just see for yourself. Ps, Craft Steak house in the Mgm Is the worst experience and food I have ever had. The butter was frozen the waiter was rude and they stuck us in the back with some kind of fold out door you see that divide room at conventions. Go the the four seasons and stay away from craft Steakhouse...... No worries

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Las Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cheetah72
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Hotel in Las Vegas is a quiet retreat. If this is what you are looking for then this is your place. If you are looking for a little more excitement then stay more in the heart of the strip. The Four Seasons does not have a casino but is connected to the Mandalay Bay Resort, so you can have the best of both worlds. It was nice to enjoy the Mandalay Bay pools and then when they got crowded retreat to the peace and quiet and attentive service at the Four Seasons. My husband and I spent four nights at the Four Seasons in April. We had great weather and took advantage of the pool all four days. The service at the pool was good, but the least consistent with other Four Seasons that we have stayed at. Most of the staff was extremely attentive and always called you by name, others were not as good. The front desk and the bellmen were excellent. The concierge did a great job getting us dinner reservations and transportation. Even when we had a problem with are final bill the front desk handled it very well. The rooms were clean and well kept, the amenities very nice. If you are looking to escape the craziness of Las Vegas, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “royal treatment at 4 seasons”
Reviews.Author: kbearmuga
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable service! First time I ever felt treated really really well by a hotel in Vegas. Usually 2 people open the front door, allowing you to sweeeeep into the lobby theatrically if necessary. Room was very pleasant, would request view of pool in future. Also would request closer to elevator if possible - this is, like everything in Vegas, a huge hotel. Room service was exactly on time each meal we chose. Bed, bathroom, toilet, etc. all abo ve average. Free coffee and paper in a.m. in lobby. Spa was a great place also - steam room, relaxation area, very small and private. Absolutely the best feature was the service but the pool was a close second. Offers such privacy and seclusion! The attendants put a sheet & towel on your chosen chair, spritz you with cool water, bring around frozen/wet washcloths, and you can actually get lunch/breakfast served to you on a tray on your lap. Fantastic luxury. Also nice was the hotel car to take you out when it was available. Each staff member made us feel like it was important to them that we be totally happy, cossetted. It seemed so natural. Wouldn't stay anywhere else in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “I love it!”
Reviews.Author: NoelleVancouver
Reviews.Content: Can I just say how much I love this hotel!!! We have stayed here numerous times and have always found it to be exceptional. I just love the entrance (without all the smoky casinos to walk through), so peaceful and beautiful. The rooms are great, the treats for the kids are sooo loved. The service has been faultless and when there have been small issues, they are so quick to solve the problem and are happy to help in every way. The pool is great, it can be crowded but there is always room. It can be hot, but there are places with the sprayers or shade. The treats around the pool are always lovely and the food and service is so well done. There are staff there that recognize us by name upon our return even though it has been over a year since we were there! Love going to the Mandalay Bay for dinner/shopping/wave pool ect but we always breathe a relaxing sigh as we re-enter four seasons. It is a real getaway from the hustle of Vegas, which for us is fun in appropriate doses! We will be back again soon!

Reviews.Title: “A nice retreat from the strip”
Reviews.Author: CK1025
Reviews.Content: We just returned from three nights at the Four Seasons in Las Vegas. Overall, we are so glad we picked this hotel over the other hotels on the strip. Pros: *Our room was ridiculously quiet, although we were not facing the airport. It was like retreating to the comfort of your home after a chaotic day. *Beautiful view of the entire strip. *Extremely comfortable bedding. *Fastest check-in/check-out we've ever experienced. *Friendly, competent staff. Cons: *We thought the food was at both restaurants was pretty substandard. *There is only a gift shop. It would have been nice if there was one or two boutiques/shops in the hotel. *The odd design...I wish this was a stand alone hotel instead of the top floors of another hotel. It made things feel a little disjointed to me. *It was clear that some rooms directly overlooked the airport. Ours did not but could of. That would not have been ideal. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to those who do not want to be directly in the middle of the action. You will be close enough to immerse yourself in it if you want to but far away enough to feel as though you are retreating back to your room for some tranquility.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but noisy”
Reviews.Author: kidsmurf2000
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel, if you don't get a noisy room; some rooms face the airport and get a huge amount of noise. The walls are thin, and you mostly likely will get woken up by noisy gamblers on their way back to the room. However, the rooms are clean, good service, and an amazing pool. The restaurants were disappointing, but had good wine lists.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis”
Reviews.Author: passionforadventure
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Four Seasons Las Vegas for three nights in July to celebrate my 24th birthday. What an oasis! We loved the Four Seasons because we could enjoy all that Las Vegas has to offer and then return to tranquility at the end of the day. The staff were genuine, the pool was beautiful, and we never had to wait for a taxi. I loved the fact that you don't have to walk through a smokey, loud casino to get to your room! Instead, the Four Seasons is adjacent to Mandalay Bay, and we could access the casino from a hallway in the Four Seasons. The highlight of the weekend? THE SPA!! I had a hot stone massage which was AMAZING. I also loved the showers/relaxing locker area. My husband even sent an attendant to come find me; I didn't want to leave! My only "negative" is that our room was at the end of the hallway near a loud air conditioning vent, and while we had a pretty view of the desert, I would recommend a strip view. All in all I would return in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: kengoeswest
Reviews.Content: Does exactly what it says on the tin! excellent service, brilliant facilities, creme de la creme and approved by the missus as well!

Reviews.Title: “The best of the US Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: HulagirlNyny
Reviews.Content: This hotel has now taken my perfect Four Seasons Beverly Hills and tossed its first place rating...this crew..the food is beyond divine. The spa employees bend over backwards to help you get appointments at other places if they are booked...the waitstaff gets the food there on time and the food was perfect...not fussy NY or Paris Four Seasons perfect..but clean and somewhat updated food. The front desk crew is superb. I cannot say enough about this staff...the only downside to us is that the pool gets a bit crowded but so what? We are 40 and a wee bit crabby with the 20 something crew...which is not an issue here really. The other issue that cannot be changed is how far you have to walk to your room if you are at the end...not fun for the girls in heels or when you are so tired after a long night...

Reviews.Title: “Sinfully Great in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: laabis
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons has done it again. I continue to marvel at the class, charm and service orientation of the Four Seasons. The FS Las Vegas is no exception. We experienced the typical greeting with an army of men coming to grab our bags. People greeting us by name, fast checkin and the best was yet to come. When we arrived in our junior suite on the 39th floor, we were floored by the elegance and size of the suite. It was one of the largest suites I have ever had. The decor couldn't have been more elegant and the views so high up were stunning. The honey color of the wood, the intricate marble floors, the artful floral presentations everywhere present, made it a special experience every time I entered the public areas. Our suite had two large bathrooms and, of course, every imaginable modern convenience. While I love other chains like the Ritz Carlton, nothing compares to the Four Seasons. The location in Las Vegas is perfect. It is still on the strip, but a short distance out of the maniacal activity of strip central. The spa was one of the best anywhere. Great weight set and loads of alternative aerobic machines. Again, FS takes this to a new level with all manner of refreshing drinks, towels, tvs on each machine, etc. You can't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: drc1017
Reviews.Content: I was in Vegas on business for 4 days/3 nights and had the pleasure of staying at the Four Seasons. Overall, what a treat! I was on the 39th (top) floor and was at the very end of a very long corridor, providing me the best view I have ever had of the strip, and I have been going to Vegas yearly for 15+ years. Amazing view!!! I was actually rather ill most of the trip unfortunately so I really did not get to use any of the amenities of the hotel. But not feeling well did allow me to spend a lot of time in my room and it was very spacious and comfortable, with lots of details like crown moldings, tray ceiling in bathroom, etc. The TV is HUGE (I just wish it rotated so I could have watched it while I was working ata the desk. The TV actually would not work when I first got there and they had to send an engineer up, but he fixed it very quickly and it was OK the rest of the trip. They have some system called NXTV which is some sort of interactive thing, I was not impressed with it and I think it made the TV act up a little. The first night, one of the sheets was stained (I have no doubt it was clean and washed, but it had a permanent stain on it), which I have to say I was shocked by at a hotel of this caliber. Why would you not throw a sheet like this out? Since I was alone and the bed was a king, I simply slept on the other side where I saw nothing of the sort! Housekeeping even unplugged and wound up my cell phone charger, which I accidentally left plugged in after night 1. The bathroom was beautiful! All marble and tons of lights, which I never really noticed at other hotels, but the lighting in the bathroom was excellent. Great shower, the shower head was like a downpour, I loved it. I actually heard from coworkers that the "regular" Mandalay Bay hotel rooms had a TV in the bathroom, that would be a nice touch for the Four Seasons perhaps as well. The staff was all exceedingly friendly and helpful and always greeted me every morning if I was passing them in the hall. I thought that was a nice touch although I do not need to be treated that special, haha. My only regret is not getting to use any of the other amenities as they looked great. They even do turn down service but I did not have them do it for me as I was already in my room for the evening at the times they tried to come. If you don't like this service, just hang your Do Not Disturb sign and they will leave you alone. Besides the stained sheet, a great hotel stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: everton_1978
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a work function for a weekend in August. The staff were friendly, the rooms were great (HUGE televisions!) and the beds were comfortable. The bathroom was luxurious marble affair. It was ridiculously expensive by Vegas standards, but then as it was business it didn't affect me!

Reviews.Title: “Posh”
Reviews.Author: jjlasne
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons hotel in Las Vegas occupies the last four floors of the Mandalay Bay hotel building. It is very posh, service is excellent but the location... Well, it is at the end of the Strip so most rooms have a view of the airport. Now, the windows are double paned so you cannot hear anything really and I don' t mind looking at airplanes or helicopters taking off or landing but for some folks, that might not be posh enough. Rooms are great, with a huge bathroom, with tub, shower stall, two bathrobes and two pairs of slippers. I recommend it for someone who wants posh and does not mind to be at the end of the Strip. Otherwise, if you want to walk to nearer casinos, choose something in the middle like the Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Warning - They Will Take Your Pets!”
Reviews.Author: GwenneC
Reviews.Content: Even though this hotel claims to be pet friendly, do not bring your pets. This was the third time I stayed at the Four Seasons, Las Vegas with my 2 small, 10 pound dogs. The first 2 were exceptional, no complaints. My husband and I went to celebrate our anniversary and brought our 2 dogs with us again. We travel with them everywhere and they are basically our kids. Everything was fine until the last night, we went out to a nice dinner at the Wynn and when we returned, 2 1/2 hours later at around 8:30pm, our dogs were missing from our room. They had been kept in a crate and the crate and dogs were missing! There was also a small piece of dog feces on the floor. I started to panic and my husband immediately called the front desk asking where our dogs were. They said they had been removed b/c they were making noise. I have stayed at many fine hotels and have never had my dogs removed. We asked the manager to deliver the dogs immediately; she came about 20 minutes later with our freaked out little dogs. She was completely incompetent and overly arrogant. She tried to tell us that we were hiding the dogs and that no one knew we had them in the first place. That was completely a lie since when we checked in, we had them with us on leases and the woman at the front desk who greeted us and gave us our room key, pet the dogs. We also had walked them several times through the lobby during the previous 4 days of our stay. The manager never apologized and told us that someone had complained, which was completely false, since they were asleep in the room and the only time they would bark would be when the maids wanted to clean the room. We had left instructions that we did not want the room cleaned while we were away since it disturbed the dogs, but they apparently really wanted to get into our room. We were appalled that they left dog feces in the room as well and never cleaned it up. It was a truly horrible experience and ruined our entire anniversary. We spoke to the manager after checking out the next day, he was a young kid in his 20's and he was as useless as the night manager. I have never been treated so poorly at such a supposed "luxury" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Service lacking”
Reviews.Author: Daoda2
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed at the hotel and it's the only place I would stay in Vegas. That said, I found the service below par this time. The concierge was not knowledgeable about where to pick up the Deuce bus (a pretty basic question), FedEx packages weren't delivered promptly, requests weren't followed through, etc. At this caliber of hotel, it's the service that distinguishes a property and I felt it was lacking here. The hotel, itself, though, is a treat, despite the long walk from the entrance to the elevators. Top notch beddings, bathroom, etc., as you would expect from Four Seasons. A tip: You can park in the convention center parking lot for free. No need to pay the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “no romance allowed”
Reviews.Author: f360Spyder
Reviews.Content: Went there for the weekend of the 28th of Dec got a strip view room for 800 a night for my girlfriends birthday. Unlike any of my other stays at 4 seasons including this one as well at the Aviara, the Beverly Wilshire and Santa Barbara facilities they never even asked if it was a special occasion. The room was ok but sub par for the price but had a strip view. Room service was prompt and the food was good. Here is where it got ugly. Coming back to the Hotel at about 3 a.m. I picked a rose out of the lobby arrangement at which time a young man in his early twenties runs up and say you can’t do that “Man” . I asked to speak to the manager and he claimed he was the night manager. At this point the young man tells me that I have to pay 200 hundred for the flower arrangement since I took one out to which I agreed. Then he summons security and forcefully asks me for my signature for the flowers. Meanwhile the security is harassing my girlfriend for smoking while entering the lobby. After arguing in the lobby for nearly 2 hours this turned out to be the worst stay of my life in any hotel let alone a 4 Seasons property. I asked for Manager to call me when he came in the next day but to no avail. My experience in this hotel was certainly not in accord to what I expected based on the pitch “29 countries One Philosophy” and would certainly not suggest for a romantic getaway at this hotel. Both the Wynn as well as the Skylofts are superior choices while in Vegas. the funniest part was upon checkout when the lady asks my how my stay was and then when I expressed my displeasure she literally had no response.

Reviews.Title: “Top-notch!”
Reviews.Author: bstro202
Reviews.Content: WOW, that's all I have to say! I was in town when the NBA all star game was there and the airport had 6+ hour delay including traffic jam to get to the airport itself. The hotel heard that I had a flight leaving in 3 hours and gave me a complimentary limo ride to a "VIP" part of the airport that only high-rollers and celebrities usually get to use. Bottom line, I made my flight! Unbelievable service and that's only the beginning. Stay here if you can afford it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a single fault”
Reviews.Author: JPax
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Four Seasons in Las Vegas. What I liked the most: Extraordinary spa with some of the best therapists anywhere. The hotel is an oasisi of calm in Las Vegas. The service and quality of rooms is top notch. What I disliked: I had to move to the Embassy Suites for a meeting. I felt like Cinderella. This is the best hotel in Las Vegas and one of the top hotels in the USA.

Reviews.Title: “an oasis in the desert, esp. if you're not into gambling”
Reviews.Author: ny traveler 02
Reviews.Content: my family and i (with a 2 year old!) stayed at the four seasons in las vegas over thanksgiving weekend. generally, i agree with most of the reviews of the hotel, but wanted to highlight the following: 1. the service is truly superior, esp. for las vegas. very consistent with four seasons globally. no request was too small, and everyone, from the front desk to the concierge to bellmen to car drivers to the restaurant staff, was friendly and efficient. 2. we loved the intimate setting. you will NOT feel like cattle (like you do at most large casino resorts in vegas / restaurants / the airport, spas etc.) 3. we loved the fact there was no casino (none of us are major gamblers). no smoke-filled lobbies, clanging slot machines, etc. however, access to mandalay bay's casino is fast and easy through the four seasons elevators. 4. the hotel is incredibly kid friendly, and caters to them. our 2 year old had a great time, and the staff was very kind to him. milk & cookies on arrival, little stuffed animal gifts, great patience in the restaurant, really good kids menus, etc. 5. the spa was first rate, and not too crowded. the waiting area had about 10 seats, compared to more than 50 women in robes and slippers waiting around at canyon ranch at the venetian (where we stayed last time). 6. the verandah was probably one of the best four seasons hotel restaurants we've ever encountered (and we've been to a lot of them!) truly great food (not haute cuisine, but just simple, well executed dishes) and fine service. the sunday brunch was memorable (they actually make small portions of everything so you can sample!) this is NOT the hotel you want if you're looking to party / shop / gamble in the heart of the strip (i'd stay at the venetian or bellagio for that). cab rides there were about $15 each way and a pain in the neck. but for us, the four seasons was as close to perfect as possible in las vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Very luxury!!”
Reviews.Author: Pluttan
Reviews.Content: Four season is excellent!!! Our luxury strip view deluxe room was surperb. The view is absolute wounderful at the evening. The cleanears cleans the room many times a day...perfect! And the stuff is very service minded but they except much tip.... The breakfast....was the best breakfast ever but a little bit to expensive for us. This hotel is perfect but for us a 4 star hotel had been enough. Four season is to luxury for us. But for a few nights it´s lovely...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, consistent with other FS experiences”
Reviews.Author: anna78
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at the Four Seasons in Las Vegas. I stayed here for 3 nights for business. I'm not a gambler and dont really enjoy having to walk through a casino floor to get to my room. So I really liked the fact that although the Four Seasons is located in the Mandalay, there's a separate entrance. I also liked the private pool and though the lunch at Veranda restaurant was very good. Aside from that this FS was consistent in service and experience to other FS properties I've stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit of heaven in the middle of Sin City”
Reviews.Author: kujhawk
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Four Seasons in Vegas for a trade show. I wish it wasn't so pricey so I could stay there when I'm paying the tab...but then I guess it wouldn't be the Four Seasons for long. Check-in was flawless. A nice touch is when the doorman asks your name and then says welcome back...are they primed to do this each day for returning guests? The front desk was helpful as always...even accommodated me with a room change so I could be close to the elevator...had stomach surgery the day before this trip and didn't feel like walking down those long halls. I had a view of the LV airport which was just fine. I booked their cheapest rate, I didn't expect a strip view. Due to my surgery-induced laziness, I ordered room service for dinner both nights. The first night was uber-prompt...the 2nd night was not. I had to call down and check on my food. I was told it would be here in five minutes. Ten minutes later the room service manager called and said my food was sent to the wrong room and would be brought up right away. Ten more minutes and I received another call that the food was cold when it was brought to my door so they were re-cooking it...and there'd be no charges for dinner...and they included a couple Coronas and some ice cream. You definitely don't feel like you're in Vegas at this joint. Especially when it comes time to catch a cab. Most Vegas strip hotels have cabs lined up waiting to go...the Four Seasons rarely had a cab line which meant you had a 10 minute wait or so...but with free cold water bottles. The Four Seasons just knows how to do it. First class all the way.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding in every respect”
Reviews.Author: BKKandKSK
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a blissful stay at the LV Four Seasons. We know the hotel well as we were married there 6 years ago and decided to return for an Anniversary visit. The staff exceeded our every expectation. The stay began with what could have been a bit of a bump, but it was smoothed out so nicely that it actually made the trip even more delightful. We had anticipated an early arrival and had ade arrangements for an early check in. We arrived only to find that one room wasn't vacated, blah, blah, blah...The helpful desk clerk assured me that he would take care of it and took a cell number. Less than 30 minutes later, he called and offered me a suite for my trouble. While I have never had a bad Four Seasons experience, this took the cake...the room was absolutely stunning. Lovely views, spacious, well kept--in short, exactly what expected from this wonderful chain. Not only did the desk person take care of this, he made arrangements for a cake to be sent up while we were at dinner. What a lovely surprise. We had two wonderful breakfasts at the hotel--the Veranda--and were delighted. I could have stayed the entire day, just drinking yummy coffee and reading. The valet staff were top notch--car always ready when we called down and always had water waiting for us. If given a choice, I don't think that I will ever stay in another hotel in any city, and will certainly NEVER stay in any other hotel in Vegas. Thanks Four Seasons!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - service outstanding.”
Reviews.Author: SLWATKINS
Reviews.Content: We arrived on July 22 from the UK with Virign flying prem econ. the flight was very good and the terminal in vegas was very swift. Arrived at hotel at approx 3pm, room we had booked was superior non strip view. Room was not ready so they upgraded us after about 10 minutes to next category. Whilst checking in comp bottled water was offered, Escourted to lift then made way to room , room was a good size , lots of space and good wardrobe space, bathroom was a good size, bags arrived very quickly, and gadgets in room explained by porter . Room has fresh coffee and tea (comp ) as well as free bottled water, good bathroom products. Turn down was very good our stay was over two trips and was in total 8 days. Moderate rooms look over the airstrip and are def of the airport , floor to ceiling windows. Return visit was strip view and absoutely excellent but would book non strip room as well as view was different . Outstanding service from conceirge and pool guys and verdannah resturant. Always had great tables in resturants booked outside of hotel by conceirge. Would only ever stay at this hotel in vegas. a great hotel in vegas , forget the non casino thing, the fact that there are only 400 rooms gives you great service, comp water (anytime) great personal service, and the casino is by a private door into mandaly bay, and no wait for cabs or check in lines.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: M0ED
Reviews.Content: The best hotel stay ever, great pool. Stayed in the prem. Strip view room, worth every penny! Best service I have had in my life. Stayed with my husband a couple years age, going back with my husband, brother and sister-in-law.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: Lakeshore18
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a short 4 day stay in Las Vegas where we stayed at the Four Seasons. It was a wonderful experience. The entire stay was calm and serene. Our check-in was smooth and everyone we can into contact with was extremely pleasant and helpful. Housekeeping was phenominal; I never saw a piece of paper on the floor and there was always someone cleaning something somewhere. I became ill the first night we were there and was comtemplating going to a hospital. My husband went to the front desk to speak to someone and within 5 minutes there were 2 security guards and the night manager at my door. Luckily my problem resolved and I didn't have to go to the hospital. The next day I received a note from the Assistant Manager inquiring about my health along with a plate of pears, chocolate covered strawberries and a large bottle of "Four Seasons" bottled water! The night manager also left a message on our voicemail inquiring about my condition and offered her assistance whenever we needed it. This was a really nice touch! Also nice was the ice cold water bottles placed in your car when it was retrieved from the valet. We were just a 2 minute walk to the Mandalay Bay shops, restaruants and casino. The only downside was this hotel is at the end of the strip, so it was necessary to take the tram from the Mandalay Bay to the Excalibur and then walk across the pedestrian bridge to the MGM to get the monorail ($5 per ride) if you wanted to get to the center of the strip. We gladly did this though and returned to the relative calm of the Four Seasons once we had our fill of the hustle and bustle of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “a class by itself.”
Reviews.Author: pprahlad
Reviews.Content: I have to agree wholeheatedly with the last 2 reviews from early Sept.Hotel staff call you by name after a day! Express elavator to the 35th to the 39th floor.never had to wait for more than a minute. After 2 visits to the evening bar ,it was ,"the usual Dr Prahlad??" from the bartender,I"ve never had that in a long time.!! And the final touch was ice cubes made of frozen ice tea in the iced tea ,so it does'nt get watered down. Got a great rate from [---] call for specific questions only.

Reviews.Title: “Does not get better”
Reviews.Author: arnit47
Reviews.Content: Quiet, refined, relaxing, first class. You can find better rooms. You can find better bars. You can find better pools. However, you can not find a better combination of all amenities presented with an unpretentious, customer focused and believe it or not in Vegas, nice, friendly staff. Rude is not acceptable on this property. Staff shows real concern for your satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “World Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SueLondonUK
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on comments from Trip Advisor and it was perfect and just as people described. This was part of a round trip in the US and we had no desire to go to Las Vegas but realised it was a good base from which to see the Grand Canyon. My husband and I travelled with our two sons Age 12 and 10 and they loved Vegas. The Four Seasons has the top four floors of the Mandalay Bay hotel, and as a result is very quiet, there is no gambling at the hotel ( which means it is a haven of tranquility ) but has the advantage of having access to the facillities of the Mandalay Bay Hotel - notably the huge swimming pool with the wave machine and Lazy Man's river which the boys adored. The service was excellent from the moment you walked in the door - with water on arrival to counter the 115 degree heat. We were a little early to check in but they let us have one room immediately and phoned us a soon as the other room was ready. The children's bathroom had alphabetical sponges in each of their names, laid out in their bathroom, and on returning to their room in the evenings they were provided with Coca Cola and Popcorn - not quite what you wanted them to have a bed time but a nice touch nevertheless. The concierges were incredible and had every possible information at their finger tips and were able to book shows instantly - I would say the best concierge we have ever experienced. We were only there 2 nights but saw two shows and visited the Grand Canyon by helicpopter ( 30mins drive away for pick up ). Overall it was a great stay with the Four Season making everything perfect in Las Vegas. ( We did not go for the gambling... )

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay”
Reviews.Author: Mike_the_traveller
Reviews.Content: Let me start of by saying that I've stayed at the MGM, Mirage, Wynn, and Ritz Carlton Vegas. I've read many reviews regarding the FS Vegas location and agree on most comments. Room: The rooms are bland (if not borderline dull and a little outdated). We had a premier strip view delux room. Only 1 sink in the bathroom with separate toliet closet, and nice shower. The room was large with a 46 inch flat screen lcd television. But the furnishing was outdated and the bed wasn't all that comfortable at all. I rate the room B+ Room Service: I called down for espresso shot and cappuccino and the room service attendant was rude. He implied that the wait would be long because they were backed up. And said something along the lines of "if you really want coffee, it'll take 25-40 minute". I asked regarding if they had pasteries with my coffee and what kind and he said "yes but we don't really have time". This kind of answer is horrible. I rate this a F Location: Although most people like the fact that it is not a casino resort, that was really one of the turn offs for us. You come all the way to Vegas and then you want to be in a non-casino destination? Well, perhaps you should go somewhere else then. We've stayed at the Ritz Carlton Lake Las Vegas resort and it beats this resort hands down as far as "non casino" resort and the tranquility of it. This resort is not kid friendly either. There is no kiddy pool or services catering kids. I rate the pool -- B Price: Our price on a Saturday evening for a premier strip view room was $525. Not cheap considering the Wynn had a parlor Suite at $499 during the same time and the Bellagio had a Penthouse suite listed for $599. The FS Vegas resort is by far one of the more expensive hotels in Vegas. I rate the room -- F. Service: Other than the fact that room service stinks, the bellman was nice, valet was efficient and informative, he front desk was professional, and the concierge did what was asked. So A++ for service and professionalism. Overrall: If you desire a non vegas destination while being close enough to gamble, I would recommend the Ritz Carlton Lake Las Vegas or the Westin Vegas resort. For the price, the FS Vegas has not met my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great FS experience”
Reviews.Author: marty99
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 6 night stay at FS Vegas. It was our fourth time in the city and were really looking forward to our break, having always been very pleased with other FS properties we have been to. It turned out we were not disappointed. The FS provides the ultimate balance in great service ( so often missing from even the best mega hotels on the Strip ) and easy access to the glitz and glamour that makes a Vegas break. Rooms are typical FS, quietly classy, but its the service that makes it stand out. Every member of staff seemed so attentive , especially at the pool, which is is delightful. The food at Verandah was also very good, although would agree with previous poster that a separate lounge bar would be good, as Verandah closes early. All in all a really great hotel , and having stayed at The Wynn last year ,and Venetian a few years back, the best that Vegas has to offer (although I do believe that first timers should try out the big hotels first , just to make it clear where the differences are ! ). As a travel agent who has been to many 5 star properties around the world this comes highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Vegas Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: gforce70
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best in vegas, if you want to stay away from the crowds. They cater to your every whim. I noticed that when they made dinner reservations for you you get the best tables at the restauarant of your choice. We had a strip view room which was very nice, nothing outlandish. The pool is nice and quit and they come around with frozen towels, evian spritz, ice's. The staff at the pool is great. If you love steak (as I do) You must go to SW at the Wynn. Simply the BEST. Dare I say better than Luger's. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful”
Reviews.Author: NYerUWS
Reviews.Content: Lovely setting on top of Mandalay Bay. Serenity upon entering. Room very spacious. Was there for my birthday, the date for which was given on my reservation. They got the date wrong, but did leave a little cake in my room. At the far south end of the strip which was a bit of a hike to all the other hotels. Taxi drivers consistently tried to rip us off. "I only have $6. I'll keep the rest, OK?" - trying to turn his tip into a $10 one.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Jockdoc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Four Seasons for a business conference. Certainly the fact that my business paid for the stay helped make the cost of the stay more palatable. On the other hand, the experience from the front desk staff to the housekeeping was top notch. The nicest thing about it was that there was no casino on the first floor so it was a nice escape from the smoke and noise that Vegas is known for for. One downside is that there was required valet service if you wanted to park your car overnight, which cost $16/night. Good news is that you can park at Mandalay Bay for free if you're willing to take a short walk from Four Seasons. The room itself was very nice though I didn't think it was any bigger than the Venetian. Toiletry was very nice from L'Occitane. Nightly turndown service with 2 bottles of water made coming in from100 degree summer heat very welcome. Extensive TV channels on flat screen tv is nice, though we didn't spend a ton of time in the room. Overall, I found the experience excellent though I'm not certain personally I would have paid the rack rate of $500/night.

Reviews.Title: “Construction Noise & Unexpected Issues”
Reviews.Author: Khy11
Reviews.Content: If you're thinking about staying at the Four Seasons any time soon, be warned. The construction noise from the Mandalay Bay Hotel (floors below) travels up to even the top floor of the Four Seasons (where we were staying). During our vacation, the jack-hammering would begin between 7 a.m. and 9 a.m. and would extend, intermittently, until 5 p.m. This was not exactly the relaxing stay which we had expected, and the Four Seasons' staff did not appear to care about the situation. In fact, we got the feeling that they were tired of hearing guests repeatedly complain. However, with the Four Seasons' reputation, and the prices charged for the rooms, we certainly expected a wonderful experience, and we were quite dismayed by our treatment. Another disappointing aspect of our stay was the terrible front desk staff. The women at the front desk/reception, in particular, were unfriendly, demeaning and snobby. They give you far less than a "five star" welcome. On the positive side of things, the pool service was top-notch, and the breakfast at the Verandah restaurant was outstanding. Beyond those two "high points," we fail to see what makes this property an oasis in the desert. We have had better experiences at Caesar's Palace! So, it's a mixed bag at the Four Season, but we certainly would not recommend anyone booking this property, at least until the construction at Mandalay Bay is complete. Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “Top Quality Service”
Reviews.Author: EnglishgalinUS
Reviews.Content: This was the best stay my husband and I have ever had in a hotel!! The service at the four seasons was out of this world. The hotel was a wonderfully tranquil oasis amongst the chaos and crowds of the 'Vegas Casino Scene'. It almost feels like you are in a completely different place. This is great as you can truly relax at the four seasons but still have the casino and nightlife experiences right next door at the Mandalay Bay and beyond. We particularly enjoyed the relaxed and attentive service at the pool so much that we spent everyday there. In contrast we took a look at the Mandalay Bay pool next door which was crowded, noisy and not at all relaxing...it still looked fun but more geared towards children and teens. The Breakfast Service at the verandah restaurant was excellent also. Our room was of average size but beautifully decorated with attention to detail. We also found the concierge to be most helpful in recommending and booking shows and putting us on the guestlist for some of the hottest lounges and nightclubs in town. We enjoyed our Vegas experience but even more so the peace and attentive service we received at The Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but average by FS standards”
Reviews.Author: Beckett
Reviews.Content: The primary advantage of FS Las Vegas is not its rooms which are almost the same as the adjoining Mandalay Bay hotel, nor its pool, which is tiny compared to others, but its calm quiet environment. It is a refuge compared to the riotous bustle of the other large hotels. At check in, there was no one in line and we were checked in quickly and efficiently. Upon learning that we had no bags we needed help with, the receptionist walked us half way to the elevator banks and it was self service from there. I found that a bit odd. Definitely not like other FS properties. We had the Mountain or otherwise the full Monty airport view with a side way glance towards the Strip. Because FS is at the top of Mandalay Bay, even a 'cheap' view affords better views than most regular hotels. The room was standard FS and came with a flat screen TV. What is worth recommending is the breakfast at the Veranda restaurant. A simple corn beef hash with eggs takes on a new meaning when it is executed to perfection. And you have the benefit of outdoor seating near the pool. Yes, the FS pool is small and quiet if that is what you want, although you won't escape the music blaring from the nearby Mandalay pool club. But the Mandalay Bay pool area is worth checking out if no other reason than to people watch and enjoy the wave pool. Overall, there was nothing spectacular about FS Las Vegas although I might try staying next time at more central properties like the Venetian if nothing else than to save myself from walking a lot in the 110 degree heat.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I expected it to be”
Reviews.Author: Trevi
Reviews.Content: Rooms: Met my high expectations for a Four Seasons property. Excellent beds, linens, pillows. Beautiful floor to ceiling window view of the strip, very quiet. Huge bathroom. Nice bar area. Very good coffee. Pool: Amazing! Beautiful, like being in some far away exotic place. Location: Really appreciated being removed from the casino noise and crowds. Mandalay Bay is right next door with a keyed entry for Four Seasons guests. Easy to take free tram to Luxor, Excalibur. Taxi’s always available to take you anywhere else. Staff: Always very friendly and helpful – Gets even the simple things right, making for a special experience. Like the Elevator “Concierge” who saw you coming and pressed the button and black napkins when you’re wearing black pants at the Veranda restaurant. Services: The best massage and facial of my life time. Expensive but felt worth the splurge. Housekeeping: Met expectations but had a couple of misses for a small maintenance issue that was overlooked, a newspaper request that was overlooked and failed to notice and replenish a prior request. Concierge: Mixed but overall very good –a call ahead for a restaurant recommendation missed the mark – food / view was great but the mood / ambience we were looking for totally missed the mark – incredibly loud –missed an opportunity to guide and set expectation for challenges to see the Grand Canyon via new glass walkway (double the time you think you will need to get there and back) –a separate call for a reservation with another concierge got us the best seat in the house for a great meal at Jasmine overlooking the Bellagio fountains –at the hotel - helped me by printing boarding passes for a late flight –very nice to be able to return our rental car at the Four Seasons for later pick up by the agency Breakfast / Lunch / Dinner: all were wonderful on the Veranda – great food, great staff, beautiful setting by the gorgeous pool Special surprises: When I made my reservation through the 800#, I requested a late check out due to an 11pm flight. They couldn’t accommodate my request at that time and suggested that I reserve an extra night. I declined the option. I asked again on the day I was due to check out and they had already noted my prior request and accommodated me with an 11:30pm check out. Good example of doing everything you can think of to please a guest. Tips: Ask the Taxi driver to take you “the back way” to avoid traffic – Quicker = Cheaper

Reviews.Title: “Big Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: CCBP
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed with the Four Seasons. To start with the “Mountain” view is really an Airport view. We tried to take a nap when we first got there, but there were very loud construction noises. The staff claimed it was from the Mandalay Bay over 10 floors below us. We found it hard to believe that the sound could be that deafening that many floors away. The staff claimed there was nothing they could do about the noise, nor did they offer any solutions. I asked if they could give us another room and claimed that it wouldn’t make any difference. When I questioned this a little further, they said they would look into getting us a quieter room and never followed up. Fortunately, the construction only lasted for 2 days. Also, the air conditioner made a high pitched squealing noise that could not be fixed. The housekeeping staff didn’t show up the second day after numerous calls to the staff. We engaged the concierge for help with a sold out concert. I questioned the price of the tickets they were quoting me, went on line, contacted the very first ticket broker in Las Vegas I found and got the same tickets for $150 less than what the concierge quoted us. We ended up extending our trip by one night since we wanted to attend this concert, instead of going to another hotel, which we should have, we simply stayed at the Four Seasons one more night. When we returned from the concert late that night, neither room key worked. When we contacted the front desk they acted as if they didn’t know what we were talking about. When they actually looked us up in the system and realized they had made a mistake they sent security up to our room to let us in. Security insisted on walking into our room with us like we were con artists and were not apologetic. After security was satisfied it was our room and that we had in fact extended our trip, they said they would have 2 new room keys delivered to our room. We waited for about an hour, no room keys showed up, we decided to go to the casino on last time before we left Vegas. A couple hours later, we returned to the hotel, went to the front desk for a room key. When we got back into our room, guess what, no room keys had been delivered. Overall, the facilities were sub par, but the staff was terrible. We were nothing but understanding with the staff and they seemed to have a contagious attitude of indifference. When we checked out the next day, I pleasantly handed the individual helping us one of my business cards and ask that the GM contact me for some feedback since speaking with other mangers didn’t seem to have any impact. They ensured me I would be contacted that day. I have yet to hear from anyone at the hotel. I would not recommend staying at the Four Seasons. There are many great hotels in Las Vegas with staff that actually cares about your comfort and experience.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: KerryWombourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons for my husbands birthday on June 12th and we were the "lucky couple" previously mentioned who got the two drinks whilst waiting for our room to be ready, probably because we drink quite fast!! Adrian the concierge was just perfectly helpful with everything we asked and got us a great table for dinner at Joel Ruberchon's restaurant (just opposite Celine Dion's table) and the best thing was he is ENGLISH. When the pool closed early without any advance warning Sung the Pool Manager did her best to compensate us and I did suggest to Matthew the director of rooms that the hotel should adopt a "cruise policy" and notify all guests of any closures or disruptions that will affect their enjoyment of the hotel's facilities. On my husband's actual birthday, we were welcomed with birthday greetings from the pool attendants and an ice-cream birthday cake with lunch which more than made up for the previous evening's pool closure. Housekeeping was exceptional throughout the hotel with wonderful giant displaysof every type of flower imaginable all grouped in single colours. Shiny marble floors throught the ground floor and wonderful thick carpeted corridors to the bedrooms. The Occitane toiletries were wonderful for my hair and skin, I never use hotel toiletries normally preferring to use my own, but these were top quality. After walking down the strip and visiting other hotels, it was just wonderful to return to the calm of the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: ariga
Reviews.Content: In all the travel that I do around the world and all the hotels I stay at, I must say that the Four Seasons in Las Vegas is definitely up there with the best.... I do not like Las Vegas, but sitting outside the hotel near the pool, you would not even know you are in the gambling city of the world. It is peaceful, relaxing and very luxurious. The service is fantastic and the staff is extremely helpful. The rooms are beautiful with a very comfortable bed and a fantastic bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Service Excellent but Rooms need upgrading”
Reviews.Author: ilovecheese
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and although it was a very pleasant stay Im not sure its the THIRD best hotel in Vegas! The girl who checked us in was slightly abrupt and not as pleasant as other staff members we met. The room was large but definitely starting to look worn and was in need of renovating. The hotel is nice, but really all of the facilities are in Mandalay bay, which doesn’t have the same number and standard of restaurants and bars that other hotels do. Also the pool at M-bay charges a jaw dropping $20 to RENT the tubes you go floating down the lazy river in - TWENTY DOLLARS!!!! You can buy them in CVS for FIVE!!!! Surely they could provide them for FREE!!!! Its extortion of families of the worst kind! M-bay and four seasons is not really convenient to the strip action - to get anywhere you had to get a lift 35 floors, walk through M-bay, get train to Luxor, walk through Excalibur, NY-NY and MGM to get train up strip - doesn’t look too far on a map but in 112 degree heat it got to be a bit much! The one area it does excel in is the standard of housekeeping! If there is some kind of hotel Oscars, the house keeping staff at Four seasons would win hands down! They folded clothes, lined up shoes, plugged in my straightener, etc etc etc - all done twice a day - they really worked staggeringly hard (and I hope they are paid accordingly!) Other than that, if I was going back to Vegas I wouldn’t stay here - Id go with the Venetian instead!

Reviews.Title: “I have no complaints!”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl30
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here June 18-20 for the HP Executive Series Conference that was taking place both at Mandalay and Four Seasons. While my husband was at sessions all day Monday and Tuesday, and I was at the pool. This pool was on par with pools I have been to in Hawaii (at Hyatt Regency Poipu and Four Seasons Wailea) in both level of service and grounds upkeep. It felt very relaxing and tropical.... a far cry from the thumping music and crowded scene at the Mandalay pool. The nice thing about being at the Four Seasons is that you have the option of sitting at the Mandalay Pool Area but the Mandalay guests can not come to the Four Seasons pool. At the pool at Four Seasons you get very comfy lounges, shade or sun, pitcher of ice water with lemon, chilled towels, Evian spritz, fruit bars, and option of ordering at the bar or poolside for food/drinks. Room was great, very tastefully decorated, excellent turndown service, comfy bed, and awesome L'Occitane bath products. I ate breakfast at Verandah (Four Seasons restaurant) both mornings and was not dissapointed. It was very relaxing/tropical feel. Of course breakfast prices are higher here but do not let that deter you as you will be eating in a very comfortable environment on real silver(!) and will have exceptional service. It does not have the hurried and crazy vibe of eating in the casinos. I am only sorry we could not stay longer. Thank you to the kind gentleman at the door Monday evening who took my husband and I to Capital Grille in the Four Seasons house car. Very much appreciated! Oh, and I took part in the Savor the Simplicity Spa Package (50 min swedish, 50 min European Facial) -- also highly recommend doing that if you can! The spa facilities are great. Thank you Four Seasons for a very nice vacation. As far as the previous review dated June 17th, I did not have any customer service issues at all related to the pool area. They did close the Mandalay Bay pool early for a concert though.

Reviews.Title: “Sanctuary in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: nyctravelr
Reviews.Content: I'm not a huge fan of Vegas, so it's wonderful to have a quiet WELL-RUN oasis in the city. Fantastic treatment from check-in on. Had a deluxe room with Strip view - nothinghighly unusual, but tastefully done & well-appointed (the rooms at the HOTEL are larger, but the service is not as good & the hotel is difficult to access). Pool is fabulous. Not necessarily the prettiest pool (my favorite so far is the Bangkok Peninsula), but staff & service make the experience wonderful - a nice change from the frat party/cruise ship environment throughout the rest of hte city. The only drawback to hte hotel is that it's pretty far away from everything, since it's at the southerhn end of the Strip, but why would you want to leave?

Reviews.Title: “Love the hotel but did have some problems....”
Reviews.Author: starbuck3
Reviews.Content: When we checked in (after the 3pm check in time) I was given our room keys. It was the last door on the corridor and was about 200 steps from the lift! I had already told them we were there to celebrate my mother's 70th birthday and I had booked months in advance. I said the room was just too far for her. They finally conceded that we could have another room closer to the elevator but as the room was not ready, they could not give any indication of how long we would have to wait. We had just driven from Los Angeles that morning so we were very hot and tired. Finally a bell man took charge and spoke to a manager who did find us an alternative room but we lost our good view too and I had specifically asked for a Strip View. Anyhow we finally got our room nearly 2 hours after arriving and all we were given was two small bottles of water. The hotel is lovely and the staff friendly apart from one particular receptionist who was very unhelpful. A warning - they shut the pool some afternoons with no notice because of private parties. We had just got back from shopping and went down to the pool. We were told it was closing in half an hour. I could not believe it. Had we known we would have stopped in the afternoon and sat by the pool in the morning. Another UK couple was caught out by this too. I complained about the situation and the fact no notice of this private party had been given to any guests and we were given a free drink and they took off the bill our pool lunch the previous day. However this did not really make up for the fact that I would rather have sat by the pool. All guests had paid to use the pool and now they were selling it again to a private party. It was only by chance that I found out by speaking to the other UK couple that they had been told to wait in the bar for their room that was not ready upon their arrival and were given two free drinks each. I went back to the unhelpful receptionist who had dealt with us when we arrived and asked why that courtesy had not been extended to us and why we were just left to sit in reception waiting with our warm bottled water. She did not know what to say and got the manager who arranged the same thing for my mother and I that night! Basically you need to be aware of what is going on around you. The staff by the pool are pretty good except for Danny who nearly knocked me in the pool with a towel when I said I did want to sit by the pool if only half an hour (the day they were closing it!). The food was great and if I ever go to Las Vegas again I would certainly stay there but check out certain things like private parties first!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jeffinco
Reviews.Content: We routinely stay at many five star properties throughout the world ~ not bragging, just letting the reader know that we understand the level of service and quality that is needed to truly be called a five star property. The Four Seasons Las Vegas was one of the best. True, there were a couple minor problems, but overall, a memorable, wonderful experience! Starting off, we were ushered into a small but elegant lobby that was nearly empty. If anyone's been to Vegas, you know how chaotic lobbies can be. Once registered, we were escorted by the host towards the elevators. The gym is complimentary and we did use it a few times. It has nice new equipment, The pool is private, The service at the pool is AMAZING. The staff cpmes around with complimentary popsicles, orange slices, and evian water atomizer for your face. The buffet breakfast on Sunday should not be missed. The rooms are large and well decorated. The bath products are L'Occitane. I highly recommend this hotel. It is a nice get away from the Strip and the hustle and bustle of Vegas. Only complaint was the room was rather hot ~ they provided a fan, but still not sure why the room was hot with outside temps only at 100F (a cold spell for Vegas).
