Bottom line, you will not be disappointed with this property!

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Oasis”
Reviews.Author: PattyNewportBeach
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend stay from this wonderful hotel and I must say that I will probably never want to stay at another resort besides this one in future travels to Las Vegas. It is a beautiful property and just what you would expect from a Four Seasons.....great service, quiet ambience, beautiful rooms and wonderful food. We were upgraded to a "specialty suite" upon an early check in and it was outstanding. We especially loved the pool area with the super comfy chaise lounges, misters, shade option if you wish and great service. The food poolside was very good as were the drinks. We walked over to the Mandalay pool to check it out and it was madness...so many people, no shade, noisy and crowded. When we went back to the Four Seasons pool it was like a bit of heaven. If you are looking for a really relaxing place to unwind while in Vegas you can't go wrong at the Four Seasons. They will treat you right, I promise you.....

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: JJ400
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 days in this hotel and loved every minute. It offers a welcome sanctuary from the noise from the rest of the Las Vegas strip but is close enough to enjoy the strip as and when you want to. Our room was very good - we stayed in a suite with a strip view. It was large, immaculately clean with lots of luxurious touches that you would expect from this hotel chain. The service and friendliness of the staff was consistantly high from the moment we arrived - the pool staff were particularly good at making you feel like the most welcome and important guest they had. This hotel is elegant yet fun. Above all it is very flexible - because we were there 10 days they ensured we couldn't get tired of the menu or the hotel itself and often recomended alternatives that weren't on the menu for example. The Charlie Palmer restaurant was the only disapointing thing about the hotel - the quality of food and service just wasn't as good as the other high quality restaurants we ate in on our trip. Overall though we are looking forward to returning the Four Seasons soon.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: sjp1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice overall and very close to perfect in my opinion. The service was stellar in almost every way, with the property being immaculate. The room that we had was a standard room with a non-strip view, however we still had what I thought was a beautiful view of the desert and mountains.The room was nicely appointed with great towels and bed linnens. It also had a big flat screen tv. The two restaurants(The Verandah and Charlie Palmer Steakhouse) at the hotel were great. Room service was spectacular and boy do you pay for it. Room service breakfast for two was around sixty dollars. The pool was immaculate with great service from the attendants. There were always chaise lounges to use with fresh towels laid out for you along with a pitcher of ice water. The spa was great as well! I had a massage and it was so perfect in every way. There is also a complimentary gym to use. It had all sorts of cardio machines along with a decent set of nautlius machines and some free weights as well. The Four Seasons is actually the top five floors of the Madalay Bay Hotel. However, the Four Seasons has its own entrances, reception/ lobby, and pool. The Four Seasons is such a relaxing place to the point where I forgot I was in Vegas. And when I wanted to gamble or party I could just walk through a set of doors and be at the very nice Mandalay Bay Hotel in less than a minute. Most hotels in Vegas have several thousand rooms, hence you suffer as a guest when it comes to service and quality...not at the Four Seasons. I would for sure stay at the Four Seasons again with it being my first choice every time I am in Las Vegas. In fact, I don't think I will ever be able to stay at another mega resort in Vegas again since I got spoiled by the great service at the Four Seasons!

Reviews.Title: “Great for gluten free!”
Reviews.Author: micdenver
Reviews.Content: Had a 3 night stay and it was wonderful. The service was great. I am allergic to gluten and they took very good care of me. So much so that I ate every meal there. The pool is a great place to relax and order a meal. Only draw back and it was minor was that the connecting door to the adjacent room had no insulation. I could hear the girls next door talking in a normal tone of voice. Luckily they were not being loud but if you had the wrong neighbor it could be annoying.

Reviews.Title: “always our favorite”
Reviews.Author: noagent
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay here and we loved it as always. It is so peaceful, quiet, and the staff is wonderful. I booked online at the Four Seasons web site and got the package that give $50 credit per night. I have always gotten the best prices booking directly and the further in advance the better. I love how you arrive at a separate entrance from the Mandalay Bay madness, no wait to check in, the room isn't a mile from the front door, and the pool is perfect. We love laying by the pool since the service is top notch and we've even ordered off the room service menu. You have the option of using the Mandalay Bay pools but their guests can't use the Four Seasons. We looked at them but went back to "our " pool where someone is always ready to bring you a drink and the chairs are plentiful and comfortable. The concierge made all our dinner reservations before we arrived after I contacted them by email. There's never a cab line, room service is always prompt, accurate and tasty (though expensive), the Veranda restaraunt is very good and Charlie Palmer's steak house is our favorite steak place in Vegas. Other restraunts we went to this year: Mix-wouldn't recommend-food was good, not great, very overpriced, staff rude at check in for reservation. Bartolotta-awesome! We did the tasting menu which is pricey but worth it. All the seafood was great and so were the pastas. We saw the chef walking around the restraunt which is unusual to see those famous chefs actually on-site. Highly recommend it. We also ate at Olives-very good but nothing special; very loud-can't hear across the table. We saw "O" which was worth every penny and a great show. We also saw Prince who put on a great show. If you can get tickets (I called the Rio box office directly at the beginning of the month), its a fun performance of his newer stuff with a lot of other musicians.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: gone40
Reviews.Content: We spent an amazing weekend at the Four Season in April as part of a group event. Our king room on the 38th floor had a spectacular view of the strip. The room was not huge (like The Hotel) but was plently big for the two of us. Great bed and 42 inch plasma. Great service from all the staff. The brunch buffet at the Verandah is not to be missed. Expensive but worth it. We'd love to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “a perfect hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: kitaneh
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons in las vegas is a calm oasis in an otherwise crazy city. It was a wonderful place to come back to--very beatiful, perfect service, great pool area, nice restaurants, lovely flower arrangements--a top notch hotel. The room are beautiful--our room was not ready when we arrived and we were upgraded to a huge one bedroom suite with a stunning view of the strip. Room service was timely and attentive. The best part--the pool attendants who lavish attention on the guest--bringing ice water with lemon, spritzing with cool water, cleaning sunglasses, passing around popsicles and cold orange slices--what a wonderful spot for a short vacation!!

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis of Calm”
Reviews.Author: travelmikeVancouver
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Las Vegas offers a wonderful, comfortable stay for those that need a bit of calm and relaxation. Located atop the Mandalay Bay, the hotel has a separate entrance, Lobby, restaurants and facilities. You will be whisked away into a tranquil, luxurious world- the perfect foil to the otherwise hectic pace of Vegas. Gamblers should note that this property does not have a casino, but you can easily access the sprawling gaming floor of Mandalay Bay. Rooms are pretty much what you would expect from the Four Seasons. While not as large as some of the mini-suite accommodations offered elsewhere in Vegas, you will have all the usual comforts like mini-bar, marble bathrooms with robes, and exquisite L'Occitane toiletries. Decor is rather dated, a la early 90's luxury with a tropical twist, but that should not deter you. Try and splurge on a Strip View Room, or politely ask for an upgrade upon check-in (there may well be an extra charge, but it is worth it!). The hotel boasts its' own lovely pool area, much quieter than those found at the mega-resorts. Adjacent to the pool is a small but well-equipped exercise room (free of charge unlike most hotels of this caliber), as well as a soothing Spa. Treatments are fine though a bit expensive. Staff here are eager to please- we were constantly being offered complimentary use of the comfortable chauffered sedan (please tip the driver generously ). When we had a noise-related problem (see below) in our original room, we were moved to an enormous, beautifully appointed One Bedroom Suite complete with a jaw-dropping view all the way up the Strip. We had a full bath plus a large powder room near the front door, a wonderful living room area with adjacent office nook, and a large bedroom with many closets and that awesome view right from the king-size bed. We were also offered complimentary treats which arrived periodically out of the blue.....the chocolate-covered almonds were heavenly. We loved the fact that this hotel is one of the only that welcomes dogs and met several pampered pooches in the elevators. Some pets even have their own engraved dishes awaiting them upon arrival (those which are lucky enough to stay here regularly). On site are a cafe, a fine Steak House, and a seasonal poolside cafe as well as a lounge. Guests have signing privileges at a myriad of other eateries throughout the vast Mandaly Bay / THE Hotel complex....you can also try one of the other Spas. The only problem we encountered was that when we arrived back in our original room on the first night (Monday), we discovered that above us was an all-night party complete with live dj's playing directly above us. The problem stems from the fact that above the Four Seasons are the High-Roller Suites of Mandalay Bay, and also a popular nightclub operated by House of Blues. On Mondays the entire floor becomes a wild party open to the public. By all means, if staying over a Monday, do NOT stay on the top floor of the Four Seasons (Floor 39 if memory serves). I should mention that the problem was rectified beyond our wildest dreams (see above), and that the Front Desk staff assured us they had never had similar complaints. Staying here was an absolute joy in every other respect, and we cannot say enough good things about this fine property and its' incredible staff. We also enjoyed being connected through a discreet secured door to the fun chaos of the Mandalay Bay, yet having a wonderful oasis of calm and tranquility to go to when we had had enough noise and action. I should also mention that the other usual touches one would expect from a Four Seasons stay are also here.....fine food, great service and masses of fresh flowers. There is talk of the Four Seasons eventually opening a new Resort adjacent to one of the other Strip resorts. Perhaps this particular property could use a bit of freshening-up here and there, but all in all this was one of our best hotel stays ever and is highly recommended, especially if you are fortunate enough to afford a stay in one of the palatial suites. Splurge if you can, you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Dignified Las Vegas? You've arrived.”
Reviews.Author: ocGlobetraveler
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas has made every attempt to lure travelers to their ever so vibrant resorts and casinos. You will find a variety of tastes among hotels, but no hotel delivers a more dignified experience than the Four Seasons Las Vegas. Unique to this hotel, is its prime location, with few inconveniences often associated with most Las Vegas Hotels and Resorts. The Four Seasons Las Vegas is housed within the Mandalay Bay Resort and Casio, occupying floors 35-39 of this mega resort. The Four Seasons however acts as its own property, with a separate hotel entrance, restaurant facilities, pool area, spa etc. If you never left the hotel itself, you might be hard pressed to realize you were actually in Las Vegas. All Four Seasons guests have access to the Mandalay Bay Resort through several different private access doors. These access areas offer Four Seasons guest the ability to quickly walk to casino areas, shopping and other popular areas of Mandalay Bay. What's nice however is that you never have to see a casino, if you choose not to, when staying at the FS Las Vegas. The level of service was beyond impeccable, in every regard. Our every need was anticipated, met, and exceeded at all times throughout our stay. We had two connecting rooms, in the Deluxe Category, which offered views of the "Strip" I would however recommend choosing a mountain view, as there are less lights, and a nice view of the pool area. Rooms were classic Four Seasons in style, with extremely comfortable beds and luxurious furnishings. Since this hotel was originally opened, the rooms have been updated to reflect a more contemporary motif. The bathrooms were stocked with an abundance of amenities, along with a seamless glass shower and separate soaking tub. The Verandah restaurant was superb on every occasion. I would highly recommend the breakfast and lunch service. The pool and spa were fantastic, again offering a more private Las Vegas pool experience. You don't get the sense of overcrowding, and the level of service is in line with the rest of the hotel. The fitness center is also first class, featuring a variety of advanced machines. If your travel plans call for business or leisure, and you desire a peaceful stay, you will be delighted with the Four Seasons Las Vegas. Expect service and quality that rivals that of the competition. You won't find a better hotel in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “BEST IN VEGAS!”
Reviews.Author: TravelbugVancouver
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days at this hotel with 100 of our guests for our wedding and everything was perfect. A great hotel in Vegas, where there is no smoking inside, (which is rare in Vegas) and no casino. The casino is upstairs at Mandalay Bay.... So still very nearby. The food was amazing, Pool was great with access to Mandalay's pools if you choose. Great Work out area too. The Concierge also organized for us to get on guest lists at many of the nightclubs in Vegas, which was a plus. Definetly recomend this hotel if you want to avoid all the lines up in Vegas at the, Taxis, buffets, etc....

Reviews.Title: “A True Relaxing Stay in the Capital of Overstimulation”
Reviews.Author: EyeMD
Reviews.Content: I spent a weekend here for a brief medical conference, but more so to "take a breather." I thought I liked Vegas, but everytime I go, I realize more & more that it is just one huge casino and that's it. A good show will change your pace a bit, but otherwise it gets old real fast. After checking in, I immediately left & walked the strip, and in 2-3 hours I had enough. Returning back to the Four Season made me realize that this place truly is different. For once you don't have to walk through the casino to get anywhere like every single other hotel on the strip! Walk in the front door, go through the lobby, past the spa, and into the elevator. This was a true pleasure. Invaluable, in my opinion. Room was superb - love the plasma TV (but HD programming would help). Staff was extremely helpful all around. My conference has the hotel order meals for my dietary needs, and I only had to ask once about it. After that, every meal, I was approached and asked, "Would you like your meal now, sir?" Can't beat that. Of course, the casino is there if you want it. Just walk through the "Mandalay Bay" door and it hits you like you walked into an airport. The key to this is: you don't HAVE to walk through the door. (I admit: I did use the spa at the Luxor because my wife recommended it and the massages were cheaper. Great way to unwind.)

Reviews.Title: “As always, perfect...”
Reviews.Author: Member in Philadelphia
Reviews.Content: Another visit at the Four Seasons Las Vegas and another perfect stay. After missing our flight due to a worse than expected snow storm and barely squeaking two standby seats away from two poor Irish travelers who missed their connection by minutes, arriving at the FSLV, addressed by name at the check in desk and upgraded without asking, soon put a chaotic morning and long trip in row 34, all far behind. It is a special quiet place amongst the clatter of Vegas. No lines to get into breakfast, no cast of thousands packed around the pool, a beautiful spa and gym with plenty of elbow room, staff that are attentive without being overbearing, a hotel town car to get you around town… A welcome oasis in the desert.

Reviews.Title: “Adrian is a star!”
Reviews.Author: WMadge
Reviews.Content: Our decsion to stay at the four seasons was based on our decison to get married in Vegas on Xmas day. We wanted to stay in a sylish non gaming hotel to make our experience a special and memorable occasion. As usual, the four seasons did not let us down! It was understated elegance as usual. We did visit many hotels to have the full Vegas experience during ur stay, it was always a pleasure and relief to return to the non gaming oasis hotel!!! Having said that, our visit to "The Hotel" and "The Mandalay Bay" were truly memorable. The views from the bar at "The Hotel" are an absolute must. Breathtaking and the aquarium at the Mandalay Bay is a must. Our strip view from our room was brilliant and well worth paying extra for. I never tired when we returned to our room of taking in the Vegas view. Brilliant. I would love to have been able to say that our wedding and honeymoon experience with the four seasons was great. Our wedding in the Grand Canyon with the Maverick Helicopters was brilliant. However. in true four seasons understated way, our stay even though they knew it was our wedding and honeymoon went without acknokledgement with the hotel. Oh well, I suppose Vegas is satturated with weddings. If you need to book shows or arrange anything with the Hotel, insist on Adrian the English ex pat dealing with it. A lovely man and true star in pulling strings for last minute show tickets! We had a brilliant stay at the Hotel, when we return we will stay at "The Hotel". BUt the Four Seasons was everything that we wanted as Virgin Vegas Visitors!!

Reviews.Title: “Peacefulness amidst the chaos of LV”
Reviews.Author: mlizBoston
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were at this hotel for 3 nights in October for a business trip. It was a great stay for people who were not in Vegas for the gambling/nightlife scene. Serene environment, lovely furnishings, etc. Our room was very good. We didn't go to Las Vegas for a good view out the window but overlooking the airport was a bit of a letdown. The restaurant in the hotel for breakfast was very good and we enjoyed a little time at the pool which was very quiet. Very good service in both places. Our favorite restaurant experience while we were in Las Vegas was Picasso. Terrific food, fantastic setting and great wines, plus original artwork.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: nwwriter
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel and the experience starts when you arrive. No noisy slot machines or casino sounds. Very elegant. I was taken to the Four Seasons for my 40th birthday. Unfortunately, I threw my back out the day before and could barely walk and was in a lot of pain. The front desk staff promptly rushed me into the spa for a back treatment. The massuer worked on me for an hour. When he was done, I was relieved of my pain and could at least stand up straight and walk. I was very grateful. The rooms are smallish, but tasteful and the service is immeccable. We would highly recommend this hotel for a nice retreat away from the typical Vegas strip hotels.

Reviews.Title: “First time, and it was a charm!”
Reviews.Author: KikiPeepers
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Four Seasons in Las Vegas, and we knew it would be nice since it was a 5-star, 5-diamond hotel but we were impressed even beyond what we were expecting! We have been faithful Bellagio goers for years but we have a new addition to the family (a puppy!) that we wanted to take with us and the Four Seasons is the only hotel on the strip that takes animals. They took great care of everything, including our dog. My only complaint was that they were to have a doggy pack ready for him when we got to the hotel but they brought it up later that night when we ordered room service for him. Yes - for the dog! They will make anything you want, even cut it up into the appropriate-size pieces. They give you nice ceramic bowls, Evian water and a little kit that includes plastic bags for accidents. They also had a nanny service they contracted that would watch children or pets, and we enjoyed our nanny (ask for Nancy if you have a small animal!) so much we invited her back each night of our stay. It was a bit pricy but worth it if you are afraid your pet will cry or bark if you aren't there. They do have a policy that if anyone hears your animal barking, they will be removed from your room and put in the maid's area until you return to the hotel, and you will be charged $50, so paying a bit more for someone to watch them is worth it. Other than the excellent way they treated our pet, they treated us well also. They got us into every club, restaurant and show we wanted and made sure we always had the best tables and seats. They had very comfortable beds, impeccably cleaned rooms, huge plasma televisions and L'Occitane products in the bath that were just lovely. Turndown service every evening and they will clean the room any time, 24 hours a day, depending on your sleeping schedule. Room service was always delivered within half an hour, hot food with a smiling waiter ready to take care of anything you need. We did not encounter one rude employee our entire stay, everyone from the concierge to the bellhops were professional and warm. We will definitely be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: nmclennan
Reviews.Content: We knew we were in for a good stay when upon checking-in, the receptionist came around from behind the desk and presented each of our three children with a stuffed animal (this was the last thing they needed after 2 weeks at Disney World and 1 week in New York - anyhow the gesture was welcomed and the kids loved it). We had a strip-view suite on the 37th floor. Wow, what a view!! This is where we stayed on New Year's Eve and had a great view up the strip and of the fireworks. Upon entering the room, the kids were more than surprised to see a plate for each of them, with their names spelt out with chocolate on the rim of the plate, surrounding white and milk chocolate in the shape of cactus with cookies and M&M's scattered around to depict a desert scene. We then heard a scream from our youngest daughter from the bathroom - she had discovered that each of their names had been spelt out with coloured sponges around the bathtub. As noted by a previous reviewer, I have never struck a hotel where all the staff in all areas of the hotel were so welcoming, friendly and attentive. As that reviewer noted, they must all be put through some form of boot camp. Mind you, Las Vegas people on the whole were some of the friendliest people we have ever come accross in our travels. On the afternoon of New Year's Eve, we had a knock on the door and it was room service presenting us with a bottle of Champagne in a top hat of ice and a large cocktail glass filled with chocolates for New Years, compliments from the Manager. What a nice surprise. No doubt we paid for it in the room rate, but it is the unexpected things which can really make your stay one to remember. The bed was one of the best we have slept in. Housekeeping service was efficient. Access to Mandalay Bay is easy. Loved the separate entrance and the serenity. Only grumble would be the wait we had to endure at times for a taxi. It happened more than once and there never seemed to be a taxi waiting there - one always needed to be called. This was our first visit to Vegas and I cannot compare this property to others in Vegas - but I would be very surprised if any other property comes close to the Four Seasons in terms of service. For that reason, we would not hesitate in staying here for any return visit, especially if we were travelling with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “First-class for families”
Reviews.Author: LynnDB
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our three children (ages 7,9,11) arrived at the Four Seasons after a 30 hour trip from Asia. We have stayed at hotels all over the world and have never been more impressed with a hotel. Upon check-in we were told we had been upgraded to a large suite. We felt so welcome at this gorgeous oasis. Our suite was amazing with superb mattresses, linens, pillows and L'occitane verbena toiletries. The bathrooms were huge and all-marble. Each room had a brand-new huge flat-screen tv. Soon after we arrived in our suite, a tray was brought up with 3 large plates of treats for our children. Each child's plate had a welcome greeting with our child's name written in chocolate. Having stayed at large, loud, and smokey hotels, I never wanted to visit Las Vegas, especially with our children. We did go out to see casinos and experience some of Las Vegas. But I can't tell you how wonderful it was to slide our card key into the "secret" door that let us back into our beautiful oasis. When we asked for taxis to take us to the airport, the Four Seasons insisted on taking us to the airport in their 2 luxurious vehicles. We will return to the Four Seasons with show tickets and spa services booked and basically ignore the other parts of Las Vegas that we don't like. Every other guest that we encountered was very courteous, friendly and felt the same way that we did. I realize that many people go to Vegas to party, go crazy and let their hair down but it is nice to know that we don't have to experience it with them. We will go out of our way now to pay more and stay at a Four Seasons when we travel.

Reviews.Title: “Extra Special in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: jwthere4u
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Four Seasons. Two years ago, for our 25th anniversary, we were upgraded to an 1,100 square foot suite by a kind young man at the front desk. Of course, it was unforgetable, and we were wondering if we would enjoy ourselves just as much this time, in our Standard room. We were with my parents, who had never been to Las Vegas. I asked at the front desk for an upgrade and we were both given Premium rooms with views of the Strip. Our room, however, had a gurgling sink. Two engineers could not fix the problem. A call to the front desk provided us with another upgrade to a one bedroom suite (hard not to get used to!) The staff called us three times to make sure we were now comfortable. (The beds are heavenly!) We were also provided dessert cake for our anniversary, but the next night, we were again provided with chocolate almonds for "our inconvenience." The concierge helped with our tickets to La Reve at the Wynn. We also took many taxis, and never had a problem. The quiet of the lobby-no loud casinos, no cigar smoke-coupled with the incomparable staff (and L'Occitane products) makes this our favorite place in Vegas. PS-My parents said this was "a vacation of a lifetime!"

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but worth it.”
Reviews.Author: wwwench
Reviews.Content: This hotel is outstanding in every respect, one of the nicest I have stayed in, in 30 years of serious hotel-going. If you don't gamble--and do travel with a pet--the Four Seasons is really the only choice in Las Vegas, in my opinion. (If I couldn't stay there, I wouldn't go to Las Vegas at all.) My husband and I booked a room in September, on the penultimate day of a cross-country trip, an impulse buy after the hellhole that is Rock Springs, Wyoming. Calling from our car, at the very last minute, we got an astonishingly low rate on a lovely room overlooking the Strip. I wouldn't recommend this path to everyone, but having that low, low rate in your file allows you to negotiate a pretty good deal on subsequent trips. Last night, I booked 5 nights in January for the Miss America Pageant (go, Miss Rhode Island!). The rate I got, directly from the Four Seasons for the same lovely room with a view, was lower than the lowest rate for the cheapest room on any travel Website--about halfway between the super-low rate I got in September and the first price quoted when I called. What's so great about this hotel? The staff. Either they deliberately hire exceptionally warm, kind, friendly, and welcoming people, or they put everyone through some intensive--and effective!--hospitality boot camp, who knows which? Whatever they do, it works. Everyone on the staff was wonderful: reservations, parking, bellmen, desk, housekeeping, room service, concierge. (I didn't have time for the pool or spa.) From check-in to check-out, we did not have a single bad encounter. Also (if this matters to you) they really like dogs and do everything possible to pamper them. Even behavior that annoyed me--like a woman who let her pooch off-leash and played ball with him in the elevator lobby (you know who you are, lady with the chihuahua!)--was met with genial amusement by the Four Seasons staff. The giant Samoan security guard was not a charmer, true. But he certainly made me feel secure! We had only one tiny complaint. About an hour before we planned to check out and drive to Santa Barbara, I got the bright idea of ordering a picnic lunch. The Four Seasons does offer delicious-sounding box lunches, but you have to order them 3 hours in advance. Which, for most people, means having the bright idea the night before. (Unfortunately, I am not one of the Organized People.) Room Service would not make an exception, no matter how much I sweet-talked, wheedled, and whined. They said "no" very nicely, but still. This meant my poor, long-suffering husband had to trudge down to the Mandalay Bay to fetch our lunch. Which turned out to be OK, but they gave it to him piled high on one of those ugly cardboard trays, so awkward to carry--particularly with a rambunctious bull terrier! Then again, at check-out, the desk guy whisked the offending tray away and returned a few minutes later with our lunch neatly packed in a lovely box. Now that I know the drill, I'll order our picnic the night before. And I am so looking forward to the serenity of the pool, spa, and cucumber slices after hard nights of pageant-going!

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Indypuss
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a 3 night stay at the Four Seasons which we'd booked as a splurge after 3 weeks touring the South West. We certainly made the right choice. Our room was on the 39th floor with the most amazing view of the Strip. The bed was the most comfortable we'd ever slept on, and everything about the room was so well thought out. Housekeeping service was impeccable - they even put my husband's razor on recharge when it got low. The toiletries (L'Occitane) were fab. We had all the facilities of the Mandalay Bay, but were able to retreat to our little oasis whenever we wanted peace and quiet. The Four Seasons pool is great - you are pampered from the minute you enter the complex, pitchers of iced water, popsicles, melon, sunglasses cleaned etc etc. We walked to the main MBay pool with the wave machine etc, but it just felt like a noisy beach club with booming music and we were glad to go back to our own little 'haven'. It was the little touches that we liked so much - bottles of iced water in your car when the valet returns it and the offer of directions to wherever you are going. And the way they lay out the TV guide and remote control by your bed in the evening. My husband sent his boots to the shoeshine and they were returned by the morning, perfectly shined and individually wrapped in tissue paper! The restaurants are great - you can use all Manadalay Bay's facilities and just charge it to your room. One word of warning tho - if you suffer from vertigo you may want to give it a miss. All the windows are floor to ceiling, from the moment you step out of the lift, to the windows in the rooms. It takes a while to get used to it - particularly when you see the helicopters buzzing below you! 3 nights just wasn't enough!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Zendoggie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Four Seasons for a weekend in October 2006. As background, the Four Seasons Hotel is simply the top floors of the Mandalay Bay Hotel. The Four Seasons has its own ground entrance and elevators -- and no casino (although you can easily go into the one at Mandalay Bay). The hotel was acceptable, pleasant and visually attractive – but not exceptional for the price, particularly with all the options available in Las Vegas. The Superior room was of average size and appointment. Some of the furniture was dinged and bathroom only had a single-basin vanity. The closet and cabinetry were premium and the room had a large plasma TV. The service was good, but not flawless. We ordered room-service breakfast on Saturday morning. It arrived on-time and at the correct temperature. The server has friendly and set up the room efficiently. I ordered a cholesterol-free omelet which was really tasty (it’s hard to do an egg-white omelet worth eating). However, late in the day when we came back from the pool, the plates had not been picked up. We had to call room-service to have someone come and bus the room. The hotel will deliver either the Wall Street Journal or the New York Times. We got our Saturday paper and were looking forward to the Sunday Times, but it never arrived. The Four Seasons has access to its own pool with an older, more sedate crowd than the many pools at the Mandalay. We used the pools at both facilities because the Mandalay Bay has some fun features like a wave pool and the Lazy River with a current. The hotel is pretty far from the core of the Strip at the end of the airport. It can take a while to get a cab from the hotel simply because it doesn’t have the same in-and-out traffic of the other resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Lovely”
Reviews.Author: cbcolin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 6 nights at the Four Seasons Hotel in Las Vegas as my husband attended a conference held at the Mandelay Bay Convention Center. I am a real stickler for good customer service, and I am so pleased to say that the staff at The Four Seasons could NOT have been more pleasant. We had such a lovely time there. The room was spotless and very comfortable. We had 2 parcels delivered from out of town during our stay and they were delivered to our room in a timely manner. Every staff member we had contact with was friendly, knowledgeable and professional. The housekeeping staff was top notch - very attentive to the room and very thoughtful with the turndown service. Each evening our bed was turned down, lights dimmed - and soft music and lovely video's of nature were tuned in on the very large plasma television awaiting our return to the hotel. The concierge was helpful to arrange meals, suggest restaurants, give directions and arrange transportation. The staff was truly friendly, from the General Manager to the kind man who was busily painting miniscule scuff marks on the baseboards in the hallway. Room service was wonderful and extremely prompt. The meals we enjoyed were all perfectly prepared. The fresh flowers and special touches to room service did not go unnoticed. The valet service was very nice. The staff was attentive and professional. I made special notice that all staff members addressed us by name whenever they could. Our name is pronounced differently than the spelling looks, and it was so refreshing to have our name pronounced correctly. Again - small touches matter. "Thoughtful" would be the word I would use to sum up our experience at the Four Seasons. Yes, the hotel is very pretty, the rooms are well appointed, the lobby is comfortable and well decorated...but is was truly the people at the Four Seasons who made our stay so very pleasant. The staff seemed sincerely interested in our comfort. It was so refreshing to have such a lovely experience. So many times we stay at beautiful hotels with nice rooms -- but the staff lacks something. Perhaps they are snooty, too busy to attend to their guests or maybe just unhappy in their jobs...It makes a GRAND difference in the experience that the traveler has. Many hotels are lovely, but we would never patronize them again purely because of the ill-mannered staff. The Four Seasons was the antithesis of a hotel with a poorly trained or organized staff. No matter where we stay from now on, my husband and I will forever hold hotel experiences up against The Four Seasons in Las Vegas...It will be extremely hard for a hotel to measure up!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: JodieTravel01
Reviews.Content: I researched Las Vegas Hotels in depth using this website before deciding to stay at the Four Seasons, with two children aged 4 and 6 we really wanted a high quality, quiet, smoke free environment. Check in was effortless, the lobby was beautifully appointed. Our room was exactly what we booked, two double beds facing away from the strip. We were celebrating our 20th wedding anniversary (it fell at the end of our 3 week US holiday) and we were pleased to find that the hotel had left a dessert in our room with a congratulatory note. There were separate desserts for our children plus special bath products for them (which they loved). The room was very spacious and the bathroom was huge, with high quality toiletries. Housekeeping was excellent. We ate at the Verandah restaurant twice, delicious meals both times and a reasonably priced childrens' menu. The pool was everything that other reviewers have outlined - wonderful service, pristine environment. Our kids loved it and after a visit to the crowded Mandalay Bay wave pool couldn't wait to return to the more relaxed atmosphere at the Four Seasons. We had easy access to the Mandalay Bay casino, buffet etc which allowed us to have the Vegas experience. We visited a lot of other casinos and even at the more expensive locations witnessed long check out queues, masses of people milling around the lobby etc. We were thrilled with our 4 night stay at the Four Seasons and very sad to say goodbye.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hideaway in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: hotelio
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here in September to celebrate my husband's 40th and were more than pleased. This hotel is great choice if you like to get away from the craziness of Vegas!! It's elegant with top notch service as you would expect in addition to being well located within the Mandalay Bay Complex but very peaceful and quiet. As a Four Seasons guest you have full priveldges at Mandalay's more festive pools but the Mandalay guests do not have reciprocal rights which keeps the Four Seasons so quiet! The Veranda was a delightful place to enjoy breakfast or early evening cocktails and the rooms were wonderful. My only complaint is that the floor to ceiling windows overlooking the strip were very dirty. Otherwise a winning choice!!

Reviews.Title: “relaxing in las vegas”
Reviews.Author: barnybrit
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 6 nights and although we have been to vegas a few times in the past, this is the first time that we have stayed at The Four Seasons. What a wonderful hotel. It was a joy to return to our room after the noise and hustle of the casinos. Our room was on the 37th floor and the view was delightful. Upon our return to the room the maid had been to administer the 'turn down' service. Lights were lowered, the bathroom cleaned....again!, sheets pulled back on the bed and the radio playing soft music, curtains drawn, etc, etc. We frequented the Verandah restaurant for breakfast, (although a little expensive), the relaxing atmosphere and delicious food made up for the outlay. The laundry service was very good and quick! The staff were wonderful and always had a smile which makes such a difference. From entering the hotel on the first day to leaving to go to the airport, our time here will be remembered fondly. If I could make a bad comment on our holiday it would be the flights. We flew with Virgin.........BA in future!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: monday
Reviews.Content: Loved the Four Seasons. My wife and I read reviews on this site prior to our visit, and those mentioned property being an oasis in the hectic, high energy Strip. We completely agree. Loved the fact that we can take a short elevator ride to Mandalay Bay and a quick tram to the Excaliber, yet not have to deal with the gambling traffic and noise. The spa was excellent, and the service throughout the hotel is truly 5-star, without being pretentious. Also room service was timely, accurate and polite. Overall, we highly recommend the Four Seasons. Bad experiences are inevitable at any hotel property, but the odds are in your favor at the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Loved the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: Lets_Go_Bucks!
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Four Seasons last week for three nights and it was a wonderful stay. The hotel was everything I expected and more! I rely heavily on the recommendations of the Trip Advisor web site, and it didn't disappoint. The location is perfect, and the staff and amenities were exceptional. I will look for a Four Seasons the next time I travel. We ate at one of the hotel restaurants the last day, The Verandah, and it was great. I wish we would have tried it sooner. I had the best hamburger and sweet potato fries there. You must try the fries!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice in Las Vegas for a couple”
Reviews.Author: Beyond_Boston
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons is always a great choice around the world ... but in Las Vegas there is plenty of competition ... so don't get caught up in the 'Four Seasons' namebrand too quickly ... it is a great hotel ... but us Americans get lost in namebrand excitement ... there are better hotel choices - but they depend on certain factors ... If you are an active couple that visits the gym/spa AND pool daily --- the Four Seasons should be on your list to consider ... BUT only if you can grab a rate of $325 or less ... The room at the Four Seasons is standard in my opinion ... nothing spectacular ... but the Spa/Gym and Pool services are where the value comes into play ... The pool is secluded and quiet ... the staff provide magazines, a pitcher of lemon water, occasional fruits, and spritz ... it is very nice ... the pool is small ... but a nice retreat for a couple ... not so well suited for kids. The gym is also nice ... small but it has what you need ... the staff in the gym will bring you lemon water as you exercise ... they also provide headphones ... So ... if you do not go to the gym/spa and pool ... then start looking at prices as a decision point ... if you can capture the four seasons within 50 a night of the Venetian or Wynn ... then maybe consider it ... By the way ... the Wynn has the best bed I have ever slept in ... and the Venezia Tower at the Venetian is the nicest standard room in Vegas ... Especially for a party of 3 or more ... the sunken living room is great to sit, chat, and have a cocktail while others shower, etc ... <the guys will understand> ....

Reviews.Title: “wonderful time at the four seasons”
Reviews.Author: julias
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the FS Sept. 8-10, 2006, and it was a great experience. We had previously stayed at "the hotel" and been very disappointed by its overall lack of customer service. Not so at the Four Seasons - all was wonderful. Staff really goes out of their way for the guests, especially at the pool where they bring you cold melon, popsicles, ice water, and clean your sunglasses, oh, and forgot, cold cucumber slices "to refresh your eyes." The concierge was extremely polite and helpful, as well. I really liked the intimacy of the FS as compared to the large gaming hotels.

Reviews.Title: “four seasons exceeds expectations again”
Reviews.Author: lfelix
Reviews.Content: We splurged on a weekend getaway to celebrate my 30th b-day august 19 - 21. We found a great package deal through southwest vacations. Four seasons was such a nice peaceful retreat from the las vegas scene. The staff was excellent. At check in we asked if we could change our room from two doubles to one king. Not only did our check in attendant do this for us, she also gave us a double upgrade to strip view and gave us a room 3 hours before check in. Wow! Be sure to spend some time relaxing at the pool. The pool attendents will help you pick out lounge chairs (they are cushy too) cover them with towels for you and bring you ice water. Magazines are available for you to borrow. The pool attendents occasionally walk around with treats such as cucumber slices and evian spritz. We did go check out the mandalay bay wave pool, it was fun. However, it was so crowded there, we could not find a lounge, and we walked around for 20 minutes trying to find towels. We did not stay at the manalay pool for long, we were so glad we could escape to the four seasons pool. We enjoyed the poolside menu, although it was pricey. We ordered one entree plus a side of fries and shared to help strech the dollar. We tried the sweet potatoe fries, they also had some parmesan truffle fries that sounded really good too. It is not on the menu, you can ask for it though. the beds were really nice, I felt like I was sleeping in a cloud. Then in the morning, I could look out the window at the clouds which were at eye level. the hotel did send a card and cake to our room for our celebration. We tried out the champagne brunch at mandalay bay, it was great and worth the wait in line. I am not sure why one would compare this hotel to the four seasons resort at hualalai in hawaii. We have been very fortunate to stay at hualalai, which is many times over the nicest resort I have ever been to. I believe the rate was about 3x the rate of the vegas property. Obviously vegas is not hawaii. How would an outdoor shower work at the 39th floor? Ok, enough sarcasm. We have a wonderful stay, and I plan to visit this property again. If you are looking for upscale surroundings away from the vegas crowds and excellent customer service, this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, but not over the top nice”
Reviews.Author: Tinotravel
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the FS Las Vegas and overall a very nice experience. Excellent service and a very comfortable room. My only observation is that if you are used to the FS resorts you will mostly likely be a bit disappointed. I’ve been to a few other properties, most recently the Four Seasons Hualalai on the big island of Hawaii, and if you expecting the same type of experience you will be disappointed. The room in Hawaii was big and beautiful. Incredible outdoor shower! The pools were also very nice. The Las Vegas FS is a different experience. Smaller and very plain rooms. Though very comfortable, they were still pretty pedestrian. The pool and the rest of the property is also far less appealing than Hawaii. That being said, the FS Hawaii was also a lot more expensive. In Las Vegas we got a room for $250, which wasn’t so bad. I still recommend the FS Las Vegas for the simple reasons that the service was great and it is so nice to have a quiet hotel lobby in Las Vegas. That’s what will keep me going back!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great experience”
Reviews.Author: ShaunaSchain
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for work, and I've written a few scathing reviews on supposedly good places, so in defense, I feel I should send an article about a place I love. First, you can never go wrong with a Four Seasons--they really get it right. They learn your name when you check in, and never forget it! We almost always travel with our dog (Boo) who was a welcomed guest (they bring him a tray and a pet menu). They even have a dog-walking service! We were starting to get worried Boo was gone so long, but it turns out, the bellman was having so much fun with our dog, he insisted on showing him to all the departments! There is nothing more relaxing than checking into a Four Seasons--service is impeccable, when you travel a lot, you just say "whew, all is okay now." Other great plus about the FSLV is the Mandalay Bay is attached, so if you want more restaurant choices or a little gambling fun, it's all there, with the luxury of a Four Seasons, and they have good rates! I couldn't be more pleased with this place, and I can't wait to go back next week!

Reviews.Title: “Four reasons to enjoy the Four Seasons - late July 2006”
Reviews.Author: Tripping_Up
Reviews.Content: If you need to ease your way into a very different time zone or just make that transition to Las Vegas living, then there are four very good reasons to choose the Four Seasons. It just fell short of 5 TripAdvisior 'O's - the whys and wherefores in a moment. The fab-four facts are i) Good rooms, ii) Cool pool, iii) Super service and iv) Casino-free but easy to use Mandalay Bay one if you feel the urge. It was our second stay here as a family of five (three children aged from 10 to 16) and we arrived after a 10 hour flight from the UK. We'd booked two connecting rooms, with a good discount off the second room, a $50 per day voucher for extras (about two breakfasts) and entry to the Shark Reef at Mandalay Bay. At check-in we were pleased to find only one person in front of us and that we'd been upgraded to a Strip-view room. The rooms are huge with great views, even if the view of the Strip is only a fifth of the view as a whole (only mention it because if I'd paid for a Strip view I'd been disappointed it didn't fill the panorama). We'd have been happy having a twin-bedded room with a roll-away bed for the smallest child and saved ourselves $250 a night on the second discounted room, but the hotel was unwilling to budge on this one. I'd been told it was for fire safety reasons when I'd made the call to book the rooms - but we found lots of other hotels happy to oblige in San Diego, Santa Barbara and Venice Beach (one of the reasons they 4-S didn't get full marks). Okay, the other factors for just failing on 'Excellent' rating were as follows: * The Family Deal promises drinks and cookies for the children on arrival in the room - but they weren't there and we had to nudge the Front Desk to provide the items for which we were paying. * Another disappointment was at breakfast where the free re-fills of orange juice or smoothie that we had enjoyed during our last stay 3 years ago had stopped - $9 for a glass of juice IS a bit steep. You can breakfast easily enough in the Mandalay Bay Hotel restaurants - dining there is much cheaper too. * The ensuite bathrooms are beginning to show their age - plugs not working properly in the sink and fittings showing wear and tear, don't get me wrong, this is hair-splitting because they are still good but I stayed in the revamped Hilton Hotel in Sydney recently and its bathrooms are fantastic, they even have a plasma TV on the wall at the foot of the bath! On the plus side, the service at breakfast was very, very good and the beds, bedding and pillows are just the most comfortable you can find. Great job by the housekeeping staff - the room was immaculate every afternoon. The rooms are well equipped with good plasma TVs, chairs etc - but if you want milk with your coffee you have to bring your own for some reason. It's also a huge plus if you have children for them to make full use of the Mandalay Bay Hotel's beach and wave machine pool, the rapids too - and it was fantastic at very busy times there to be able to retreat to the Four Season's private pool and have free ice creams, mineral water spray and even cucumber slices for your jet-lagged eyelids (I kid you not). One other observation - if you are a family of five, use the monorail from Mandalay Bay to the Luxor of Excalibur for local transport, but after that use cabs as the general public monorail system is a ludicrous $5 per person and $25 gets a taxi to take you most of the places you want. We stayed three nights and it was a great way to get over the flight and we loved every minute. We would go back again but hope they don't penny pinch at breakfast any further and make plans to upgrade the bathrooms in good time.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: catburd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons Hotel from August 4- August 7th. All the positive reviews were right on target. The Verandah restaurant is wonderful. We ordered champagne and they brought snacks, strawberries and chocolate truffels. The pool area was georgeous. As stated, they help you to a chair and set it up with towels. Then you are brought a large pitcher of ice water with lemon. They then come by with evian to spritz, cucumbers for your eyes, fresh fruit and popciles. It was so calming compared to the crazy Vegas pools. You can also order a wonderful lunch brought on a tray right at your seat. The rooms are first rate with a bed so comfortable you will never want to leave. The bathrooms are spacious with a large tub and a large shower. Everything expireneced at this hotel was first class especially the service which was always there for you. You also do not have to walk through the casino to get to your room. Can not wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “calm in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: gofer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the FSLV 27-30th July. Firstly I have to say it is not the best FS experience I have had but I think that needs to be put into the context of the other offerings in LV. I think that paradoxically in this city where anytghing seems possible you are unlikely to get the perfect hotel experience! We arrived early and were checked in immediately to our booked strip view room. I agree with some other coments here that the room was maybe a little bit tired in terms of decor. However the view down the LV strip was incredible from the 36th floor south strip location. (The counter to this is that it is too far to walk to the other attractions so be aware the you will have to cab it to and from the hotel to everywhere else in LV).. The breakfasts we took in the Verandah restaurant were superb with good service (we did not eat in the hotel in the evening). At the pool we received excellent service with all the freebies that have been mentioned before by very attentive and relaxed staff. The pool area was however very busy and I could no way describe it as a relaxing experience. Screaming kids were aplenty and sorry to say that the FS tends to attract the loud brash types who are eager to tell the world what they are doing and thinking in the loudest of voices without any regard to the tranquility of others. This is very offputing and will be important for me in considering another FS resort hotel. On the whole though I would say the FSLV is the calmest of the LV resorts and the no gambling in the public areas is definately an attraction. If you want to find some tranquility as youi walk through the doors then you will find it here.

Reviews.Title: “What do you want from your Quality Vacation Time ?”
Reviews.Author: kalakaua
Reviews.Content: As return guests three time F.S. failed to meet any of our expectations we were hugely disappointed in the following, being given the smallest partial view window in Vegas, non return calls about room changes, vanishing soap, not being set up around the pool and being forgotten about twice, not to mention everywhere you turn fellow guests reeling with executive stress and pressure from their conventions, we checked out early seeking some tranquility, great hospitality, and an environment in which holiday makers were enjoying their hard earned vacation time - Elsewhere - What has happened to the F.S. - What a Shame !!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience at the FS”
Reviews.Author: catmom37
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons July 24-26. We booked the room as part of a SWA vacation package, and definitely got a great deal. Our reservations were for a Superior room, but the gracious front desk clerk upgraded us to a suite without us even asking for it. We arrived around 2:30pm, and were able to check in right away. However, we had to call the front desk when our luggage didn't arrive as promptly. Our suite was spacious, with a living area and extra bathroom, and the windows faced the airport, but we still had a view of the strip as well. The decor was pleasant and comfortable, the toiletries were L'Occitane (which we love), and our suite even had a portable humidifier, great for our dry eyes. We did notice the slow drainage in the sink, loud toilets, and small shower/tub, plus some wear and tear. I've never stayed in a FS before, and after reading the reviews on this website, I tried not to have very high expectations. Overall, though, we really liked this hotel and would definitely stay there again, but only if we get the same package deal. We thought the service was excellent, appreciated the quietness (we slept so soundly), and loved the pool and its amenities. Plus, it was nice having easy access to Mandalay Bay. Our pool experience was great -- we got fruit, popsicles, cold towels, Evian spritz, etc., and it didn't seem in dire need of cleaning. We noticed that the pool attendants were great with the kids there, and even saw one of the kids hug them good-bye! So, they're definitely family-friendly. The only other issue we had was with housekeeping, who forgot to replenish the sugar and cream. (But then, she also forgot to charge us for the 3 mini-bar drinks we had.) We also dined at Verandah, and I had one of the best omelettes ever! Parmesan french fries were very yummy as well. So, now that I've had the FS experience, I'm hooked!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly What I've Come to Expect from the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: Merlion1
Reviews.Content: My family (wife and 4 kids) and I spent a week around the 4th of July holiday at the Four Seasons primarily to visit relatives in the area, but also to explore areas around Las Vegas (Hoover Dam, Red Rock Canyon, etc.) and it did not disappoint. The Four Seasons Las Vegas met our high expectations of Four Seasons properties around the world and like other of their properties, they have recreated the wonderful rooms, facilities and location but really created an exceptional experience by their premium level of service accorded each guest. My expectations, in general tend to be high for Four Seasons properties and my wife and I tend to choose them regularly on our holidays because of our good experiences around the world. I was a bit apprehensive about this property in light of some of the reviews I had read about dogs on the property and my experience with Las Vegas hotels in general, but I am happy to say all of these concerns were overblown. The Four Seasons Hotel Las Vegas is in every way, deserving of the Four Seasons brand. More specifically, I'll break my review up into 3 sections: 1. Room - Excellent - If you've stayed in a Four Seasons Room, this will be no different 2. Location/Facilities - Excellent - On the Strip, but you'd never know if if you didn't want to 3. Service - Excellent - Just like any other Four Seasons ROOM - The room is exactly what we have come to expect from the Four Seasons. Firm beds, the same Four Seasons sheets. If I was to be critical, the one issue we found was that the pillows (while nice) didn't seem to be the standard Four Seasons fare. The bathroom contained both a shower and a tub, thought the shower seemed a bit small (I bumped my elbows on occassion shampooing) though functional. If you've stayed in a Four Seasons room before, this room should offer no surprises. LOCATION/FACILITIES - As our primary purpose for our visit was to visit relatives and see sights outside of the city, the Four Seasons location was perfect. Located on the top floors (35-39) of the Mandalay Bay hotel, the hotel is located at the end of the Las Vegas Strip and accessible to the airport (a short drive) and the highway (right around the corner) without having to deal with the terrible traffic that plagues the Strip around rush hour and the evening. The pool, while simple, was an oasis. You'd never know that right over the wall is the gigantic Mandalay Bay wave pool (which Four Seasons guests have access to should they choose). Even over the 4th of July holiday, we had no problems getting lounge chairs, etc. In the evening, when they close the pools (7 pm) there is a nice private walking path open to hotel guests (of the Four Seasons and Mandalay bay) only which we walked with our kids on in the late evening to get them over their jetlag. A great alternative than having them wander the Strip or in a casino. We did pop over to the Mandalay Bay a couple times during our stay to go to restaurants and a casino. The Four Seasons has several access points into the Mandalay Bay including a private access for Four Seasons guests directly into the Mandalay Bay lobby from the Four Seasons guest elevators. So there's no need to worry that you'll need ot take a cab or a long walk to the casino if that's what you'd like to do. There are a couple of restaurants on property, but we only ate at Verandah, essentially their coffee shop next to the pool. Food was fine, though the service staff and kitchen seemed a bit stretched when full during the 4th of July holiday. As a result, our breakfasts on that day took about 30-40 minutes to come out. The manager handled it nicely, though, offering a plate of freshly sliced fruit for the family until our food arrived. SERVICE - End to End service was exceptional, even for a Four Seasons, in my view. When we arrived, we were brought to our room by a guest services who noted when we wanted our rooms to be made up each day and when we preferred turn down service (and indeed, service was provided on the dot!). In addition, with 4 children, the provided milk and cookies each night and, on the day we arrived, spelled each of our children's names in colorful sponges on the bathtub which made bath time that much easier for our smaller children. If there was one criticism, like the restaurant, the valet service seemed a bit overwhelmed during the 4th of July weekend. In summary, on all aspects, the Four Seasons met our high expectations of Four Seasons properties around the world and like other of their properties, they have recreated the wonderful rooms, facilities and location but really created an exceptional experience by their premium level of service accorded each guest.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great experience”
Reviews.Author: Family-from-USA
Reviews.Content: Since we selected our hotel based on other reviews, we feel compelled to share our experience. We had a Strip View room that was nice at night. We liked the lack of crowd and noise in the lobby and other common areas. When we saw the crowd in Mandalay Bay, Bellagio and others, we appreciated what we had in Four Seasons. This allowed us to have the best of both worlds - peace and the casino experience. The staff were wonderful. We had a room that shared a door with the next room. After a day, the next room had guests with kids who were playing all the time. We asked for another room and the front desk moved us as soon as they had another room available. When we wanted to go to other casinos, shows or restaurants, we had to take a cab since Four Seasons is on one end of the strip. The traffic at night didn't help. We really enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased with FS”
Reviews.Author: Msbness
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed the past few days at the FS in Vegas. I will NEVER stay anywhere else when in town. We were upgraded to a wonderful suite upon our arrival by a very kind staff, while they gave our infant son gifts to entertain him during our check in process. Staff is consistent, friendly and reliable from room service to maid service. Every thing we asked for was attended to in a prompt, efficient manner. Verandah restaurant is very good, we wonderful smoked salmon for breakfast. I had a massage with Tim, which was excellent. Spa is immaculate and well run. Our flight left in the evening, so after checking out, we hung out at the pool, then used the spa to get ready for our travel. Pool is nice, a quiet oasis from the chaos of Mandalay Bay. Why one would ever bother to line up like cattle and venture through the gates to that mess is beyond me. The FS pool has great perks: pitchers of H2O with lemon, popsicles, fruit, cold towels, sunglass cleaning, etc. Easy access to gamble. You simply walk through a door and you're in the middle of Mandalay Bay. Mandalay then connects to Luxor and Excalibur, not you'd want to go there normally, but the tables might be more desireable to some.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect getaway for family of four”
Reviews.Author: FS_Junkie_with_kids
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property from Jun 19-22 and enjoyed it immensely. The hotel lives up to the Four Seasons' reputation and is a nice change of pace from the casinos and smoke which are easily accessible through the convenient door to the Mandalay Bay hotel. Dining at the Verandah is a delicious alternative, but there are tons of other restaurants to check out around town and I would recommend getting out a bit and sampling other fare. We liked the dinner buffet at the Wynn Las Vegas. The pool was nice and poolside dining is from the Verandah. A standard touch is a pitcher of ice cold water and cups when they set up your chaise. The Mandalay Bay pools were fun but didn't seem particularly clean- you could see the sand and feel the grime in the lazy river. And the wave pool activates once every 30 seconds as opposed to going for 6 minutes, stopping for six minutes and going again and the bottom is rough enough to scrape up body surfers so you might wear a shirt for that activity. If you like good service, I'm not sure you can beat the FS. The doormen and bell captains were EXCELLENT. The lobby greeter was helpful (I asked if you could charge dining items at Mandalay Bay to the FS-- you can, but you should bring a credit card if you intend to rent or buy an inner tube) and the front desk staff was FANTASTIC. The concierge staff was super helpful and helped us book tickets to Mystere at Treasure Island. They also helped my husband charge his cell phone because he had forgotten his. That's service. House keeping was also prompt and everything materially was as you would expect of a FS property. Spa was also very nice. Small-ish workout area but everything you would probably look for. Massage by Nicole was fantastic. (Visited the hair salon in Mandalay Bay and liked that very much as well.) Definitely recommend this property. Couples may also want to consider the Wynn.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel, Service made our vacation a memorable stay!”
Reviews.Author: dcv2002
Reviews.Content: This was my wife's and I first vacation away from our kids. We spent 5 nights at the Four Seasons Las Vegas hotel at Mandalay Bay. Though we only stayed in a "Supeior" room with a king bed and a view of the pool/airport, this hotel was everything that it was supposed to be. It made for a memorable vacation that was difficult to come home from. Let's start with the amenities and service: * Pool service with escorting to lounge chairs (never a wait), constant service, free ice water, popcorn, ice pops, oranges, pineapple, glasses cleaning, etc. The pool service was an oasis from the craziness of the Mandalay Bay complex. * Free access to the spa/workout facilities. At most hotels you pay daily for this, here its complementary to guests. Want to leave your stuff in a locker while you stroll over to the wave pool at MB, use the locker. Want to workout on a treadmill before going to the pool, take a shower in the locker room before heading out. Amazing (spa services though exspenive were great). * Room was ultra-comfortable. Stinks having to come back home and sleep in ordinary bed. Never a problem with cleaning of room, would always be done multiple times a day. * Easy, quick access to rental car through valet. (There is a minor charge however) * Quiet, elegant dining at Verandah cafe (espeically Weekend morning brunch) * Though our kids were not with us, it appears that they are a very kid friendly hotel. * Every single time we bumped into a hotel employee, we were always greeted with a hello. * Though it is at the far south end of the strip, it does have quick, easy access to I-15 which is easier and quicker to drive up than the Strip itself (and quick to the airport). * Access to MB pools, but ability to get back to quietness of FS * No crowds at all. When walking through MB and especially Bellagio, I was amazed at how crowded these places where, especially the check-in area and valet/taxi area. Never ever experienced this at FS. What I basically found since FS is a HOTEL and not a CASINO, they care more about the service than the casino dollars. With good service they make you want to come back (and that is exactly the way my wife and I feel). Unfortunately, we had too good a time on vacation and its difficult to get back to normal life after being pampered at the FS

Reviews.Title: “Loved Four Seasons, Not Fond of Mandalay Bay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I chose Four Seasons because I was traveling with three small children (4,3, and 1). We went to Vegas during one of the busiest weekends (Memorial Day), and our selection of this hotel was a wise one. They welcomed my kids so nicely. After 5+ hours on a plane, it was so rewarding to have them received so well. Yes, I know Vegas isn't for kids, but I think so long as you don't expose them to things that are really inappropriate, it's fine. The room was very nice, the pool was nice and they are constantly coming around offering various things (sliced oranges, clean your sunglasses, spritz you with evian, etc...) - very nice and pampering. I would hang up the phone with housekeeping with a special request, and literally, they were knocking on my door in minutes. I had a party for my husband's 40th at the La Sala Room in the Veranda, and it was outstanding. I would say that this hotel EXCEEDED my expectations in all aspects. The only thing I didn't like about it, is that if you are tempted to visit Mandalay Bay Pool, Casino, etc...it is like a being at Seaside Park Boardwalk in NJ on the 4th of July.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons is the absolute BEST!”
Reviews.Author: Dragonfly972
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Four Seasons for a business trip. I ended up staying longer simply because I refused to leave! . . . I want to move in. From the moment you drive up to the valet, you know this is the ultimate customer service oriented establishment. Don't confuse the Four Seasons with the Mandalay Bay just because they occupy the same buildings. The entrance for the Four Seasons is on the other side of the complex, with their own entrance, valet, staff, express elevators, grounds, pools, etc. . . The rooms are not overly palacial. But, they are extremely comfortable and complete, down to the robes and slippers. My view of the strip, from the 38th floor (floor to ceiling, wall to wall windows), was the most incredible I have ever experienced in Vegas. Absolutely stunning. The location, the facilities, the service. . . unparalleled. I will never stay anywhere else in Las Vegas ever again. . . Pricey yes, but I'm worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons Las Vegas Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The first thought that I had when I arrived at the Four Seasons with my friends was that it's really nice not having to inhale cigarette smoke while checking into a hotel that you'll be spending quite a few dollars at. This had a great impression on me, and it set the tone for an impressive stay here. The room was very nice, though it's nothing overly special. I would describe it as 'tastefully understated.' I wasn't knocked off my socks when I first entered the room, but over the course of weekend, I grew to appreciate the high quality of materials used in the room (crown moulding, cream-colored marble in the bathroom, nice carpet in the room). Before I arrived, I called the concierge and she made dinner (Craftsteak and Picasso) and show (Avenue Q). Another concierge made nightlife arrangements for us. The concierge staff there is probably the best that I have ever dealt with. My only complaint was with the weekend brunch. It took almost half-an-hour for us to get seated for brunch on Saturday, even though it didn't seem overly crowded. The quality of the food was high, but there wasn't much selection. Our room package included a daily credit, and in hindsight, I wish we had used the credit at Charlie Palmer's steakhouse. The staff, however, warmly showered us with 'thank yous' when we left, so that made up for the experience. Although pricey, the Four Seasons provided the best experience in Las Vegas that I've ever had. No doubt, I will return.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: stuckintraffic
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Mandalay Bay and enjoyed the pool and atmosphere of the hotel. We were booked to stay there again the week before Easter. We arrived early and were allowed to check in at 10:00 which was great, but it turned out that the hotel was booked solid with multiple conventions in house and so the options on available views from the rooms was limited. They were extremely nice about letting us in almost 5 hours early and gave us the best view available, but it was mostly looking at the airport and partially looking at the pool, and there was a lot of noise from the airport. The view from the room also looked straight down at the Four Seasons private pool.......you can see where this is going. Within 30 minutes we had been allowed to cancel our stay at Mandalay, move to the Four Seasons with a complimentary upgrade, no cancellation fee, and still get into our room over 4 hours early. The Four Seasons is a non-casino hotel (Mandalay Bay's is adjacent) so the difference in the noise and traffic level is dramatic. It was like walking into another world. There was no noise in the hallways, none in the room, you couldn't hear anything from the rooms on either side or above you. The room and the public spaces of the hotel are immaculate. The pool and the pool staff were amazing, exactly what you come to expect from Four Seasons and more! We really enjoyed being able to go to the Mandalay Beach when we felt like dealing with the crowd, but not having to worry about trying to find an available chair, because when we were ready to sit and catch some rays, all we had to do was take the short walk back to our private oasis with plenty of chairs, attendants to lay out your towels, spritz you with Evian, wipe your sunglasses, bring you pineapple and orange slices, and chilled towels. You can also order meals poolside and it was excellent. We have stayed at Four Seasons properties before and we were still very impressed at all levels with this location. Rooms, amenities, staff, food... all excellent. The 42" plasma in the rooms was impressive also. We WILL be back. Kudos also to the Mandalay Bay for how well we were handled in getting a room 5 hours ahead of check in and then being allowed to switch hotels without a fee.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families with small children”
Reviews.Author: Sacramento_CADave
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Four Seasons with our 19 month-old daughter for 2 nights. It was an excellent experience. We recommend this hotel if you have small children. The hotel has a convenient location and does not have a casino, so it is quieter and has virtually no cigarette smoke. The staff is very friendly and helpful. We were put in a room on the 36th floor with an incredible view of the Strip. We arrived in our room to find that a crib had been delivered and the room had been baby-proofed, which was very helpful. The room was very comfortable and nicely decorated. We had two meals at the Verandah restaurant in the hotel and both the service and food were great. We will definitely stay here again the next time we are in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “A welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: sanfrann
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on Super Bowl weekend for a business trip. While the rest of town was crowded, noisy, and smoky, we felt like we were in another town altogether. I realize many come here precisely for the noise, crowd, activity, etc., however we don't necessarily appreciate those things, feeling like we enjoy going out into it but want to be able to come back to a nice quiet luxurious spot to sleep. This is what we got - the beds are comfy, the rooms quiet, nicely appointed with up-to-the-minute furnishings (updated from when we stayed here last year), the floral arrangements in the public spaces are incredibly lush and fragrant, the baths are spacious and chic, and the service on par with a 5 diamond property. We were always welcomed back by bellmen, maids, concierge, various managers and front desk managers. We were asked by several how we were enjoying our stay. I can't say enough about the quality of the food. We are definitely "foodies" from the SFBay Area, and from the room service breakfast, to a catered affair in one of the meeting rooms, the food was all first class and exceptional. (In particular, at the catered dinner there was a salad that came atop a mushroom-filled ravioli that was to die for). Indeed, there are countless food choices in and around town, but you can feel comfortable ordering from any of the facilities in the hotel that you will get exemplary food choices, though expensive. I can't speak to the pool facilities as we didn't use them this trip. The one downside, and this is probably due to it being Super Bowl weekend as well as Ultimate Fighting event AND a George Strait concert, was transportation was tough to come by - and I mean specifically cabs. We didn't know of the existence of the hotel's car or we would have requested it, though I doubt it would have been available. Since the hotel is behind the Mandalay it isn't approachable very easily, few cabs actually made it all the way back to the Four Season's porte cochere. The wait each time was more than 15 minutes, but, again; consider the weekend we went. All in all - we'll definitely be returning here.

Reviews.Title: “spa was great!”
Reviews.Author: 1trillium
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted a quick getaway for New Year's and the Four Seasons was the only 4 star and above hotel with a suite left.
