Check in was at 3 p.m but we arrived around 10 a.m. They allowed us to check in at noon because the occupants didn't leave until 11. We went to the spa and it was great. We both got massages and took advantage of the steam room and shower. When we did get into the suite it was beautiful with a fantastic view. The second day we had some business to take care of and didn't leave the room until 2 p.m. and got back around 6 p.m. Our room had not been cleaned. We had to request service the third day. VERY disappointed since it was a suite on the top floor overlooking the strip, it wasn't cheap and we just felt they should have been a bit more prompt with service. We had room service alot and I have to say I was extremely disappointed. My husband had a couple meals he was pleased with. Overall the experience was average. Upon check out they did ask how the stay was and I told them it was good. I would stay again if there were no other suites available in the more centrally located hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Renovation and Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Four Season's before and found the decor to be... well outdated. However, upon my most recent stay was very impressed with the renovation of the guest rooms, including plasma screen TV's. The service was incredible! Every request that I made was met with a smile and quick response. I was happy to know that the hotel is dog friendly and had special treats for my children who were always addressed by name. The spa was superb, gym beautiful! Front desk was effecient and happy! Had a great stay. The employees all seem happy and that is what really makes a hotel great! Thank you and we will be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons disappointment”
Reviews.Author: jimbuddi
Reviews.Content: Well let me start by saying, that if you are not a pet lover stay away from this hotel. I am a lifelong Las Vegas resident and as a special evening to celebrate my engagement I booked a room at the Four Seasons. Upon check in I thought that I had used the wrong entrance and entered the check in for a kennel ( There were 4 dogs and a cat wandering the lobby ). Evidentially the 4 Seasons is the only hotel on the Strip that allows animals. We arrived just past the check in time of 3 p.m. and was told that our " Superior " room was not ready yet. We were offered a drink and asked if we would like to be directed to the Spa..?? After about 45 minutes I asked the desk again if our room was ready and told that it looked like it was...almost ready. Like they had a crystal ball and could see that they were just finishing up. The room was quite typical. One normal sized room, with a view of the airport. The bathroom was nice. I expected for a Four Seasons that the bedding would have been appointed with a high thread count sheet, but found it to be quite normal. I had also expected an upgraded mattress, that even Hampton Inn has now, but found a typical mattress with what looked like a thin cloth mattress pad on it. Maybe a piddle pad for the animals. There was a flat screen plasma T.V. in the room, but with no digital capabilities or HDTV all of the images were just poor quality stretched out over a big plasma. The room next door to us had some sort of a small animal in it that kept us awake during the night whining, from under the door of the room it was in. We didn't use any of the services at the hotel with the exception of the consierge who booked a reservation for us for dinner. I have been to the pool at the hotel in the summer time and it is quite and nice. I have to say that the housekeeping staff is very friendly in the halls, always saying good evening or good morning, but noticed that they only addressed me and not my future wife. As we checked out and headed downstairs, we proceeded to the desk through the beautiful marble floored hallway. We noticed as we walked down the hall, a porter standing ahead of us holding a small towel. He said nothing to us as we approached, but we quickly noticed that he was standing next to a small pile of dog poop, that we would have stepped in if we hadn't noticed it. The porter said nothing, but only seemed that he was waiting for us to pass before he bent over to pick it up. I was anxious for someone at the check out desk to ask how my stay was, but instead was just greeted with, "well that was a short stay". I held my tongue because all that I wanted to say was, "it wasn't short enough". There was never any effort to ask if everything was ok, or if we enjoyed ourselves. In closing, I will have to say that if you are looking for a luxury experience in Las Vegas, this is not the place, unless you are traveling with a pet and would like it to be able to poop on fine marble. Sorry Four Seasons Hotel Kennel and Spa but I won't be back nor will I recommend it to anyone that I know.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service keeps us coming back”
Reviews.Author: littleplum
Reviews.Content: My husband travels to Vegas for business, so sometimes we make a long weekend out of it. This is our favorite hotel on the strip. Rooms: The rooms are well-kept and spacious, with nice large marble bathrooms. If you've ever stayed on the strip, you know to expect screaming drunken revelry promptly at 3 AM. During our stays at the Four Seasons, this has happened once. (While very annoying, we still marvel at the fact that it's only happened once.) Actually, we stayed here earlier this year during the NBA Summer League event mentioned in another review below, and luckily all was quiet on our floor. Service: This is the highlight of our experience at this hotel. It truly makes a difference when the staff is thoroughly attentive and competent. Once, when our TV remote stopped working, a replacement arrived less than 5 minutes after a call to the front desk. Every restaurant reservation made through the concierge resulted in wonderful seating (including Emeril's own table at "Emeril's" in the MGM). The maids even straighten and organize your running shoes during service. There is a house car to take you to other locations on the strip free of charge, though tipping is allowed. (You can't reserve a house car in advance, but if one is available they'll bring it around for you.) Gym: Excellent hotel gym, functionally as well as aesthetically (I like the butter-colored walls). The cardio machines are modern, with individual TVs for media hounds. The weight room has standard dumbell and resistance training equipment. The free water and Gatorade is especially appreciated during and after exercise. Food/Cafe: We had an excellent breakfast at the hotel restaurant; the corned beef hash is very tasty, as are the blueberry pancakes. There is so much excellent food to be had in Vegas, though, that we usually dine elsewhere. While not inside the Four Seasons proper, I found a decent cafe to work in downstairs in Mandalay Bay, near The Border Grill. There is plenty of reading light from both overhead and a large window nearby. (Ordinarily I wouldn't review ideal study environments in Vegas, but it took me all afternoon to find this place so there you go.) Overall: We've had great stays here, with incredible service.

Reviews.Title: “High expectations, very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: audreyport2001
Reviews.Content: After doing a penthouse at Bellagio, we wanted to try FS. While the room was sufficient, I was EXTREMELY disappointed that the pool areas at both Four Seasons AND Mandalay Bay were closed. This is unacceptable. I could have stayed at Bellagio or at the Monte Carlo for 1/5 the price and they had full service for their pool areas...I should have been informed of this and the price of rooms should have been cut for this lack of major amenity. Upon checkout, a whole HOST of phone charges that weren't ours were on our bill. We demanded they be removed, only to be told there would be an "Investigation" into them..yeah, whatever. Go right ahead because I never used the phone and I'm sure one of your employees had a wonderful time talking to his or her relatives in San Juan. But don't try to pin $250 worth of phone charges on me. Overall, not impressed with FS and probably won't return.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Stay on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: run2travel
Reviews.Content: I chose the Four Seasons because I wanted a peaceful non-smokey place on the strip to stay. And, that's what I got. Service was great. We were able to check into our room early. The only problem was that the jucuzzi wasn't working because there was a heating problem. The worse part is that the employees working at the pool didn't know there was a problem and couldn't help me out. The rooms weren't as modern and luxurious as I thought they would be. But, it seems that soon they will be going through a modernization.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised at the service...”
Reviews.Author: JRP
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 3 day stay at this beautiful property. Overall, I was very impressed with the atmosphere and ambience of the facility. However, my expectations of the service and rooms prior to arrival were met with disappointment. My greeting by the doorman was pleasant and he seemed eager to assist, direct, and answer questions. My next experience was at the front desk where it began to become evident that the staff was not consistent with those that I've experienced at other Four Seasons, Ritz Carltons, etc. From that point on, the staff, in comparison to others noted, seemed aloof and unattentive. My pre-arrival requests were ignored and unacknowledged when reminded. My housekeeping calls required follow-up to garner response. I was awakened by my room service breakfast that arrived 4 hours early. In general, the pleasant and eager attention and greetings that define The Four Seasons did not exist. My spa visit was comfortable, relaxing and quite enjoyable. My massage by Melinda was superb and she is very professional. Otherwise, the complete spa experience was not of 5 star caliber. The private pool area was beautifully appointed and a relaxing respite. Especially considering the lack of a crowd (3 hours of absolute seclusion in the sun). Must have been scared off by the calendar because the weather was perfect. Minimal staff, but obviously present if called upon. Charlie Palmer Steak House offered a superior dining experience. No doubt that I would visit this restaurant again. I am not a snob, nor am I a demanding or critical guest. I took it all very much in stride and I would easily stay here again. I appreciate the presence of The Four Seasons in a destination that largely lacks such elegance and comfort. But I do think that it bears stating that a property displaying "The Four Seasons" at it's door should provide a consistent level of service worthy of its name and reputation. I don't think that I can rate this Four Seasons as excellent. That would not allow any room for praise of those that truly are.

Reviews.Title: “Adam”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneAdam
Reviews.Content: Can people read ? The four seasons is a great company and note It is a serene enviro Yes It clearly notes "The only retreat of its kind within this dynamic magnet for international travel, Four Seasons Las Vegas is an oasis of tranquillity and refinement a short distance from world-class entertainment and the baccarat table. " aLSO NOTE THE MAP Of course being bias But read quick facts because it states "Centrepiece of the exciting Mandalay Bay Resort & Casino, a 60-acre (24-hectare) resort and entertainment development at the south end of the Las Vegas Strip" Put special needs in an E-mail before YOU go and also look up YOUR hotel . It will help you don't go blind folded. Look EVERYTHING on the webpage it annoys how people don't read. As noted on their web page. Can any one help me with The George V or the New York FS.

Reviews.Title: “Average vs. Other FS”
Reviews.Author: VWNYC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the FS from 11/16 - 11/20 to celebrate my boyfriend's 30th b-day. The front desk and concierge staff were polite and distant (Not the type that go out of their way to make their guests feel warm and fuzzy). However, services at the pool and at the spa were excellent. Also,the food at the Verandah was delicious and priced very reasonably ($50 for 2 for breakfast). Had breakfast there every morning and are still thinking about the their french toast and truffle fries (great pool side snack for $5!). The crowd was a bit old (i.e. 40 and above) and not glamourous. All and all, the hotel lacks the energy of other high end Vegas hotels. Will most likely stay at theHotel or Wynn next time.

Reviews.Title: “A haven of tranquility.”
Reviews.Author: BritEngland
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a week in Las Vegas (our first) which we thoroughly enjoyed, not least because we chose to stay at the Four Seasons. While enjoying all the facilities of the impressive and lively Mandalay Bay complex, the Four Seasons provides a welcome escape from the noise and hubbub of the mainstream casino based resort hotels. The Four Seasons public and guest rooms exude luxury that is matched by a consistently excellent standard of service around the clock. All of the attributes of a truly five star hotel with none of the disadvantages of the public thoroughfares that blight most of the other luxury hotels in Town. Expensive, but very, very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing - nothing special, poor value, blah rooms”
Reviews.Author: imaliveru
Reviews.Content: This is clearly the weakest link in the Four Seasons chain. What a disappointment. The rooms are totally standard, nothing special at all -- THEHotel is half the price and TWICE AS GOOD in terms of rooms, amenities, service, etc. I agree - the long walk to the elevators from the lobby is a bummer. The pool is OK, calm but nothing special. The bluecheese hamburger from room service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and Elegant Oasis”
Reviews.Author: Oceanangel
Reviews.Content: Our stay at "THE FOUR SEASONS" from October 9th till the 13th will remain one of our most wonderful memories of LAS VEGAS. We enjoyed the rush and excitement of a city that has to be experienced to be believed. This was our 1st trip to VEGAS, But most definitely will not be our last. Upon arriving at the FOUR SEASONS the staff at the front door, checkin desk and Concierge was first rate. We waited for about 1 hour for our room, which provided us the opportunity to investigate what was instore for us. The room was lovely and spacious with a grandstand view of the entire strip. The view was beautilful during the day and spectacular at night. The bathroom, bar facility, comfy bed and bed linen made our 4 nights a dream come true. Room service was informative, friendly and precise. The Four Seasons pool area was medium to large with friendly and outstanding service from the staff walking around spraying cool evian water, and offering guests orange and cucumber slices, cool ice water with lemon and cool towels. It was also a delight to be referred to by name. The other main Mandalay Bay pools were nice to have access too. They had a sandy beach in the pool area together with a wave machine and other pools. This was a lot of fun, but it was even more fun to return to the privacy and comfort of the private pool, excellent gym and relaxing spa. The Hotel was graciously designed paying attention to precise details such as inlaid marble floors, decadent flower arrangements and elegant decor. The lifts and access to Mandalay Bay Resort & Casino were within easy reach from the main lobby, along with the monorail heading north. Our only disappointments were: - HANDTOWEL RAIL WAS BROKEN - FAULTY LOCK ON DRINKS CABINET - A-1 SAUCE IN RESTAURANT,SERVED IN BOTTLE NOT DISH - NO RECYCLE BINS (COME ON PEOPLE) Once again, we will return to Vegas and most likely we will stay with our friends at the Four Seasons. Thank-you!!

Reviews.Title: “BEst Hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jeezer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the FS Las Vegas for three nights. This is simply a great hotel. After having stayed at pretty much every 5 star hotel in LV, the Four Seaosns was a great change. No casino, quiet pool, great food, and a terrific room. We were upgraded to a Jr. Suite and were very comfortable. The room could use a bit of a renovation and I understand that they plan on doing that soon. The service was impeccable in every respect from the pool to the concierge to the doormen. One night when we got stuck at the Forum Shops, the hotel car picked us up at no charge. I love that!! I did find the charge to check my e-mail at the business center to be a bit unnecessary as I was paying $475/night. For that price, everything should be included. The treatment I had at the spa was very good but the facility was a bit small and lacked some features that you would expect at a hotel of this quality. A small but noticable flaw. I will stay here again. I love the pampering

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Retreat among Glitz”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were staying at the Mandalay Bay Hotel; it was a disaster, so we found ourselves asking for a room at the Four Seasons wanting a queit and elegant place to retreat after enjoying the glitzy part of Las Vegas, i.e. the shows, trendy dinner, clubs or casinos. The Four Seasons never disappoints. The room was spectacular as was the pool area and food served at its restaurants. The staff went out of their way to make the stay memorable. I would highly recommend it to anyone who wants an oasis in the desert.

Reviews.Title: “Great expectations?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel, and if I wasn't familiar with other Four Seasons hotels I might not whine. However, in this instance, the usual exhorbitant price is difficult to justify. The rooms, while nice, are not much different from the typical Mandalay rooms. The private pool area is rather small, and quickly gets crowded. On the upside, the service remains impeccable, and the spa/gym is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “not your typical Las Vegas hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This may have been my most comfortable trip to Las Vegas. The Four Seasons is a welcome oasis -- no slot machines or other casino business in the way. The staff is friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the little things”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at a Four Seasons and it was a treat. The staff is so accomodating. I would say that's the best thing about this hotel. When you arrive at the pool, someone is waiting to help you to find you a seat and get you all set up with cold water, menus or anything else you need. Someone came around on what was a really hot day with cold towels, then orange slices to eat and then cucumber slices to put on your eyes. I have never experienced that at any hotel I've stayed at. The Charlie Palmer Steakhouse was great. A little dark but food was real good. If you aren't into gambling this is an even better choice as it is secluded from Mandalay Bay. But if you are into playing in the casino, it's a short walk from the elevators. Rooms are good..nothing too fancy but comfy beds and great maid service. You get what you pay for at this Four Seasons!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good But Not Great”
Reviews.Author: kiddogo
Reviews.Content: Took my wife for a long deserved break and long weekend. I worked with the conceirge a number of time for tickets, flowers, etc. so they knew exactly when we were arriving. When we got there, earlier than expected, we had to wait until 3:30 for our room. Went to the pool, temp was about 110, where service was SLOW. Room was nice, strip view, but I moved to Manadaly Bay for a conference the next week and had a much better room at 40% of the price. Lot of room at the pool and the spa was not crowded but not sure it is worth the price

Reviews.Title: “GO FOR THE SERVICE...”
Reviews.Author: ADVENTURE4LIFE
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons is renowned for service and they did not disappoint. In fact we were transfering from THE Hotel to the 4 Seasons for one night. The concierge at the 4 Seasons got us into all the restaurants and times that we wanted even though we were not going to be staying there on that day. By the way the Mandalay reservation people were unable to get any of the same reservations. However, I have to say that the rooms were very disappointing, particularly coming from THE hotel where the rooms were well appointed and spacious. The 4 Season's rooms look like they could use a makeover and don't get one too far from the elevator otherwise coming in late and less than coherent could prove to be more of an adventure than you want. The pool is a welcomed Oasis in a sea of calamity and all of the staff are great.

Reviews.Title: “My take on the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: therm
Reviews.Content: Well, there has been a lot of discussion about the Hotel at Mandalay, Mandalay Bay and the Four Seasons. In my opinion, I would choose the Four Seasons if one is interested in the location with one caveat. If one of the main interests is hanging out at the pool I would not even consider anywhere else but the 4S. I don't care is the walls at The Hotel are gold plated you will still be subjected to the zoo at the main Mandalay pools. At the 4S you have space, service and peace and quiet. My only complaint about my pool experience at the 4S is that it is a bit too quiet for Vegas. They do not play music at the pool and I did critique them regarding this. This is Vegas and I do like a more festive atmosphere. I did not ask for G & R at 1000 decibels- anything would have livened up the place. Other than that a great choice Brian

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas more times than I can count, and have stayed at many places, but hands DOWN, The Four Seasons was the best in every way. The service at the pool was incredible, from the frozen towels, cold orange wedges, and cucumbers, to the pool side meal service. I couldn't beleive I was actually eating a shrimp caesar salad IN the pool! Everyone was very friendly, from the staff to the guests. We have even emailed back and forth with some guests we met at the pool! The concierge service is wonderful. We loved the pillows in our room so much we asked how we could purchase them, and India at the concierge desk, ordered them for us, and had them sent from The Four Seasons, New York property. We upgraded to a partial strip view suite when we arrived. It had a powder room in the marble entry, and a full size bathroom off the bedroom. My one and only "complaint" was that the shower was tiny, and it was a little difficult to shave. The hair dryer that was provided in the room was also small, but I called housekeeping and they brought a full size dryer right up to me to use during my stay. We didn't eat at any of the restaurants during pur stay, but did order room service several times (excellent as well, the food was actually steaming hot when it arrived). Can't wait to go back. Oh, the flower arrangements are STUNNING!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had a great time. With one exception, the staff was superb. Lalani at the front desk welcomed me with a great big smile. The best times were spent at the pool relaxing. Chaz and Dan welcomed my wife and I with open arms and made us feel like we were the only ones there at the pool. Thanks guys!!! What a treat to be served Gordon Biersch beer. Yummy!!! We loved the nachos and the chicken ceasar salad!! The beds in the room were very comfy. The spa was great. Thanks to Carlos for doing a fantastic job in keeping the place so inviting. WOW!!! The hotel car driver wasn't very friendly in my own opinion. I find it very very tacky to count your tip in front of your guest. Shame on you! Never judge a book by it's cover. That's 101. Thanks Four Seasons for a memorable 40th Birthday!!!! We will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Still the best”
Reviews.Author: Bobbyoyo
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons is sill the best of both worlds when it comes to Vegas. The hotel is separate from The Mandalay Bay and it's casino, but has easy access. The pool is very nice and peaceful and the staff was very accommodating, I counted 14 staff members working to service maybe 70 people. The pool food was expensive, as is everything at the Four Seasons, but I didn't mind the price because of the quality. If you want to use the Mandalay pools, all you need to do is show your room key. The Veranda restaurant was fine, other reviews said the service was slow. That was not the case when my family and I had breakfast everyday. The only complaint I had was the cigarette smoke traveling under our door in our one bedroom suite. I thought we were on a non-smoking floor! We call housekeeping and they sprayed our room and the hall with air freshner. The room furnishings were a little outdated. They need to redo these rooms for the price they charge. All in all, The Four Seasons Hotel treats you special and on a vacation that is want I'm looking for.

Reviews.Title: “atrocious service at the Verandah cafe”
Reviews.Author: janyap
Reviews.Content: We have been at the Verandah before, and have always enjoyed good food and excellent service. Not this time. :( To start off our meal, a waitress dumped a full glass of tomato juice on my friend, completely soaking her jeans and t-shirt. Juice was also everythere - on our purses, a little on my shirt, some on the table. The manager came out and yelled that she would like to pay our dry-cleaning bill - all of six bucks of it! Who dry-cleans jeans? Anyway, we told her that would not be necessary. We did not specifically ask for it, but expected the manager to at least comp the meal for the person who was soaked. She ordered a soup, and an entree, and only the entree was free. We were also charged for that tomato juice. Other annoyances were aplenty as well. It took about 40min to get another glass of tomato juice, and about an hour to have the table cleaned up. We were offered bread, but no butter, olive oil or vinegar. My husband asked for a cup of coffee, and 20min later had to ask again. I ordered a dish with a side of berries - and had to ask for that again, too. A couple of waiters bumped into our table throughout the meal - almost sending the glasses flying, but not quite (the waiters did say they were sorry, though, so that was nice).

Reviews.Title: “A Dishonest Internet Portrayal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked the Four Seasons with my wife, looking for a weekend getaway. The internet site portrays it as a "non-gaming hotel," an "oasis away from the strip" and an "exclusive hotel." Unfortunately, it is right on the south strip. What is worse is that, after you check in, you walk down a very long hallway, and find yourself entering the Mandalay Bay elevators. The Four Seasons in Las Vegas is simply the top four floors of the Mandalay Bay, with more expensive room rates and an "exclusive pool." It was very dishonestly portrayed on the internet, and not at all worth the money. We could have had a similar room for half the price by staying two floors down. We have been fortunate to stay in many wonderful five stars hotels around the world. The Four Seasons in Las Vegas is definitely not one of them. If you really want to stay here, call them first and ask EXACTLY where there hotel is located.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: harjeeves
Reviews.Content: One of the few places of quality on the strip that is calm with first rate service, great SPA, rooms and service. Get the Oasis Package.

Reviews.Title: “Not a High Roller? Who Cares?”
Reviews.Author: borisnyc
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at The Four Seasons was simply wonderful! I won't repeat what everyone else is saying but will add three observations. First: Other reviews mention the rooms needing updating. It seems to be happening, my room had new carpeting, and the furniture and bedding seemed to be new as well. Second: Don't count on the Mandalay Bay Pool! It was loud, crowded, and at Ten AM they said they would have towels in a couple of hours. Third: There's No Casino! They treat everybody to the same excellent service, whether you gamble or not.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of serenity on the strip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after 2 underwhelming days at the TheHotel. Switched to the 4 Seasons because we knew what we would get for the price - service, serenity, and everything a 5 Star Hotel has to offer. Yes, its in the Mandalay Bay Tower, Yes, its on the busy crazy Mandalay Bay property..but you'd never know it. Its wonderful to step away from all the craziness into the peaceful atmosphere at the 4 Seasons. Walk in the private entrance to the private 4 seasons elevator and when the doors open you will forget that you are in Las Vegas! The ambiance is wonderful, the staff are friendly, helpful, and really make sure you have everything you need and are enjoying yourself. The rooms are typical 4 Seasons, great beds with down comforters and soft sheets, large bathrooms, and L'Occitane amenities. The rooms could probably use an updating of the furnishings, but nothing really to complain about. One of the best things about the 4 Seasons is the private pool. While the Mandalay Bay Pool was standing room only (seriously!), we could spread out and relax at the uncrowded 4 Seasons pool. The pool service was wonderful, with fresh fruit and evian spritz's throughout the day - and there was always someone there when you needed them. We even spotted a celebrity or 2. If you want to go to Vegas, spend time in the casinos and shopping - but enjoy some quiet and serenity at the end of the day, this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Priceless”
Reviews.Author: PeckCheck
Reviews.Content: A virtual oasis in the middle of Vegas madness. The rooms were wonderfully quiet, the service impeccable, the spa heavenly and the pool peaceful. It could not get any better than this. (except perhaps a longer stay...)

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Travel147
Reviews.Content: Love the Four Seasons Las Vegas. The strip view rooms are probably the best Vegas has to offer. The lobby is pleasant with beautiful flower arrangements, but it's not over the top.....which is a benefit because the hotel is not full tourists checking things out. It has easy access to Mandalay's casino, clubs, restaurants.....FS rooms occupy the top 5 floors of Mandalay's tower....but it has totally seperate lobby/restaurants/pool/spa/elevators. The Four Seasons pool is only for FS guests,which is nice because you're not sharing it with 2000 other guests. FS guests also have access to Mandalay's wave pool and lazy river. The weekend breakfast buffet was great. I had my dog with me, and he was treated like a prince. For any one who is familiar with Four Seasons service, they won't be disappointed here. In fact, I think the service can be more appreciated here because the hotel provides a perfect respite from the other hectic spots on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, 15 year old daughter, and I just got back from a Memorial Day weekend getaway to Las Vegas. The Four Seasons was perfect for us. Very quiet - no casino! The room was beautiful with a strip view. When, after the first night, I had to call to complain about the screaming baby in the next room, the staff were very cordial and moved us to a better room. The pool is great and staff very attentive. Love the Evian water and orange slices! On Sunday night we ate at Envy in the Renaissance Hotel (which, by the way, looks like a really cool place to stay). It was one of, if not THE best, steak we'd ever had! And the special french fries (Truffle Fries) were amazing! Service, too, was great. Overall a really fun Vegas experience!

Reviews.Title: “Best time of my life!”
Reviews.Author: JM1974
Reviews.Content: I had a few days off after a very busy year, and I decided to book it to Vegas. I stayed at the Four Seasons and I'm so happy that I actually took some advice from my friend. Great view of the strip...the lights at night were definitely a site to see. Exquisite service, friendly people, beautiful and comfy rooms...the list goes on and on. The hotel's concierge was helpful with the night life scene, although how hard could it be to find a wild and crazy time in Vegas? The workout room was great, so much equipment to choose from. I definitely kept in shape while I was there, if only for a short time. On my down time, I had my own Swedish in-room massage and four layer facial. Imagine making one phone call and having all the comforts of the good life coming to you! You can't beat that. Also, the Verandah restaurant was a treat. Very tasty food, well prepared, prompt and courteous service. The next time I'm out in Vegas, that's the only place I will stay. Try it out for yourselves....it's definitely something you don't want to miss out on!

Reviews.Title: “Classy and elegant - too spoiled to stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: cruzergirl
Reviews.Content: First trip to Las Vegas and we stayed in the Four Seasons. Outstanding service and exceptionally friendly staff--the concierges can work miracles. They were able to obtain front row center seats at the sold out Cirque du Soleil production of "O" at the Bellagio. They also booked us a helicopter Grand Canyon tour. We enjoyed the hotel limo service many times. Our room was on the 39th floor with a fantastic strip view. Room service came exactly when they said they would. The pool service was great. Exciting stay in an exciting city. I highly recommend the Four Seasons Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons - Good Choice for us”
Reviews.Author: OverPlanner
Reviews.Content: Stayed @ Four Seasons for three nights beginning 4/19/05. Awesome service, great room overlooking strip. Staff is very attentive. Quite easy to move between Mandalay Bay pools and Four Seasons pool. Service @ Four Seasons pool was superior, tho! Definitely pretty far down the strip...used the monorail between Mandalay Bay/Luxor/Excalibur every time to cut the walking down. Shark Reef was VERY well maintained and more of an attraction than I had at first thought. Definitely worth the $ and I would stay in a Four Seasons Hotel again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Not A Casino In Sight!”
Reviews.Author: Marcmarc
Reviews.Content: I am not overly fond of Las Vegas, but on occasion will visit, as I did last Friday night. While driving from Aspen Co. to Los Angeles, I realized that I didn't have the stamina to make it straight through, so I started calling from the road to hotels in Las Vegas. I spoke to a very polite fellow from The Four Seasons about availability and found that there were two rooms free, one was $500 plus and the other $450, I negotiated and got the price to $375 (it was already 9 pm) and an hour later I pulled into the valet station (The Four Seasons is located in The Mandalay Bay tower but has a seperate entrance) and proceeded into their beautiful and elegant lobby. Checked in ,mindful that I was not in a casino in spite of the fact that I was in a hotel in LV, my room was beautiful the sheets were Italian about a 2000 thread count and the bathroom was spacious. I have stayed in TheHotel , which is also a part of Mandalay Bay, a very nice hotel, but I preferred the old world charm of The Four Seasons. It's Las Vegas without the "Vegas" clang clang of slot machines. The restaurants in MandalayBay are very chic and I have found the food to be very good. Will only stay at The Four Seasons from now on, my Cirus Cirus days are behind me now.

Reviews.Title: “Classy oasis”
Reviews.Author: Daoda
Reviews.Content: Get away from the crowds and the kitsch. Located at the end of the strip on the top floors (35-41) of the Mandalay Bay hotel, but it has its own entrance/lobby. Beautiful hotel; everything top notch.

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve”
Reviews.Author: florida
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Four Seasons 12-29 thru 1-1-05. Specifically chose this hotel because of its design (Elegant & quiet lobby,Private Hotel entry area,etc. Did'nt want the typical vegas hotel set-up) Check in took less than 3 minutes. Room was great. View of Strip was great from the 38th Floor. My wife & I felt like we were the only guest in this hotel. Loved going from our elevators thru the private entrance into the casino area. Had reservations at Charlie Palmers New Years Eve. Staff very professional. We were seated immediately. Food was excellent. Highly recommend this hotel & restaurant to anyone seeking the combination of private,elegant surroundings and one of the most comfortable casinos in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice in a Great City.”
Reviews.Author: tennis_ace_2005
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights and truly enjoyed the experience. My wife and I travel with our 5 and 7 year olds often so it's nice to have a hotel that treats kids in a special way. The front desk greeting was rather sterile but the rest of the staff was friendly and accomodating. We have been to Las Vegas about 10 times and this was easily our best stay. Great added benefit is access to the Mandalay Bay pool area, which is the largest resort pool complex that I have ever seen. Breakfast onsite was fine and food service at pool was great. We have been fortunate not to have a bad experience at any of the top hotels we stayed at over the years. My tip is be realistic or assertive. Most hotels are going to have less than stellar rooms so you either pay for a nicer room or put your foot down request a nicer room. Request a strip view room (great at night). I believe that this is the top choice if you have kids traveling with you. Highly recomend.

Reviews.Title: “OK but stay away from Charlie Plamers Steakhouse”
Reviews.Author: rjkazoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a quick get away, the hotel was very inconvenient to get to being that its in the Mandalay Bay. If you plan on driving, well be prepared to pay for parking per day. "Every other parking garage in Vegas is free" The hotel staff very nice. The place smelled like a funeral home with all the flowers. I think that it was a bit overkill. The Charlie Plamer Steakhouse. What a joke. EXTREMELY expensive and so not worth it. In a town that you can get gourmet anything top quality. I live here and try new places quite often. The service just as bad as the food. The quality about the same as the 4.99 special that I used to get at the old Horseshoe. We actually sat for about a half of an hour before I finally got up to get myself a menu. That was after we sat for about an hour past our reservation time. When I expressed my concern they offered to buy a dessert. We excepted, the waiter then brought us something without us even getting to look at a dessert menu. What if I had a problem with chocolate? It was probably the dessert that wasn't moving that night! Upon check-out I let them know at the front desk. They heard me out and proceeded to not charge me for the lame meal. Upon thier investigation, I guess they thought my complaints weren't warranted. The meal including the dessert that they were supposed to give me appeared on my credit card with some apology. They said perhaps I just caught them on a off night! Much better choices in town. Charlie should try his restuarant sometime. He might be shocked at whats going on there!

Reviews.Title: “more like two seasons..”
Reviews.Author: bhattdi
Reviews.Content: you would think staying at the four seasons, especially in a place like Vegas, would be a most elegant experience...it was more like staying at the Two Seasons. We stayed in Vegas for New Years eve/day 2004-05 and were disappointed in the facility. Knowing that my fiancee and I were staying in a double occupancy room, they gave us one bathrobe, NO towel and old tissues/makeup was left over from the previous guest, so I question if our room was even cleaned. The next day, I left my shoes out for shining (which is a nice gesture) and was unpleasantly surprised to find out they were delivered to someone else's room (by now I'm picturing a 6ft tall gentleman wearing my size 5 max azria heels.) On our final day, the cleaning crew was leaving at 3pm and were in a rush to clean our room at 230 while I was sick in bed with the flu during this trip. They banged down our door and when we let them know that we were not ready to have the room cleaned, they called the front desk to call us and let them in.....very unprofessional. I stayed at the resort to consider it as a wedding site...now I don't think I want my funeral held there.
